text: Bottle from Systembolaget (9%). Dark brown with big creamy head.Aroma of chocolate and raspberry. Taste is chocolate, cherry and vanilla.Sweet finish. Nice and easy to drink.

A: Cloudy brown with a big tan head. 
N: Caramel, chocolate, coffee, plum, raspberry.
 T: Malty, cacao, liquorice, plum. 
P: Medium-thin
O: Compared to other strong Belgians, I found this ones body to be a bit too thin for the style.

Aromat: z butelki piwnica, mocne przyprawy, goździki i czysta słodowość w tle, ze szkła do ww. aromatów dochodzi karmel i lekka owocowość (rodzynki może trochę jabłka)
Wygląd: barwa brązowa, lekkie zmętnienie, piana wysoka, beżowa, drobnobańkowa, trwała, zostawia ładny lacing
Smak: słodkie, wyraźnie karmelowe, przyprawowe, słodowość raczej w tle, alkohol praktycznie niewyczuwalny, goryczka średnia, stanowi przyjemną kontrę dla słodyczy
Podniebienie: wysokie nagazowanie, pełne, lekko gęste, raczej pijalne, alkohol ogrzewa gardło podczas przełykania
Podsumowanie: bardzo dobre, chociaż niczym szczególnym nie oczarowuje
En bouteille de 33cl, cuvée 2016. Faut-il vraiment commenter cette perle? Le plus simple cest juste de la laisser glisser dans le gosier. Elle fait le reste.

Yummy! Nice downer or even as Appetizer! Just simple and a really good beer! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Piwo wypite jakiś czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Dark brown, sweet and alcoholic, caramel and dark dry fruits. Not breathtaking, but not bad for such a commercialised beer.

Pours hazy, brown colour with a 2 finger, beige head. Aroma of fruits, plums, bananas, caramel, raisins and alcoholic touch. Almost perfect. Taste is rather sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty. Caramel and alcoholic notes. Dry and bitter finish. Great, but after a while too alcoholic.
Отлично& пиво, пена стоит несколь& минут и не оседает, аромат приятны& цвет красивы& свежее - дата розлива 22.02.2017г. Выдержу пару лет и перепро&

Kolor: Brązowy, zmętniony. Piana: Beżowa, bardzo obfita, złożona z małych i średnich pęcherzyków, opada powoli i ładnie zdobi szkło. Zapach: Mnóstwo suszonych owoców (rodzynki, figi, śliwki), drożdże, karmel. Smak: Jest słodko i słodowo, znowu pojawiają się suszone owoce, karmel i trochę alkoholu, goryczka jest bardzo niska. Piwo wyraźnie rozgrzewa, jest dość treściwe i mocno nagazowane.

Aroma of yeast and phenols, cloves in particular; beyond that sweet, dark fruit (plums, raisins, cherries) but it takes a good whiff to smell them. Very dark brown pour with massive beige foam. In taste sweet, malty with caramel, plenty of raisins/plums, spicy aftertaste. Mild bitterness. Full body, medium carbonation. Good but not as spectacular as I expected.
Dark brown, with a foamy head. Rousty caramel, sweet with a bitter ending. Well balanced double, some yeastines along with the sweet and bitter.
Dark in color. Smell: yeasts, alcohol, raisins and sweetness. Taste: raisins, on the 2nd stage coffee and roasted malt. High carbonation. Nothing breathtaking. Just ok.

Had in Brugge. Best beer I had on my whole trip, in the best beer country in the world. I am not really sure how to describe the Chimay Bleue. It was just about totally flawless in every way. I am no professional reviewer, but I am a lover of stouts, porters and malts and this one is battling for the best beer Ive ever had.
Pours dark brown with a creamy head. Taste of dry fruits, malt, a bit sweet and with an alcohol touch. Very good beer!

330ml. bottle in Vientiane, Laos. Pours a dark brown with a medium foamy head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, malt, floral. Taste of malts, yeast, plums. Strong alcohol notes with a bitter finish but not overpowering. A stronger beer than I would usually try and a little disappointing but I will revisit at some stage.

Aroma: Caramel and alcoholic touch.
Appearance: Very dark brown color with clear liquid and white frothy head.
Taste: Medium sweetness with light bitter notes.
Palate: Full body with thin liquid and average carbonation. Sweet caramel finish with very subtle alcoholic touch.
Overall: Very good beer, strong flavours and notes in the nose. The alcoholic touches are very subtle and do not overpower the other features.

Pours rather dark muddy brown, bubbly, head dissipates fairly quickly. Fruity and spicy nose - raisin, currant, fig, gingerbread. Flavour is sweet, juicy and winey, with spicy finish. Notes of caramel, toffee, citrus peel, banana, clove, allspice. Dry floral finish - some noticeable booze here. Complex, well balanced, and very pleasant.
Malt:nuts. Other: licorice. Sweet: medium. Bodí: full. Texture: creamy. Head: creamy. Carbonation: average.

Mooi kleur, eerste smaak sensatie lijkt een beetje op pistache, verder een mooi smakelijk biertje, wat voor herhaling vatbaar is.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Maryhill Tesco, Glasgow. Beer served in 10°C, Teku Glass. Pours hazy red, little head with very good lacing. Aroma of dried fruits, red berries, prunes, pepper, cloves. Taste is rich and malty, warming alcohol, caramel, pear, spices, pralines, figs, yeasts, herbal hops.
An overrated beer, not saying it is a bad one, but I have had better within this category. Quite sweet with roasted malt.
Aroma: dried fruits, belgian yeast, cloves, banana. Taste: yeast, malts, dark fruits, dried fruits, cloves, sweetness and subtle alcohol. Nice head, good lacing and high carbonation.

From 330 ml bottle. Pours brown with considerable head and foam retention. The staple aromas of clove and roasted nut of belgian ales is vigorous. Slightly dry body, marvelously balanced for its powerful 9% alcohol content. A great belgian strong ale.

Vierte marrón con suave cabeza blanca crema, alta carbonatación y buen cordón. El aroma es audaz y complejo. Maltas oscuras, ciruela, marmelada, higo, razón, roble y, por supuesto, el belga con clavo, cítricos, plátano maduro y canela. El sabor es dulce, efervescente y con un largo final amargo con una sugerencia de burbon booze. Complejo, material de gran alcance.
Not much to add that has not already been said. Dark and smooth. Looks very sexy in a proper trappist glass!

Pours brown with soft cream white head, high carbonation and good lacing.

Aroma is bold and complex. Dark malts, plum, marmelade, fig, raison, oak and of course the Belgian ueast with clove, citrus, over-ripe banana and cinnamon.

Taste is sweet, fizzy and with a long bitter finish with a suggestion of burbon booze.

Complex, powerful stuff.

Достато& крепкий эль, при этом легко пьётся. Во вкусе преобла& шоколад, Очень вкусное. Обязате& для ознаком& 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Murky brown pour. Aroma/Taste: Belgian yeast, dark fruits, sugarcane, molasses and oak. The cork bottle version seemed to have more complex flavors than the cap. Would highly recommend cellaring for a few years.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi
I can add nothing to the collective rating of this beer. It has all already been said, and much more elequently than I can. Cheers.

Aroma: Dark sugar, caramel, sweetness, brandy.
Appearance: Dark brown with red notes, small white head.
Taste: Same as aroma with a bit dry finish.
Palate: full bodied, medium carbonation, smooth.

2016 bottle. Hazy dark red to brown colour, frothy tan head. Aroma is phenolic, spices, cloves, a bit fruity (pear) with hints of caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter, phenolic, spices, cloves, dark fruits, pears, light caramel, a bit peppery finish. Medium+ body, average to lively carbonation. Very good trappist beer with yeasty character.

2016 catch up. Yuck. I really didnt like the strong yeast flavour of the beer. It wasnt enjoyable, but a worthwhile experiment nonetheless. Maybe the yeast got stirred up in the bottle or maybe its just me, but this is not something I ever want to have again. I really struggle to find Belgian beers that I like.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Bottle.Clear red,thick,creamy and quite stable,off-white head,copious lacing.Aroma malty,fruity,red berries,rose jam,spicy,pepper,complex and quite intense. Taste thick,smooth,dry. Carbonation medium,slightly tingling,bitterness medium,balanced. Aftertaste malty,grassy,fruity,spices, berries,some alcohol,clove. Very nice.

I carefully pour this gloppy dark brown beverage and a two finger cappuccino coloured head rises up; interestingly the head around the perimeter is foamy but in the centre it's a fluffy fine fizz. The head size slowly shrinks but the fizz continues.

Bouquet is slightly muted but boozy (9% ABV) some yeastiness and fruity promise - dark fruits hints of raisins, plums and distant cloves. 

The mouthfeel is syrupy smooth almost chewy; but the sapor is somewhat surprisingly subdued - the mellow ripe fruity flavours give just enough sweetness but this is finely balanced by the yeast and cloves. 

Whilst it's flavour is not overwhelming it has such a warming charm, winsome character and a wholehearted constitution that you just want to sink back into a comfortable leather chair, listen to a Chopin nocturne and savour its gentle delights.
Leicht trübes rotbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, Röstaromen, etwas Vanille, leicht fruchtig, etwas Rumtopf, spritzig.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle, best before end of 2013, about nine years old. Clear, dark reddish brown with a frothy, beige head. Sweetish, very oxidized, fruity and slightly yeasty aroma of port, raisins, prunes and caramel. Rather sweet, malty, slightly fruity, a bit yeasty and quite oxidized taste of raisins, prunes, caramel and some port, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, slightly yeasty-spicy and quite dry finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Definitely past its prime, will revisit from a fresher bottle.

Barwa ciemniejsza miedź, piwo lekko zmętnione. Piana bardzo wysoka, sztywna, głównie drobno-pęcherzykowa, ładnie oblepia szkło i jest bardzo trwała.
Aromat: Typowy dla belgijskiego ale, szybko wyczuwalne fenole, oraz estry. Ładne aromaty pomarańczy, goździków, przyprawy, lekki pieprz, minimalnie wyczuwalny alkohol, pojawia się również lekka słodycz.
Smak: Z początku nuty estrowe, pomarańcz, jabłko, gruszka, mocne nuty fenolowe, przyprawowe, goździki. Naprawdę bardzo złożony aromat jak i smak. Na finiszu nuta szlachetnego alkoholu, lekko piecze w przełyk ale jest to bardzo przyjemne uczucie.
Head light moka, thick, long lasting, good lacing. Aroma and taste somewhat alcoholic but rich: caramel, lots of dark fruits with a slightly roasted finish. Mouthfeel creamy, soft carbo.
Butelka, barwa ciemnobrązowa. Piana dość wysoka, długo się utrzymuje. Przyprawy, fenole, słodycz. Alkohol wyczuwalny, ale w przyjemny sposób.
Barwa ciemnobrązowa, wysoka piana. W aromacie słody, drożdże, nieco alkoholu, przyprawy. W smaku dość wytrawny, lekko alkoholowy, trochę karmelu, jakieś suszone ciemne owoce. Fajna niska goryczka.
A very good beer, simples, a very good beer, simples, very good beer, simples, very good beer, simples 😀😀😀😀😀

Piwo barwy ciemno brązowej, nieprzejrzyste. Piana, jasno-beżowa, dość wysoka zbudowana z różnej wielkości oczek, ładnie zdobi szkło.
Aromat drożdżowy, alkoholowy w kierunku brandy, ciemne owoce(rodzynki, śliwki) nieco przypiekany, przyprawy..
Smak dość wytrawny, nieco alkoholowy, drożdże, fenolowy, ciemna czekolada, praliny, ciemne owoce + jakaś nuta marcepanowo-przyprawowa. Jest w sumie dość wodniste, ale jednocześnie dość ciężkie. Goryczka niewielka, wysycenie niskie.
Szczerze to spodziewałem się nieco więcej po ikonie stylu.
Wow! What can i say about this beauty. Dark, Rich and smooth hints of dark chocolate, figs and caramel make it so yummy. This ia a quality Ale the best in my opinion.

Very dark ruby colour with a tall tan head with relatively OK retention. Smells like dried fruit - prunes, figs, belgian yeast, caramel and a bit of sour funkiness. Tastes bitter-sweet, with notes of dark fruit, dried fruit, a bit of dark chocolate, spices.nice belgian strong ale.

Aromas of yeast, bread, nuts, and dates. Taste is Belgian candy sugar, yeast, caramel, raisin bread, bread crusts, some toffee, some marmalade. Finish has a slight touch of grassy hops, phenolic esters, and a touch of spicey pepper.

Bottle. Aroma: Dark dried fruits marmolade, cheeries and figs, toast, little spicy and vine-like aroma. Full body, sweet and little sour, no bitterness but phenols and sourness balnce sweetness well. There is a little alcohol in aroma and taste but its pleasant. Rich and smooth beer, verry complex.

@ Brussels, Belgium Beer Trip // 2017. december



<><> Beeroda.hu - Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary <><>

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Wow! This was recommended by some many friends. I was eager to taste it and ... wow, too good! Brought the 750ml Grande Reserve at my sisters annual lobster family gathering. Still amazing.

Awesome beer.
Aroma feels royal, it is sweet, spicy has hints of caramel, rasins, malt and bread dough. True Belgian aroma :) Reminds me of my grandma baking cookies...
Taste is really amazing - it is enjoyable, sweet-bitter, chocolatey and spicy. Dried red apples in thin chocolate? Cardamom, liquorice cooke with vanilla... Almost no alcohol in taste but leavs a warm feeling in the throat. Really hard to describe actually, really complex taste.
Aftertaste lasts realy long and keeps on building. Hints of dark bread, white bread, plums and brown sugar. Chocolate chip cookies with pepper. Heavenly.
One of the best beers available IMO.

Updated: Bottle at SoHo (Pitt). Dark plum color with a white head. Sweet raisin plum aroma. Plum toffee malt biscuit flavor. Medium heavy body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1 pt 9.4 oz bottle. A dark chestnut near black with a gradient to light cola. Head is huge and off white. Aromas of fig, root vegetables, molasses, yeast, alcohol, and spices. Taste is lightly spicy, a little brown sugar, alcohol, molasses, plum/raisin/dried fig. Significant carbonation.

Flasche 0,75l: Kastanienbraun, dunkles Mahagoni, leichte Trübung, kräftiger mittelporiger Schaum; in der Nase würzig, Malz, Malzzucker, Karamell, dunkle fruchtige Süße, eingelegte/getrocknete Früchte, Backpflaumen, Rosinen, Röstaromen, Tannine, würzige dunkel-fruchtige Bitterkeit; sehr süßer würziger Körper, Malz, Malzzucker, Karamell, getrocknete/dunkle Früchte, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, Röstaromen, leichte trockene Säure, dunkel-fruchtige Bitterkeit; angenehmer fruchtig-würziger Nachgang mit leichten Röstaromen

Bottle. Dark brown. Big foamy head. Aroma of malts, caramell, sugar and dark fruits. Taste is caramell, sugar, malts, belgian yeast, figs, plums and raisins. Medium carbonation. Warming finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Full bodied. Very balanced. Great.

750 ml bottle, Uncorked with a nearly violent pop, leading me to expect a gusher but it was well behaved. 
Excellent aroma with lots of fruit notes, some spiced fruitcake and a hint of yeast. 
The flavor largely follows. Improved with some warming even though it started at about 50F. 
Lively carbonation in a medium body.
Bottle-dark with thick creamy head. Good bready aroma Slight lemony, good mouthful full bodied tasting very pleasant drinking with strong finish.

Chimay Bleue (Blue) / Grande Réserve
Brewed by Chimay
Baileux, Belgium 
9% Belgian Strong Ale
Una trappista de referència però una mica sobrevalorada pel meu gust... després de conservar-la i que evolucioni en ampolla millora molt!
Beer tasting at Olut Sabadell. 2016 bottle. Dark amber with white head. Red fruit aroma. Malty and dry. Sweet.

Tasted bottled @Olut. Amber brown colour with white head. Malty aroma, caramel, raisins.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
floral, bread, dough, brown, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, light body, thin feel, lively,

3 years old
Hazy brown, very high carbonation, high, long lasting head. Aroma: belgian spices, peach, geraniol (rose), dry fruits. Full body, lots of sweetness, low bitterness. Flavour: peach, banana, spices, dark caramel, malt. Nicely hidden alcohol. Very stylish.

Aroma: phenols, peachy, alcohol, roasted dark malts.
Appearance: deep amber color and creamy head.
Taste: peachy, esters, phenols, warming alcohol, roasted dark malts, quite dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Nice BSA, quite zesty.

Mocno fenolowe, przyprawowe, trochę estrów w postaci gumy balonowej, wysokie wysycenie, całkiem sporo pełni, alkokol dobrze schowany. Dość słodkie odczucie w ustach, ale raczej od drożdży, muśnięcie słodu w tle, posmak gumy balonowej na finiszu. Dużo się tu nie dzieje, ale jest nieźle.
33 cl bottle @ home. Amber brown colour with a medium, off white head. Malty aroma, sweet brown sugar, caramel, raisins. Similar taste, paired with a nice palate.
Sublime taste, which attacks you with coffee and foam. Its really nice though I wouldnt call it amazing.

0,33l Bottle. Pours withs dark amber color and a small white head, wich dissapears very quickly. The Bleue has a very fine malty smell with dark honey, lighty caramel and some undefined fruits. Taste is malty and sweet, some herbst an nice almond/caramel feel at the palate. The cabonation remebers a little bit on champagner.

backlog

aroma of prunes, some yeasty notes and some malts.

taste is the same with a little bit of alcohol at the end.
Tried 330 ml and 750ml (Grande Réserve) at home. As usual, the larger the bottle the better. Roasted-malty, brown, medium sweet beer. Totally recommended on its larger format.
Botella de 33cl. Aromas a levadura y malta. Cuerpo medio, textura suave y ligero amargor. Final seco, persistente, con ligera presencia alcohólica. De las buenas

Looks really good when poured into the glass, with a dark amber colour and a big beige head, which maintains itself during the drinking session. 
After it sits a couple of minutes, the aroma starts to get more fragrant and floral: brown sugar, a bit rosy (like in the description), fresh yeast, caramel. Smells really nice. Taste is sweet and spicy. Easy to drink, alcohol is felt just at the end. Taste is great: caramel, licorice - sour cherry, almonds. Its interesting how almost every sip is different. Great beer!
Barwa ciemnobażowa, piana srednia, nie zanika do konca ale jest nietrwała. Aromat drożdży, owoce. W smaku podobnie. Lekko gryzące, ale pijalne. Alkohol dobrze ukryty.
Bottle from Carrefour. Deep amber in color. Malty, fruity, typical belgian yeast in aroma. Flavor fruity, spicy, sweet. Really nice

Tomada en copa a partir de botella de 33 cl.
Después de probar la Chimay Red, tenía muchas expectativas puestas en esta cerveza que tiene aún más crítica favorable que la Red. Y la verdad es que siendo una cerveza de buen nivel, esperaba muchísimo más de ella.
Tiene un aroma intenso y agradable, una apariencia de color marrón oscuro con ligeros tonos rubí y una corona de espuma densa y espesa de color beige que se mantiene constante.
El sabor es fuerte e intenso, pero le falta algo que he apreciado en otras cervezas trapistas de las mismas o parecidas características. El paladar deja un gusto a caballo entre el dulzor y el amargor bastante agradable, pero también le falta algo.
En definitiva, buena cerveza, pero esperaba mucho más de ella.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text: Sötét borostyán/barna szín. Nagy, bézs színű krémes hab. Élesztős, gyümölcsös illat. Nagyon elegáns, komplex sör. A pörkölt karamell, a méz érezhető ízében.

Chimay Blue Grand Reserve- bottle, mainly malt smell when opening, but rosy as description, not carbonated but very tasty, no lingering bitter taste which spoils in mouth, spicy fruit taste, very smooth nice creamy feel that melts in mount, dry, Cannot taste the 9% alcohol.

2014 vintage. Peach, brown sugar, bubblegum in nose. Pours brown with white lacy head. Taste is medium sweet with peach, apricot, bubblegum, brown sugar. Low bitter finish, lively carbonation, some booze. Overall good but lacks complexity.

Bottle 75cl.
Aroma is sweet, brown sugar, a bit fruit in the nose as well.
Pours dark brown with a nice tan head, more carbo than I expected.
Taste is fruits, sugar, caramel and a gentle alcohol hint in the end.

Presa in bottiglia. Birra marrone scuro. Schiuma cremosa e scura. 
Allolfatto sentori di spezie e profumo di tostato.
Al palato si presenta un corpo con note di caramello e di cioccolato.
Una birra eccezionale da bere sui formaggi.
Tap in Ghent with commonmac and samuelito, willyp, and rosskyle. Dark amber brown with thick off white head . Sugar nose. Sweet, layered flavors, well balanced. Good body. Great beer. 11

Birthday present, 750 ml bottle. Tulip glass. Cork pops, mist appears. Hazy orange/bronze beer with off-white head and champagne carbonation. Nose of yeast, fruit, malt, dough. Spicy fruity taste, smooth texture. Really easy to drink at 9%! Finish has more fruit and floral notes. Alcohol only becomes noticeable very late on, but not unpleasant. As it warms, more malt is apparent. Classic.
Rosinenrumtopfflaggschiff mit deutlicher Malzquadrupelschlagseite. Schwerst belgisch und von unfassbarer Eleganz. WOWWWW.. 0,1/Fass. TAPHOUSE MUNICH.
very pleasant and tasty Belgian beer. The sweet aroma of fruits, yeast and light alcohol. In the taste is the same sweetness of fruits, caramel and a nice warming alcohol in the finish.
Dark beer, with lively carbonation. Licorice and sugar , it produces still a strong kick so that its not too sweet. Kinda sultry aftertaste, which is preferable!

Barwa ciemno br?zowa z bordowymi prze?witami. Piana w kolorze z?amanej bieli, ?rednio wysoka i nie trwa?a.
Aromat ziemisty z mocnymi nutami palonych ziaren kawy, delikatnie ciemne owoce.
W smaku bardzo podobnie, palone ziarna kawy, intensywne nuty ziemiste, przypominaj?ce spalon? ziemi?, marcepan. Calo?? okraszona jest rozgrzewaj?cym alkoholem, szlachetnym alkoholem.
Nasycenie ?rednie w kierunku do niskiego.

Bursztynowe, nalało się praktycznie bez piany. W aromacie sporo suszonych owoców, figi, daktyle, ciut moreli. Delikatnie przyprawowe akcenty też się pojawiają. W smaku gładkie, bardzo mocno owocowe, zdecydowanie słodkie.
Bottle. Fosdem. Unpoured. Scent is slightly peppery. Taste is lovely soft cloves on ale. Finish is dry. Great, if a little simple.

Bottle at home from Auchan. Expiry date: 2021. Bottle from 2016. Pours dark amber-reddish brown, big foam, which I like. Tastes like roasted malts, caramel. Sweet and mellow. Medium carbonation. Big and enjoyable. Very good.
Dark golden redish brown, minimal tan head that quickly disappears and no lacing. Chocolate, caramel, sweet fig, yeast & mild spice on the nose. Taste follows. Replete, smooth & balanced. Great brew.
Zajímavé pivo, i kdy to není můj styl tak musím hodnotit objektivně , tak na polotmavé pivo výborný říz i jemná hořkost. Barva pěkná a vůně osvěující.
Strong tasting beer, fresh yeast fragrance with a light touch to it. Aromas of roasted malt, good all round beer
poured from bottle black with quick fading head slight floral aroma taste is floral with carmel notes very carbonated hides the booze real well.

330ml bottle in a beer hawk mystery case. Pours with a good head. Dark beer. Not too sweet for 9%. Nice chocolate malt with nice hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bursztynowe, nalało się praktycznie bez piany. W aromacie sporo suszonych owoców, figi, daktyle, ciut moreli. Delikatnie przyprawowe akcenty też się pojawiają. W smaku gładkie, bardzo mocno owocowe, zdecydowanie słodkie. Niby nudna Belgia, ale piło mi się to naprawdę przyjemnie. Gładka faktura, zero alkoholu, zdecydowanie fajna rzecz.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Bought at Colruyt in Antwerp, 330 ml 2016 bottle. Served in a Trappist glass. Aroma is very malty, like caramel, but not that intense. Colour is rather dark, like a Dubbel. Taste is bittersweet, but more sweet than bitter. Aftertaste is watery and flat. Carbonization is still good. Overall, it tastes like a stronger Dubbel with less aroma. Chimay Bleu is in my opinion way too overrated.

Na wejście gushing. W zapachu nuty sodowo alkoholowe.

W konsystencji puszystość i wysokie nasycenie. Złożony smak.
Cerveja muito equilibrada, cor escura e sabor com notas de malte e caramelo, carbonatação elevada, garrafa 33cl

Piwo metne w kolorze brazowym z obfita lekko bezowa obfita piana. W aromacie na pierwszym planie karmel i belgijskie "przyprawy" pochodzace od drozdzy, sa tez suszone rodzynki i figi. W smaku mamy w dodatku nuty chlebowe i troche banana. Wysycenie na sredniowysokim poziomie prawie bez goryczki, alkohol niewyczuwalny. Bardzo zlozone i bogate piwo ktorym mozna sie rozkoszowac przez dluzsza chwilke lub wypic szybko z przyjemnoscia.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2017 Chocolate, wheat, herbaceous and slightly spicy, hint of cloves. Not too sweet. Nice fine carbonisation. Well balanced. Long warm finish.

Chimay bleue... LA Chimay bleue, la fameuse, et en bouteille de 75cl sil vous plait ! Brune transparente avec de superbes reflets rubis, le tout couvert dune grosse mousse ivoire, bien dense et bien stable. Nez chocolaté à souhait, avec des notes de lait et de noisette. Lhabituel caramel bien sûr, une légère levure, un alcool perceptible, le pruneau, la poire, la mirabelle, le raisin, lorange, le citron, un côté douçâtre beurré, du miel, du bois (passé à la cire dabeille !), du cuir, de la cassonade, de la vanille, un peu de coriandre, de la fleur de rose, de la fleur doranger, de la bergamote, du jasmin... Très beau nez, pas le plus complexe ni le plus original qui mait été donné dhumer, mais cest du très haut de gamme et ce côté floral est le plus indéniable de cette bière. La carbonatation est soutenue, lalcool puissant mais sous contrôle, la texture bien souple mais aussi pétillante avec cette grosse carbo. Deuxième gorgée sur les malts et lamertume, très affirmée avec des saveurs et arômes de café ainsi quune petite sécheresse tannique au palet sans parler du fond de langue... Troisième gorgée qui révèle les levures, douces et sans ce côté cave. La quatrième va sur les notes de bois, de cire, de cuir et de terre. Le final est long, lalcool prend le temps de descendre et de récurer la tuyauterie tandis que les arômes de malt restent en bouche, lamertume sassagissant au fur et à mesure. Petites notes minérales et herbeuses sur la toute fin, très rafraichissantes, ainsi que le côté très légèrement beurré... Voilà, cest une Chimay bleue... Pas mon breuvage préféré, mais le plaisir est toujours intact ! Bouteille 75cl, supermarché XXX.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 2016 bottle: Not very intense aroma, rather slight. First taste is malty, rich, caramel. Then bitterness kicks in, alcohol. Finish also bitter, alcohol.
A bit overrated beer in my opinion. Maybe have to get some aged bottle.

2006 bottle: well this bottle is fully aged. No malt any more, no sugar, its all now alcohol. This beer has become barley wine now. Strong alcohol in aroma and taste, certainly above 10% vol now. Taste a bit like cognac. Better than 2016 bottle, i still think its overrated.

A well balanced beer. Its not a slow drinker nor a pilsner. One can easilly enjoy this beer. Don't drink it to cold. The aromas stand out better at little elevated temperatures (say 10-15 deg.)
Some say one has to store this beer for 15 years to reveal all its qualities, hence we stored 2 bottles in te wine cellar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 mL bottle. Pours a murky brown with a big khaki head. Smells of caramel, bread, and banana yeast aromas. Tastes very bready. Has a little sweetness, but less than I would have expected. Earthy and lightly spicy finish. High carbonation. I cant believe Ive never rated this. This style is remarkable. This beer is delicious. When someone tries to recreate it and misses the mark even a little bit, its practically undrinkable.

Bottle 33 cl
Pours dark brown with a big tan persistent head. 
Aroma of caramel, plum and bread.
Taste of caramel and a well balanced sweetness and bitterness.
Sweetness in the aftertaste. 
Medium body with average carbonation.

Bottle purchased... I dont remember. Faint roasted aroma, pours deep opaque brown. Fairly carbonated with hints of plum, clove, and roasted malt, with yeasty finish. Smooth and warming to drink. I can see why the monks created this...

This one is from memory, not that hard to recall. Pours dark amber with a fizzy tan head. Aromas of plum, raisin, licorice are a mouthful and first taste confirms this is truly a great beer. Easily discernible from the Rochefort, St. Bernardus and Westvleteren 12. In my opinion, the most accessible of the bunch and a great awesome starter beer.
Vertical tasting at Kulminator 14 / 04 / 94 year. Absolute fan form vintage editions, The best is mature some bottles 5 years if you can.

Ciemnomiedziane z obfitą pianą w kolorze złamanej bieli, która opada dość szybko, ale jednak ładnie się utrzymuje. W aromacie suszone i dojrzałe owoce, rodzynki, trochę chleba, tostów, pumpernikla,do tego szeroko pojęte estry. W smaku półsłodkie, sporo fig, daktyli, trochę wiśni, odrobinę cukierkowe. Wysycenie wysokie, ciała mało, ale całość dość gładka, absolutnie nie wodnista.

Dark brown beer wit a big, good lasting, off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, spices, banana, clove, fruity, bit of belgian yeast, florality, mellow raisins. Taste is firstly like a Weizen Bock, yeasty, but belgian yeast here with fruity cherry and light bitter almond, then more malty, coca-cola, and in finish very dry and light acidic. Full body, fizzy carbonation, creamy texture. Interesting, every sniff and sip is somehow different, i should buy some more for my cellar.
Very young chimay Blue, Dark brow beer, medium head. Aroma is red fruit, malt, Taste is the same, bittersweet, somewhat fizzy, needs more aging.
Cherry, raisin, malt, other stuff. May be out of my league here - Im only half way through. If I dont make it, Ben can have my bottle top collection....
Braun. rötlich, leicht trüb. Geruch röstig, karamellig. Sehr süß, aber mit Fruchtkorb. Leicht bitter, Alkohol gut versteckt.
dark brown , almost black colour, nice foam, tastes like caramel and biscuits, really good beer.

Belle robe marron foncé légèrement trouble. Une mousse fine et persistante. Arômes complexe fruits sec, de caramel, et bien plus encore. Corp rond, goûts complexe de sucre candy, de vanille, dépices juste ce quil faut pour balancer le lalcool. Belle carbonation . La finale est agréable et longue.

2016 330ml bottle from Melbourne Street Cellars pours very dark brown with generous foamy off-white head. Aromas of yeast, stone fruit, spice and floral characters. Brown sugar, caramel malt, yeast, dried fruit and alcohol. Initial sweetness decays quickly leaving a short dry finish which is a little unexpected. Generally a little thin to mask the 9% alc vol, not helped by the high carbonation. Definitely not as rich as some of the other trappist beers.

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Helder kastanjebruin met een licht beige schuimkraag. G: Karamel, kruidig, geroosterde mout en gedroogd fruit. S: Zoet, karamel, chocolade, rozijntjes en alcoholwarmte. Moutbittere afdronk. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2017 Bardzo obficie się pieni, biało-kremowa, średnie pęcherze, dość szybko znika. Prawie nieprzejrzyste, rubinowe, opalizujące. W zapachu jak na targowisku ze straganami z owocami, jednak zdecydowanie bardziej suszone i kandyzowane owoce m.in rodzynki, figi, śliwka, chleb i skórka od chleba, drożdże - aromat jest bardzo bogaty i każdy znajdzie tu coś nowego, ale faktem jest, że nie jest bardzo intensywny. W smaku półsłodkie, bogate w te nuty ciemnych owoców, goryczka niska i zdecydowanie ziołowa. Alkohol idealnie ukryty, rozgrzewający. Gładki, ale bardzo wysycony, na szczęście to szybko mija gdy odczekać po przelaniu, treściwy, trochę wodniste. Bardzo dobre.
Arômes de caramel et merisier. Mousse blanche abondante, robe brune opaque. En bouche, caramel sans le sucre, un petit goût de bonbon cerise.

Poured into a tulip from a bottle marked 2015.

Appearance a dark brown, quite cloudy with 1.5 fingers of fluffy light-tan head.

Fruity on the nose. I pick up dark fruit, cherries and a raisin sweetness.

The flavour is dominated by malt sweetness, raisins and cherries. Faint hints of vanilla and dark wood. Brings to mind a sweet Christmas cake.

Medium-to-full body, nice and smooth with enough carbonation that theres some crispness in there too. It makes for a good balance. The aftertaste is as boozy and warm as youd expect from a 9% ABV beer, but its masked by the lingering raisin and malt sweetness.

Overall Id call it fruity, malty and a pleasure all around. Quite a lot going on in here and I look forward to the next time.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 Aromat rodzynek, fig, suszonych owoców, fenolowy, drożdżowy, niezbyt intensywny. W wyglądzie rubinowe, wpadające w ciemny brąz, bardzo obfita beżowa piana. W smaku słodkie, śliwkowe, rodzynkowe, pełne suszonych owoców, do tego drożdżowe. Ciało średnie, nieco wysycone, lekko rozgrzewa z każdym łykiem, przyjemnie rozchodzi się po ciele. Ogólnie piwo smaczne, wybitnie ułożone, delikatne, aksamitne, brakuje mi tu jednak tego czegoś, co by mnie porwało. Smaczne, ale z butów nie wyrywa.

Una Belgian Strong Ale de color marrón, sin filtrar de media carbonatacion y media espuma que se disipa lentamente. Su aroma es a toffee caramelo y Malta tostada. Su sabor es a Malta caramelo, toffee, frutos secos (almendras).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1998 vintage. Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Poszło mocno w Barleywine (melasa, śliwki itepe), alkohol totalnie schowany, ale trochę wodniste. Tak czy siak - ogromny szacunek.

Aromas a leva caramelo y Malta tostada
Buen aspecto carbónatacion correcta y espuma persistente
En boca ligeramente dulce, seca y amarga al final

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 33 bottle. Pours intense brown, with a limited whitish head. Aroma is of coffee, caramel and licorice. Body is medium-thick, with quite some carbonation and stickiness at the same time. Sweet dominates taste with just a hint of bitter. More sweet finish. A great beer-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

I drank this in the Restaurant Appelmans, Antwerp.
Typical Belgian beer, yeast is dominated, 
(I have 0.33l bottle with batch 15-580 and best-before 12/2020)

Flasche in einem Kiosk gekauft, dunkles Bernstein, viel Schaum. Aroma Malz, Hopfen und ein abwechselnd süß und dann wieder saures (Grapefruit) Aroma in der Nase. Geschmack ebenfalls intensiv und abwechselnd. Langsamer neutraler Karamell Geschmack, der später ins alkoholische abdriftet. Aber trotzdem ein sehr angenehmes sanftes Mundgefühl.

Aroma: boozy, malty and spicy; Appearance: very dark amber pour with off white head that lingers; Taste: follows nose - smooth, delicious, boozy; Overall: even with widespread distribution, still a special treat.

Flaske best før 12/2021. Gjær og noe brødskorpe i aroma. Fraværende humle. Savner noe vinøs aroma. Mørk rødbrun. Kraftig off-white, vedvarende skumtopp. Noe vinøs smak. Svak maltsmak med preg av knekkebrød og mørk kandis. Klarer ikke å kjenne humlearoma. Varmende alkohol. Litt mye bitterhet? Medium kropp. Relativt kraftig co2. Ikke min favoritt, men virker typeriktig nok.

Thick beige head. Nose is not as strong as you expect. I just get malt and yeast..... Upon heavy sniffing I get a bourbon like smell. Thick mouthfeel. It has a strong sweet taste with a creamy edge. I get some plum, maybe chocolate and yeast. The alcohol is also apparent but not cloying. The finish leaves a bitter taste ....But in a good way. Again it leaves me thinking of a sweet bourbon. Perhaps a mapled one. Such as Evan Williams. The longer it sits the more flavour it gains. Dont drink this one cold. Although I might just prefer the red. I think it is mood dependent tho. Also at 9% I cant drink as many of these as I can the red. Top stuff.

11.2oz bottle. Pours a rich mahogany brown with a moderate beige head. Aroma is yeast, molasses, dry fruits, alcohol, and grain. Taste is much the same, with yeast molasses, and grain being accompanied by caramel, raisin, clove, some bready malt, and hints of plum. Finish is moderately bitter and alcoholic. Full body. Lively carbonation. Smooth, heavy mouthfeel.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2016 33cl bottle at home. Dark brown colour, big foamy beige head. Dried fruits, caramel, clove, molasses, bread, herbal, light cough syrup, some vinous red fruits. Good body, lively carbonation.
Dark brown, beautiful foam. Fruity, malty, plums, some yeast, spices, porto wine, chocolate. Gets better when it warms.

0,33 l bottle. Pours brown with tan head. Aroma is malty, plenty of dried fruit, some caramel, bread, noble hop notes, light yeast and some alcohol, a hint of roasty malts. Flavor is light sweet caramel, more dried fruit, roasty notes. Very complex. Texture is silky smooth despite its rather lively carbonation. Light bitter finish, more noticeable alcohol in the aftertaste.

This is the beer that introduced me to Belgian ales and it remains at the top of the list. I poured it into a Chimay glass (all the quads and trippels and dubbels get this treatment of course). It shows a great dark red, very regal, and leaves a superior off-white head that stays and stays. The smell is fruity with a bit of cinnamon, a little floral. The taste is quite complex, Sweet as in dark cherries, but not as sweet as others, an adult taste. Just a hint of red licorice, spices. Settles in and finishes with dough, perhaps just a bit of toffee. Wow. Highest rated beer for me to now. I treat myself with this every now and then.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2017 Bottle, vintage 2016 from Systembolaget. APPEARANCE: dark mahogany colour with a big off-white head. AROMA: moderate malty, dried fruits, toffee, syrup, molasses; moderate yeasty, spices, barnyard, musty, banana. TASTE: lightly sweet, medium bitter. MOUTH: medium body, lightly astringent finish, with average carbonation. NOTE: "100/100? In my opinion there are so many better Belgian strong ales"

Serious throwback. One of the first Belgian beers I tried. I used to sip this, red, and white in 2007-08 at 333 belrose with Tony yayo, and Terry. I usually preferred Blue and White. Pours a hazy brown color with creamy head. Smell and taste of figs, plum, wood, florals, pear, and rich bready malts. Medium to fuller mouthfeel. Awesome stuff and easy going at 9 percent alcohol

What a classic! An excellent Trappist Ale. Aroma is complex; great barley malts, sugars, alcohol, fresh hops. The appearance is great; opaque really dark brown color, with a nice head of a little tanned foam. Taste is pretty sweet. Medium body, medium to carbonated... overall one of the best examples of the genre.

Not much to say, this is a perfect beer. It has wonderful aromas of plums, raisins, blackberries, just tons of delicious unmistakable dark fruits. As it warms up they become more juicy and intense. Theres a nice sweet sugary molasses aroma which really plays nicely off of the dark fruit. The taste is so good. Its sweet, but effervescent and there is so much of that dark fruit from the aroma. Really easy to drink, the 9% abv is not present at all. Its super smooth and velvety. Overall, this is a wonderful quad and is an absolute classic. I had no doubt it was going to be delicious and there is so much depth and flavor its wonderful. Highly recommended.
Bottle. Dark Ruby red in color with a big beige head and minimal lacing. Notes of plum, grapes, cloves and Belgian yeast. Well balanced with the 9% abv well hidden. Very enjoyable.
caramel, cereal, citrus, floral, leather, licorice, banana, smoke, vanilla, woody,
Mooi bier. Eerder ingetogen dan uitgesproken. Lichter van smaak dan het alcoholpercentage zou doen vermoeden. Een klassieker.
Perfeito adorei muito esta cerveja...poderia tomar varias...saborosa demais  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Wysoka, świetna drobnopęcherzykowa piana. Barwa ciemnobrązowa. Aromat drożdżowy, kwiatowy, fenolowy, ziemisty z lekką nutą alkoholu. Jest przyjemny ale mógłby być ciut bardziej intensywny. Bardzo złożony smak. Przyprawowość, ciemny słód, karmel, ciemne owoce, lekkie drożdże. Alkohol dobrze ukryty. Długi finisz z charakterystycznym przyjemnym rozgrzewaniem. Wysycenie wysokie. Dobre piwo, bardzo złożone. Z każdym łykiem można dostrzec coraz więcej.
heerlijk biertje mooie donkere kleur met een lekkere caramelsmaak als afdronk.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Poured into a tulip glass at cellar temperature. Colour is cola like, with a modest short lived tan head. Aroma is light caramel, alcohol and ripe berries. Light body, lots of carbonation. Taste is sweet but not overwhelming, notes of caramel, ripe berries. No hint of the 9% abv. The flavours are subtle. I highly recommend trying this beer.

I bought this bottle in a monoprix in Paris. I drank it tonight at home. It is a bottle from the year 2014. Since a long time that I was expecting to note this beer. It is the true that it is the most commercial trappist beer, some marketing, even though the quality of this beer is great. First, I was impressed with the foam, compact, staying a long time, white and brown. The carbonation is normal. The taste is really good, notes of malt, hop, grapes, plum, final note of honey, we smell the alcohol but it is well integrated in the beer. There is a persistent taste of sugar but it is pleasant, licor, a love story that you drink step by step before to sleep.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2017 0,33 bottle. This is a rich, tasty ale with a strong head and strong aroma. Beautiful late at night or after a good lunch. Just lovely and quite affordable for the quality. Excellent.

Toujous difficile de sattaquer à un mythe! Depuis sa création en 1982, la Chimay Grande Réserve est un succès qui se confirme année après année. Il faut dire que depuis 1862, date de la première production brassicole à labaaye de Chimay (qui date de 1850), les moines se sont fait experts en la matière. La prodcution atteint actuellement 180 000 hectolitres dont la moitié pour lexport. Fort de ce succès, lembouteillage ne se fait plus à labbaye depuis 1978. Si la bière a donc le label bière trappiste authentique, difficile toutefois de croire que les moines de labbaye de Chimay ne sont pas un tantinet perdu dans les affres du marketing. Lauthenticité nest plus tout à fait présente. Masi revenons à notre bière! Sa robe est dun brun profond et surmontée dune splendide mousse blanc-cassé d1,5 cm dépaisseur environ. Le nez est souple, légèrement sur la réserve, avec des notes de céréales, de coriandre et une touche de café torréfié. La première attaque est de suite dune très belle intensité, toujours sur les céréales et le caramel. Lutilisation de froment en complément de lorge permet de complexifier les arômes. La 2ème bouche laisse sexprimer lamertume, belle et intense. sur des notes de café, dépices et dorange. Léquilibre est parfait. Lintensité de lamertume va crescendo pour laisser un final intense laissant saffirmer davantage lalcool. Lensemble reste néanmoins soyeux et mesuré. Ceci est dailleurs à la fois la raison du succès de la Chimay Grande Réserve succès mais également sa limite. Les arômes gagneraient à être légèrement plus affirmés pour que la bière atteigne la perfection.
33 cl bottle. Dark reddish brown. Funky, yeasty & malty nose. Taste has sweet malts and dark berries. Ends with a lingering alcoholic note and some caramel sweetness. Great stuff!

11.2 fl oz bottle - pours dark reddish brown with a fluffy white head. This certified Trappist beer is a go-to for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very delicate, fruity, dark berryish aroma. Excellent lacy head. Color dark amber, clear. Aroma very light, malty, dark berries. Taste dark berries. slight tartness. Not sweet, but not dry. Mouthfeel comfortable.
Bottle from Tesco. Dark and bubbly with big airy head, which quickly disappears. Aroma massively fruity with yeast, grapes, roses, some vegetale notes and slight spiciness. Rich, complex and warming.

Bottle. Dark brownish with big beige head. Aroma of fruits, roasted malts, yeast, bread, raisin, dried fruits. Taste is light sweet, caramely mouthfeel, acidic fruity notes. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2017 Bottle at home with dad. Deep, dark brown with eggy white, bubbly head. Cant smell as Im a bit crook but on the tongue I can pick up roast, spices, raisin and some alcohol on the finish. The taste is predominantly sweet but not too sweet. There is more in the complex aromas than on the tastebuds. The finish is long, warm and spicy. Looking forward to finishing the glass.



Magnum with M for our anniversary - dont worry weve only just started it. First sip is reminiscent of burnt toast and butter but with a caramel finish. Bubbly and oh so delightful. Mellow funky tones, nice palate. A perfect complement to a feast fit for kings.
Butelka 330 ml. Bardzo dobre, pełne ciało. Barwa bardzo ciemna miedź, wybitna piana. Bardzo duże wysycenie. Delektować się powoli. Goryczkowe. Alkohol bije po głowie, ale w przystępny sposób.

Clear dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of malt, yeast, dried fruits, spices. Taste is medium sweet, notes of caramel, some warming alcohol. Dry finish. Good mouthfeel. Pretty complex beer. Interesting beer. A good one.

Aroma of cloves, banana, pepper, yellow fruit, prune, bread. At first the spicy compounds from the yeast are prominent and prickly, then the caramel and the sweetness from the malt show up giving a decent balance. Theres a very very far hint of sulphur but surely not a big deal. Dark amber cloudy color, white long lasting foam. Sweet, slightly tanninic, hugely carbonated, not so attenuated as I expected. Not complex as her cousin her majesty Rochefort 10 but a great classic that everyone should try sometime.

33cl bottle. Hazy and very dark brown colour with a small beige head. Aroma: yeast, dark fruits, alcohol, bit of spice. Taste: yeast, caramel, dark fruits, spice, small amount of warming alcohol, slight roast. Lively carbonation, medium body. Decent. 2016 bottle so quite fresh, will have to try and aged bottle some time.
Hazy brown, small tan head. Really floral aroma with some toffee and caramel. Taste follows the aroma perfectly. Surprisingly no traces of alcohol. Full body, long sweet finish. Very nice.

Pours a hazy cola color with a robust light tan head that lingers. Mild aroma of roasted malt. Taste is sweet roasted malt, rock candy, dried dark fruit, some chocolate and just a bit of bread dough. Almost no bitterness whatsoever. Some alcohol warmth after the swallow, but no alcohol in the taste. Smooth and delicious, top drawer all the way.
UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Bottle at pub. Pours dark brown with small off-white head. Aroma is strong yeast and malts. Taste is roasted with hints of yeast and banana. The great trappist.

Bottle/draught. Dark brown with solid head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, candi sugar, toffee. In taste sweet, malty with lots of fruits, caramel and some warming booze. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, quite dry and slightly bitter in finish. Very good classic beer, even better with some time.
Aroma: phenols, caramel, toast, raisins. Taste: Slightly tea, caramel, dried fruit, spicy. Average body. Very tasty.
Uit de fles geschonken. Mooi roodbruin bier met flinke schuimkraag. Geur en smaak van mout, gist en gedroogd fruit. Redelijk wat carbonatie wat dit zware bier een fris karakter geeft. Mooie trappist.
Butelka, najlepszy z trójki braci, niebieski król, zarazem najmocniejszy bo aż 9% alkoholu w tak małej butelce, świeży, lekko kwiatowy zapach, lekki, alkohol czuć w głowie.

Belle robe brune foncée avec une jolie mousse ivoire peu persistante.
Le nez nous amène sur des odeurs de pruneaux et de banane.Le goût est très subtil et délicat malgré sa forte teneur en alcool avec une douce amertume en fin de bouche qui nous laisse sur des notes de figues et dattes.....
Le Sommet des Chimay!!!( à gravir encore avec mon Appiantiqua...)

Goûtée en 75cl partagée avec mon Kittenbieer!!!
Verre Maredsous.
Robe brune avec une belle mousse peu tenace.
Le nez est sur les fruits secs avec une petite touche de banane.
Le goût apporte une discrète et agréable amertume très naturelle et dautres saveurs parfaitement fondues les unes dans les autres.
Larrière bouche est longue et nous ramène des notes de figues et de dattes.
Un sommet de classicisme!
Note la version 2016. Bière très foncée avec une mousse épaisse beige. Bière très douce malgré ses 9° dalcool.

Speciale 1956 Bottle @ home. Pours dark brown and with small head. Taste is dried fruits, berries, dark syrup bread and herbs. Slightly bitter. Very well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clear, nice dark brown color, very nice foamy lacing head. Sharp ethanolic smell, which dominates the nose. Light sweet, heavy alcohol taste, medium bitterness. Long malty, bread aftertaste. Mouthfeel is pleasantly medium, with a more fresh carbonation.
Brown liquid with big tan foam. Fruity, yeast and alcohol aroma. Nice bitterness with light sourness.

2015 vintage 300ml bottle BB 12/2020 !!!
Yeasty aroma with lesser spicy fruit notes.
Dark brown with superb tan head.
Alcohol up front followed by smooth sweet fruitcake finish.
Yum.
Pours an opaque deep brown with a thick beige head. Nose is light ripe fruit. Taste is sweet malt wth a touch of roasted malt. No bitterness. 11.2 oz bottle Bring back 12 oz bottles. Use cans!

soft aroma - fermented plums, malt, yeast, some caramel and cognac.
medium, heavy and sweetish taste - wild black currant, fermented malt, caramel, dark honey, some yeast and cognac. good!

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 330ml Bottle. Pours Dark brown with medium white too beige head. aromas of dark dried fruits, Raisens and caramel. Taste is sweet with dades, sugar and roasted malts. Aftertaste is a bit spicy and long lasting

Pours hazy light brown with a huge beige head, no lacing. Nose of spice, raisins, caramel, smoke, yeast, toast, plums, bread crust and a bit of cooked bread, and all this somehow indeed reminds of rose aroma. Tastes medium sweet with enough roasty sourness to make it feel dry-ish and with a distinct somewhat-roasty bitterness. High carbonation, medium body, a bit of alcoholic warmth on finish. Lovely complexity and balance, I prefer it at 13-15 degrees Celsius.

Pours murky dark brown with a large beige head. Smells strongly of dark fruits and alcohol, hints of toffee. Taste is fruity sweet, with some alcohol sting and maltiness. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and lively mouth-carbonation, Chimay Bleue (Grande Réserve) finishes with a lingering toffee, fruity sweetness.

Pours a dark brown with a large head, that begins dissipating relatively soon. Aroma is malt forward, with caramel and dried fruit. Taste echos the aroma for the most part. Not a lot of alcohol taste for the ABV, being just present enough to give a warming feel. Mouth feel is carbonated, and the pleasant warming stays with you afterward. Quite good.

Bottle. Dark colour. Stable head with big bubbles. Champagne carbonation. Medium full body. Alcohol heats the throat. The aroma is very sweet with notes of dry fruits, alcohol, toasts. The flavour is typically Belgian, with notes of fruits like: plums, cherries, raisins.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 Aroma complesso ma ben amalgamato, grande palato ed equilibrio straordinario tra le fragranze luppolate amarognole e un lieve sentore abboccato. Bella densità al palato, maltosa e ancora, nonostante i numeri, vicina a un gusto artigianale. Rimane una delle migliori.

Bottles of Grande Reserve shared at RB/HD at Fjøløy 02.09.16.

2009-vintage. Dark copper. Brown head. Vinous aroma and taste, with rasins, dates and prune compote. Fine sherry in aftertaste. Complex, drinkable and very, very good!

2008-vintage. Dark copper. Brown head. Less creamy and less prune compote than in the 2009-vintage and perhaps a bit of aceton i aroma. Drier and bit more lively mothfeel. Very drinkable!

2007-vintage. Quickly diminishing head. Similar taste and aroma as 2008, but more malt and drier. Refreshing!

2006-vintage. Quite similar to 2007. Excellent!

Sir Longdong Hausyerpupu say, ah bieg luvely last long time good for aging up to 12 years, in fact, may be best around 4 years, plus or minus...the standby for the style as is Dupont for saison, Pliney the Elder for double IPA, la la la...not perfect, but such a consistently delicious classic for the style and beer itself...amen.
Dark, warming flavours, chocolate, little head but it stays on the pour. Aromas open as it warms. Quite simply incredible. Heavy so not a continues drinker ;-)

[backlog] 02-09-15 / bottle bought in Belgium, drank at home. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 3.75/5

Color marrón oscuro con capa de espuma marrón claro, tirando a grisáceo, de dos dedos de grosor (se disipa fácilmente hasta menos de un dedo de grosor). Carbonatación media. Restos de fermentación en botella. Aroma a levadura, malta, humedad, alcohol. Sabor similar, con mayor presencia de malta tostada, poco alcohólica si tenemos en cuenta sus 9%. Evidentemente, una de las mejores cervezas belgas, en cualquier categoría. Todo un acierto. Podría beberla casi en cualquier momento, aunque ciertos momentos sean mejores que otros.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2016 Dark brown color. Bright, fruity, phenolic aroma with some raisins and cream cheese. Quite sweet and rich, but is very drinkable and well attenuated. Has a bit of light roasted flavors, not too much bitterness, and spicy phenols, mostly dry.  Nice fruity esters. Excellent beer.
Jedno z moich ulubionych piw, ciemne, mętne, z bardzo złożonym smakiem i aromatem. Chyba nie trzeba nic dodawać. Klasyk

Upon opening the bottle, a very strong malt smell followed by dried fruit, clove, and hint of banana.

Taste same as the smell, strong malty taste with a lots of dried fruits, clove and hint of alcohol. Surprisingly smooth for a 9% abv. Pretty good carbonation too.

A sweet, fruity and non bitter after taste. Lovely.

0,33l bottle. Hazy brown colour with very long lasting big beige head. Aroma: Nuts, especially almond, black currant, chocolate a bit coffee and matured cheese!Taste: Sweet-sweet start with a light sweet/sour mouthfeel. Fruity, dessert like and mature. Almost no bitterness but who cares. Full body with soft carbonation. Long sweet/sour finish. Great and huge beer.

Piana kremowa, średnio pęcherzykowa, sycząca i dość szybko znikająca do niewielkiej pierzynki. Barwa rubinowa, opalizująca. Aromat delikatny, jest trochę karmelu, suszonych i kandyzowanych owoców, nieco ziół, akacji, porto i starego chmielu. W smaku półsłodkie, znacznie bogatsze i intensywniejsze niż w zapachu, przede wszystkim rodzynki, daktyle i figi, kandyzowana skórka pomarańczowa, toffi, przyprawy. Goryczka niska, ziołowa. Wysycenie średnie, puszyste. gładkie i lepkie w odbiorze. Alkohol rozgrzewający, kojarzący się właśnie z porto i sherry. 
Klasyczny Belgian Strong Ale, praktycznie Quadrupel - wyraźnie po słodkiej stronie, mocno estrowy, delikatnie fenolowy, gładki i treściwy. Odrobinkę do poprawy jedynie aromat, co jednak zostało zrekompensowane w smaku.
Ps.
Piwo leżakowane ponad 1,5 roku.

Bottle conditioned. Mahogany body. Large off white head. Nose is cloves, banana, malt syrup, dark fruit, oak, yeast, cherries, cinnamon and herbs. Fairly sweet with some bitterness and some raw alcohol. Dry finish.

0,75l, pantu 2010. BBE 2015. Kolmisen vuotta virheellisesti eri lämpötiloissa säilytetty olut. Tummanruskea, ensimmäinen lasillinen läpinäkyvä, toinen hiivojen kanssa lävitse näkymättömän samea. Ei vaahtoa lainkaan. Tuoksu maltainen ja hedelmäinen. Maku pehmeä, täyteläinen ja maltainen. Ennen kaikkea vahvan täyteläisen maltainen maku, joka tuntuu syventyneen ja voimistuneen ikäännytyksellä. Sen sijaan ulkonäkö on kolmessa vuodessa mennyt selvästi heikompaan suuntaan. Pitäisi kaiketi kypsyttää pidempään ja varsinkin tasaisemmassa viileähkössä lämpötilassa. Tuore: 8-4-9-4-19, 3v vanha: 9-2-9-5-19
Lovely deep brown/ruby pour with tan foam. Plenty of yeasty esters, bread, dried red fruit, all the Belgian good stuff. Lovely.

Well this is just a great beer. Very dark in colour head off white but soon gone ( from a bottle) taste of malt hops and I have to say chocolate for me. Taste for a strong ale is very pleasing a beer to be enjoyed and not rushed.

Dark brown with strong light beige head. Earthy with herbs, licorice, dried fruit and malt. Yeast, malt, sweetness and more of the fruit. Medium body with smooth palate and a long malty finish. A great beer as always but this particular individual has probably been shaken too much recently.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Head is large, thick, foamy, and light tan in colour. The beer itself is a dark dark cloudy brown, almost completely opaque through the glass. Aroma is sweet and earthy, a bit subtle. When the head dies down you can smell the strong alcohol in this if you really take a whiff. Taste is where it gets exciting- even just the head is rich and creamy, it fills up your mouth. Incredibly smooth texture and quite sweet, deep flavours- primarily caramel and rich honey, malty. Fruit undertone, plum comes to mind, lots more going on here. It?s delicious, ending with a long and warm mouthfeel.

The aroma is full of flowers (namely roses), malt, dried fruits, caramel and yeast. The color is dark brown with a minimal, white and frothy head. The taste is full of malt, yeast, caramel, malt, dried fruits. A nice beer but overrated.
Donkere trappist. Deze smaakt erg zoet met een fruitige touch. Mooie afdronk die lang blijft hangen.

Problem z tym piwem jest taki, że biorą się za nie czasami markety i wtedy chuj wi ile to leży w świetle i wysokiej temperaturze - bywa wtedy gorsze, ale chyba nigdy nie trafiłem na złe. To jest perfekcyjne belgijskie piwo. Aromat suszonych owoców (figi, daktyle, rodzynki) miesza się z pikantnymi aromatami , karmelem i odrobiną ziołowości chmielu. W smaku dochodzi lekko pikantna alkoholowa nuta, wszystko pijalne i zbalansowane. Nie ma co się bać klasyki - potrafi skopać dupsko.

W aromacie przewijają się akcenty winne - owoce skąpane w szlachetnym alkoholu, takie jak śliwki i daktyle z apertifem kawy i karmelu. Ponadto klasyczna drożdżowa estrowość z bananem w roli głównej. Piwo barwy brunatnej, piana średnio i grubo pęcherzykowa. W smaku karmel, rodzynki, ale i banan z białym pieczywem. Lekka kawowa goryczka. Struktura gładka, mimo tych 9% alkoholu. Pije się świetne. Nie zalepia, a nadal pozostaje świetnym piwem degustacyjnym.

Apparence : Brune au versement, surprenamment noire dans le verre, bon col beige pétillant, bonne rétention, effervescence semble assez élevée et rapide, dépôts présents au fond du verre. 

Nez : Malt grillé, levure, phénols, arômes floraux, léger caramel, légèrement dattes en arrière-plan. 

Goût : Pain grillé, légères notes de chocolat noir (qui ne reviennent pas par la suite), levure bien présente, sucre contrôlé par les notes rôties et la légère amertume, finale dans une alliance de malt, de phénols et dalcool. 

Sensation : Corps plutôt dense, effervescence élevée, belle chaleur en finale, piquant sur la langue. 

Bref : Cest spécial, car je ne peux dire que je lapprécie réellement, pourtant je me surprenais à toujours retourner mes lèvres au verre. Trop deffervescence, goût de levure trop présent, malt intéressant, sans plus, pas assez fruitée malgré tout, la présence du malt rôti, lalcool et le corps en font une bonne bière. 
À racheter? Non, il se fait de meilleurs exemples du style, autant localement que dans les bières Trappistes à mon goût.
Deep brown colour with good creamy head. Aroma is caramel and toffee and some spices. Taste is both sweet and bitter. The alcohol doesnt come on too strong. Good balance. Long finish. Classic.
Delicious Trappist Belgian Beer the only way I can describe it is it brings happiness to your mouth. Definitely a must buy.

Served in a Chimay goblet from a 330ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium beige head. Aroma is banana, molasses, clover, dark fruits, spice, bread and a hint of yeast. Taste is extremely smooth with banana, bread, clover, molasses and a hint of spicy notes. Medium body with medium carbonation, the 9% alcohol is virtually undetectable. Fantastic, warming and extremely enjoyable.

75 cl bottle pouring a dark ruby-brown and a glassful of head. Sweet and dizzying aroma the pungency slaps me in the face. Heavy malt and earthy accents with berries. A beer to knock you out after a hard days work. A
Very nice beer. Ive tasted it for the first time in a Belgian Bar in Stockholm. It was ideal for a dinner with a great hamburger.

A bottle from Jasons, near NCC Uni., drunk at home. Aroma: strong presence of alcohol. Appearance: head is of small bubbles, certainly not fluffy or foamy, minimal. Hazy, dark brown, almost purplish colour. Taste: raisins, wood, alcohol. Palate; warm, lasting, well-balanced. This has got to be one of my favourites - complex flavour with a real kick. Widely available in Taipei.

This beer was very interesting. Has a strong sweet and sour aroma and a large head. Taste of cinnamon and ginger also which was nice and different. Very great overall beer. It pairs well with Lays Lightly Salted potato chips.

Stubby little 33cl bottle to Chimay goblet. L11 date code, which makes this 2011 vintage, I think. Cant believe that I havent entered a rate for this yet! Pours medium brown with a lingering beige head. Aroma is banana, molasses, clove. Flavor is super smooth... Banana, brown bread, clove. Really impossible to detect the 9% hiding in here. World class.

Bottle. 2014 tasted yesterday (14/Jul/2016) 
Aroma: Caramel, raisins, dried fruit. Very delicate aromas, nothing strong. Being used to the strong new-wave scents I miss them here. Alcohol pretty much covered but you can feel it is there.
Appearance: Hazy dark brown with redish reflexes. Minimal off-white head that does not last more than a couple of seconds.
Taste: Traces of caramel in a malty sweetness and a bitterness that comes from the alcohol that is not hidden but rather ballanced. For my taste the alcohol is a bit too much prominent.
Palate: Medium carbonation gives that sticky feeling. 
Overall: Seeing the score and how everybody goes crazy for this beer I am not that impressed. Judging by this bottle Id say it is overhyped, and the brand makes a lot of the score. Although it is a very good beer and I did enjoy it very much. I will get back to this beer a couple more times to compare my rating.
Wooow, aroma davvero complesso, odore di malto tostato, pane, orzo e cioccolato. Gusto amaro con retrogusto di caramello. Fantastica!
caramel, cereal, bubblegum,,medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, slick feel, lively, nice brown strong belgian beer, well balanced.

750mL bottle. Pours a hazy, deep coppery reddish with a massive frothy off-white head. Nose is mildly funky Belgian yeast, dates, raisins, prunes, candy sugar, touch of Band-Aid phenolic. Mouth is medium-full, relatively sharp carbonation, creamy, dried fruity, caramel, hint of vanilla. mildly sweet. Havent had this one in years. Still solid.
Would be nice with a steak and chips dinner, not after a mcdonalds..............

Barwa ciemno miedziana, piwo klarowne, z bujną, drobnopęcherzykową pianą. Niezbyt intensywny, ale złożony aromat, rodzynki, daktyle, czerwone owoce, brązowy cukier. W smaku wyczuwalne podobne nuty, piwo ma odrobinę zbyt wysokie wysycenie; alkohol wyczuwalny, ale w przyjemny, szlachetny sposób.
Szép nagy, tartós habja van. Átlátszatlan sötétbarna szín. Fincsi karamellás illat. Íze erősen komlós, feketecsokis jelleggel. Mintha gyenge füstösség lebegne a háttérben. Testes sör.
A heavy hitter. Heavy aromas of malt, caramel, yeast and brown sugar. Taste is yeast, sweet flavors like raisins, dried fruit and some spices. Really good.
Dark brown. Sweet ripe fruits. Basement aromas. Carbonation. Yeasty. Basic all around tripel. Elegant, but not fancy.

Pours a hazy, deep brown color with huge, creamy beige head. Nose is sweet caramel malts, toffee and herbs. Very nice.

Medium to full body with regular carbonation and smooth texture that is kinda sticky. Taste is bittersweet, with sweetness coming from malts and bitterness from alcohol. Very nicely balanced. Aroma of caramel malts, toffee, herbs, spices. Floral with just the right amount of alcohol presence on the tongue. Finish is long and slightly bitter.

Overall, delicious.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso: luppolo ricorda liquirizia, orzo tostato, caffè, marron glacé e cuoio. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è ragguardevole. Il cappello è di schiuma compatta, cremosa e aderente. Le bollicine sono medie. Il colore è scuro impenetrabile. Il corpo è pieno e strutturato ma duttile. Lamaro è medio. Lintensità gustativa è molto elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole e godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate e da favola, ma anche di birra impegnativa. Il finale è amarognolo, lungo, secco, pulito e complesso. Il retrogusto è intenso e persistente. In bocca laroma riporta sentori di caramello, miele, cioccolato, frutta secca, fiori, frutta secca, agrumi, alcol presente non invadente, malto tostato, frutta scura, dattero, zucchero e vaniglia.

Bottle into wine glass. Dark thin head. Dried fruits, molasses, candy. Tasty after dinner beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a nice rich brown from a bottle, thick off-white head with large bubbles. Dark candi sugar, bit of an alcohol burn. Good beer.

The beer is hazy and dark brown in color. The foam is beige and will firmly. The foam has small to medium bubbles that hang around for a while. The foam leave direct track in the glass. Scents of some malt and dried fruit. Some floral and candied sugar with rum raisins. A little bitter orange and yeast with a little fruit cake. Very round in the aroma with a nice sweetness. The flavors are as scents. But with a little cocoa and a little caramel. There was a little lees. Is a real good balance in it all. Rich body. Moderate Carbonic. A little sweetness and a little small dry. Good roundness sitting on the palate just long.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a darker brown color with a thick khaki colored head and a bit of lace. The aroma is interesting. There is a nice dark fruit and caramel. I like the sweetness from the dark fruit, but its just rather light and non-complex. The flavor is similar. There is a caramel and a dark fruit presence, but its light and crisp. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a caramel sweetness that falls off pretty quick. There is a bright soft carbonation, which is weird, and the aftertaste is quick fading and malty. Interesting for sure.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. For the book. Aroma is dark fruit, dry, yeast, really nice. Appearance is brown, hazy, light tan head. Taste is dry, some dark fruit, its sadly pretty bland by comparison to other Belgian Strongs. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, dark fruit and candy aftertaste. Overall, good and drinkable but not what I expected.

Cor marrom escura e turva com espuma marrom de alta formação e média persistência com pouco lacing.
Aroma de frutas secas, nozes, pão, leveduras e leve chocolate.
Sabor inicial de nozes, frutas secas e pão, evoluindo para um meio de leve vinho do Porto migrando rapidamente para um final alcoólico, amadeirado e picante; retrogosto amadeirado e alcoólico persistente.
Corpo sedoso e média carbonatação.

330ml bottle from Tesco. Brownish color with an off white head. A pleasant but muted aroma from this beer. Some banana and malt. The taste is full though with medium sweetness and light bitterness. Oily mouthfeel. Not sour at all but maybe some unami. Nice strong beer

muy poco que decir, chimay!!muy buena cerveza, la complejidad del aroma tapa perfectamente todo el contenido de alcool, muy balanceada, color oscuro, sin llegar a ser negro, caramelo, levadura, malta tostada, corona de espuma tirando a oscura y sabor complejo como el aroma.

Aroma: it doesnt show a lot of aroma. Alcohol is almost indiscernible (a great achievement for a beer with this quantity of alcohol). Hints of yeast, caramel, roasted malts, spicy. No hints of hop aroma.
Appearance: dark brown color, hazy, almost totally opaque. Average head despite its 9% ABV alcohol level. Beige head slightly creamy. Low retention.
Taste: medium to heavy sweetness, light bitterness, no sourness.
Palate: medium body, soft carbonation, oiliy texture, not quite long sweet and finish.
Overall: a good beer. The high alcohol level is almost indiscernible in flavors and aroma. You know its there because of its warming effect. Great sweet, caramel and roasted malt flavors, a little spicy. Low bitterness. Dont drink it too cold or youll lose a lot of the complex aromas and flavors. 10-12 Celsius degrees is the right service temperature.

Dark brown colour with some reddish hints. Average head, slightly off-white, dense and stable, low lacing. Aroma shows caramel and sugar with some dark/dried fruits notes in the background. Taste has a lot of sweetness with caramel and an almost aggressive sugary feel that feels kinda artificial. Pity cause the beer shows some very nice liquorice and dark/dried fruit notes on the background. Some earthiness and a slight hint of acidity are also noticeable. Finish is also a bit too much on the sweet/sugary side. Medium body, a bit more crisp than usual per style, but overall still decently creamy. Warming enough. Decent, but far from quality strong dark ales

Small sample at Mitsui Food Show, Yokohama. Pours brown, bit of foam, relatively clear. Aroma has some alcohol bite, also sweeter dried fruits. Taste has the same, dried fruits, prunes and lots of caramel. Sweetish and quite tasty, suitable for drinking from Chimays chalice. Makes me think that I should maybe give trappists a few more chances.

Uma pequena maravilha em forma de cerveja: marrom-escura, opaca, com boa formação de creme, que logo se acomoda em uma fina camada. Aroma de açúcar mascavo, biscoito. O sabor é bem mais intenso que o aroma, prevalecendo o malte, sem ser muito doce, com amargor e acidez equilibrados, com toques de frutas vermelhas. Final levemente picante. Ótima
This one has a darker pour than the red. Dark brown with an off white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of caramel and malts. Flavor is malty with a little bit of alcohol coming through in the finish.

What to say about it ? A classic that well worth it. Stong character, strong alcohol level, strong taste, not for the weak ! Possibly one of my favorite "classic" beers, no artificial aromas or novelty flavour, you know what youll get and you cant be disappointed. APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW !
Chimay Bleue (Blue) / Grande Reserve - uzupełnienie ocen piw pitych przed używaniem ratebeer.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 Meget mørk og tåget, men med klart hvidt skum. Sødlig smag af karamel, brændte mandler og lidt malt. Let bitterhed i eftersmagen. God balance,  så sødmen ikke får overtaget.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2016 Bottle at pm. Brown colour, medium white head. Nose is banana and molasses. Taste is low sweetness low bitterness. Sadly got a fresh bottle, but I?m sure it would be even more interestig in a few years.

Donker amberrood, licht troebel, beige volle schuimkraag, fijn qua structuur.
In de aroma geroosterde mouten, karamel en donker zoet fruit. Na opwarming ook wat gist hinten in de aroma. Smaak: Behoorlijk zoet, karamel, siroop, rood gedroogd fruit en een chocolade hint. Tikkeltje van de bekende Belgische gist smaak. Een aardige alcohol warmte en en redelijke nabitter. Alles is heel zacht, ook het mondgevoel is zacht en romig. Medium CO2 en een medium tot volle body. in de afdronk is lang nog smaak en eindigt droog.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 330 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a large frothy beige head and some larger particles. The aroma is light to moderate yeasty and fruity (apples and pears). Full oily body with a distinct alcoholic finish. The taste starts pretty sweet with distinct acidity and some bitterness. The aromas are complex and heavy of roasted malt (caramel, chocolate and bread) but also dried fruits and apples and pears, honey, vanilla. Warming alcoholic feeling. Very nice beer.

Aroma: Belgian yeast, caramel, alcohol, stone fruits
Appearance: clear amber with an off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 

Sublime
33cl bottle. Pours with very thick head. Dark brown color. It has very rich aromas such as caramel, toffee, raisin, molasses. Full bodied and a bit too sweet tasted for me.

From bottle in Belgian ale glass. Pours dark brown and murky with a lively head thanks to the bottle fermenting. Yeasty aroma and rich malt profile giving a broad range of flavour including aniseed, faint chocolate and prune. One for the ages.
Bottle at home. Pours brown with medium sized tanned head. Aroma of yeast, plum, berries and caramel malts. Full bodied, the taste has heavy sweetness and light to medium bitterness. Quality.
typical Belgium-style beer, very flowerish aroma which nicely fits exactly same taste, which corresponds to aroma, fits the style perfectly, but personally not one of my favourites.

The last beer this tourist downed in Belgium. At a tram stop. Insane flavours, so verbose yet harmonious. Dark, warming flavours, prune, chocolate, little head but it stays on the pour. Aromas open as it warms. Quite simply incredible.
2015 Edition. An absolutely amazing beer. Full bodied with a massive palate. Undoubtedly one of the best beers in the world.

The Chimay Bleu is a Belgian Trappist Ale brewed at the Abbaye de Scourmont in Belgium. From every bottle of beer that is sold, ?0,25 cents goes to the social instutions to support the lesser divided people. 

Taste: the Chimay Trappist Ale has a full taste which opens up with chocolade and coffee related flavours. The fullness of taste is supported by its alcohol percentage which makes it a beer to enjoy with passion. Serve this beer in the characteric Chimay Glass and prepare yourself for one of the best Trappist Ales Belgium has to offer. Drink this beer as a wine or a wisky. Dont drink it too fast. Take some time. 

Overall: for those of you who like chocolate and coffee flavours in beer and espescially trappist ales, this is worth everything.
bottle @ supermarket (brussels) brown colour, heavy body but also silky, tasty bitterness for my mouth. very good belgian beer!

2016 Bottle. Pours dark humus-like brown with high head. Aroma is yeast, fruits, berries, chocolate, malts. Taste and flavours are smooth, balanced, raisins, malty, spicy, toffee, rye, whiskey, butterscotch with an awesome development.

Dark brown beer, little head which stays. Beautiful color. Nice sweet aroma, little bit fruits maybe. Pleasant mild taste, after it gets stronger and few bitter notes also. You can´t tell on the taste that it is so strong beer (9%) Good easy drinkable for such strong beer.

Espuma en tonos marrones y beige muy abundante y cremosa que permanece durante la cata, color chocolate oscuro por donde no pasa la luz, aroma dulce en nariz, sabor penetrante y potente con matices tostados tonos dulzones y retrogusto permanente, a pesar de la alta graduación no se aprecia en exceso durante la cata.

There is nothing to add. Nice dried plums palate, a robust body and a long dry finish are the main characteristics.
