Bottle @ Headquarters, Aarhus. Pours dark hazy brown with a medium brown head. Aromas of malts, dark fruits, belgian yeastiness, caramel. Taste is malty, yeasty, filled chocolates, dark fruits, slick caramely trappist classic notes, dry fruity finish.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2016 APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso con destellos cafés y rojizos a contraluz; corona de espuma color marfil de buena retención, con burbujas compactas y abierta.

AROMA: compleja; notas a azúcar morena, caramelo, costra de pan, plátano, especiado de la levadura como pimienta, nueces, algunos frutos oscuros maduros como dátiles y ciruela, se alcanza a percibir ligeramente el alcohol pero muy leve.

SABOR: sigue al aroma, predomina el azúcar morena, caramelo, las notas de plátano y costra de pan, el especiado de la levadura, nueces, más ligeramente frutos oscuros maduras como dátiles y ciruelas; el retrogusto queda un amargor ligero casi medio, ligeramente seco, quedan algunas notas amaderadas probablemente de los lúpulos, y muy ligeramente dulce sin llegar a ser astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero, mediana baja carbonatación. El alcohol sólo se percibe ligeramente al pasar el trago en garganta como una sensación cálida sin llegar a ser agresiva.

RESUMEN: Buena cerveza trapense.

Servie dune bouteille à deux verres. Brune opaque avec un col beige et une forte carbonatation au moment du service. Au nez, levure, vin, chêne et fruits confits. En bouche, fruits confits, malt rôti et bois. Lalcool donne une belle rondeur, et on sent bien sa chaleur.
Flesje met familie gedronken. Matig geurend, stevig schuimend donker bier. Smaak is dropachtig. Nasmaak is bitter

33cl bottle from 2015. This beer is strong, but I honestly cant understand the hype. Carbonation is too high and the alcohol taste is too obvious. Nuts and dried fruits, raisins maybe but too much sugar in the taste, almost artificial.Strange, maybe its a bad batch or it was stored in improper conditions, but its not my first beer (in fact, more of the 200th), Ive also had the Rochefort Trappistes 8 for example and the difference is huge.
Très bon rapport qualité prix, un vrai plaisir à boire. Un classique belge à connaître.
Brown dark appearance. It leave a little taste of alcohol in mouth at the end but it has good flavor.

Flaska 2003

U: mörk röd/brun klar vätska. Låg kolsyrenivå. Ett litet skumlock som inte ens täcker vätskan helt. 

A: Knäck. Kola. Melass. Kandisocker. Soja. Pumpernickel. 

S/M: kraftigt oxiderad. Portvin. Upplev som dammig och gammal. Sötman från en ung är väldigt nedtonad. Smakar nästan lite mögligt. Torkade fikon. 

Har tyvärr blivit för gammal. 

Lätt kolsyra. Mjuka bubblor. Mellan medel full kropp. Mjuk vätska. Slutar torr och sträv. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown. Not transparent with huge creamy head. Smells malt, wine, dark fruit, alcohol and some nuts. Thick body, no carb. Sweet, fruity and malty. No alcohol in the taste. There's some alcohol in the finish though.

Kolor brązowy, bardzo zmętniony. Piana drobna, szybko opada. Aromat mało intensywny, słodowy, drożdżowy i przyprawowy z lekkimi akcentami kwiatów, owoców. Smak lekko wytrawny. Trochę drożdżowe nuty i przyprawy. Czuć lekki alkohol. Wysokie wysycenie. Słaba goryczka. Jak na piwo trapistów to mało intensywny smak.

Piwo ciemnobrązowe z beżową pianą oblepiającą szkło. Aromat przyprawowy, drożdżowy, brzoskwiniowy, odrobina alkoholu, przyjemny. Smak przyprawowy, owocowy, goryczka niska, piwo degustacyjne. Piwo gęste, o wysokim nasyceniu. Bardzo przyjemne.

Donker bruin bier met fijne dunne wit/beige schuimkraag. Geur: gistkarakter, brood, wat fruitig en alcoholisch, vleugje donkere chocolade en koffie,. Smaak: zoetig, zoethout, wat banaan en een milde bitterheid. Goed in balans. Redelijk volmondig. Weinig koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitterig. Ik heb een eigenaardige relatie met dit bier, ik lust het de eene keer meer dan de andere keer.
330 ml bottle. Dark brown with a small beige creamy head. Roasted malt, yeast, sweetness and plums/raisins in aroma. Medium carbonation with full body. Sweet bitterish finish.

Tasted from a 750 Ml bottle with Marc and Denis. Red and slightly cloudy. Malty but very well balanced. Lots of molasses. Huge mouth feel. 

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - Dark brown color, creamy head. Aromas of licorice, caramel, coffee, roasted malts, sharp alcohol in the end. A bit sugary. Strong body. Very well balanced. Very good.

33cl bottle (2015) on 28-Feb-2016, poured into a trappist glass. A gorgeous deep brown colour with a small to medium sized brown head. Aroma of yeast, spices and malt. Full body and medium carbonation. Flavour of bananabread, malt, spices and yeast. Light sweetness with just a hint of bitterness. A wonderfully crafted and well balanced beer.

En bouteille 33cl. Superbe couleur foncée et belle mousse légèrement brune que reste bien dans le verre. Arôme café, pas très prononcé. Goût sucré avec un long final très agréable.
Une bonne bière trappiste.

From the bottle. Dark with a quickly dissipating head. An opening day tradition for me. Cannot go wrong with a good Trappist ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kolor brązowy, bardzo zmętniony. Piana beżowa z drobniutkich pęcherzyków, opadła szybko do minimalnej warstewki na powierzchni. 
Aromat mało intensywny, słodowy, drożdżowy i przyprawowy z lekkimi akcentami kwiatów, owoców. W smaku początkowo wydało mi się lekko słodkie, z czasem bukiet stał się wytrawny. Znów mamy drożdżowe nuty i przyprawy. Jest lekka alkoholowość, podbita wysokim wysyceniem. Goryczka ledwo wyczuwalna w tym wszystkim, lekko też osadza się na języku. Piwo jest treściwe i wybitnie degustacyjne.
Jak na piwo tej mocy spodziewałem się czegoś mocniejszego, w doznaniach oczywiście.

From the bottle poured into trappist glass. Pours nut brown with quickly vanishing head, but strong residual lacing. Nose of roasted malts, breadcrump anf liquorice. Mouthfeel is intense carbonation and alcoholic warmth. Taste is liquorice, intense malts, alcohol. Grassy herbal finish on the palate.

bottle, cant remember where from, finally round to rating it. pours brown with a tan head. aroma of dark fruits, raisins, poached apples and pears, brandy. tastes of plums, caramel, spices, hint of zesty orange at the end. alcohol blended in nicely. sweet with hardly any bitterness. i love this kind of beer. big stewed fruity flavours and a toasty dunt of booze. doesnt look much in the wee bottle but its greattttt
Cerveja trapista belga, de coloração marrom, sabor adocicado dos maltes. Alto teor alcoólico
Good beer, has a very yeasty and malty aroma. The taste is very malty, raisiny, yeasty and a hint of alchohol. Its a very highly carbonated beer perfect for aging.
Cloudy mahogany. Large frothy head, high retention. Aroma intensity 3.5/5. Banana, malt and cut grass aroma. Good bitter/sweet balance. Full body
2015, Dunkelbraun rötlich, klar, wenig hellbrauner Schaum, süßlich in der Nase, spritziger antrunk, nette Hefe, süßlich malzig, durchaus merklicher Alkohol, hätte noch gelagert werden sollen

Originally rated on 8/15/ 08. Bottled on 04/08. The best of the Chimay line in my humble opinion, poured a murky, deep brown body, sediment visible, with a thin light tan head, Aroma and flavors of fig, raisins, caramel, malts and a little nutty, flavor changes with the temperature. Mouthfeel is full bodied and smooth and despite the high alc. content it was hardly noticeable. Top notch brew, you gotta treat yourself from time to time
with a dark brown color, and large cream-colored foam. Its complexity is remarkable, highlighting its malty notes, candy, sugar candy, berries, grapes and prunes. Powerful body, complex and balanced.

75cl bottle (2014 Vintage), pours a cloudy brown with a thin off-white head, decent lacing. Aroma is lighter than expected, yeast and slightly alcoholic. Sweet taste of roasted malts, caramel, light bitterness, well balanced and smooth. Medium to full bodied, slight fizzy carbonation. For the style this is an excellent example.
From bottle. Pours Dark brown color with medium tan head. Aroma of caramel, dry fruits and roasted malts. Soft carbonation with low to medium bitterness.
Dark brownish colour with lots of caramel, nice bitterness and late sweetness. Easily one of my favourite belgian beers.
Absolute perfection. Caramelized malt leads to toasted nut and chocolate malty notes, balanced by mildly spicy hops. Aromas from yeast as only the trapists can do.

Mørk brunt med noen rødlige nyanser med høyt skum som forsvinner fort. Søtlig duft med krydder, vanilje, plomme og typisk belgisk gjær. Krydder og plomme fremtredende i smaken sammen med en ganske "skarp" avslutning. Litt mye kullsyre.

Aroma: Caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, belgian yeasts.
Appearance: Dark brown, tan 1-finger head. 
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, fruits, touch of port wine, very well balanced.
Palate: Full body, creamy slick texture, soft carbonation, long sweet finish. 
Overall: Balanced, very tasty, great example of the style.
Mouse fine belle couleur ruby, levure au nez, sucre et acidité qui reste longtemps en bouche, caramel mais pas vraiment et fruits rouge idem...déçu..
The complexity in the taste, aroma and texture in this beer is just mindblowing. One of the best I have experienced.
Een mooi donkerbruin bier, met een volle schuimkop. In het smaakpalet zitten koffie, karamel, vijgen, sinaasappel, toast. Zeer zacht van smaak en aroma.
The elevated alcohol level is good hidden behind the bouquet. The aftertaste is ok. Its not my style
Dark with nice head. Aroma is yeasty, spicy with nuts and dark fruits. Taste is lightly sweet, spicy with bitter finish. Alcohol is well hidden.

Aroma: Metall, Karamell og Belgia
Utseende: Voldsomt skumhod som holde leeenge.Brunrød farge
Smak: Nytelse. Anelse brentmalt. Karamell, toffee.
Munnfølelse: Balansert og fyldig. Bra karbonert.

Caramel, yeast, dark fruits, huge white head, persistant and very creamy, brown with ruby reflections, medium body, for me too carbonated, taste similar to the aroma, alcohol is well hidden, it emerges only in the aftertaste giving a pleasant feeling of warmth that should, in my opinion, be more present during the drink.....nevertheless it remains a wonderful strong.

Tastes like a nun just sat on my face.
Rich, Sweet and innocent. 
Delicious.
Bottle. Dark brown color, tan head. Aroma of banana, whiskey. A tin of sourness, medium sweet. Great one.

Pours dark brown, almost black with a medium off-white head. 
Aromas are pretty subtle but there is some plum and prune along with some spices and yeast. Its just... I had to dip my nose really deep into my glass and smell it a couple of times before I found what I was looking for.
Once in the mouth I would say that it is a medium to full bodied with a medium carbonation. 
Nicely balanced. Sweet but not too much with just a hint of bitterness at the end. Medium-long lasting taste.

Poured from a 11.2 OZ bottle into a goblet. The appearance is a dark brown with a huge tan head. The aroma is caramel and yeast with some hops and fruit added. The taste is sweet caramel with some yeast or dough in the background. A great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Bottle 75 cl : une bière à partager ! Peut-être une des brunes trappistes les plus (re)connues et ce nest pas pour rien. Quand on y a goûté et même lorsquon est curieux de découvrir dautres bières, on y revient régulièrement. Couleur brun foncé, mousse claire, arômes puissants de fruit où domine la prune, bouche intense de fruits, caramel avec rondeur et amertume équilibrées. Un must.
Mooi donker bier met witte schuimkraag die langzaam wegebt. Mooi aroma en smaak van koffie, pruimen, chocolade, caramel, licht kruidig. Mooie warme afdronk. Trappist van de bovenste plank.

33cl bottle (2004 vintage) from Vinmonpolet Ullevål Station, Oslo. Pours very dark brown to chestnut with a minimal head. Malty and vinous with raisins, some earthy notes and caramel. More vinous than I remember it, but guess the aging has made some difference. Feels a bit thin, but certainly flavourful. Sweet and dessert, possible over the top at this age, but still decent.

33cl bottle: I am a bit leery of a beer rated 100....this is a truly fine beer, no doubt, but I can´t give it a perfect score, knowing something, somewhere might be even better. That said, this is a pure joy to savor. Very little foam, no lacing to speak of, nice dark brown color. A bit tangy on the tongue, which is nice. Definitely one to look for in the larger sizes, if for nothing else to compare the taste. In the end I give this one a personal 98.
Arom med plommon och sviskon. Ljusbrunt skum. Mörkbrun färg. Smak av karamellmalt och plommon. Alkoholen anas. Mycket god.
Cant believe I havent rated this, probably my favorite beer. Bready nose with plum and prune, maybe dark cheery? In the mouth, heavy, malty, more some fruit. Moderate finish. Just about perfect.

Dark copper brown with light brown head. Full body with caramel, dried fruit, and orange flavors.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Love this beer very much. taste so good, 150cl is better than littler bottle.

Brown, dark ale. Smell and tasts of dark fruits, prunes, a bit of raisins. 
Well balanced with the delicate bitters.
Excellent beer.

Bottle. Dark, murky brown with frothy cream head. Aromas of bread yeast, caramel malt and spice. Huge, rich caramel malt along with banknotes of spice. Quite sweet and deliciously smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A thoroughly luxurious Belgian abbey ale, Chimay Blue pours a flawless ruby-brown color with a small but steady white head. Aroma of rich slightly roasty brown sugar- caramel maltiness, along with yeasty candy apple notes. Some cocoa-coffee notes also, this is the first abbey ale I've sampled with a coffee malt accent to it. Taste is caramel malt, candy yeast, some dark chocolate, vanilla, and red fruit. Slight boozy tinge but minor. Mouthfeel however strikes me as an unusually thin and weaker texture, the low point for this brew in my opinion. Overall still a rich and flavorful rendition of the style, less delicate in its flavor profile than others. Not my personal favorite but well done.
Flaska 2015. Djupt brun, smuts brunt skum. Doft: Belgo, örter, parfym, godis, blommig honung, kryddigt knäckebröd. Smak: Som doft i stort + kola, alkohol. Ska lägga undan några för lagring.
Coffee, barnyard, clove, earthy, leaves, banana, clove, basement aromas, barnyard, leather, dough

33 cl bottle, Vintage 2015. Served in Trappist chalice. Poured a very dark brown with a small frothy one finger ivory head. Aromas of sweet caramel, flowers, vanilla, cherries, banana, dark fruit, candy. Taste: Caramel, vanilla, candy sugar, dark fruits, banana, coriander. This is one fantastic tasting brew! Medium to full body. A very spicy, sweet frothy mouthfeel with a dry bittersweet finish. The best of all the Chimay!
Bevuta in bottiglia da 33 cl al petrarca. A torino. Ottima birra belga in stile. Una delle migliori trappiste. Forte. Finale stigrato

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Chimay Blue. Dark Brown Color. Dark Fruits and hints of coffee in the Aroma. Sweet Caramel, flowery beginning. Hints of Port or sherry in middle. Spicy and Sweet Finishing. Rather Medium bodied, Medium carbonated, very well Balanced, well drinkable Beer.

330 ml bottle. 2006 vintage. Dark brown colour. Modest white head. Grapes, caramel, port. What a rich palate. Real enjoyment. Rather heavy bodied and aristocratic.

330 ml bottle from 2015 as a comparison. Hints of coffee and
 caramel in the aroma. Slight coffee taste and caramel. Rather medium bodied young beer. Still good, but not so complex.

Overall, my opinion change by one grade. Great beer for cellaring.
Donkerbruin bier met mooie ruime beige schuimkraag.Aroma: Mout en karamel.Smaak: Zoetig, licht bitterig.Mondgevoel: Ruim met mooi koolzuur.Bitterige afdronk.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Dark brown with a creamy head. Aromas of toffee, banana and malts. Taste follows nose with some sweetness, full body rounds out the light fruity and malty flavours.
strong and tastefull beer. reveals freshness. caramel with fruity aroma interesting.

Bottle at SBWF 2015.
Short head. Clear brown color. Roasted and light caramell aroma. Light roasted malt in the taste and light belgian phenols.
Aged bottle from 1997 in the same sampling.
Aged aromas that is a litele too old. Big madrefication in the taste.

Cette brune et tout devenue tout simplement une vrai bière de repas, comme un bon vin

Dark amber/brown with thick off-white head. Lots of stuff going on in the aroma. I mostly sense cookies, banana and yeast though. The taste is firstly sweet followed by a bitter sharpness that seems delivered by the carbonation. Great full bodied and full flavored beer. A bit too carbonated for what best suits a full bodied beer in my opinion.

33 bottled
dark brown color
strong aroma of fig, red berries and honey

Goed bijna zwart bier. Wel wat saai in mijn ogen, in balans kan ook.

A hazy, dark brown pour with an off-white head. The aroma has sugary malt and floral notes. It has a full body with slick texture and lively carbonation. The taste is moderately sweet with a well-rounded woodiness and some mild alcohol warmth in the finish.

Caramel like and bready aroma with a high level of Belgian esters with notes of raisins and plums. A low level of floral, spicy hops. Alcohol is noticeable. Appearance is a hazy Amber brown with a large off white head with good retention. Flavor is sweet with notes of toasted bread with a complex caramel character. Ester character is high. Alcohol is apparent in the taste. Mouthfeel is medium with a high level of carbonation. Overall, this is a great and complex tasting Belgian dark strong.

Fizzy, darker than the red Chimay, but lighter. Foamy head that quickly fades. Wonderful, rich fruity smell that is not quite matched by the taste. Mildly sweet throughout. Finishes with a flatter, lightly bitter aftertaste

I have a Grande Reserve 2014 bottle, but you know this is the nearest to that on here. Its just brilliant, a muddy brown pour, a generous head of large proportions, an aroma of stepped fruits, a taste like an angels kiss (I imagine) and it takes you and wraps you up, no telling how its 9%ABV and how youll be wanting to go to a karaoke bar next, it is a comfortable beer well done. A man could get quite emotional about it.
Backlog. I can remember this is a nice beer, but the details of it Ive simply forgotten. Will definitely drink it again soon.

Aroma suave y afrutado aunque se nota el toque a levaduras. De vez en cuando refermenta mucho en botella por lo que la gasificacion es muy variable. Color ambatrino turbio. Sabor suave y sumamente agradable, al menos para alguirn de stouts como yo.

From bottle to wine glass
Appearance: pours dark brown, dark amber
Smell: Aroma of slight toasted grains
Taste: very good, well balance
Fell: very good, slightly carbonated
Overall: Very good beer, will drink again

750ml bottle poured (several times) into a snifter glass. Delicious. Aroma from the bottle is divine toffee, caramel malty essence. Similar from glass, but scent is subdued due to the large slightly off white / beige foam. Dark murky brown colour. Appearance suffered simply because the head didnt hold as well as expected. Reasonable lacing. Taste is sweet and malty which nicely balances the high alcohol content. Palate was long and lingering. Overall an amazing beer. But I enjoyed the white more - will need to pay attention to the label and perhaps cellar for a while to get a better flavour profile as this bottle had been delivered to the store the day I purchased it.

2015 bottle shared (but had this many times before in a distant past). Brown color, hazy after pouring some of the sediment. Light beige head, rocky. Aromas: sweet malts, fruity, spices, raisin. Sweet, malts and spices retronasal. Flavor is moderate to full sweet. Rather strong alcohol feel. Medium bodied. Finishes with some herbal spiciness, light bitter. Still pretty good.
Beautiful in aroma glass. Spicy and toffee notes. Brownish black. Thick white head. Full bodied, sweet. Slightly sour. Finely balanced. Long finish. Goo-hood.

Draught at the Biergasthof Schiffner. What a treat! This stuff is awesome bottled but utterly Devine from the tap. The sweet flowery yeast notes are like marrocan rose otto and a true complex beauty with candied black cherries and dried plum in taste. Beautiful bitter almond finish. A goddess in a glass.
Una de las mejores cervezas que he probado nunca. Muy buena y equilibrada en conjunto.
En klassiker der har en fin smag af malten og den belgiske gær. Alkoholen smager igennem.

Into a trappist glass from a 33 cl bottle. Pours cloudy dark brown. Beautifully balanced, notes of caramel, fruits and a pleasantly slight bitter finish. Is wonderful at cold temperature, but as it warms, it is just as pleasing to the palate! A favourite!

Aroma of caramel, bicuits, some fruits (peach?).
Deep brown color, with a tall head, which gets reduced to a layer of foam pretty fast.
High sweetness, not bitter at all.
High (too high) carbonation.
Not bad at all, but i expected something more tbh
Bottle. Pours dark caramel color with a tan head that sticks around for awhile. Taste of raisins bread, plums, and alcohol. Very delightful, with a great aftertaste. Great beer.
Very nice! Smooth brew...sorry I waited so long to give this one a try. I want to try the others now.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2016 Butelka 330ml. Ciemne lekko metne o bialej duzej pianie ktora redukuje sie do obreczy. W aromacie karmelowe nuty . W smaku dominuje owocowo karmelowy posmak. Moje nie bylo ulezane wiec delikatny posmak alkoholowy byl ...to jednak swietne piwo i kilka butelek poczeka kilka lat na kolejna degustacje.

Bottle, 2015. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aromas include yeast and are very nice and well balanced, smooth and rounded with no particular ones sticking out. Flavours are spicy, malty, somewhat fruity, yeasty, just a tad too much alcohol feel but that might be me. Full body, very nice.

On draft at When Pigs Fly (Kittery, Maine) on 10/16/15. Really classic, even archetypal, Trappist dark beer. The flavor is raisins and plums and candy sugar. Gets even better and richer as it warms up.

I have recently tried all three chimay, so i will judge this one compared to the others. In this one there is tons of flavour, bread, dates, roasty bitterness. However, i feel it is not as smooth as the bruin and the triple and has a bit of an unpleasant alcoholic bite.
I really appreciate that it is not as sweet as a trappiste rochefort and overall it is a very good and well balanced beer.
It gets better and smoother when it has lost some carbonation and has warmed up ever so slightly.

Aroma is yeasty, malty, caramel, and floral. Taste is medium sweet with medium bitterness, with warming from the alcohol. High carbonation. Aging would probably this beer very well, but this is a very good trappist.
20.12.2015-0,33L - Flasche. Aroma Feige, Rosine. Antrunk Feige, Trockenpflaume, Melasse, Honig. Im Ausklang Röstmalz.

0,33l bottle from Drinkshop. Quite rich fruity aroma with notes of cherry, a hint of roast, almost like a flanders red - there is a similar impression. In taste it once again reveals fruitiness, cherries, dried fruits. A bit yeasty. Also a hint of chocolate. Quite good and balanced, with alcohol hidden relatively well.
Flaske. Farven er mørk kobber med en cremet hvid skumkrone, Aromaen og smagen er mørk frugt, malt og rosiner.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2016 Very dark ruby pour with a tall tan head with relatively OK retention. Smells like dried fruit - prunes, figs, raisins - Belgian yeast, caramel and a bit of sour funkiness. Tastes bitter-sweet, with notes of dark fruit, dried fruit, a bit of dark chocolate, spices.

Bottle from Carrefour.
Golden color and moderate flavour.
Drink with room temperature. A little bitter with a sweet taste.
Its great but not so great.
Belgian yeast, dark fruits, plums and raisins. Sweet caramel malty taste with raisins that turns to a slight roasted malt aftertaste. Really enjoyed this one, good trappist!
Aroma is malty with a little fruit flavour. Taste is complex and balanced. Full body. Great beer.

Bottle - Cloudy brown color, large, creamy off-white head, excellent retention and lacing. Sweet malty aromas of caramel, nuts, raisins, dried plum, dates, cloves, candy, bubble gum. Taste is sweet, very complex and well balanced, toffee, dried fruits, cloves, bubble gum, candy, low herbal hop bitterness in the end. Full body, soft carbonation, velvety texture. Well rounded, complex belgian strong ale. It has some magic within.

Tap at Punavuoren Ahven, Helsinki. Colour is dark brown with medium creamy white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, dryness and malts.

Espuma densa e cremosa sem segredo. Um pouco amarga para mim no final. Tomei uma só e já fiquei doidão, 9% é sinistro! A cor escura não é minha preferida.

Overrijpe banaan en rietsuiker. Te zoet voor mijn smaak. Zurig gist smaakje. Backlog from 2014/11/21.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 Golden color, sparse lace. Medium body and moderate flavor, avg carbonation and heat, good length. Bitter with a slightly sweet background. Yeasty, hoppy. Cannot see why it is so highly rated. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One may ask, how the hell can you have had 1600+ beers and never had this 100/100 classic thats in every grocery store for 300 miles in any direction? And my answer would probably be "I can get that any time, but I can only get this [ipa, DIPA, BA imperial stout] that tastes like every other [ipa, DIPA, BA imperial stout] for a limited time." Which is stupid after a few years in the game, and theres a good chance itd last even longer had I not found it on draft in an adorable 4oz pour that I could tick. When I write this all out, actually, it sounds more sad than amusing, like if you were sitting next to a dude at a bar who had this tiny beers out in front of him furiously typing a novel into his phone, youd want to say "wtf dude, just sit back and drink a fucking beer and enjoy it man." But you wouldnt, because its 2015 and half of the sorry sots sitting at the bar are looking at their phone. But, I digress. Dark ruby pour, creamy head, great thick sheets of lacing. Aroma is awesome - dark fruit, plums, candi, clove. Pretty much a classic Belgian strong dark nose, executed to perfection. Taste follows - sweetness is there, but never overpowering as so many lesser examples are. Beautiful malt driven balance. Articulating how I feel pretty much all that comes to mind is "sexy awesome." Full body, velvet texture. Overall: fantastic. Im an idiot. I should drink this all the time. But I probably wont.
20 years after the first try, this is still something that I enjoy often. A fantastic beer with an even more fantastic history.

9%ABV. Belgian Ale.

Poured out a dark brown. 35ºSRM

Nose has some faintly funky acetic aromas with wet yeast.

Mouthfeel is carbonated with an alcoholic palate. The palate has some honeyed dates and stone fruit. Quite pleasant.
From 330ml. Pours medium brown with a creamy tan head. Malty nose, lots of spice and dark fruit flavors. Medium-bodied with a long, warming finish.
Bottle 33 cl, pours a dark Brown colour with a beige head, Sweet aroma, Light bitter taste

Bottle, 33 cl. Clear dark brown body with foamy beige head. Slightly sweet, malty aroma with notes of spices, alcohol and yeast. Rich malty taste with medium caramel sweetness and light bitterness. There are spicy and yeasty flavours. Medium body with foamy and prickly carbonation. Some alcohol. Dry and spicy finish. A great example of a dark belgian ale. I do not appreciate this type of carbonation, but aside from that it is very tasty.

Bottle from Alko, Kokkola ( 2015). Great fruity, herbal, caramel, sweet malt aroma. Dark liquid, white head. Powerful well balanced high sweetness, that last for a long time. Light bitterness, too. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Very nice!

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Pours bit hazy brown color, huge beige head. Aroma of raisins, belgian candies, sugary. Taste is sweet, candies, raisins, overcarbonated, malty, caramel.
Bottle @home. Pours brown with a tan head. Nose is fruity, caramel, blackberry. Taste is fruit cake, raisins, currants, molasses again blackberry. Great beer.

De color marrón granate, con un capa de espuma color hueso, esponjosa y no muy persistente.
En nariz fruta madura dulce tipo ciruelas, algo de maltas tostadas, caramelo y especias.
Bastante ligera de cuerpo.
En boca alcohólica y compleja, con los mismos sabores que aromas.
Final dulce y seco. Clásica!

Fizzy, darker than the red Chimay, but lighter. Foamy head that quickly fades. Wonderful, rich fruity smell that is not quite matched by the taste. Mildly sweet throughout. Finishes with a flatter, lightly bitter aftertaste. Very pleasant drinking.

Piwo ciemno-brunatne, mętne z niewielkimi refleksami. Piana dość obfita, szybko opadająca. Doskonały owocowo - kwiatowy aromat!!! W smaku wyczuwalna moc, alkohol grzeje w przełyk. Sądzę, że świetnie będzie się leżakowało. Polecam, bo to piwo naprawdę godne polecenia!!!
Mörkt brun dimmig öl med ett ljusbrunt öl. Doft och smak är söt med torkad frukt, kryddighet och karamell. Lättkryddig beska i eftersmaken som balanserar sötman.
09/10 Scotts bar Brussels. Great fruit Xmas flavour undertones. Great strong dark Belgian beer.
Milder roasty fruit aromas. Tastes smooth and rewarding. Maltose syrup warm aftertaste. Lovely. Thin foam but color makes it up for it.

330ml bottle from Tesco. 
Bubbly off white head, good lacing. Body is dark brown, cola coloured. Aroma is yeast, some sour notes. Flavour is malty, banana, yeast, a little spice, bready finish. No real signs of alcohol strength. Lots of carbonation, mouthfeel is surprisingly thin. I expected more from this beer.
Bottle. Dark brown color with huge unsteady head. Aroma of caramel, dry fruits, alcohol notes. Very subtle and gentle aroma. Taste is balanced, bitter-sweet. Finish is medium. Good trappist.
Altra grande espressione di Belgian strong ale. Ottimi aromi e un gusto ben equilibrato, sempre più piacevole sorso dopo sorso-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Aroma: quite malty, some chocolate, toffee, nuts, peach. A lot is going on.

Brown colour, hazy with medium, frothy and rocky beige head.

Medium sweetness, heavy and long lasting bitterness. Delicious.

Full bodied, medium to thick texture. Fizzy carbonation. Bitter and long finish.

Great beer!
Et ekte klosterbrygg veldig fruktig og med maltsmak en bitteliten antydning til beskhet i ettersmaken men minimal.
Cerveja de coloracao de caramelo queimado. Espuma com boa formação. Aroma de frutas secas, ameixa. Cerveja bastante alcoolica. Sabor com notas de frutas vermelhas.

Brune foncée aux reflets marrons, notes café et malts torréfiés, alcool fort sans quil soit agressif, pour un ensemble très équilibré, avec rondeur et petite onctuosité. Bue occasionnellement, trouvable en grandes surfaces ou en restauration.

Caramel, bread, hay, cereal, roasty, coffee, nuts, toast, citrus, herbs, floral, barnyard, barnyard, citrus, resin, dough, barnyard, cheese, basement aromas, banana, earthy, bubblegum, butterscotch, leaves

Flaska systembolaget. Mörkbrun vätska. Nästan svart. Fluffigt beiget skum. Fuktig doft med mogna äpplen, torkad frukt och nyslaget gräs. Lätt rostad smak med säd, trä, äpple och jäst. Värmande munkänsla med torr avslutning.

33 cl bottle from a random corner store in Zagreb, served in a snifter. Dark brown to black, non-transparent, with huge tan head that settles over a few minutes. Aroma is quite yeasty, mild malty, caramel, faint floral. Medium to full body, low carbonation. Taste is medium sweet with medium bitterness, with mild warming from the alcohol evident in the finish. Texture is oily to creamy.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2015 Aromat karmelowy, alkoholowy. Piana srednia. Kolor ciemny braz. W smaku slodkie, karmelowe.

Dark brown with a light coating. Malty and nutty aromas. Smokey flavors but not too spicy, sour but slightly sweet, clear taste of alcohol at the end. Feels zesty, burnt, well balanced.

Overall : Very well crafted and balanced. Easy to drink trappist beer.

2015 bottle, room temp, poured into a stange glass all the way in Almaty, Kazakhstan. Found a small liquor store that carries it for $3.50/bottle. Amazing. This particular bottle is aggressively carbonated, crackling like a glass of soda for several minutes after pouring. The head was light tan and fizzed up quickly before rapidly dissipating. Like the carbonation, the appearance also reflects a glass of coke: brown and opaque. Lots on the nose. Sweet up front with some caramel and candy sugar, then a strong fruity aroma with plums, raisins, and maybe a floral undertone. Body is full and creamy with an unsurprising carbonated sharpness and a dry finish. Taste doesnt carry as much sweetness as a nose and has a strong lingering bitterness throughout. The fruity notes remain with some smoke, leather, and woodiness. Boozy finish leaves alcohol on the tongue. I dont think this is the best bottle of Chimay Blue Ive had, and Ill definitely update this rating next time I get the chance, but its delicious nevertheless. A flavorful, complex, layered beer, Chimay is always a brew worth having around.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Dit is gewoon een heel lekker bier. Geen uitgesproken smaken of geuren aanwezig.

Brune très foncée, à la limite du noir, haute mousse beige crémeuse et à cratère, de longue tenue, laissant une dentelle sur le verre. Nez de levures (noisettes, fromage) et de fruits secs (amandes). La bouche est complexe, chaleureuse, noisette, fruits confits et secs, réglisse, pudding. Le corps est rond, la carbo excellente. Un classique dont on se lasse jamais !

Grand Reserve 2014. Dark brown with medium white head. Aroma is fruity, caramel and sweet malts. Taste add spices, and doesnt overdo with sugar like other Belgian ale. A classic masterpiece of beers. Awesome.

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: Large bottle.
Appearance: Pours a rich, impenetrable brown with a big beige head. 
Aroma: Dark bread, spices, berries, and cinnamon. 
Taste: Dark fruits, dough, woody and sort of peppery. 
Palate: Richand medium bodied. 
Overall: Very good and classic for the style.

A bottle from 2014. Great fruity, herbal, caramel, sweet malt aroma. Dark liquid, white head. Powerful well balanced high sweetness, that last for a long time. Light bitterness, too. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. A very good Belgian strong Ale!

Bottle. Birthday gift from finol.
Dark brown, redish, off-white head.
Aroma of brown sugar, caramel.
Taste, sweet, nice bitterness, round texture!
Fizzy!
Pours nut brown, with tan head. Aroma has some alcohol, toffee, caramel. Taste is complex, balanced, toffee, malty sweet, caramel.

F: huge lasting beige to pale brown.
C: dark brown to dark, non-transparent.
A: roasted malt, floral, yeast, earthy tones, hint of raisins, dark fruit.
T: complex malty taste, roasted malt, raisins, dry plums, earthy/dusty tones, liquorice, hint of milk chocolate, espresso, caramel, candy sugar, banana, and so on, full body, average carbonation, masterpiece of this style.
Een typische Belgische trappist. Een donkere kleur en een goede neus. Ook een goede schuimkraag.
Bottle. Malts, dark fruits (plums), spices, caramel, toffee and yeast. Moderate to high sweetness and mild bitterness. Complex. Smooth mouthfeel.

Maker: Chimay, Baileux, Belgium ***
Beer: Chimay Trappist Grande Réserve Limited Edition 2014 (bottled, unfiltered, 750ml) ***
Style: Belgian Strong Ale ***
ALC.VOL.: 9.0% ***

This is not the regular "Grande Reserve" Blue or Red beer from Chimay, but a special limited edition for 2014 (Best before: 2019!) ***

Colour: Hazy dark copper, with a medium-sized, creamy light beige head. ***
Nose: Preserved plums, cane sugar, a whiff of orange peel, toffee. ***
Texture: Medium body, still a bit watery(!). Medium carbonation. ***
Taste: Prunes, cane sugar, yeast, mild spices (licorice) and oranges at the start, but not cloyingly sweet. More licorice to come towards the middle, but with a hint of lemon and yeast to liven things up. Finish, too, has licorice, and toffee, cane sugar. Very mild, yeasty aftertaste. ***

Impressions: Medium-heavy Belgian strong ale with a nice mix of flavours, but not too much body considering he 9% ABV. Will stick with you after a while - before it REALLY sticks with you.
A stepping stone into the great, Belgian trappist brewing world, esters and complexity.

aroma: banana, raisin, vanilla, alcohol, creamy,caramel, roasty.
appearance: dark brown, hazy, brown foam, head forms relatively quickly, good retention.
flavor: strong alcohol taste, raisins, caramel, slight fruity taste, slight astringency, long finish, no bitterness from hops. light sweetness.
palate:medium body, slick feel, lively, slightly astringent.
overall: a good beer, although alcoholic taste is a little too far forward. greatly enjoyed the raisins and banana which were not overbearing. much better than the brun version
Dark with a hint of red. Big off white head. Aroma is huge with raisins, toffee and bread. Taste is a bit underwhelming compared to the powerful aroma. Sweet with medium bitterness. High carbonation

Bottle. This is a classic of my teenage times. Pours in hazy brown body with medium white head. Aroma has caramel profile, light yeasty, floral, nutty, light coffee. Taste has high caramel sweetness with light earthy bitterness. Light bready. Body is full, high carbonation.

Je continue ma série de retour en arrière vers des classiques belges que jappréciais; il y a quelques années. Surpris de voir combien celle-ci me semble anodine maintenant .... Trop sucrée, arôme assez vain et peu de longueur en bouche. Le même petit goût de banane. Finalement, très agaçant ... Amusant de constater aussi combien toutes ces bières belges, sont finalement très proches les unes des autres ...

0.33l bottle. Very hazy dark orange body, thin off-white head. Aroma of banana, caramel, cloves and peach. Taste of chocolate, banana, peach, floral hops and some booze. Sweet, but not cloying. Awesome beer.

Average creamy light brown lasting head with murky brown body.
Average malt caramel aroma with grapefruit hops and dough presence. Full creamy body with average carbonation and a metallic finish.
Average to long duration flavor. Moderately sweet and bitter.

Verdensklasse øl - den er virkelig god! Mørk, brændt, sødlig, lækker... Den har vist det hele. Og en høj alkoholprocent - hele 9. Men den er vild lækker...

Bomber to tulip. Pours dark ruby-black, tan cream head. Aroma of graham cracker, black cherry, brown sugar, banana, sweet malts, caramel, toffee. Taste of same with Belgian yeast notes, hay and herbal fruits, mostly banana. Caramel banana bread. Lots of carb. You can feel the booze but it?s not big in the flavor. I?m not huge into Belgians yet, but this is good. And filling.
Vermelha escura, opaca. Espuma âmbar abundante e persistente. Aroma adocicado de malte e caramelo. Sabor de ameixas, mel e especiarias. Álcool presente. Retrogosto adocicado de longa duração.

Pours a dark amber with slightly tan head with lacings throughout the glass. The nose is heavy malt and caramel with a subtle sweetness that reminds me of cotton candy. The flavor is malty, caramel with a roasted bitterness. This is a medium-full bodied beer with a bitter caramel finish with a fizzy carbonation.

My 1000th beer at Kents! Quite sweet taste, kinda like a liquid cow tail, malty caramel, kinda one dimensional though.. Little too sweet for me

Brunatne, w przebłyskach rubinowe piwo o obfitej pianie, która redukuje się do pierścienia przy brzegu szkła. Aromat ciemnych owoców, rodzynki. W smaku także ciemne owoce plus szlachetny alkohol i lekka ziołowość. Goryczka średnia, alkoholowo-ziołowa. Ogólnie udane belgijskie piwo, czuć jego moc, ale w pozytywnym tego słowa znaczeniu, na pewno warto zmierzyć się z legendą trapistów, jednak ja nieco wyżej oceniam tripla z tego browaru, ale to chyba dlatego, że ten styl ostatnio bardzo mi leży.
Lo mas grande en trapistas. Lo mejor de lo mejor. Equilibrada y muy llena de matices. Perfecta para celebraciones
Coloração escura, boa carbonatação, aroma alcoólico com notas de caramelo. Sabor rico, doce com predominância do malte tostado, amargor forte e persistente
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2015 Bière bien connue avec finalement un très bon goût, bière goûtée à la pression. Ne démérite pas

Copenhagen 5/9 2015. 33 cl bottle from Fakta. Pours hazy reddish brown with off-white head. Settles as thin layer of foam. Aroma is sweetish with notes of banana and caramel. Medium carbonation. Taste is immensely rich. Quite sweet with brown sugar, banana, caramel and raisins. Balanced by aftertaste with light bitterness and spicyness. You can sense the alcohol but it does not dominate in any way. A very nice Belgian.

Pours deep rusty brown with a fierce cream coloured head. Aroma of Belgian beer - slightly musty. The flavour is strongly influenced by the alcohol content but strong caramel malt flavours with a hint of floral funk. The finish finally reveals bitterness, ever present alcohol and sweet malt as the alcohol kicks in and provides you with that warm glow.

Incredible lingering creamy and ethereal head. Aroma is caramel with some flowers, a bit bread and malt. Appearance is a little bit hazy, nice dark amber color. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish. Very complex beer. PS My first English review.

sampled at 2015 Dayton Alefest = Pour murky dark brown with no head. Mild caramel bitter cocoa with a delicate finish. Lingering spice on the tongue

Amazing. Great lingering head, particularly when served in a Chimay glass. Very poppy on the tongue.

330ml bottle, 2013. Served in Chimay glass. Dark brown amber colour with a reddish tinge and a foamy beige head. Aroma is dark fruity, caramel, raisins, bready & yeasty. Taste is malt, molasses, chocolate, bready, dried fruit, raisins with yeasty & boozy notes. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy boozy finish. Good balance, very drinkable.
330ml bottle of the 2014 grand reserve at home. Heavy Belgian beer with a good foamy head.

Nice thick head with a dark brown body. Slight with a hint of red. Flavors consist of dark fruits. Mainly raisin and plum. Small note of coffee. Delicious snack beer

Grande Reserve 2014. Big beige and foamy head with good retention. Hazy reddish caramel amber colour. Aroma is caramel, dried fruits (prune), spicy and vanilla. Taste is caramel (toasted sugar), bitter and spicy (clove). Medium creamy palate. Quite a good beer.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Marrón rojizo oscuro con opacidad propia de la fermentación en botella, buena espuma, lúpulo especiado-terroso moderado, malta maltosa caramelo moderado, con balance, algunas notas tostadas, ésteres a fruto seco y ligero diacetilo. En boca malta maltosa caramelo moderado a alto, tibieza alcohólica presente, lúpulo especiado-terroso bajo. Final alcohólico con frutos secos. Buena carbonatación, con cuerpo. Excelente cerveza!

A fruit salad of dark red plums and blue grapes, slightly over ripe pears and apples. Theres a spicey spike in the smell and I think about dark, mature, evil but with a tongue-in-cheek manner. There is a good amount of juvenile spirits in here. Taste is plums and raisins with a badass attitude from the yeast that wants nothing but converting you to the Trappist monastery. Active and energetic.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2015 (2014 edition) Negra avermelhada, espuma marrom de boa formação, média persistência. Chocolate, cacau, toffe, sem amargor. Malte aparente, licorosa, corpo médio, baixa carbonação. Aftertaste bem maltado, caramelado, leve fumo. Muito boa.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur marron foncé, opaque, mousse moyenne de belle tenue. Arômes de noix, légèrement fruitée et boisée, une touche de caramel. Du corps et de la longueur. Texture très vivante, très agréable en bouche. Trouvée à Roby - Menin.
For me the perfect balanced beer, strong but still very tasty. For me a every years fixed event.

0,33 bottle. Pours dark amber color with huge off-white, mostly lasting head. Aroma of malt, yeast, hints of fruits. Medium murky body, average carbonation, slick texture. Flavor is medium caramel sweet, medium bitter, decent alcoholic notes on the front. Aftertaste is medium long, sweet and moderate to high alcoholic. Ive expected more from this beer.
Pours a thick dark brown body with a beige head. Main nodes of raisins, plum, dried fruit and a hint of coffee
obligé de mettre la note presque parfaite sur cette bière. Elle se conserve très bien très très longtemps. Pas fan des bières brunes, celle-ci est hors normes.
750ml Flasche. Klar und bersteinfarben. Kleine Schaumkrone. Karamellaroma, sehr malzig. Trockener Nachgeschmack.

Bottle 0,33.
Brown color, small head. Aroma: rich & complex, plums, alcohol. Taste: warming, ABV hidden. Good.

Donker bruin bier met een hele mooi schuimkraag. Complexe zoete smaak naar kersen. Lekkere zachte smaak en weinig bitter. Je zou bijna niet zeggen dat er 9% alc. in zit en drinkt heel makkelijk weg. Echt een gigantisch lekker bier!
Bottle.Dark amber with off white medium head.Roast, dry fruits,caramel flavours.Medium carbonation.

Big tan head, fades to a creamy thin blanket. Surprising better head retention than the Chimay Red. Colour is a deep, dark copper. Spicy ester aroma, plum, fig, caramel, perfumy, slight must. Flavour plum, dried fruit, cherry, cola (Dr. Pepper), dark caramel and raisin. High carbonation. Beautiful complexity. Med-full mouthfeel with dry finish.
Bottle 33cl. Pours hazy dark brown with big off white head. Caramel hops sweets and yeast. Full body a tangy taste with caramel and some coffe
2015-05-15 Great beer. A real trappist with a very nice taste. I recommend it.
Bottle @ jorn69. Dried fruit in both aroma and taste and some chocolate notes. Low carbonation which takes down the grade

Foam is nice and the aroma is fruity and mild. Tastes heavenly fruit and has a distinctly vinous character that makes it suitable for almost all occasions. The scent is limited, actually smells not of as much as the taste of. First taste impression might feel a bit sharp, but later youll find the flavor nuances almost queuing to please your taste buds. It is unfiltered and unpasteurized, but can advantageously be stored for several years.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 2006 dark liquid with minimal tan to no head. Aroma of bread, silo. Taste same, medium sweetness, light bitterness, lightly sour. medium body, creamy feel, average carbonisation, long maly finish.
2015 6;4;6;4;10 chestnut color liquid with thick tan head. Aroma: yeast, malts. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, alcohol, malts. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long bitter finish, astringent,

This is a smooth, bubbly beer beer that is very easy to drink. The reason I didn't give it a higher rating is because not only is the taste very mild, the palate is almost nonexistent. You almost forget what the heck you are drinking. I would consider a smaller bottle to build a 6pack or something, but that's really it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka 0,33l warka:L13-141 2018, temp. serwowania 12 stopni +, szkło teku. Aromat: słodki owocowy (głównie śliwka), trochę kwiatowy, delikatnie drożdżowo-karmelowe z alkoholową nutką, bez rozkładania na czynniki pierwsze aromat przypomina wino Porto ruby, po ogrzaniu staje się trochę rumowe, aromat jest przyjemny i złożony. Piana: beżowa, przy nalewaniu obfita ale bardzo szybko zbija się w duże pęcherzyki i opada prawie do zera, po zamieszaniu szkła pojawia się ponownie ok. 1,5cm drobno pęcherzykowej piany żeby po chwili zniknąć, szkła nie oblepia. Barwa: brunatne, pod światło widać unoszący się osad drożdżowy. Smak: słodki, podobnie jak w aromacie, z alkoholową goryczką rozgrzewającą przełyk, wysycenie początkowo średnie, ale szybko się odgazowuje, piwo pełne ale aksamitne, nie zatyka,  z większą butelką byłoby ciężko bo szybko idzie w głowę. Dobre piwo na degustacje dla porównania z innymi w stylu, ale nie na codzień z racji %, póki co jeden z lepszych bsa jakie piłem.

Deep amber, hazy, tall bubbly head leaving a thick film with a hill in the middle of the surface. Nose of dried fruit, port wine, some nuts. Medium to full body. Alcohol well hidden. The flavour is similar to the aroma with addition of slight hoppy bitterness. Perfect balance.
Converting" from old excel scoresheet. So there are no comments on this beer.
Aroma is Belgiany and caramel like. Pours a muddy brown with tons of head. Taste is rich and malty. Nutty and caramelly. Light ish bubbly body.
Cracking beer pours mahogany with silky head strong alcohol nose taste prunes slightly tarte brown sugar with a warming alcohol finish great sipper.

A brown, cloudy belgian trappist ale with high creamy head. Aroma is complex yeasty, malty, prune. Taste is bitter sweet.

330ml bottle from 2014. Pours dark brown with a fluffy light brown head. Aroma is almonds, vanilla, dark fruits. Taste is brown sugar, dark fruits, almonds. Light sweetness, alcohol is very well masked. Glad I finally got round to trying this one.

An old bottle from 2006 - Tasted summer 2015. 

Dark (red)brown, hazy beer with a small, beige head that dissapears fast. 

Nose: Plum, madeira wine, alcohol, fudge, nuts, dried fruit, honey, caramel malt and raspberry. 
Taste: Sweet caramel, raisin, fudge, chocolate, brown sugar, syrup and vanilla. 
Body: Medium body. Light carbonation, A structure of a madeira wine. Almost no alcohol taste. Great hidden ABV! 

Smooth and tasty even after 9 years!
Świetne piwo. Aromat lekki, mało intensywny, ale bardzo przyjemny. Piana słaba, kolor brunatny, nie przejrzyste. W smaku idealna mieszanka karmelu i jabłka z lekko zalegającą goryczką. Polecam!
Pours dark brown. Malted chocolate aroma. Sweet maltiness fills the mouth. Carbonation is spot on. Perfect

0.33 bottle in Big Blue, Ba?anija, Istria. Hazy brownish red with lasting small off-white head. Sediment visible in the glass. Aroma of syrup, raisins, smoke, hints of strawberry jam. Crispy start, sweet, malty, syrupy, alcohol in the taste. Medium carbonation, full body, lingering sweet alcohol finish. Hints of dried fruits in the finish, too. Superb.

Bottiglia. Colore bruno intenso con riflessi rubino. Abbondante e cremosa schiuma beige, poco persistente, che lascia evidenti tracce sul bicchiere. Aroma molto complesso ed interessante, con malto, uvetta, caramello, note di lievito, una minima componente vegetale del luppolo, ma anche la dolcezza della frutta matura. Gusto altrettanto complesso e particolare, dolce - amaro molto ben bilanciato, calda nota alcolica sul finale. Corpo pieno, carbonatazione bassa e di sicuro non particolarmente beverina. Una vera e propria birra da contemplazione. Straordinaria.

Bottle from 2005 @ Kulminator, Antwerpen - BE. Color: deep dark brown beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: caramel, malt, roasted malt, black bread finish. Small yeast note but really nice. Taste: good body, nice malt and caramel taste. Good sweet malt finish. Nice yeast and spicy attenuation. Very nice beer. Good body and really sweet. Aftertaste: caramel, malt and sweet yeast. Really great!

What a beauty. The beer has a deep ruby red color, and it looks just as pretty as a ruby. The beer pours a nice layer of soft, fluffy foam with a slightly brown color tint. After a while the foam layer shrinks, but s rather thick layer of creamy soft foam remains on top of the beer. The smell is amazingly rich. There are aromas of raisin, almond paste, it reminds me of moms apple pie, only cinnamon is missing, and apple of course. The smell is dark, and deep, brown, very sweet and slightly bitter. There is some alcohol sweetness. Smell it and you know what I mean, words are. It enough to describe the smell and rich aromas of this beer. The taste the taste contains a lot of the smell. There is also this alcoholic sweetness, accompanied by the almond paste taste, which is very nice. The raisin is also present in the taste, really nice. The taste is just like the smell dark and brown and silky smooth, very special and very nice. On of the best beers on the planet, thats for sure.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 Aroma e sabor com notas de café e chocolate. Aparência escura, espuma densa e duradoura. Amargor intenso e teor alcoólico não evidente.

Ivory-white head pours on top of deep ruby red, slightly cloudy, beer. Dominant aroma is esters, pears, green fruit. Also some malt character, perhaps a light to medium caramel, and a hop vegetal component. The esters are there on tasting, but sit behind a complex malt ensemble: roast malt, burnt toffee, and liquorice. Quite a sweet finish, but the 9% alcohol is well hidden. Will drink again.
Bottle. Pours hazy dark brown witg largish beige spongy head, caramel aroma, medium carbonation, slightly sweet caramel taste with medium salty ending. Very very good as known widely.
W aromacie glownie czerwone owoce. Lekko winne. W smaku raczej slodkie. Alkohol bardzo dobrze zamaskowany.
Bottle, 33 cl. With character, not that complex aroma, but powerful taste (high ABV).
70 cl corked bottle. Nose - caramel, malt and liquorice taste similar but spicy notes. Strong alcohol.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dried fruits, Belgian yeast and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with medium yeast and with a medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dried fruits, Belgian yeast and spices.

Overall:

Finally managed to get my hands on a grand reserve 2014 bottle. The carbonation is less intense, the sweet dominant malt flavour is diminished and thus the beer is more complex. An amazing dark Belgian Strong Ale, I cannot wait to drink the oak aged version.

Pours a dark brown with a white head that quickly receds. Aromas bring pears, plums, raisins, white grape juice, nutmeg, clove, molasses, and apple juice. Flavours bring caramely malt sweetness, burnt sugar, and a generic spice note (clove maybe?). Leads into a semi-sweet, somewhat bitter, long finish. Effervescent carbonation lifts the sticky mouthfeel a bit. Fairly full bodied.

(Bottle 0,33l)
Aroma: Malty, spicy, sweet.
Appearance: Dark brown color. All time, beige head.
Taste: Medium sweet, spicy, light yeasts, fruits.
Palate: Medium body. Light warming finish.
Overall: Pleasant belgian. Not so extra.

This is for the 2015 Chimay Peres Trappistes that I received from someone who just returned from Belgium. The aroma is yeasty, malty, and I pick up a hint of apricot and molasses. Quite nice. Looks a bit like a raspberry ice tea under the light. Head is fluffy and almond in color. The taste is that of Belgian yeast and malt with a bit of fruit. Theres a bit of carbonation burn to the palate, but it fades quickly, leaving a medium oil slick on the tongue thats not unpleasant. I really enjoyed this beast and will be on the lookout for it the next time I head to the liquor store. Great stuff.

Appearance: Deep mahogany and opaque with thing but persistent foam.
Aroma: Brown sugar and raisin malt sweetness with moderate clove-phenol (medicinal like) and a low mineral quality.
Flavor: Chewy cereal and caramel malt with med-low european hop spiciness. Clove comes through in the mid with the finish being mostly raisin and stone fruit.
MF: High carbonation mixed with a warming alcohol and a stern hop bitterness. Finishes warm and dry.

Famosa trapista verteu na taça um liquido licoroso,acobreado,espuma formou um creme bege volumoso inicialmente,porem com baixa duração,carbonatação média para alta;aroma bem maltado,com notas cítricas,amadeiradas,leve tostado e caramelo; no sabor embora o malte ainda predomine é notado um aumento do amargor,contrabalanceando bem com o dulçor e o álcool,bom corpo,retrogosto adocicado,equilibradíssima,ótima crveja.

Dark amber color with a nice head, very complex flavors. Hints of different spices and fruits. One of my favorite beers. Great beer. Vintage 2001. Dark amber color with a nice head, very complex flavors. Hints of different spices, alcohol and fruits

Bottle shared during Pauls 30th. Many thanks to Daniek. Vintage 2011z pours unclear amber with some sediment and a creamy tan head. The aroma has some toffee, butterscotch, bread, slight candi sugar and Belgian yeast. Medium sweet flavor with lots of ripe, semi-dark fruits, bread, brown sugar, yeast, toffee. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Warming finish with more ripe fruits, berries, toffee. Well rounded, nicely complex but still very drinkable. Deserving of its status as a classic.
Ah putains tu l? as vu? -mais qui? -Mon cul! !! Des amis ? De l?argent? Du boulot? - non monsieur, je prendrais une Chimay bleu.

Rocznik 2013. Kolor ciemnej, mocnej herbaty, klarowne. Piana obfita, szybko opada. W aromacie owoce, przyprawy, karmel, rodzynki, morele, lekki alkohol w stylu rumu. W odczuciu gladkie, oleiste, wysoko wysycone. W smaku karmelowe, przyprawowe, orzechowe, duzo mniej bogate i wyraziste niz w aromacie. Goryczka niska, polaczona ze sciagajacym alkoholem.
Ну Шимэйко& я не удволет& однако траппис& и Бельгия там очень ярки. Как сорт пива отлично, другое дело и маленьк& груди в ладони на удивлен& много.

Casi negra y opaca. Espuma blanquecina muy abundante (4 dedos) con aspecto de espuma de gel de baño. Aroma a malta, caramelo y manzana. Sabor muy completo compensando dulces y amargos... para dejar un final en donde aparece claramente el alcohol, con cierto regusto metálico. No es la mejor de las Chimay.

33cl bottle BBE: 2019. Lightly chilled. Major froth-over when opened. Pours a cloudy mahogany body with many floaters, and a generous, creamy, tight fawn head. Medium intensity aromas of fresh bread, browned toast, plum, peach and apricot, rose, cocoa... Beautifully complex. Rich, syrupy sweetness (not overpowering), cut with a gentle bitterness. Wonderfully balanced. Full-bodied with a creamy texture, carbonation is a little below average and the finish is long and lingering. A magnificent beer, let down slightly by the frothing when opened (probably due to poor storage/handling). Could maybe stimulate the taste senses a little more, but Im really trying to find fault where there isnt any.
Bottle. Cloudy, amber, frothy, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.
Bottle @ a bar. Aroma of malty, some fruity booze. Hazy brown with big off-white head, long lasting. Moderate sweet, light bitterness. Full body, soapy texture, average carbonation, malty finish.
Caramel, roasted malts, honey, belgian candy sugar and dark fruits. Taste is rich malts, plum, raisins, wild yeast and caramel. Appearance is a clear amber with a lace head
Probabilmente la migliore delle birre chimay. E una trappista di stostanza, può risultare non facile da bere. Ma i sapori sono tutti bilanciati.
Bottle from brian the regular....thx man....solid stuff....great style....great beer....(#499)
De couleur marron-rubis, cest la meilleure de la gamme chimay avec sa puissance et sa richesse en arôme et en saveur.
Bottle. Dark carmel colored pour with a creamy tan head. Smells and tastes just like a fine Belgian should. light roasted malt and Belgian candied fruit. Excellent.
Bottle. Cloudy, dark brown beer with a beautiful creamy foam. Outstanding aroma: malts, chocolate, dried fruits, perfume. Taste: chocolate ice cream with dried fruit, caramel and cognac. Epic ale.

750ml bottle shared with lots of people at Savori. Aroma: caramel, molasses, toffee, dark red fruits. App: hazy brown, murky. Minimal beige head. Taste and palate: medium body, medium sweetness, average carbonation, light dry bitter and alcohol warming finish. Overall: liked the alcohol warming finish.

Red brown pour with medium light tan head. Aroma is complex with fruity aroma, bubblegum and cinamoon. Malt richness with caramel, toasty, nuts and dry fruits as raisin. médium sweet ans light bitter. Great beer.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 S:
-caramel,cherries,banana,figs,raisins,plums
T the nose
F:
-Medium-high carbonation,full body
O:
My fave Trappist

Update for a 2012 vintage (drank on april 3rd 2016):
With age this turns into a straight-up chocolate milk shake with cinnamon and Red Wine aroma

Kastanjanruskea, erittäin runsasvaahtoinen trappisti. Tuoksu on todella hentoinen, jonkin verran löytyy kuitenkin siirappista makeutta, sekä lämmittävää alkoholia. 
Suutuntumassa hyökkää aluksi varsin runsas, mutta samalla pehmeä hiilihappoisuus, joka kääntyy sitten tunteeksi, jota voisi kuvailla "vanhanaikaiseksi" ei kuitenkaan vanhentuneeksi.
Makua hallitsee runsas makeus ja hänellä kaverina pehmeää, lämmittävää alkomahoolia. Jälkimaku on aavistuksen kuivahko ja kevyen mausteinen.
Kokonaisuus on vivahteikas, hartaasti nautittava olut, joka sopii hyvin ainakin juustojen ja jouluaterian kanssa nautittavaksi. Ei parasta trappistia, mutta ei todellakaan huonointa!

In several bottles I had too much of CO2. 
Aroma - malts, raisins, dried fruits
Palate - nice and heavy with caramel malt, prunes, figs and raisins.

One of the iconic beers for me.

330ml Bottle from Systembolaget, year 2014. Dark brown with a large and creamy tan head. Sweet aroma of toffee and yeast. Dry, caramel-sweet and rich flavor. Yeast, sweet fruit, banana, butterscotch and orange. The aftertaste is dry with a hint of sweet booze taste.
Dark color little clouded foam that sticks tot the glass aroma of malts taste some bitterness dark malts and little.dry aftertaste

Bottle:
Cola brown with a creamy beige head.
Dark fruit, chocolate aroma.
Taste is slightly yeasty, spicy, dark fruit, caramel malt.
Sweet....with a slight alcohol tang....
Really nice.

Color is dark red, hazy. Head is short living, sparkling.
Aroma: prunes, alcohol, plum wine, some Maillard products.
Taste: moderate sweeteness, light to medium bitterness, light to medium fruit sourness.
Flavour has plum wine, prunes, dried sour cherries, sherry, complex roasted notes.
Light metall notes in the aftertaste.

Overall this is a good but not the great.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 Bien que classique est très bue, il est assez difficile de tirer des conclusions sur la complexité de cette bière trappiste.Au nez, l?alcool est très présent et apporte des notes très épicées.On retrouvera ces dernières en bouche dans une explosion d?arômes très caractériels sans être agressifs. Sans être ronde, elle n?est pas non plus amère.Personnellement, je perçois avant tout des notes vanille/cannelle qui laissent très vite place à une longueur en bouche réglisse.
Après lavoir regoutee, je le trouve globalement écoeurante étant donnés tous les arômes évoqués qui se marient mal à la levure très présente.
Good, strong beer. Not too sweet, which is good. Good carbonation. Just not special enough. Was expecting much more.

Grand Reserve, 2003. Large creamy off-white head and a hazy dark brown body. Basement aromas, lots of coffee, brown sugar, prunes, figns, alcohol. The taste is heavy sweet and light bitter. Oily texture.
Bottle 2014, 15/05/2015 dark Amber in colour. Sweet fruity aroma tastes treacle, sweet slightly raisin. Seasonable for 9%!

UPDATED: APR 15, 2017 From Carrefour Camas. Playing KB Dark Side. Great beer, one of those youll never get tired of.

2nd take on 4th Nov 2015: In La Trappe Chalice. Watching Worst Week 1x07. Wanted to revisit this classic to compare with the Westy 12 recently taken. Good but softer and less intense in aroma, taste and body

8 June 2016: Good, but a bit of a letdown after taking yesterday its barrel aged sister. This feels lighter and has a liquorice-like taste. Overall 4.

9 Aug 2016: 1956 Special edition. From Saveur-Biere. It may be suggestion because from the fancy especial edición bottle, but this one seems yummier than the usual ones, without the liquorice I found in the previous take, a greatly adjusted carbonation and very pleasant to the nose.

14 Apr 2017: 2017 edition. In La Trappe chalice. Playing 12 Labours of Hercules.  Nice but behind aged versions. Less body and dark fruits

Bottle vintage 2010. Deep, dark brown. Medium bodied with some winey and roasted malt notes, dried fruit, raisins most of all. Very sherry-like. Nice carbonation. Mild bitterness on the palate. Very good.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 Bottiglia. Un?ottima birra caratterizzata da un sapore marcato, forte e sfumature particolari tipiche delle trappiste belghe

Pours dark brown. Abundant ivory head.
Intense aromas of prunes, dates, banana, caramel, honey.
Full body. Sweetish, powerful, well structured. Bitterer finish than most trappist ales.
Might be the best value beer in the world.
Deep, dark brown in colour with a tan head. Taste is a balance of roasted malts, light sweetness, and a warming sensation of booze.

Bottle bought at Delhaize.
Pours dark brown with a medium beige head.
Taste is roasted malts with a warm hint of alcohol in the back. 
Also a hint of dried fruits, well balanced sweetness.

Une vraie bière belge, forte, marquée, une couleur ambrée, de lalcool et un gout de levure.
Une valeur sure dans la catégories bieres de trappistes.
750ml bottle everything works well looks great smells appealing & tastes really good
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2015 Cerveja mais escura, muito gostosa, Ã© uma cerveja bem saborosa que vale tomar novamente. Comprei no pao  de aÃ§Ãºcar. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 2019 Pours deep hazy dark ruby red to dark brown liquid, huge frothy tan head, Aroma: Belgian phenols, banana, clove, candied fruits, warming alcohol, griotte cherries, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter, light sour, in the first sips some metallic off taste present, fruity, phenols, cherries, clove, candied fruits, warming alcohol, Palate: medium body, oily to creamy texture, average carbonation, bit watery, long sweet fruity-bitter aftertaste, Overall: nice Belgian strong ale, has everything it should have, but it didn´t catch me too much.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2015 Pours copper brownish. Small frothy head. A little sour, caramel, some berries, brown sugar. Full body. Not too sweet compared to other trappists. Full body. Quite a high carbonation. Complex and well balanced.
dark beer,some candy sugar, caramel, some spice, 2014 bottle, would try this again ordered from http://www.belgianbeerfactory.com/
Strong, yet subtle. Prums, fruit and a hint of yeast. This beer is simply awesome.
La reputo un pelo inferiore alla bianca. Marrone scuro, schiuma beige, aroma di caramello e malti tostati. Al palato superba, dolce, carbonazione ottima, alcol che riscalda.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2015 Aroma is raisin, caramel, roasted malts, honey, belgian candy sugar and dark fruits. Taste is rich malts, plum, raisins, wild yeast and caramel. Appearance is a clear amber with a lace head that retains well.

Pours dark brown white tan foam. Lots of caramel and licorice nose. Taste is well balanced. Dark fruits, caramel sweetness, toasted nuts, yeasty favors balanced by a light buttering hop. A classic Belgian!

Dit is echt een bier waar je heel blij van wordt. Mooie donker/rode kleur in het glas. Kleine schuimkraag heeft het bier. De smaak is vol fruitig met een hint van karamel. Afdronk is wat bitter maar toch ook zoet op de achterkant van de tong.

Cor marrom escuro com um creme bege. Aroma alcóolico, mas sem ofuscar as notas de frutas secas, açucar mascavo, baunilha, caramelo. O paladar também é complexo, com uma explosão de sabores, de salgados a doce. Maravilhosa!
Very well balanced dark beer and very strong. It is a kind of beer for special ocasions

what a surprise for me. Deep brown color with frothy head, like cappuccino. Aroma of sweet red fruits,a bit of vanilla,chocolate, syruped fruits. flavour of vanilla,raisin,Coffee... Sweet in a word with long and astringent finish. Wonderful beer.

Pours brown with creamy persistent beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, licorice, light floral, candy sugar. Taste is nicely balanced by sweet caramel, some toasted malts and bitter hops. Smooth palate with, though alcohol is present. Full body.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 Uitgeschonken in Chimay bokaal. Donkerbruin bier met roodachtige gloed, en beige schuimkraag die terugzakt tot permanente fijne schuimlaag. De geur is vol Belgische gist, rozijnen en bloemig parfum. Absoluut de beste Chimay, werkelijk een complex en aangenaam trappist bier. Tonen van karamel, rozijnen, chocolade, zacht bloemige smaken, zeer goede balans. De afdronk is licht bitter met een zachte carbonatie. Dit is weer een van die Trappistenbieren die je moet proeven. Zacht, complex en smaakvol Belgisch bier. Ik dacht altijd dat de Chimay Blauw een quadrupel was, maar blijkbaar is het een Belgian Strong Ale.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Tumbler. Supplier: Carrefour (Lézignan). Earthy with very foamy head.

Reddish dark brown color with a nice beige head. Aromas include raising, fruits and caramel with some spicy notes, pepper; also alcohol traces. Sweet and malty flavor with a sparkling tongue sense. Very carbonated and with a long sticky end.

Dark cider/brown color; Medium slightly cream body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit, & some spice; Flavor of slight roasted malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruit (notably plums), and spice; Slight alcohol at the finish; Nicely balanced and complex; One of the gold standards for the style.

330 ml bottle in osaka. dark, warming alcohol, sweet aroma but not cloying and thin body. couldnt get much in aroma or flavour. somewhat underwhelming. I remember it being better - should try again and rerate.

Deep amber pour, thin but firm tan head. Nose is raisins, dark bread, hint alcohol. More sweet than bitter. The middle is wonderfully comfortable; a medium body, some cherries, light toffee, a touch of tobacco and medium roasted malt. Finish is gently bittersweet. Must try this.
Probably my favorite beer right now. Love the flavor, very smooth. the only thing I dont like is the price.... i heard rumors they may begin to produce this in the USA to lower costs.... I hope!

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2016 75 cl. Tappo blu 2013 aperta il 6 Marzo 2016, Lotto 13 327.
Tra il rosso rubino e il tonaca di frate, velata dai lieviti, schiuma beige di persistenza medio-bassa.
Aroma di chiodi di garofano, banana, ciliegia e uva passa, vinosa ed oleosa.
Al palato ciliegia, uva passa e banana, chiodi di garofano, oleosa e vinosa con finale tostato ed erbaceo con note di cioccolato fondente.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata, etilica, texture oleosa, leggero diacetile.

------ da 750 ml millesimata 2014, aperta l8 Gennaio 2016.
Color mogano scuro con riflessi rosso rubino.
Aroma di banana matura e uva passa, lievito belga, malti tostati in secondo piano.
Al palato ben presenti gli esteri fruttati, soprattutto banana; malti tostati sul finale, dove si percepisce anche una piacevole nota alcolica ed erbacea.
Schiuma abbastanza persistente.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata.

750ml bottle, from Dutchs. Bottle has a newer label, reads L14-605. Enjoyed from my Chimay goblet (fits two pours precisely btw, with perfect space in the glass for the head). Up front, awesome dark fruit aroma, some chocolate, mild spice. Very satisfyingly rich. Totally hazy ruby red / brown color. Creamy thin off-white head, with good retention. Leaves some ropes and good splotches of lace. Looks great in the glass. Some good mild herbal flavors. Vanilla. Hazelnut. Fig. Bigger body, very nice full feel. Mildly chewy. Smooth, creamy mildly soft lighter to moderate carbonation - not over carbonated though, like many other belgians. Moderate-plus sweet taste, satisfyingly rich, but never cloying. Nice amount of dryness. Lighter to moderate bitterness. Touch of pleasant warmth on the finish. I cant believe I havent tried this up until now. Absolutely fantastic, will definitely remember this one. Surpasses the hype. Fantastic to enjoy with my sandwich (sweetness is a touch more noticeable without the food). Finished the bottle much easier than I expected to. Glad it was a 750ml.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Dark brown - reddish clear colour with yellow mousse-like firm head. Head subsist untouchable for a few minutes. Visually high carbonation (fast rising bubbles).
Aroma witth well hidden notice of an alcohol. Dominate fruity notes: you can smell grape, strawberry, coriander, oranges, bananas, yeasts etc.
Taste: alcohol is noticable, but is discrete. Taste is firstly sweet, with dry, adhesiv finish. Malt sweetness is medium, the same is hop bitterness. They are almost perfectly balanced. Esters: floral notes, caramel, dark dried fruit, plums, bananas, grape...
Body is soft, also soft is carbonation. Finish is dry and adhesiv.

My first and one of my favorite Belgian Strong Ales. Poured into a chalice or tulip, the dark mahogany and tan thick head could not be more appealing. Aroma of toffee and coffee malt mixed with ripe fruits, plums and raisins. A moderate, chewy, mouth feel that finishes with slight alcohol, raisin, and apple undertones.
THIS IS THE BEST BEER IN THE WORLD. BEAUTIFUL DEEP GOLDEN BROWN COLOUR WITH FULL FLAVOUR. A BIT OF FRUIT WHICH BALANCES THE 9% HIT. GREAT SUNDAY ARVO SIPPER WHILST READING THE PAPER
Very tasty, nothing too aggressive, goes down very easy with nice rich aftertaste with hints of coffee and chocolate

Botella de 33 cl tomada en la antigua internacional de Oviedo en junio 2004. vintage 2001 lote 238 hasta fin de 2006 9 vol. cuerpo medio a intenso con sabores maltosos tostados y dulces. bastante buena.
Love this beer. Had been drinking the white recently and thought how good it was but this one is even better.
Flaska från SB. Mörkt bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Doft av jäst och karamell. Lätt munkänsla med lite värmande alkohol. Karamell, jäst och russin i smaken.

What can I say that hasn't already been said; a great Belgian, a classic. Beautiful mahogany color with a very light brown head, nice lacing. Caramel and raisin favors with a slightly warm finish. I probably drank this too cold right out of the cooler.
Excellente bière belge. Fidèle à la tradition. Maintient sa personnalité au fil des années.

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno miedziana, zamglone. Piana drobna, niska, krótka.
AROMAT: Kwiaty, zioła, owoce (wiśnia, czerwona porzeczka), karmel, charakterystyczny zapach belgijskich drożdży.
SMAK: Słodowość, skontrowana owocowością i kwiatowością, poza tym karmel i zioła. Na finiszu wyraźny alkohol.
OGÓLNIE: Kolejna belgijska klasyka. Degustowałem piwo relatywnie "młode" (4 lata przed terminem), wiec nie może dziwić wyraźny w smaku, choć nie co mniej w zapachu - alkohol.

Appearance: dark brown
Caramel, nice flavor. Spicy and sweet and everything neat. 
Chewy texture.

Awesome beer. Better than i remembered which wad stilll Damn Good.

Big fan of belgians stron ales. This Chimay blue, has a big head. Deep brown in color with a flowery aroma that hints of earthy fruits and honey. Flavor is very mellow to start with the same earthy fruits and some rasin. Towards the end of the bottle there was a hint of spice. Would recommend this to anyone. Cheers!

Vintage 2007 Grande Réserve (750 ml bottle) at around 8 years of age. Pours a murky mahogany brown with small off-white head and lots of lacing. Lots of chocolate and some coffee on the nose. Very porter-like aroma initially. Much less sherry-like than the 2006 from a 330 ml bottle I drank in 2014. Still some wineous notes but more like a fine port than bad sherry. The palate is slightly less impressive than the nose. Medium bodied with some winey and malty notes. Medium-short finish. Lacks some acidity, bitterness or something to keep it interesting.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Heads up on 18th February 2015:


Bottle vintage 2014
Pours quite hazy caramel with big frothy off-white head thats settles nicely. Aroma is loads of belgian yeast, esteres, banana, ripe fruits, dried fruits, slight toasty malts. Taste sweet, caramel, burnt and candied sugar, yeast. Yeast and dark fruits. slight dryness in finish and full well carbonated body. Very well hidden ABV. 


Bottle vintage 2012
Pours very hazy caramel with pretty creamy one finger off-white head. Aroma is more port. Aroma is dried fruits, toasty malts, belgian yeast, port and slight booze. Not as fruity as 2014. Taste is sweet, but more complex, candied sugar. Dried fruits, yeast, more tasted. Finish is more intense and port like with some pleasing booze to cut the sweetness, like burnt figs. Full smooth body and rather dry finish from the toaste malts. Well incorporated ABV.

Still a well balanced classic!
Trüb dunkel, kräftig malziger Geschmack, kakaoaroma?, gut zu deftigen speisen wie dunkles Fleisch und starke Gewürze. Sehr gut

330ml bottle from Masuyos. Poured into a snifter. Dark amber brown color with a big soapy head. Plum, cacao, fig, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove and cherry all present on the nose. Bit of barnyard in there as well. Sweet with a mild bitterness on the palate. Medium body with nice carbonation. Slightly oily mouthfeel. As it comes to room temperature the fruit notes become more pronounced. Boozy with a little bitterness on the finish.

Zapach z butelki dosyć wyraźnie fenolowy, belgijski. W barwie piwo jest brunatne, mętne, pod światło rubinowe. Piana wysoka, beżowa. Szybko się rozluźnia ale nie traci na wysokości. Oblepia ścianki. Aromat ze szkła owocowy, przyprawowy, nieco ciasteczkowy, pojawia się też lekka guma do żucia i alkohol. W smaku jest nieco wytrawne, owocowość jest na granicy wyczuwalności. Fenole wyraźne  głównie guma do żucia i korzenie. Goryczka bardzo niska, ale w tym przypadku to nie przeszkadza. Głównie alkoholowa, chmiel w ogóle się nie odznacza. Wysycenie jest średnie. Całość sprawia lekkie wrażenie pomimo wysokiego ekstraktu. Alkohol w sumie ukryty naprawdę nieźle.
Piwo o średnio-intensywnym aromacie zbliżonym do czerwonego wina. W smaku wytrawne, z wyraźnymi nutami czerwonych owoców i solidną słodyczą na finiszu.
this is the one of the best beers in the world! i hope tofind this beer outside of the belgium too
Muito equilibrada, cor carregada com uma espuma creme que se aguenta até ao final. No paladar sobressai um toque de açúcar caramelizado muito agradável. Não se sente os 9% de vol.

10.5.2014. Dark ruby, very thick head. Aroma has syrup, roasted sweetness, malts and ripe fruits. Taste is what aroma promises. Caramel, malts, alcoholic warmth, ripe fruits, syrup. Quite full-bodied.

Aroma dry fruits raisin, 
Appearance red, brown, hazy, cloudy, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, sticky, lively, 
Overall not the best trappist ale I have had but the most readily available
Сильно карбони& крепкий тёмный эль. Сложный вкус, нотки карамел& дымка., древеси&
Sem dúvida uma das melhores Dark Strong Ale. Aroma intenso e complexo, levemente frutado. Sabor torrado, amargo e muito equilibrado.
Bottle from everards brewery shop. Deep Amber colour off white head. Aroma has banana and yeast. Taste is quite sweet.
