Pours dark with a lot of head. Smell is strongly sour, strong yeast presence, but some rosy touch can be felt. Strong carbonation at first tickles your tounge, than a strong sour body starts to evolve, but quickly turns in another direction that you would expect and finishes with a gentle roasted taste, with a quite pleasant rose-like aftertaste. An exceptional beer!
Pours a dark brown amber color with a beige head. Nose of dark fruits, spices, brown sugar, banana. Low to medium carvonation. Malty sweet flavour, Alcohol finish. Very good.

0,33l bottle from beerbottle.eu. I was insecure because of the high ABV but the alcohol is well-embedded here. This beer grows with every mouthful. Never had such a good high-alcoholic beer before.



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.33 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland. Prod.: 2014; Best before: 2019.
Ciemnobrązowe, mętnawe piwo o beżowej, ale niezbyt obfitej pianie oraz aromacie ciemnych owoców. W smaku słodkawe o posmaku ciemnych, lekko suszonych owoców oraz szczypiącym w język i rozgrzewającym gardło, półwytrawnym finiszu.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2016 Bottle 750ml. Pours cloudy reddish brown with a frothy brown head that dissipates immediately leaving no lacing. Weak watery thin body, faint flavors of banana and raisins, little or no aroma and a thin finish. Purchased in a store where it was not refrigerated. Poured the rest down the drain. 

Bottle 750ml. Same physical physical deScriptors as before. Light to medium body, complex flavors with banana, raisins, leather, yeasty basement aromas and excellent malt/hop balance, a bit too fizzy, drank a little too cold, bottle could have aged longer. An excellent brew but not my preference.
Very good Belgian ale, quite strong, with a complex taste. You can taste the chocolate and banana easily.

Jedno z najbardziej przereklamowanych piwa. 100 na rate beer, a żaden z moich znajomych nie był zadowolony z tego piwa. Zbyt duże wysycenie (to źle), aromaty suszonych owoców (to dobrze). Zdecydowanie lepiej celować w barley wine, które można sączyć, a nie próbuje na siłę jeszcze orzeźwić jak ten belgian strong ale.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2015 330ml bottle served in a trappist glass. Dark brown with a big persistent beige head. Aroma is chocolate, plum, yeast, wood, nuts, bananas, cherries, very complex but not so pronunciated. Taste is bananas, chocolate, bread, yeast, plums, very low alcohol presence. Yeasty and bittersweet aftertaste. Spicy and warming mouthfeel. Great strong ale!
Deilig komplekst øl. God sødme. Perfekt til løksuppe.

Bewertung importiert von Bier index: 
 7	/	7	/	7	/	8	/	4	/	5	/	5	/	5	/	76

330ml bottle. BB 2018. Amber brown colour with a dense, light tan head and left some nice lacing. Aroma of caramel, raisins, sherry and alcohol. Medium sweetness and minimal bitterness. Smooth, medium-full bodied with alcohol warmth. Like drinking a fine fortified wine. Delicious. I cant fault this one, one of my favourites. 10.

Trochę się zawiodłem a spodziewałem się wiele po tak dobrych ocenach. Kosztuję właśnie wersji z 2014 roku i fakt faktem, wszystko co w piwie trapistów powinno być jest i tu, ale jest też wyjątkowo kwaśnawe, a alkohol jest bardzo wyraźny. Może to po prostu wina warki i wcześniejsze były lepsze.

Very good. Nice off white head brown colour and prickly carbonation. First sweet then bitter dry. Complex flavor with bitter caramel, spices, hops and some overripe fruit. Alcohol does come through but it is not boozy.

Quelle complexité dans cette magnifique bière trappiste! Un véritable bouquet dépices explose au nez, accompagné de superbes arômes fruités. En bouche, lamertume est très longue et les saveurs sont multiples avec du sucre roux, du caramel et des fruits noirs. La torréfaction du malt est très présente jusque sur la finale. Une bière exceptionnelle !
Brown, mostly clear, with a bit of off white head. Aroma is sweet, dark fruits, Strong, but smooth. Nice.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2015 Wow! If theres a better beer than this (Westvleteren?) I have yet to find it. A super subtle blend of flavors that leaves me wanting more. I fondly remember the blue from a bike tour in Belgium back in the Eighties. Great Trappiste. Chimay glass, yeasty, dark fruit tastes, frothy, sweet, mild and deceptively strong... drinking this for my 70th.
Cerveja encorpada, de gosto forte e amarga. Fica melhor quando colocada num copo apropriado, para respirar... Fica mais amarga ainda!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka rozlana rok temu. Piana bardzo wysoka, bialo-kremowa, ale dosc szampanowa i szybko opadajaca (pozostaje warstewka cienka do konca). Piwo prawie nieprzejrzyste, burgundowo-brazowe. Aromaty owocowe (caly stragan, choc z naciskiem na suszone owoce - rodzynki, figi, sliwki, wisnie), slody, drozdze belgijskie, lekki, likierowy alkohol, karmel. Smak slodkawo-kwaskowaty, delikatny, czasami )nie wiem czemu, tylko w niektorych lykach) z lekka, chropowata goryczka. Alkohol w smaku ukryty idealnie. Bardzo wysokie wysycenie, az przeszkadzajace. Na szczescie pokal z grawerem na dnie i poczekanie chwilke zmniejsza problem. Klasa piwo, ale zarazem nie sprostalo troche oczekiwaniom.Slepy test BSDA/Quadow w pdf: http://tiny.pl/ggmvg - mial wplyw na ocene :) Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
A Belgian beer which is soothingly aromatic, divinely tasteful and relaxing to say the least!

La cerveza Chimay Azul, bautizada la Grande Reserve, en botellas de 750 ml, es una oscura cerveza trapense que tiene un aroma potente y un complejo sabor que mejora con los años. Se elaboró por primera vez como una cerveza para la Navidad, lo que explica la presencia de una vendimia. 

NOTA DE CATA: 
- Color: Esta auténtica cerveza belga, cuyo tinte de levadura fresca se asocia a un ligero toque de flores rosadas, es particularmente agradable. 
- Aromas: Su aroma, que se percibe cuando se disfruta de la cerveza, sólo acentúa la agradable sensación que revela el olor; todo desenvuelve un ligero pero agradable toque caramelizado. 
- Sabor: relativamente seco con un toque de caramelo. 
- Tipo de espuma: espesa, marrón cremosa. 

Características: 
- Graduación alcohólica: 9% de alcohol por volumen
- Período de conservación: Se puede guardar por varios años

Se sirve idealmente a temperatura de bodega (de 10 a 12°C).

Barwa ciemny brąz z czerwonym, piana średniej wielkości. W aromacie czuć rodzynki, ciemne owoce, lekko alkohol, karmel. W smaku rodzynki, karmel i alkohol - który nie przeszkadza - przyjemnie rozgrzewa przełyk, bardzo przyjemny posmak taki kwiatowy z lekka goryczka. Średnie wysycenie, złożone zbalansowane piwo.

Returning to this after a long absence, and as I thought it might be, not as good as I remember. Has quality gone down, or my palate improved. The aroma is yeasty, and there are still some ice flavours, but it seems a bit thin in the mouth, and slightly over carbonated.
Black with a finger thick head. Malty sweet aroma. Sweet taste of dark malt an fruits. Creamy feel in the mouth. A very good and strong beer!
An excellent Trappist beer. Tons of flavours, including malts, dark fruits, brown sugar, candy, spices, and alcohol heat. An incredibly smooth, velvety beer.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with large dissapating frothy white head. Aroma of lightly roasted cereal, caramel, red fruit and spices. Taste more of the same, but the spices fade away giving more space to the rosated aspect. Nice.

33cl bottle from Tesco. 2014 on label. Poured with a deep off white head that lasted only a few minutes. Deep dark reddish brown beer. Sweet malt aroma. Well carbonated. Acidic peppery crisp bite. Flavour largely malty with subtle caramel sweetness and floral overtones. Fine sediment in base of bottle.

bottle 355 mL poured in tulip glass, dark color with little head, aroma are mostly malt. taste is malt, a nice bitter end but no too bitter with a very distinct alcoholic kick, silky sensation, very nice beer, even the high alcoholic volume is very drinkable and tasty, gonna try more of these.

Pours a hazy dark amber (mahogany). Massive head volume, exceptional retention and normal lacing.

Nice, but somewhat light, nose of dark fruit (mostly raisin and date), grape and hints of cherry over caramel.

Light full bodied with a creamy texture. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence in the finish.

The flavor profile is intense, slightly complex but not well balanced due to the lack of alcohol coverage. The aroma flavors are present, but get overwhelmed by alcohol. It begins with dark fruit, then light caramel, over an underlying tobacco element. In the middle alcohol takes over and never relinquishes its hold through the finish. Caramel and dark fruit notes are underneath, but are simply overwhelmed. Perhaps this bottle is old, but since it has no bottle date...

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 Pours hazy brown with a finger of dense, creamy head. Yeasty esters, bread, and lightly caramelized sugar take the nose.Tastes of bread, some alcohol, and a slight sweetness make this a great example of the style - a favourite of mine.

Barwa wisniowa wpadajaca w bronz. Piana drobna szybko znika. Zapach z butelki ciemne winogrona, ze szkła winogronowo/alkocholowy ,słodkie owoce. Smak ciemne suszone owoce lekko rozgrzewajacy alkoholowy. Goryczka srednia

Bottle. Nice malty aroma (no roasted notes), dark brown, it got bit hazy as some sediment went from the bottle, nice head, vanished after minute or two, some bubbles left till the end. Light sweet, full bodied, high carbonation, bit oily, nice bitter finish.
It goes well with style, but its probably not my type of beer. High carbonation (as expected from BSA) is too high for my taste.

Colore marrone rossastro, bella schiuma. Odore fruttato e caramelloso.
Sapore di caramello, cioccolato, molto dolce, finale non troppo amaro, astringente e leggermente aspro (apporto del roasted barley?). Nota calda di alcool nel finale.
Honestly it is brilliant and lovely warm malty swim in a caramel sea. Alcoholic bite .

Aroma - alcohol, yeast/bread, some dark fruits in the background. Appearance - clear dark brown, decent off-white head, dissipates quickly. Taste - light sweetness. Palate - medium body with sharp carbonation, the finish is long and dry, with the astringent alcohol dominating. Overall, it wasnt bad but did not live up to expectations. The heavy alcohol flavors and lingering alcohol aftertaste brought it down for me. I was generous in the discretionary points due to its reputation.
Strong and dark ale with a little taste of caramel. A little too much of alcohol.fermented in bottles.
Very nice strong beer, nice toffee taste and although very strong it is very nice to drink. It also looks nice with its dark brown colour and there is almost no bitterness at all.

It pours a very fine, foamy head that last throughout, very deep dark brown in appearance, cloudy. The aroma is yeast, dough, bread, toffee, very low bitterness but heavy, and a very long finish of that distinct Belgian flavour.
Cerveja bem alcoólica e com aromas de torrado, caramelo e malte. O gosto confirma a torrefação e traz mais uma fruta mais passada. Com aftertaste bem amargo

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2015 Cloudy brown colour with a beige head. Smell is yeast, alcohol, lemon peel, nuts, dark fruit, banana. Taste is sweet, with lots of spice, and a long, super malty-alcoholic finish. The alcohol makes this beer quite warming. It is complex, no doubt, but just too boozy to really be enjoyable...

Une belle robe brune. Un nez plutôt discret mais où l'on retrouve des notes de malt, de caramel, d'épices et de levure. Bouche ample et soyeuse, belle équilibre entre rondeur et amertume. Une belle trappiste mais un cran en dessous de la Rochefort 10

I could drink this all day, any day of the week. It must be drunk out of a goblet shaped glass. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. 0.33. Very strong. Nice sweet flavor and taste. Alcohol much, but nice to drink.

Bottle - copper colour with a good sized fizzy light brown head which lasta a good whilte, good lacing too. Aroma of clove, yeast, hay and a little dark fruit. Taste of berries, cloves, quite a bit of alcohol, combiner with dark fruit and hay. Delightfully warming body, prickly carbonation. Exceptionally good.
A big bluesy, boozy trip. Surprised to say I prefer the Chimay White over the Red and Blue.
achoocol, fruit and sweet. lowery rosy touch is especially pleasant. great beer.

Very malty Trappist beer. I don't really like it.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cerveja de bela aparência, castanha clara, espuma de formação e persistência permanecendo até metade da degustação. Lindas bolhas grandes, mas não observei rendilhado belga. No aroma percebe-se álcoo bem evidente, caramelo, chocolate e um pouco de frutas secas cristalizadas. Percebi que em alguns momentos da volatilização os aromas pareciam desaparecer ou álcool ficava perceptível demais, em outros um delicioso aroma de cacau sobressaindo. Confesso que fiquei decepcionado com essa variabilidade. O sabor acompanhando o aroma muito de perto, cerveja bem equilibrada. Corpo denso, alcoólico, para beber em dias bem frios. Acho que o calor atrapalhou a degustação.

Bottle from The Abbey. Pours a very dark brown with an off-white head that lingers for a bit; thin on the lacing. Aromas are very dark fruits and a pretty strong malt backbone. The yeast comes through on the taste, which is quite boozy and very full bodied. Long finish, really good beer. Acquire.
Strong beer! So rich on tastes! But too much alcohol for me; the alcohol paralyzes the other flavors.

330ml botle at The Bristol Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark brown color with reddish notes and beige head. Malty sweet taste, dark fruits, wineous, spicy. Sweet and bitter taste like the aroma, with malty caramel notes at the end. Medium oily boy with soft carbonation.

Flaska från SB. Nötig mörkbrun färg med stor luftig smutsbrun skumkrona. Söt doft av skumbanan och belgojäst. Medelfyllig torr halvsöt kropp. Smak av skumbanan, smörkola och citrus. Spritig, torr, frisk eftersmak.

Chimay Blue 9%, 33cl bottle part of the tasting set I got for Christmas and so served in the matching Chimay glass. It pours a dark opaque brown with a huge beige head of foam that leaves roapy belgian laces as it slowly subsides. The aroma is sharp & fruity with raisins, figs and sweet surgary spicy baked goods. Think a really nice glazed raisin cruller. Intially the carbonation is somewhat raspy like the Red but it segways into a smoothness fairly quickly. Medium bodied with a pillowy full mouthfeel the taste has more boozy heat that the Red with sharper flavors of sweet malts, candy sugar and dried fruits. A very dry finish primes you to have another sip. A different beast from the Red but still very nice.

Appearance: dark brown - deep red, small head
Aroma: fruity, blueberries, raisins 
Palate: light & sweet
Taste: vanilla, caramel and fruity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Marrom escura, boa formação e estabilidade de espuma. Fruta passa, álcool, ameixa, figo, brandy. Caramelo e açúcar mascavo mais presentes. Corpo médio, carbonatação média. Aftertaste aquecedor, doce, prolongado.
One of the best trappist beers out there. I really should try to age a few bottles of this one, but I cant seem to keep them a long time. cereal, coffee, brown, red, hazy, tan foam, frothy,

Gamle noter fra tidligere ølsmagning:

Duft 3 ud af 5
Smag 3,5 ud af 5
Useende 2,8 ud af 5
I alt: 4,4 ud af 10

Sampled in Brussels after many bottles in the States; I keep a case in my basement for seasoning. Captivating aroma with malt, touch of spice, chocolate, caramel. Perfect head in a tlip, tasted as fine as it smelled. Lasted a long and satisfying time. Just a touch more flavorful than the Chimay rouge. In its home country, even tastier and smoother than I am used to in Boston. A little more bite than the Saint Bernardus and the Westvleteren. A world class beer.

Pours very dark with a creamy, almost stout-like head which dissipates quickly. The aroma of Belgian yeast is strong. Tastes of caramel, raisin and more Belgian spices. Very smooth with a slight boozy kick at the finish. Well carbonated. Very nice

Pours a clear brown color, topped with a beige colored head. Caramel aroma with some fruity and yeast notes. Not bad. Taste sweet and malty, caramel is nice in there. Bitter finish with obvious notes of alcohol. Not a big fan of Belgian ales, but still quite nice.
SB Oskarshamn, flaska. Har mycket av allt skum arom färg smak munkänsla historik. Stor belgare. Älskade den vita gilladde inte denna förr. Riktig fin vinterdricka..
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 One of my favorite drinking beers. The smell and taste of caramel makes this exelent strong belgian.
Bottle. Brown with tan head. Aroma is slightly metallic, some stewed fruit, raisin, prune. Taste of dried fruit, raisin, molasses, fruity alcohol. Clean finish.
From a bottle. Pours deep copper, thin head, mild aroma, big complex flavour with a sour finish.

A very classic brown Trappist beer, my favourites still being the Rochefort 10 and Westvleteren 12. 
As a Belgian person, this beer is very common and though I have it very often and it doesnt surprise me, I like it very much.
One of my favorite drinking beers.  The smell and taste of caramel makes this exelent strong belgian.
It has brown toasted colour and a balanced head. Also, It has a good taste, but is not specially aromatic and quite carbonated. It is not the best of the trappistes but a good one, though.

75cl bottle. 2014. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Clear, reddy brown. Thick, dense, lasting, pale tan head. A looker. Aroma of nuts, raisins, light chocolate maltiness. Light booziness. Taste is soft sweet. Dried fruit dryness. Rich, silky palate. A little boozy heat. Finishes fairly dry, but with some sweetness to match. Lovely.
Poured from bottle, dark red brown with beige head. Aroma with notes of dark bread, dried fruit and herbs. Taste is full, bitter sweet with a medium malt body. Long semi dry after taste.

Pours dark ruby with a foamy tan head that leaves a thin but creamy layer with great retention. Vinous, sweet and complex aroma of yeast, brown sugar, citrus, dark berries and bread. Full body, creamy feel, soft/avg carbonation. Taste of dried fruit, licorice, mocha and herbs. Long but quite dry finish with some lingering alcohol.
Not my kind of beer cause its cloying, but still beeing a MUST. Big head, nice body, balanced...Great!
Great trappist on the side some aged strong cheese. Caramel, earthy, bubblegum, butterscotch, raisin, vanilla

Poured from bottle into a tumbler. Pours a dark red/amber color with a foamy white head. Aroma consists of caramel, banana, yeast, floral notes, and roasted malts. Taste brings out molasses, brown sugar, and sour cherries along with all the smells present. Medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth feel.
Excelente cerveja, uma tomada mais jovem que não me impressionou porém a com uma certa guarda deu um excelente ressalto ao gosto. Sugiro guarda

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 33 cl. bottle 2014 vintage at home. The blue Chimay is a really good beer. No doubt about that. Tasty, a hint of yeast, but not too much and a long, rich aftertaste of roastd malt. Yet I was somewhat disappointed. Blue Chimay does not hold up to a comparison with a young Rochefort 10 and not at all to an aged Westvleteren 12 - though the last comparison is unfair - the latest two trappistes I have enjoyed. Yes, it is more drinkable, yes it has a very nice head (too much?) and aroma, but it is so much less complex and almost watery in texture compared with its peers. The most accessible trappiste perhaps, - the beginners entry into the world of trappistes? - good yes, better than most beers as available in all of Europe? Yes. But great...not at this age. However, having shared a Grande Reserve from 2001 with James this Christmas, I was amazed how much life was still left in a 14 year old Chimay. It stil had a little head and surprised with a sherry like taste with clear hoppy notes also still present. I have no doubt it was past its prime, but it was not only interesting, it was also drinkable and good. I still have a 2003 cellared...must try it soon.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip on 03.31.14.

A: 4 finger head. Almost nearly opaque dark red/brown.

S: Dark berry, earthy, bready, wheat. Very complex. Some sweetness.

T: Dark berry, wheat bread dominate. Ripe banana, plum, malt, sweet yeast are there too. There is some alcohol burn on the back end.

M: Creamy smooth.

O: This was an impressive and very complex beer.
How: bottle Appearance: dark amber, minimal head . Aroma: honey, raisins, plums, grass. Palate: average carbonation, medium to full body.
Bottle at home. Rich and malty, with a fairly sweet yet complex flavour, some dark ripe fruit notes. Strong bitter finish. Highly enjoyable. Yay.

Bottle. Fantastic sweet, plum, dried fruits, tea aroma. Appearance: dark amber, hazy, with thick head. Taste: Sweet, honey-like belgian yeast, herbs, dried fruits. Full body. Alcohol very well hidden. Great one!

2014 bottle. Murky brown colour. Head light beige and massive. Lovely caramelly scent with notes of dark fruits, raisins, spices and alcohol. It opens up when warmer... gets very thick and nice. Taste similarily caramelly, but not at all too sweet, some toffee and nutty notes, alcohol, raisins. Body above medium, carbonation active but soft. It finishes with nice warming alcohol (its really quite strong) in the throat and back of the mouth, but somewhat dry and metallic on the roof of the mouth. It is a very decent beer, a real treat, and I have to note this was the first time it didnt explode on me when opening. Should get my hands on some vintage bottles.

January 11, 2014. Bottles at home, 33 cl, vintage 2003, 2006 and 2014. 
The 2014 is the odd one out (no surprise...). It pours dark reddish brown with a large creamy off-white head. Aroma is caramel, light dried fruits, some spicy notes. Taste is medium sweet caramel, light roasted notes, light muted spices. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation. 
7-4-7-4-15 

The 2003 and 2006 pours dark reddish brown with small/medium fizzy off-white head. Aroma is port, sherry, dried fruits, caramel, faint roasted notes. Taste is sweet caramel, dried fruits, oxidized and vinous, finish is a bit watery with sherry and sweet notes. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.
Classic. Delicious. Of Course. Deep brown-red. Smooth with lots of character and depth. Caramel malts, dark fruits, strong Belgian yeast, slight hopping,bittersweet. Well carbonated.
Baseline for what to expect from a belgian beer. Smooth character with a depth of flavors. Notes of candied sugar and sweet plum tingle the tongue.

Mild yeasty, malty aroma. Pours a deep brown with some red when held to the light. A rocky, thick, tan head. Cassic nutty, sweet taste with malt and a good tart bite at the finish. Full bodied with a noticeable, but pleasant alcohol edge. The monks know what they are doing.

Birra di assoluto rispetto!! Si presenta subito di un colore ambra scuro e limpido con una schiuma decisamente densa. Sapore forte e vinoso allinizio divinamente godibile....uno spettacolo da tenere sicuramente in cantina.
very malty, slight fruit aroma. very dark red/brown in color with a nice head. taste is layered of darker caramel malts, raison. good body, smooth finish

Glass with dad and bro outside by the fire. Will need to drink again for more detail. Didnt like the red but this was solid. Great muted dirty brown color. Taste was much dark fruit sweet from those fruits. Great palate. Maybe too much yeast and bubbles. Will have again

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2016 Bottle 33cl. Vintage 2010. Cloudy deep amber brown color, lots of tiny bubbles, good frothy light tan head, recedes after a while to a thin layerwith yeast islets, light lacing; very complex aroma, sweet malty, light acidulous, caramel, brown sugar, dark chocolate, raisins, dates, mocha coffee, yeast, spices (cinnamon, cloves), portwine; taste medium to heavy sweet, light to medium bitter, caramel, brown sugar, maple syrup, spicy notes; full bodies, creamy texture, average carbonation, aftertaste mild bittersweet, bit roasty, dried dark fruits notes, alcohol; overall a great beer a withvery complex aroma and taste, surprisingly smooth and mild in the finish.

330ml bottle. Hazy burgundy with a foamy beige head. Flavors are bread, dark fruits, brown sugar, roasted malts, toffee and spices with herbal and floral notes. Medium body, lively carbonation, sticky texture.
Dark brown color. Creamy caramel taste which is surprisingly mild to drink, yet a heavy body.

No evident defect.
Very dark colour, large stady head.
Fruits and flowers aroma, very smooth. In my mouth is very warm and structured, sweet and fruity. Malty and slightly hoppy, well balanced.
The perfect beer.
Bottle 330ml. Lovely floral, spicy and yeasty aroma. quite fruity with dates, plums and cherries, smooth mouthfeel with warming alcohol and nutty roasted malt, this is one of my favourites.
750ml bottle pours a amber brown with a large off white head. bread dry fruit and sweet malt taste
Amber brown in color, fruity,cherry, plums, lightly spicy aroma and flavor, light roasted malt, dry, medium body. This a beer to enjoy, a drink a barrel, delicious.

Bottle aged for ~15 months. Pours a hazy, dark, amber-brown body with full tan head that dissipates rapidly, however, adequate lacing resides.
Beautiful floral and yeast aromas with a touch of dark fruits. Dates, cherries, and even some banana scents are noticeable.
Very complex taste with molasses, brown sugar, and spicy bread. Nutty malt flavors create an inherent earthiness.
Ideal carbonation level cuts the sweetness and is spot on. Creamy mouthfeel with a dry finish.
This is one of the dynamic beers that spurred me further into my lust for quality beers.

Bottle at home. Appearance dark brown / reddish, and relatively clear. Aroma is mostly sour and yeasty. Some toffee sweetness, but not much else detectable. Taste is bready with a prominent hint of sour cherries. Toffee, caramel and sweet malts. Alcohol is nicely warming, really smooth. A little too much carbonation for the style. Finish is a bit short and watery. Good trappist, but not up there with my favourites.
@ pub in Brussels. Pours dark brown with a white head. Aroma of bread and fruit. Taste of brown sugar, caramel, grains, and dark fruits. One of my favorite beers!

Bottle 330ml, dark brow and cloudy with creamy colored head, unfortunatly quite fast falling. Aroma very changing - imidiatly after opening the bottle yeast and bananas, later raisins, caramel, nuts and strawberries. Quite sweet with decent bitterness in the aftertaste. Carbonisation is avarage but very fine what makes the beer very good drinkable and the most important its not to heavy although it has 9% alcohol. Considering Im not a big fan of Trappist beer its quite ok. and I even enjoyed it.

Aroma: Smells like commercially made bread (think Wonderbread) with a pepper finish. 
Appearance: Dark amber, deep apple cider colored beer. More carbonation than expected. Big, lacy, four finger head (terrible pour) that disappeared quickly. 
Taste: Honey, brown sugar, raisins, caramel malts, cherries, yeast, and butterscotch. Some alcohol in the finish, but less than I expected for 10 ABV.
Palate: Creamy front end that dissipates immediately into a surprisingly clean, airy, light and crisp feel in your mouth. 
Overall: I poured this 33 cL bottle into a glass I like to drink beer in. I am not a Belgian beer fan but the pretty girl at the liquor store convinced me it was a solid dark beer to restock my beer fridge. RateBeer member Jablanko summed it best, "This is my favorite out of any Belgian style brews"...but its still a Belgian style beer. #respectbeerbrethren

Bottle in Thalys train. Pours a dark ruby with a thick, foamy beige head that leaves decent lacing. Aromas of grass and citrus with some floral notes. Wonderful, full taste with many sweet notes -- beginning with citrus and moving on to a pronounced black cherry and then to a toffee finish. Medium carbonation. Awesome beer.
Beau col épais et persistent, arôme aux effluves de banane et de caramel et très typique des meilleures bières belges. Fine en bouche. Un pur délice!

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 Exceptional beer.  Appearance is very bold, and excellent lacing and frothiness which i like.  Aroma is the weakest point for me-  a bit hoppy and a hint of caramel but nothing too striking.  Beer is definetly much better at 10c than 5c. (50F).   Taste however is remarkable start to finish with a good mix of dark fruit, nuts, maybe dark chocolate and malt.  Palate is the best part - its creamy and rich and extremely drinkable for 9%abv with almost no boozing.  After taste is not bitter at all and just is longing for more.

UPDATE:  i purchased a 2010 bottle today instead of 2014.  Wow,  even better!!  Especially the aroma,  very lively with a distinct sweetness and very strong malty bread flavor coming through which is anazingly complete.  Also i drank it warmer-  definetly best around 10 or even 12c.

33cl bottle
Apperance: Dark amber colored beer with a small head that had quickly disappeared.
aroma: a little bit sweet and mild oxidized, with candy, sugar, honey, raisins, caramel malts, yeast, nuts, butterscotch,grass
Taste: dry with some sweetness caramel, yeast, hay, grass, nuts, raisins, candy sugar, and some warming alcohol in the finish.
medium body, average carbonation.

And I probably have to rerate this when I open up a 75cl bottle knowing how that one develops better over time.
Bottle. Brown to red colour. Unsurprisingly, a nice head and a range of malty notes on the nose. Molasses, candy, even some umami. Very accomplished!

Brown body, with a tiny brownish head that lasts forever. Rich, chewy texture, complex and tasty. Doesnt pack a heavy alcoholic punch despite having almost 10 ABV. This is my favorite out of any belgian style brews so far in my rating "career".

12 oz bottle poured into a Chimay goblet, natch.

A: Pours a murky dark brown color with great opacity. The head is about two fingers high, with an off-white shade. Typical of the style, its very airy in texture and a bit rough-looking, and its retention is decent without being spectacular. No much lacing to speak of.

S: At first, the aroma is mostly bready and peppery, lacking in both fruit esters and even darker malts. There are also touches of earth here and there. To get the most out of this beers nose, you really have to let it warm up - this way, it will develop some nice tones of caramel, chocolate, brown sugar, cherries, and raisins. While the aroma develops into something quite good, not once does it jump out at me; its rather mild to a fault.

T: There is a good amount of raisin flavor as soon as this hits the palate. Past the swallow, it transitions into a sweet caramel-and-chocolate flavor to go with its earthy (but not funky) yeast. There seems to be something ever-so-slightly off about this one, especially on the back end - I want to say its kind of metallic? Yeah, thats it. Metallic. Some stank-ass cheese flavor also pops up in spurts, but I dont consider that a flaw. The complexity here is quite good.

M: The carbonation is quite intense. This makes it light-feeling and a bit prickly, but also very drinkable. Once the fizz calms down, it still remains very dry on the back end. The feel does a good job of reminding me why I enjoy my Belgian-style ales to come from Belgium itself: the carbonation doesnt try to cover up an overly sweet finish, while still retaining a complex nature.

O: Almost great, but that metallic strangeness kind of hurts. This and the mellow aroma keep it out of the fabled 4 range, sadly. I imagine this would go great with a stank-ass cheese (preferably from Chimay themselves), and this is certainly worth having again to find out. Still, my favorite (non-quad) BSDA remains Gouden Carolus Classic.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Belgian glory! One of the most serious well known beers in the world. Simphony of aromas and strong alcohol only improve the beer qualities. Hazy dark ruby color and enormous tan head (full of taste also) slowly diminishes. Nectar of Angels!
First Chimay for me. This is quite complex and strong beer in 33cl bottle. Hint of caramel and sweetness. Minimal head, dark brown color. Need to try this again in the future.

Small bottle, served in goblet. Appers dark and ruby/cherry, at first thick head, but quickly diminihes to minimal and slightly beige. Very clear. Aroma is malty with terrific and distinct cherry. You can smell sourness, probably stemming from candi syrup. Lots of fruits (dried ones), some breadiness. Aroma is perfectly mixed. Taste consists mostly of malts, some bread crust, toastiness, maybe nuts and some dried fruits. Also a hint of sourness. Its medium-bodied, mildly carbonated and with quite long finish. There isnt any distinct bitterness, but very pleasant alcohol warmth in mouth. You couldnt be negatively surprised by this beer, one of the best Belgium has to offer in wide distribution and at reasonable price. Always enjoyable.

Old rating rerated 26.12.2014, 0,33l bottle (best before 2013) @ home:
Soft gusher. Small shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet and mild oxidized, candied sugar, honey, raisins, caramel malts, yeast, nuts, butterscotch, burnt caramel, alcohol, grass. Taste is slightly dry, burnt caramel, yeast, hay, caramel malts, nuts, raisins, candied sugar, alcohol, grass. Medium bitterness, slightly dry yeasty mouthfeel. Nice.

Pours a medium brown with a pale thin head. It has a slightly fruity aroma and a bit of a tingly effervescence. The fruit flavor isnt very strong nor does it last very long. The flavors is pleasant but it slips right by and doesnt linger. For the high alcohol content there is very little or no burn or aftertaste. It drinks very smooth. It is light, smooth, and pleasurable to drink but not as good as I expected. Id enjoy sitting back and relaxing with one of these again but at ~ $9.95 for an 11.2 oz bottle it isnt really worth that price.

750 ml bottle (batch from February 2013). Dark amber/light brown, slightly hazy, with a nice, creamy and persistent off white head. Good lacing. Pretty nutty and toasted nose, moderate alchool presence, tons and tons of dark/dry fruits (especially plums and figs), perhaps a touch of bitter dark chocolate as well. Lighter and more zingy than expected, but very clean and tasty. Less alchool compared to the aroma, just a mild warming sensation. Again nutty, slightly toasted and much more fruity (even some blackberries and mature pears). A bit yeasty in the aftertaste. Average to lively carbonation, medium body, slightly oily texture. Solid but not mind blowing.

Rating a classic beer is not easy for a newcomer. Heres my first attempt.
Liquorice and molasses with gently roasted malt. Finish with a sharp liquorice alcohol feel. Alcohol rather felt but in a subtle way. Elegant beer. One of my all time favourite. Probably had a few hundreds bottles so far in my short life. Never met a beer enthusiast who doesnt like this beer.
Cerveja de sabor marcante, maltada, entre as Trapistas é a minha favorita. Nota 5 pra ela!
Glass from a magnum from 2010. Dry and yeasty, dark fruit, bread, malty. Not as full on as I remember. Interesting though.

750ml bottle at R2L in Philadelphia, PA. Sets the baseline for what to expect from a belgian beer. Smooth character with a depth of flavors. Notes of candied sugar and sweet plum tingle the tongue. 

--you've been Dubbed.

In bottle. Beige, frothy, rocky head. Persistent. Copper. Cloudy. At nose intense, a bit persistent. Chestnut honey, caramel, hezelnut, dried fruit, brown sugar, plums. , also a bit of yellow and white fruit, maybe peache and pear Very complex. The big amount of alcool is not perceived. Strong body, warming sensation. Intense and persistent. Very balanced, the sweet entry isbalanced with a discrete bitter lingering all around the mouth. The alcool in the throat is not aggressive. Beautiful

75cl bottle poured into chalice. Great aroma of belgian yeast with some bready fruit notes to it. Pours a beautiful dark brown with a light tan head that dissipates into a ring that sticks around. Tastes incredibly smooth with a great mouthfeel and carbonation. Great yeasty flavors.
One of my favourite beers, smooth ritch aroma and very enjoyable, prefere the 75 cl bottle
caramel, toast, roasty, herbs, butterscotch, brown, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, full body, sticky, lively, long finish,

33 cl bottle at home. Pours a clear dark red-brown with a white head. This rapidly disappears leaving a thin film. Slight aroma of malt with some leafy hop just detectable. Pleasant taste of sweet malt with some bitterness: well balanced. Palate is on the thin side, there is a floury edge to the finish. Ending dry, but the sweetness is still there. Overall: OK, better than I remember.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2015 Dark brown-amber color with big head. Spicy yeasts, chocolate and a bit of fruitiness. Taste is the same. Just a bit boring for a Trappist beer... Not my favourite. 6/5/6/3/14. Update: Sampled from a Magnum bottle. This one was better. More raisins and smoother carbonation I feel. Very silky mouthfeel. Maybe the corking made it age better, although it was young. Had the corked bottle again.

Bottle. 
Dark Brown pour, frothy White head.
Sweet Nose, sweet malty taste, with a hint of prune.
Heavy body, soft carbonation.

Pour is loud and and the colour of homemade iced tea. The cap is an inch and a half of tan foam, even with the gentlest of pours, but it settles to a film pretty quickly, leaving a bit of lace. The nose on this stuff is a treasure trove. I get something new with every sniff: pungent Belgian yeast, prunes/raisins, banana, lots of spice, hazelnuts, dark caramel/toffee, a hint of something floral. Taste is a slightly sweet malt with caramel and hazelnuts, ripe banana. The booze is virtually invisible until the finish, where it starts to give off this pleasant, lingering warmth. This is remarkably drinkable for 9%, and while its not dry per se its remarkably well-balanced. And I just downed it in ten minutes, on an empty stomach, so there goes my night. Cheers!

Bottle thanks to Jaco. Pours a beautiful dark brown with large cream head that eventually recedes to a thin layer that persists. Not much aroma, slightly fruity. Taste of coffee and dark fruit, very drinkable for a 9% beer, a very smooth alcohol flavour. Really nice.
0,75l bottle from Erzbierschof. Pours brownish with a lively foam that quickly dies. I enjoyed this beer and theres clearly nothing wrong with it, but I find it a bit boring.
Degu @erzbierschof. Nicht schlecht, wenig CO2. Sehr viel Caramell. Rund und harmonisch, aber keine Ecken und Kanten. Langweilig.
Delicious. Pours dark hazy brown with thick beige head. Smells sweet and of Belgian yeast. Tastes of dark fruit, slightly bitter with sweet malty notes and some hint of banana and bubble gum. Primo

APPEARANCE - Dark brown, with a 4-finger head that dissipates slowly. Not much lacing.

AROMA/SCENT - Nutty, sweet.

TASTE - Fresh, sweet, nutty.

MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - Good carbonation, smooth.

VALUE - $8 for 11 oz. bottle - low price for an import at a restaurant.

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - Good drinking beer. Not overly boozy.

I find this beer as the others 330ml Chimay charming just looking at the bottle: simple but elegant.
The real appearence in the glass confirms the idea with its dark ruby color and the thick with head.
It gets a little while to open nad probably its a matter of right serving temperature, but the aroma is definitely the best feature of this beer, which will literally fill your nose with yeast and toffe, but I must say that every time I find some little differences.
Great beer for those who like to pay attention to every details.

Cloudy Dark Ruby Brown Color, Huge Foam Head That Does Not Last Too Long, Settles to A Small Lacing Ring. Sweet Fruity and Boozy Aroma. Malt, Fruit and Boozy Finish. Might Be Very Good At What It Is, Have Rich History but then again it is not for everyone. I personally dont like booziness although it is part of this style. Drinkable. Worth A Try To Expand Your Horizons...

330 ml bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a cloudy copperish brown with a good finger or so of light tan head. 
Aroma: Belgian yeast, malt, straw 
Flavours: Cloves and other baking spices, yeast, bit of hops, floral notes, hints of fruit such as apricots and prunes with some burnt sugar.
Mouthfeel: Lots of carbonation. 
Overall: A very nice characteristic Trappist ale. You get that unmistakable Belgian yeast aroma right off the bat and those complex flavours with baking spices and fruits.
330cc bottle. Lovely trappist brown colour. I am a fan of the stile and this one lacks some sweetness and creaminess. Fantastic beer although. Better in the nose than in the mouth.

Niespodzianka tuż po otwarciu - gushing z butelki. Barwa brunatna, lekkie zmętnienie. Piana średnio pęcherzykowa, bardzo obfita. W aromacie mocna słodowość. Pierwszy łyk zdradza całą moc tego piwa - pełne w smaku, przyjemnie wyczuwalny alkohol. Piwem można się spokojnie "najeść".
of all our belgian quads, i will forever prefer this one, even to the "westy 12". Build character & do like i do : i keep the crates for 5 yrs before drinking em : this one ages heavenly.

Bottle at home (75 cl Grand Reserve 2010, lot: L010 998). Pours a light hazy red brown with a fast disappearing off-white head leaving a bit of lacing. Aroma of caramel, lightly roasted malts, a hint of yeast, and intense dark fruits. Taste is malty caramel, lightly roasted malts, lots of intense dark fruits, bit of warming alcohol in the end, aftertaste of dark fruits and warming alcohol. Very nice for the long winter evenings.
Bottle. Dark ruby brown. Lingering beige head. Nose of sweet malt. Strong raisin, plum, dark malt, burnt sugar. Heavy and fruity.

Bottle from Tesco. Pours dark brown with tan head, aroma of Belgian yeast, spices, chocolate and candied fruit. Flavours of chocolate, spices and Belgian yeast with good mouthfeel and a nice alcohol warmth. Lovely beer.
Simplesmente a melhor cerveja da Bélgica, foi servida com pouca espuma mas perfeita

A sweet, malty aroma with a touch of honey. In the taste a perfect balance between the alcohol and the malty, yeasty aspect. its not as sweet in the mouth as in the nose, but with a nice bitter in the ending.

The best (stout) beer in the world, simple as that, and shes less expensive than a Rochefort or worst a Westvleteren and shes more easy to find in France.

I highly recommand this product but thats a strong one !

33cl bottle pours cloudy ruddy orange brown with a big rocky tan colored head. Aroma is of toasty malts and caramel. Tastes like raisins, spices, and the alcohol is well hidden. Bubbly clean mouthfeel and slightly dry finish.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 the aroma of caramel, dark fruits and port with hints of toffee and chocolate... the taste is spicy, caramel and fruity with shades of red wine, flowers and spices... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...
75 cl bottle @ Poteaupré. Dark brown with huge off-white head. Aroma of caramel malty, yeast, some spices. Sweet flavour, Alcohol is incredibly (and dangerously) covered, just some feeling in the end
Black, medium beige head. Caramel, roast and yeasty alcohol on the nose. Sweet and strong with caramel notes. Finishes warm, bitter, dry and roasty. Nice.
Dark, clear liquid, small head. Light aroma of caramel. Full body, average carbonation. Taste is bitter and sweet.
Black, medium beige head. Caramel, roast and yeasty alcohol on the nose. Sweet and strong with caramel notes. Finishes warm, bitter, dry and roasty. Nice.
Cloudy brown extensive white head head. Aroma and taste of banana, cloves, brown sugar and caramel. Very well balanced and very smooth. Magnificent when aged for a year or two.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 Belle robe couleur noisette. La mousse apparaît facilement et tient bien. Arômes de malt dominants. Saveur plutôt douce, fruits noirs, réglisse. Assez longue en bouche. Arrière goût de miel et de prunes.Une très bonne trappiste.

Pours a very dark red with a large light brown head. Sweet malty aromas, caramel, berries, maybe a bit of apple, smells very rich. Thick texture with an average amount of carbonation, a little sticky and has a nice bitter finish. Has a slightly sweet honey taste, some raisin and berries and a very nice warming alcohol flavor. My first of hopefully more Trappist style beers.
2006 reserve. pours brown with small white head.Aroma is bready (rye like), sweet, dark berries. Taste is sweet, caramel, honey, warming. Not bad, but not for me.
Strong dark beer with warming alcohol which does not disturb its flavour. The taste is complex, spicy and persistent.

belle couleur brun foncé; mousse blanc-crème; arômes et goût fruités (fruits rouges, réglisse), un peu de malt et dépices; les 9% dalcool ne se font que très peu sentir; finale assez douce (trop ?), réchauffante, avec un peu damertume

Great beer. I had it a number of times and it was always great. Very nice aroma of caramel and dark fruits, and similar in taste with a little warmth of alcohol which is very well hidden. Very tasty,very drinkable. A touch of beauty, art and greatness in the glass.

Aroma: Medium malt. Medium alcohol, spicy. Medium vinous. Medium fruitiness, banana, pear, prune.
Appearance: Clear, amber/brown. Head: Small, tan, large bubbles, good retention.
Flavour: Medium-high malty, toasty, Medium fruity, banana, pear, dried fruits, licorice. Light spicy, pepper from alcohol. Medium bitterness. Medium-dry finish with lingering fruitiness and slight warming. 
Mouthfeel: Light warming. Medium-light body. Medium-high carbonation, creamy. 
Overall: Fruity, spicy with light warming. Great example.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
18E. Belgian Dark Strong Ale

Mahogany color, beige head. Dried fruit nose, candi sugar, Belgian yeast, nuts. Caramel and roasted malt taste, candi sugar, dried fruit, yeast, hint of alcohol. Medium to full body, average carbonation, warming alcohol.

Pours a deep Amber color, aroma is malt, lots of dark fruit, sugar, hint of alcohol, spice - almost like all spice? - taste definitely malt and dark fruit, hint of alcohol, creamy and smooth. Pretty damn good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours with an average, light brown head with good lacing. Definite murky body thats brown in color. Aromas of tobacco, musty earth and leather, and slight rotten eggs (not in a bad way). Definitely a long-duration flavor, with moderate sweetness. An excellent session beer.

Pours a nice, murky reddish brown with a think, bubbly head. Some dark fruity notes in the nose and Belgian yeast. Flavor builds on the aroma and it has the typical extra fizzy tingle on the tongue you would expect from a Belgian strong. Definitely a classic of the style and one that I come back to every so often.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2014 When the aroma is less, I feel that I cant feel/taste the beer. A good beer for sure but since Im living in Belgium this is not the most special one for me. However I love Trappist beers!

About time I stopped dragging my feet and drank this beer. Having finally had it, Im happy to say that it lives up to the hype and is worth the cost. Chimay Blue is sexy (well, as sexy as Belgian dark ales can be) with its brown color and awesome head. Smell is distinctly fruity - grape, cherry, plum, raisin - and malty sweet with caramel and candy-like booze aromas. Flavor has complexity to spare. Caramel, brown sugar, nuts, raisin, yeast, toasted malt, cherry, and grape. Like the best Belgian beers, Blue continues to unveil its character as you drink it. The sheer amount of flavors would overload your palate if it werent balanced so well. Mouthfeel manages to be creamy and lively at the same time. For what its worth, this beer loves to be paired with rich cheese and game meat.
Aroma of malt with a hint of Belgian yeast, cloudy brown color with a lasting white head. Creamy feel with a complex taste of nuts, fruit and malt with a sweet finish.

Bottle.

A- Applesauce, dark fruits, slightly sweet, spices, raisins, brown sugar.

A- Brown color, hazy liquid, tan head.

T- Applesauce, dark fruits, slightly sweet, spices, raisins, caramel.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- Hands down the best in the Chimay series. Outstanding flavors and aromas of applesauce and other various fruits and sugary goodness. Nothing wrong with this beer.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2015 Forse la più nota tra le birre belghe. questa strong ale si presenta bene. Di colore ambrato, con una buona schiuma, presenta subito le note caramellate e di cereali, sentori erbacei con una buona presenza di odori da lievito. Ben strutturata, una buona birra da meditazione
Pours brown with thick head. Minimal aroma. Tastes of raisin, sugar, rum. Not that much aftertaste. Okay.

Appereance: hazy reddish dark brown with a big beige head. 
Aroma: coffee, resin, alcohol, complex aroma
Taste: medium sweetness, caramel
Palate: 
medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter

es schmöckt sehr fein, fruchtig, gseht dunkel brun us, s erste bier womer guet gschmöckt het, bes i das trunke han hani ned gwösst was bier isch, chasch nur wieterempfehle, aroma isch bärig und schmökt au de alkohol
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2015 From the bottle. Brown beer with white head. Round fruity taste. Sweet with a bitter.
Bij de fles open doen kwam er meteen een ontzettende schuimlaag uit. Hele mooie smaak.
Rich, complex beverage with a rounded fruity and floral character unlike any other. Good, solid body and a pleasant maltiness. No alcohol taste despite strength.
330ml bottle. Pours light red with light brown head. Oily texture and average carbonation Prune aromas. Very balanced beer with bitter / sweet finish.

Den som lagrats i 8 år. Kryddiga russin i doften. Mörkt bröd och pepparkaka. 

Kryddig men tunn smak. Kroppen har försvunnit men smaken har utvecklats. Kanske borde bara lagrats i 5-6 år. 

Absolut prisvärd dock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

23/10/14 - 750 ml bottles of 2006, 2009 and 2013 shared by Sam Vanderstraeten with Johan Brandt at s Smiske.

2013 : Nice thick brown color, good head. Roasty, caramel spicy smell same for taste. Full oily palate, lively carbonation.
2009 : less thick color, medium head, adds port to the taste. Nicest palate.
2006 : when opening definetly smell that it is over its date. No head. Taste port, bit spices. Clearly too far (in comparison with the oters) but still much better than a lot of other brown beers.
Untill this tasting I had doubts whether I find this a great beer or a very good beer. Now I clearly know. I prefer the 2009 but learned to appreciate the fresh one more.

Belle robe brune sanguine, mousse abondante et beige, un fin col persiste.Je conseille dailleurs comme pour toute les belges de bien les aérer lors du service.Au nez : le caramel, les céréales, le biscuit spéculoos, le sucre de canne chauffé, amertume et alcool perceptibles. Au goûté : attaque de fruits secs liquoreux, puis les malts torréfiés au goût de caramel et de biscuit.En fin, une légère amertume enveloppée dans une belle douceur de sucre de canne/candy.Puissance et corps assurés par le taux assez élevé dalcool.Excellente brune dAbbaye.
Excellent beer...great color and aroma. Small hint of alchohol considering its 9% ABV. A bit pricey compared to my regular fare but worth it.
Heerlijk donker Belgisch biertje. 9%, zachte smaak. Pruimsmaak. Redelijke schuimkraag.

11.2 oz. bottle from Cash Wise in Williston. Appearance: 2 finger light brown head, good lacing, amber-red color, clear. Aroma: prune, notes of bread, light alcohol. Palate: medium body, alcohol thinness and light heat, oily texture, average carbonation. Taste: sweet fruity prune with touches of bready malt into moderate alcohol taste, with sweet fruity malt finish. Overall, amazing beer, great balance, awesome balance. Lovely and lives up to hype.
Brewed by monks. Beer monks. Wake up 4am. Do monk stuff etc (silent cold porridge eating). Potter about tending carrots. Drink Chimay and taste / meet God.. .
Mörk mahogany med brunfärgat rejält skum. Doften något "brett torr" kastanj med jäst. Smaken oerhört bred med bränd maltig karamell. Eftersmaken lång med jäst & champinjon.
Bottle from mane liquor. Floral and banana aromas. Raisins and toffee coming through with some pepper and zing from the 9%. Warming, quite high on the carbonation.
2010 bottle. Very balanced. Lots of tastes and aromas playing around and none ofthem coming out too strongly. Still not my favourite style even though its good.
Flaska från systembolaget - doftar jäst med en liten hint av malt. Mörk med vitt skum. Komplex maltsmak, en sötma och lite värme från alkohol, kanske något spritig.
"my favorite of the chimay line...not by a whole lot, but the mouthfeel is great, and the flavor inviting and quite complex...and at 9%, its an enticing ale."

Bottle 750ml. A bit cloudy brownish-red with quickly diminishing low beige head. Sweetish aroma, dried plum, cherry, yeasty, some spiciness, bready. Sweet cherry flavor, fruity, malty, quite spicy, light sourness, a bit alcoholic. Lively carbonation. Medium to full body. Sweet-sour aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 Bottle of 33cl , in a Trappist Chimay glass; from the fridge (and room temperature too).

Okay, were in front of a good trappist beer, but not the best. The aroma is weaker than in the others, the same for the palate. Nice taste of special, trappist yeast.

Cheers !

750ml bottle served in its own chalice.
A: Beautiful bottle art and label, first of all. Pours a nice dark amber to brown color. Cloudy and dirty with some particles floating around. Forms a big beige head. Good retention. A thin layer remains for long on the top. Lots of lacing are formed and left
S: Great nose. Sweet, bready and very fruity (raisins, mainly). Notes of wood, toffee, vanilla roasted malts and brown bread. Classic Belgium yeasts. Flowery hops. A bit of alcohol in the end
T: Sweet upfront. Very bready and fruity. Dark fruits, roasted malts, caramel malts. Notes of vanilla and wood. Nice hops profile. Moderate bitterness
M: Heavy, creamy and molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Bittersweet aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Excellent Trappist specimen. Absolutely recommended
[ BA Review @ 1/12/2010 ]

Bottle. A classic, and my gateway into craft beer, enjoyed on countless occasions. Rarely disappoints. This one pours a hazy dark brown with a reddish hue. Creamy finger thick head. Tremendous and complex aroma with roasted malts and bread, as well as chocolate, kandi and then theres the yeast with nice dark fruity whiffs. All very nicely balanced. Full creamy body, with average carbonation. Flavour is sweet with roasted malts, bread, nuts and chocolate and a long chocolate sweet finish. Delicious!

Bottle at home, 12th October 14. Pours deep Brown, aroma is slight, sugar, fruit, ok. Taste is brown sugar, toffee , slight Banana, not as intense as I expected. Overrated due to wide reach, over better Belgians, but its ok

Nice Fruity and roasty aromas. Some spicy notes aswell.
Intense flavour (sweet and slightly bitter) and full bodied. Not very long ending. Alcohol is well integrated.
Good Beligian Ale but it is not a top one
33cl bottle at home. Dark colour. White tastefully head. First impression : caramel, sweet, bubbly. Nice aftertaste!

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2017 It pours cloudy dark brown with a medium tan head. It has the aroma of roasted malts, coffee, caramel, strong yeast and dough, but spices and fruits too. Taste is light sweet with a bittersweet finish. The carbonation is soft but it invigorates the texture: creamy, leaning towards oily. Nice touches of alcohol. A very good beer and a classic.

Pours dark brown with great, lasting head and nice lacing. Some sweet, malty aromas, together with typical Belgian yeast nose. Great balance in taste, despite low bitterness. May come across alcoholc at the finish, but hey, its 9%. Fantastic beer.
Pours a hazy brown with a foamy off-white head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, honey, and fruit. Flavor is fruit and yeast, with a nice sweetness. A delicious example what a beer can and should be.
Overall a good beer, can't smell the aroma, but the first taste makes you want more. A dark trappist with a good palate. I usually don't like trappist, but this one i can drink again.

Bottle from the LCBO. Cloudy dark brown pour with a large long lasting khaki head that leaves some sparse lace. Nose is roasted malts, toffee, yeast and a lot of fruit including pear, plum and cherry. Light sweet start with a mild tart middle with a complementary level of spice throughout. Mouth is medium full and creamy with average carbonation. Well balanced and enjoyable.

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 Eine Wiederbegegnung mit dem Starkbier-Klassiker. Ich erinnere mich noch gut, mit welcher Begeisterung ich vor rund 25 Jahren meine ersten Flaschen dieses Bieres (von P&M in Bad Godesberg) verkostet habe. Damals glaubte ich, einen wahren Göttertrunk genießen zu dürfen ... Später sah ich es nüchterner: Rohrzucker und eine blockhaft-eindimensionale Würze ohne Finessen. Recht simpel gestricktes Bier, notierte ich zuletzt. Immer wieder war auch zu lesen, Chimay sei nicht mehr dasselbe Bier wie früher und entfalte sein volles Potential erst nach mehrjähriger Lagerung. Das wollte ich doch mal ausprobieren. - Flasche (75 cl), Jahrgang 2011, drei Jahre im Keller gelagert. - Mahagonifarben, sahniger beigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase schweres dunkles Malz, Pflaume, zart säuerliche Note, Portwein (oder Rumtopf?). - Antrunk schwer dunkelmalzig mit brotigen Röstaromen (Melanoidine), Rum, Pflaumenmus, Gewürzbrot (Spekulatius). Dabei doch leichtfüßig und sogar spritzig. Gut rezent, weich im Mund. Im Abgang krautig-herber Hopfen mit schwach holziger Herbe. Nicht allzu bitterer, aber komplex würzig-herber Nachtrunk. - Gut komponiertes, in Würde gealtertes Starkbier, füllig aber nicht plump, mit Anklängen von Weihnachtsgewürzen, dabei fast schlank (darf ich sagen: dünn?). Durchaus ein schönes Bier, eins der besseren Starkbiere. Aber 100 Punkte scheinen mir doch etwas übertrieben. Inzwischen gibt es weit bessere Biere dieser Art in Belgien.
Bottle revolution Leeds. Cloudy brown good head. Aroma is fruits banana taste same cloves nice bitter finish. Nice body prickly carbonated. Very good.

This is the standard I hold other beers to. Dark brown where you can see sediment in it (for some reason the smaller capped bottles show it more than the ones with the cork - unsure why. Lacing that never fully disappears. Fragrance, malt, but there is a fruit ending to it - almost pinot-like in nature. Carbonation seems a bit higher in the capped then the corked bottles. Oily mouthfeel. I do like it out of the 750ml bottles more - but want to do a blind test to see if it is psychological or true. This is a beer than you can taste, smell, and feel. It is a true favorite.
Wyglad, lacing, piana drobno i srednio, zmetnione. Aromat lekko winny, lekko dziki. Smak, wyczuwalna goryczka, pozostale smaki w tle. Ogolnie przyjemne piwo.

Quite dark color with very slight tan head.

Aroma is surprisingly mild; a touch of vanilla with some sweetness and dark fruits.

Taste: vanilla, sweet dark fruits, complex, spicy. Mouthfeel is mostly the carbonation plus a slight oiliness. 

A very good beer.

Cloudy dark brown color with a large tan head, complex aromas of yeast, basement and fruit (berries, grapes, banana). Sweet with a light sourness. average carbonation, oily texture, long sweet finish with hints of coffee. Good, complex and strong beer.

Bottle. Huge ochre bigbubbled head. Almost no lace. Deep reddish brown, clear. Mild herbal aroma, hints of coffee and chocolate. Sweet malts, herbs, minerals, strong, warming, bit oily. Wide taste, good balance. Noble.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

@ Nedre Mölla 29/9-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Yeasty, malty, fruity, raisins, notes of caramel. Taste: Fruity, dried fruits (raisins?), notes of caramel, sweet. Body is medium, the finish is fruity.

330 ml bottle called Chimay Bleue Grande Réserve 2014.
Beer enjoyed @ "Den Gamle Major" from a tulip glass.
September 23, 2014.
Dark brown color with a beige head and medium carbonation.
Aroma is malt, dark sugar,caramel,a bit yeast and some spices.
Tastes a bit sweet and has a warming alcohol feeling.
The beer has a bittersweet finish.

0,33 l, flaske, 9,0 % ABV, købt i Netto på Roskildevej i Valby, 24. september 2014.
Mørk mahognifarvet og ufiltreret "stærk belgier"/belgisk Ale med kæmpehøj 6-7 cm tyk offwhite skumkrone, "storboblende". Et ikke specielt kønt skumlandskab, efter toppen er svundet ind.
Aroma af kaffe, chokolade, gær, tørret frugt og bondegård. 
Ganske kraftig og fyldig smag af tobak, alkohol og chokolade. Spændende symbiose mellem sødme og det bitre. Solid bitterhed, medium sødme, zero sur. 
Kraftfuld krop og ganske vel-karboneret. Cremet til sticky konsistens og meget perlende. 
Chimay Bleu udvikler sig efter åbning, og sødmen får mere plads henover afklimatisering. 
Denne øl var for en årrække siden min egentlige første specialøl, og det kan undre, at der skulle rate's små 450 øl før den. Smagen holder, som dengang, men karboneringen kunne IMO sagtens være neddroslet. Trods dén observation, er dette bryg en klassiker!

I had this at Global Brew. Pours brown with a tan head. Taste caramel, dark fruit, Belgian yeast. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark malty beer with chocolate and Carmel flavor. Leaves great taste, but heavy in nature.

Chimay 2013 - Ambrée marron-orangée très foncée. Grosse mousse yvoire assez persistante. Carbonation agréable.
Arômes épicés et fruité, avec une torrefaction un peu caramel-café. Nez très complexe et balancé.
Bouche très longue, complexe et balancée. Epicée-fruitée, avec une suite en bouche plus amère. La torrefaction, café et le goût caramel donne du corps également. Lalcool est très bien intégré à la balance de la bière.
Exceptionnelle bière, longue et complexe.

A garrafa sofreu um acidente na hora de abrir... mas consegui salvar a maior parte da cerveja.

Apesar da abertura explosiva da garrafa (e talvez por causa disso), o aroma do doce e intenso de malte caramelizado se espalhou pelo ar. Um pouco frutado e um pouco floral também.

Formou um creme acastanhado bonito, que permaneceu como uma fina capa até o fim da degustação.

O líquido tem uma cor castanha ferruginosa bastante bonita que vale a pena apreciar. Lembra uma bebida licorosa e antiga.

Muito saborosa. Doce, intensa, álcool bastante presente, mas bem posicionado. Tem algo de nozes e outras castanhas no sabor.

O retrogosto é muito agradável e tem uma persistência considerável. Neste quesito é a melhor cerveja que já provei.

Vale para degustar mais vezes.

Comparison between 2014 and 2006 bottles from Systembolaget (numeric rating based on current 2014 beer). Pours dirty dark brown in the glass - the 2014 with a beige head that stays throughout the session - the 2006 totally without head. Appearance: 5/3. Aroma of 2014 is very discrete, some roasted notes, thats all. The 2006 has a more powerful aroma, mainly of yeast - not too attractive. Aroma: 5/5. The taste of the 2014 is fresh, full of roasted notes, some spices like licorice, and a little bitterness in the aftertaste. The 2006 has obviously lost its freshness but the licorice and fennel spices are there, also the yeast comes through, but hardly any bitterness. Taste: 7/4. On the palate the 2014 wins easily, being fresh and lively. The 2006 is smooth but dull. Palate: 5/2. Overall: 14/9. The 2006 is sold as a special case at Systembolaget, probably some boxes that were misplaced and found 8 years later and now sold at premium price: 5.2 euros a bottle. Its a beer well over its prime and not worth the price. The normal fresh Chimay displayes the qualities that made this the most popular trappist beer in the world, with its herbal fruity freshness. But theres a timelimit in this beer and 8 years is beyond that limit.

Ambrée
Arômes fruités et épicés
Amertume prononcée

La Chimay Bleue est la plus forte et la plus complexe des bières trappistes de l'abbaye de Notre Dame de Scourmont Elle offre un bouquet d'épices et un nez fruité, très caractéristique de la Chimay. En bouche, elle procure une longue amertume et traduit une torréfaction prononcée.
A l'origine, uniquement conçue pour Noël, elle est désormais brassée régulièrement depuis 1958. En grande bouteille, elle est appelée Chimay Grande Réserve.Cette bière est millésimée, elle demande donc à être vieillie quelques années.

Pours a murky brown-amber color with a quickly attenuating khaki head. Bubble gum, mincemeat, spicy nose. Pretty lively mouthfeel. Brown sugar, earthy notes, spicy Belgiany flavors. Poor for the price.

Hardly no head. Smell is lots of apricot and some banana. Nice smell! Taste is complex! Nice and quite much! Apricot is still in there, some banana as well. Hint of coffee and some crackers. Not very much carbon in. This was a 2006. Nice beer!

beautiful coffee cream head, and quite a lot of it, reddish (maybe a bit towards orange) colour, clear (if you dont mix the yeast from the bottle to the glass), fullbodied nicely caramel and a slight taste of roasted malts, a great trappist beer

Fantastisch bier, dat eigenlijk alleen maar echt tot zijn recht kan komen als het lang genoeg gerijpt heeft. 

Er zijn wel betere trappisten te krijgen als deze, maar dit heb je als Belgisch lierhebber standaard in huis.

Mag hoe dan ook niet bewaard worden in een koelkast.

Coloração marrom escura. Espuma bege fina e de média persistência. Aroma licoroso e maltado. Álcool bem evidente e agradável, bom corpo e alta carbonatação. Evidente malte torrado, com notas decidiras maduras (principalmente ameixa) e caramelo. Dulçor sem exagero. Não se percebe lúpulo. Retrogosto leve, persistente é agradável. Bela cerveja.
Pours brown with a grey head that disappears quickly. Taste is malty caramel, with a slightly alcoholic aftertaste. Good one to drink slowly, but not my fav abbey.
Malty taste with some alcohol backfire. Also some roastiness and spices. Flowery odor.
Bottle 33cl. Deep brown with a light brown top that fades quickly to a thin one. Aromas of sugar, caramel. Taste is sweet, little dry, with hints of bitterness and alcohol.

Bottle, tasted 100ml during Beer 2014 festival tasting. Served very lightly chilled, too warm for my liking, and this probably hart my rating of it
Pours dark reddish brown, with a very stable dense head that lasts well. Aroma is sweet and grainy, malt, very complex, some vanilla. Carbonation is soft and body is very full, creamy and rich. Taste is slightly sweet, without any sourness. Flavor is rich and complex, grains, malt, straw, savory-umami, aged cheese. Alcohol is present but not too strong (might be better if chilled slightly more). Taste and flavors are gentle and not assertive. Good - will be great when served in a proper temp and glass.

Bottiglia, colore ambrato carico con riflessi rossastri con un cappello di schiuma fine e persistente, laroma è molto carico, malto, frutta secca e spezie, al palato è morbida senza essere mai eccessiva nei sapori. Ottima birra

Flaska från systembolaget. Mörk mörk bärnsten, lite ljusbrunt skum som stannar kvar som en ring. Varm, blommig, lite söt. Mycket god. Har en liten touch av alkohol men inte allt som förväntas av 9%. Riktigt fin.

Aromat silnie słodowy oraz drożdzowy, w tle winny i brzoskwiniowy. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, piwo zmętnione, piana beżowa, obfita, ale z dość dużymi pecherzykami. W smaku także słodowo (ciemne słody), a ponadto brzoskwinia, nieco karmelu, lekka nuta suszonych śliwek. Wszystko bardzo zbalansowane, bez ostrej, kwaśnej nuty, która sie zdarza w tego rodzaju piwach. Alkohol wyczuwalny, ale także dobrze zbalansowany. Warka L14-354.

Ottimo equilibrio per questa birra, tra le migliori che abbia mai degustato. Risulta leggera al palato, di facile beva, ma contestualmente complessa nellaroma, armoniosa, giustamente densa, da meditazione

Aroma caramelizado e frutado. Coloração marrom, com boa carbonatação e boa formação de espuma (com pouca retenção da mesma). Sabor frutado e levemente adocicado/caramelizado. Ótima opção de trapista (dark strong ale).

750 ml bottle spilt 4 ways with family. 2013 vintage. Dark amber color, severed in a chalice. Aroma is yeasty and sweet, candy sugar, plums, raisins and Belgian yeast. Nice.
I had sampled this years before I knew anything about ratebeer. I really am wondering if the recipe or brewing process has changed on this after the higher production rate? Anyhow the brew is still very nice. Fruity, dark notes, caramelized sugar, burnt toffee, plenty of yeast. The yeast gives a full body and the carbonation has a smooth silky feel. Very light alcohol warming after the sip. Classic top notch Belgian.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2016 The big blue Chimay, their most notorious product. Yellowish beige, sticky head, medium thick, decreasing and opening but leaving islands of foam and a steady rim around the glass with pretty lacing; colour deep mahogany with wine-red hue, notably darker than Chimay Rouge but still transparent, clear but hazy after adding the deposit. Rich aroma - though less strong and more restrained than in its Rochefort or Westvleteren counterparts - consisting of fondant chocolate, candied dates, pears, port wine, brown candi sugar, some faint but nice wheaty sourishness, orange peel, marzipan, gingerbread, dry spices such as coriander, cinnamon, cloves or aniseed, brown bread, banana, aromatic brown rhum especially as the beer warms up, red wine. Taste of candied fruits (figs and dates), some dried banana, smooth and rich, deep dark caramel and chocolate maltiness, medium but somewhat sourish carbonation, something wheaty, clean yeastiness with lively spicy notes dancing on the tongue, dryish, bit starch-like and powdery, finish with drying carbonation, some elegant floral and herbal hops and booze, in the form of brandy-like, warming, long and dry alcohol, managing to stay just subtle enough to avoid becoming wry. Though often considered less authentic and too industrial compared with the smaller Belgian trappist brands, this is still a very big beer, which becomes all the more clear in the Grande Réserve version on 75 cl: this is one of Belgiums best provisional beers, with an amazing ageing capacity. I have bottles from different vintages in the cellar and am patiently waiting to open the first one reaching five years of age; earlier tastings of old Grande Reserves will stick with me forever, as they undergo a maderisation leading to an immensely complex ale, almost like old port wine. I have taken this into account while rating this - since there is no separate entry for Chimay Grande Réserve (as it is indeed simply the blue on 75 cl bottles). The true great trappist beers are a joy forever and a beacon of good taste in the Belgian beer landscape.

A great tast with good aroma. Easy to drink and great tast. No jast tast or so.
Bring in chock tast from the cigar i have to this beer. Little sweet that is good when smoking cigar
Een heerlijk biertje die ik iedereen kan aanraden lekker mondgevoel ziet er goed en smaakt lekker goed

Bottle. Brown reddish, beige head. Aroma yeast, bananas, taste likewise, leaves pleasant bitter-sweet palate. A good Trappist.

Não gosto de ficar flando sobre a cerveja, isso deveria ser desabilitado, seria mto melhor
Very dark but still slightly transparent. Nice floral in taste and smell with just the right roasty malt flavor at the end. Very good beer.

Donker fruitig fris aroma, mooie wolk-achtige schuimkraag. Prachtig smaak palet dat zich in de afdronk mooi langzaam maar fel ontwikkeld. Donker fruitig karakter met hinten van chocolade en port. Pracht bier.

Bottle, year 2014. Pours hazy dark amber to reddish brown with a big brown head that recedes into a thin layer of bubbles. Not much lacing here.
Nose of yeasty fruits, taste likewise, ripe, dried fruits, banana, watermelon, candy sugar, malts, some alcohol but it is rather well hidden. Taste is not as sweet as the red version, well balanced with a light to medium hoppy bitterness. Smooth, vinous, oily palate. Long bittersweet finish. Lovely.

0.33l bottle. Dark brown to black color with big browny foam that disappeared faster than I expected. Aroma of chestnut, wood and cooked caramel. Some alcohol can be tasted and very little bitterness. Little overrated, but maybe it just is not my cup of tea(glass of beer).

Bottle in a huge tulip glass. Pours dark copper with the creamiest head I have ever seen in a Belgian style ale. The creamy head coats the side of the glass like ocean foam on the beach. Very well balanced. Deep, dark chestnut flavor throughout the palate. Theres cooked caramel and spice in there. Overall, a classic.
330ml bottle at home. Amber with an off white head. Yeasty earthy aroma. Fruity caramel flavour, dates and raisins with an alcohol kick. Long dry finish. Very good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2014 Aroma: pan, banana, alcohol. Apariencia: marron, mucha espuma. Sabor: ligeramente dulce y ligeramente amargo a la vez. Paladar: cuerpo ligero, final un poco amargo. En general: buena, suave, pero pense que seria mejor realmente.
Fodaaaaa! Breja Top mão... Se alguém tem melhor mande aqui pra casa que eu dou a nota!!! E se alguém não concorda!!! Se morraaa!

Finally got around to trying this one. Pours dark brown/copper with a small, quickly vanishing tan head. Smells fruity, carmel, yeasty. Taste follows the nose and finishes off with an ever-so-slight alcohol bite. Mouthfeel is medium, carbonation is definitely there but not overwhelming. Pretty great beer.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 330ml bottle from the LCBO .Pours a bubbly tan head with opaque brown/red body. Aroma is yeast-dominant with present alcohol contrasted well with caramel and malty notes. Mouthfeel is heavy/ lively carbonation and a strong alcohol finish. Wood notes are subtle.
Botella 33cl. Cerveza de color marron oscuro con mucho cuerpo y buena espuma. Sabor contundente que llena la boca dejando regusto de madera. Cierto toque caramelizado. Buena cerveza.
Rated based on notes taken 15 Jul 2011 -- Classic Chimay, Malty, crisp and clean. Good brew.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2014 Its very sweet in the aroma, with a small note of caramel and delicate notes of strong alcohol. Its dark copper color, almost non-transparent, with small head. Its highly carbonated. In taste its sweet, with small notes of caramel and fruits. But mostly its very alcoholic, alcohol is definitely on the foreground, so strong it sear in the mouth. / heh and its completely different from the two years old bottle, which I found in poland. Its smooth, with non alcoholic taste. Its completely different.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 33cl flesje via AH Maastricht Alcoholpercentage van 9% Uitgeschonken in La Trappe glas Uiterlijk: donkerbruin met schuimkraag die mooi blijft zitten Aroma en smaak: caramel, rozijnen, zoetbitter Conclusie: smaakvol bier, bekende trappist natuurlijk ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2015 Wow, what a flavor explosion. Packed with licorice, acid and yeast and some flowers. Really well made trappist.
A great Beer to drink after a good meal or if you want a complex Beer for a quite cheat price. It's dark and complex with flavours that will stay in your mouth for a while.

Bottle ordered at Newsroom. Ridiculously expensive at this spot. Order somewhere else. Im not kidding. Deep plum color with minor lacing that I attribute to my own not good enough pour. First word that comes to mind is smooth. The best of the Chimay color wheel. Malty sweetness at the forefront without overdoing the biscuity taste of other varieties. Just a perfect balance.Hides the alcohol really well. Im a huge fan. This was number 300!

330 ml bottle. Hazy dark amber with tanned head. Smell is deep malty, alcohol, belgian yeast, sweet fruit snd dried fruit. Taste is sweet fruity, deep malty, semi sweet caramel with a dry herbal finish.
Corpo medio, aroma caramelo, mel, sabor lupulado e retrogosto caramelo, cor marrom com media turbidez
Bottle. Cloudy mahogany liquid. Tan head, full body, light carbonation. Creamy. Taste of caramel. Heavy richness, a bit hard to drink.
Dark brown with tan head aroma of Belgian yeasts, raisins, figs, earthy. Bitterness up front, dark dried fruits some spicyness. Boozey in the finish. Classic quad.

You can feel the liquor while drinking, but it is more like a warming sensation, not booze-like notes. Taste is malty with medium bitterness and quite delicate finish. Not a big fan of the belgian beers but this one goes down wothout a problem.

mouth: coffee, caramel/toffee, roasted malts, grain, bread, a tiny bit watery though
