Banana and cloves. This is a very smooth pouring beer with a huge off white head. The flavor was well balanced between the yeast, malt, and hops. This was a pleasure to drink a bit of history.

Aged 1 year. Aroma is very clean, parfumy. Some caramel notes. Pours dark brown with copper tones. Very subtle Belgian character with overpowering alcohol. Latest Chimay are not that good. Supposedly monks dont have money.
Pours a dark reddish/brown with a big off white head. Dark fruity aroma. taste matches smell, dark fruits some spice, a little alcohol. A really good ale would drink again.
Dark brown with a rich light brown cap. Rich taste with caramel bitterness, some sourness and sweetness, fruity yeast notes.
Bomber for 150th anniversary. Pours a dark amber color, white head. Aroma is malty, bunt sugar, toffee. Taste is malty, sweet, think body, just ok. Aftertaste is light, cleansing.

Buena espuma persistente,cuerpo medio, sabores a oporto, balanceada hacia la Malta.
Aroma perceptible
Pretty dark in color nice head 2 fingers disapates fast. Dark fruit and sour nose. Nice taste, rich traditional belgian with a malt and sour kick. Alcohol is definitely present.

Mørk brun med et off white skum, skummet la seg raskt som en tynn ring. Aroma av malt, sukker, moden frukt og gjær. Smaken følger aroma, men her er det plomme og aprikos som utmerker seg. Alkoholen er meget godt gjemt.

Dark brown color and rich head. Aroma has yeast, malt, plums and a bit sourness. Complex taste with elements of coffee, chocolate, raisins, roasted malt. First feeling is sweet but in the end there is a good sour aftertaste. Excellent one.
Cloudy dark brown ale with large head. Malty caramel, chocolate, and dark fruit aroma. Full body. Complex taste that is similar to the aromas. Aftertaste is long lasting and full

Bottle from Cedrics tavern. Pours dark, dark brown with a khaki head. Doesnt leave a lot of lacing in the glass. Has a big molasses and Belgian yeast thing on the nose. Lots of brown sugar and dark fruits on the tongue. Hides its alcohol well. Nice.

Bottle @ home. Pours with a dark red, almost brown colour, big long lasting white frothy head. Aroma is medium to heavy malty, with notes of fruit and chocolate, softly hoppy, medium yeasty. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, softly bitter, softly sour, very softly salty. Medium to heavy body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

Bottle to a Chimay glass. Aroma is sweet, light, yeasty. Pours a slighty hazy reddish-brown with minimal head. Taste is moderate deep fruit. Slight malt. Yeast in moderate doses. Medium thin mouthfeel. I believe I have liked this beer a lot more in the past. Pretty uninspiring here. Looking forward to trying it in Belgium in two months and may re-rate.

Bottle. Brown colour with ruby reflects. Dried plums, yeast, cherries, caramel in aroma. Taste: malty sweetness, caramel, chocolate, raisins. Some floral hints also. Pleasant warming after every sip. Brilliant.

Dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is fresh and slightly sweet. Taste is slightly sweet, strong grain flavour, notes of toffee and caramel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml body, pours brown with red tinges, medium tan head without much retention. Dark fruit, brown sugar, caramel. Similar taste with some spice and warming alcohol coming through. Great mouth feel.

Poured from 330mL bottle [best before end 2015]. Cloudy, copper brown with dissipating fizzy beige head, a bit of sediment at the bottom. Aroma of dark red fruit, raisin, caramel and toffee. Flavour comes through, but a little muted, minor alcohol taste, a little flat.
0,33 pullo ms Starilla. Pisuaarin lievä haju?! Hiivaa. Pistävämpi kuin Red. Alkoholi puskee läpi.

Bottle, bb 2019. Pours ruby/brown with a tan head. Brown sugar, raisins, wood, spices, caramel. Taste strangely reminds me if vanilla coke ( but in a good way i suppose). Sweet, fizzy carbonation, body feels thin after the full nose. Nice begian ale, but not that special really.

Very dark brown with foamy off-white head. Medium bodied at best, with soft carbonation. Less aroma than expected, even when warmed up. Tastes of malt and dried fruits, with a slightly metallic tang at the end. Little bit disappointed to be honest.

Bière brune aux reflets rouge-orangées, voilée dune multitude de particules, très bonne effervescence, et surmontée dun coussin de mousse brunâtre léger et mince. Arômes dominants de caramel/cassonade (ça fait un peu penser à du cola par moment), et de petits fruits foncés bien mûrs voire confits (raisin, cerise, prune, datte), avec un peu de pain grillé, et dautres odeurs sucrés plus subtils rappelant soit le bonbon aux fruits (réglisse rouge), ou la pâtisserie, le gâteau. On décèle quelques effluves épicés également, surtout de lanis. Très beau nez bien agréable, belle complexité, intensité adéquate. En bouche, pétillement élevée sur la langue, breuvage bien mousseux, onctuosité moyenne au palais. Au goût, pain grillé et pâtisserie, avec saveurs de caramel, cassonade et petits fruits foncés, mais cest moins sucré en bouche que ce que laissait présager le nez. On décèle une légère acidité rappelant presque les agrumes, lanis au goût est très subtil, et la finale apporte une amertume bien sentie sans goût houblonné particulier. Tout au long de la dégustation, lalcool est bien présent au goût, un peu trop selon moi. Lintégration des différentes saveurs me semble laisser un peu à désirer. On me semble également perdre un peu de complexité par rapport au nez. Il sagit dune très bonne bière néanmoins, mais un peu surévaluée selon moi
Pours dark brown with minimal white head. Aroma is mostly alcoholic with hints of caramel and dark fruits. Taste is alcohol at first but the longer you drink it it becomes sweeter and nicer. Amazing.
750ml ($16.99) very good beer. Definitely worth trying this out. Price is high but its a very decent beer but at the price it can still be beat. but if this is being served then drink up...

Aroma is sweet, of brown sugar, dates, and oak. Appears a hazy orangish-reddish-brown, with caramelish-white foam, but not much lace. Tastes of mildly bitter oak, sweet dates, and nearly hidden brown sugar, a little alcohol burn on the end. Palate is fizzy and light. Overall, a great bear, delicate yet interesting.
Excellent Belgian ale. Brown with sweet flavor and heavy carbonation. Caramel and chocolate taste. Fantastic beer. Will get again, but pricey.

Magnum datant de 2012 bu après un déménagement pendant une journée exceptionnellement collante et humide. Rafraîchissante? Pas vraiment, mais cest une excellente récompense après une dure labeur. Robe cuivrée aux reflets rougeâtres subtiles, une mousse beige domine la bière. Des notes de fruits rouges confits et de caramel explosent, cest clair quil y aura une certaine madérisation en bouche. Cest effectivement le cas, mais ce nest pas du tout négatif. Fruits rouges, toffee et chocolat samalgament pour donner un résultat cochon et goûteux, mais jamais lourd. Un classique toujours agréable à revisiter.

BOTTLE 33CL

Look: dark ruby cloudy, light beige medium head.
Aroma: rich dried fruit (plums, raisins), light toasty notes, winy.
Taste: dried fruit, red wine barrel, spicy alcohol, a tad peppery, the body is not as big as expected.

Bottle 33cl. Dark reddish brown with a light beige head. Dried fruit, jam and a bit of yest in the nose. The taste compliments the nose with some banana flavour. Medium length. One of my favorite trappist beers.

The aroma is faint and slightly floral. There are other smells lingering beneath that I cant identify. The appearance is dark brown and clear with a slight, consistent head. The taste is complex; there are so many different things going on. The palate is full bodied with a creamy texture and an almost perfect finish. Overall, this is one the greatest ales that I have ever had.
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Brussel. Aromas of bread, caramel, chocolate. Perfectly balanced. Great belgian strong ale.

Dark brown color...limited foam. Sweet dark fruit aromas and flavors. Caramel,cinnamon, plums...very sweet and long aftertaste.
Very nice beer.

(Flasche) Es hat eine braune bis rubinrote Farbe, ist leicht trüb mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist karamellig, mit etwas Pflaume, Blaubeere, Harz und eine kleine Note von Aceton. Der Geschmack ist mittel schwer, leicht alkoholisch, sonst wie das Aroma. Bittere gibt es nicht
330ml bottle from local shop in Changchun. Reddish brown with a thin head. Bready, yeasty aroma. Right amount of carbonation. Too east to drink for 9%. Lovely.

Aroma is lacking. Perhaps its the glass. Its being served in a glass more appropriate for a pilsner. Appearance is a nice dark brown, similar to some doppelbocks. Nice dark, albeit small head. Flavor is this beers strong suit. Nice dark fruit, Belgian yeast and spices. Very good beer. Drinks like a dubbel almost thats very strong.
Birra intensa e di gran classe. Fruttato, maltato e caramello le fanno di padrone, senza mai risultare stucchevoli. Decisamente la migliore tra le Chimay (senza nulla togliere alle altre).

Illata szinte előrevetíti, hogy nem fogunk csalódni benne: édeskés, élesztős aroma bontakozik ki, teret engedve némi aszalt gyümölcsös, datolyás jellegnek. Keserédes keretben pörkölt ízjegyek rajzolódnak ki vaníliás, dohányos beütéssel gazdagítva az összképet. Tulajdonképpen útjának minden egyes szakában előad magából valami különlegeset, alig győzzük befogadni az impulzusokat. Változatos ízvilágú, igazán különleges főzet, mely valóban nem érdemtelenül foglal el előkelő helyet a stílus képviselői között.

DATE REVIEWED: June 15, 2014... GLASSWARE: Chimay chalice... OCCASION: saluting the Spurs for knocking off LeBron--and celebrating fathers Day as well...APPEARANCE: ark chocolate purple body; one finger pale off-white head--creamy... AROMA: immediate floral yeasts pitch thee malts favorably; a wine/red grape insinuation--promising... PALATE: smooth, velvety dry as a pinot noir; soft aftertaste; warming but not overt--a body that is more than sippable, and one that demands immediate revisiting... TASTE: big yet palatable flavor, reminiscent of grape and dry wine tannins; malts are subdued, slightly toasted; well balanced... OVERALLL: a great nightcap to a great Fathers Day; 9% ABV never felt so good....

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Ive been looking forward to this one.
Pours chocolaty brown with a creamy almond-colored two-finger foam that thickly coats the sides of the glass. The aroma of flowery dough leaps from the glass and is followed with a taste of the same and an addition of a musky fruitiness. The medium body coats the inside of my mouth with a lively carbonation and a lasting bitterness that only invites me to have another swallow.
A delightful experience that should be shared. I almost feel as though I am doing this beer a disservice by drinking it without friends. I enjoy the yeast-iness of this as well as the light carbonation. The perfect balance of bitter and sweet keeps me reaching out for the glass.

Review according to BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18E). Bottle 33cl - batch L14-273. AROMA: malt sweet aroma and esters reminiscent of vanilla. no hop aroma. faint metallic aroma in the background. APPEARANCE: coppery-brown color with a large ivory head with good retention. clear. TASTE: sweet malty flavour with vanilla notes. no hop flavours. some solventy-like flavour present. low bitterness and dry finish. PALATE: high carbonation with no carbonic acid. smooth alcohol warmth. medium to medium-light body. OVERALL: a slight above-average bulk belgian strong ale.

The body has a beautiful deep dark brown colored body with dark ruby highlights and a slightly hazy body. The head builds up tall and thick with an abundance of small tiny, tight packed bubbles. It has a creamy off white color and good retention as it slowly settles down to a light thin covering. Lacing is very slick and minimal. The aroma has an intoxicating mix of sweet malt, earthy yeast and dark fruity esters. Ageing only adds more complexity and character and each sip will reveal different flavor notes. To start there is a nice lightly roasted, almost smoky malt with different layers of dark fruits that is revealed as it warms. Plums, figs, dates, dark and golden raisins are some fruits I noted and all is surrounded buy the presence of a pleasant warming port like alcohol. Its palate is full and well rounded with a smooth feel and mellow carbonation.
Clear brown, thick beige head. Aroma has yeast, brown sugar and dried fruit. Flavour is similar with fruity, warming alcohol. Thick and creamy finish.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Cloudy dark brown with large head. Malty caramel, chocolate, and dark fruit aroma. Full body. Complex taste that is similar to the aromas. Aftertaste is long lasting and full

Mild aroma. From from bottle into appropriate chimay tulip glass. Minimal off white head. Dark reddish brown colour. Smooth, malty almost chocolate taste with a very slight spicy "trappist" style flavour and perfect carbonation for this style of beer. Great beer!!
Schöne Farbe, prickelt fein auf der Zunge. Unglaublicher Abgang, sehr länger Geschmack nach Röstnoten. Malice grundnote, Frucht Bananen. Versteckt en Alkohol nicht.

(Drinking date: 15 June 2014) The beer is hazy dark brown with no foam on it. The beer smells really good. Aromas of bread, caramel, chocolate and ripe figs and plughms. The taste is also really good. Bitter and sweet. A slightly sweeter aftertaste. The body is a bit full, which is good. However, this beer has a bit too much carbonation for this kind of beer. Overall, this is a delicious beer. Not the best one in his kind, but still really good. Thats why I give it the total score of 4.0
Cerveja escura e muito saborosa. Com alto teor alcoólico, está cerveja é a mais interessante já experimentada.

Surprisingly light on the nose, but great on the tongue. Definite hints of dried fruits, kandi sugar, and a bit if a floral note. Been a long time since I had this, forgot how good it was. Excellent mouthfeel too, quite bubbly - almost sharp. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Deep brown color, creamy head. Aroma of fruity esters, dried fruits, caramel, yeasts. Taste is spicy, fruity, malty. Beer is full bodied, alcohol well hidden. Very good beer.
chocolate, caramel, coffee, brown, light brownish foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, long finish,

33 cl, 75 cl 2012, and Magnum 1.5 Lt vintage 2010, in chimay glass. Now reviewing from the common 33 cl. Pours a creamy and thick bubbly extremly light beige head, colour its dark mahogany brown with golden/ruby reflexes. Smells sweet malts, nuts, clove, spices, caramel, figs and bit chocolate, all bonded by a particular nice yeasts aroma. Taste is on that way: initially sweet, malty and nutty, a bit spiced, then turning to a deeper taste, with cloves, cocoa, dark fruits and the very smallest hint of bitter you can imagine (little licorice). Noel beer roots here (christmas!). Long, malty and perfectly sweet, very nice, finish; almost no hops at all here. The real deal with the blue is its smoothness, balance, drinkability and extremly well hidden alcohol. A really nice beer, the best Chimay product for sure
Fruity esters,banana mostly, with a combination of liquer and bread hints. malty taste most toffee and caramel, medium bodied and not so much bitternes

Transferred from BA review on 4-14-12 

Poured from 750 ml bottle into snifter 

Appearance  Pours a deep hazy brown color with hints of mahogany seen when held to the light. Upon pouring a one finger tan head is formed. The head fades with some swiftness to leave a nice amount lacing.

Smell  Dark fruits are heavy in the nose with nice prune, cherry, and raisin aromas. There is a yeasty, spicy, and malty aroma as well which meld nicely with the sweeter dark fruit aromas.

Taste- The taste starts out with a nice mix of dark bready malts and darker fruit flavors. These two tastes provide a very solid foundation with which the rest of the taste experience evolves from. More towards the middle the yeasty flavors detected in the nose come into fruition with some spice flavors coming into play as well. Toward the very end of the taste a lighter alcohol flavor develops along with a molasses flavor which when mixed with the bready malt and dark fruits leaves a rather satisfying aftertaste on the tongue.

Mouthfeel  The body is creamy and smooth. It coasts the tongue allowing all the flavors to really sit on the tongue to be experienced. The carbonation is on the medium side adding some tingling excitement on the tongue, but not too high to take away from the creaminess of the body. 

Overall  A fantastic abbey beer. Its renowned and a classic for a reason.
Pours dark amber with a foamy beige head. Malts and caramel, with some fruity overtones. I do get a hint of rose. Perfectly balanced, creamy pleasant medium body. Really great.

Dark brown bronze with a beige cream. Aroma is powerful, with toasted malt and black fruits, well accompanied by plums and berries. taste of malt, toffee and caramel together with ripe fruits and nuts.

Pours a reddish brown color with sediment and a khaki head. Yeast, sugar, dark fruit, caramel and malt aroma. Yeast, cherry, raisin, plum, fig, sugar, caramel, toast, light hop and sweet malt flavors. Medium body and lively carbonation. Sweet taste and a dark fruit, sweet malt and slight alcohol finish.
bubblegum, caramel, resin, brown, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish

Pours with a nice head and dark brown almost black. Fruity aroma, almost a little dark cherry. Tastes a little cherry, maybe a little plum. Complex taste of fruit, yeast, malt sweetness and warming alcohol finish.

Great beer. Strong from start to finish. Aroma is strong and has a great head. Strong malty taste

Very nice beer but it is just not my type. Good to drink in belgium especially brussels

Dark brown color, almost black with mild and persistent foam.

Smell of toast and sweet fruits, and the taste is very intense, highlighting the toast and relatively dry touch and some caramel malts rememberances. A great one!
Bottle bought at Delhaize Maxi Serbia.Pour it dark color with small whote head.Taste and aroma pf blackcurrant, cherry, caramel.Nice Trappist beer!
330ml bottle. Dark brown color with little off white head. Smell of fruit and figs. Taste of figs and plums, but hides the alcohol well. Great beer.

Une bière belge qui ma agréablement surpris!!!! Arôme et texture plutôt sirupeuse, cette quadruple est dun brun acajou et se boit très bien malgré son fort pourcentage dalcool (9%). Elle a un certain goût sucré et caramélisé qui la rend à la fois délicieuse et très complexe!!! __________________________________________________ Belgian beer that really surprised me!!!! With an aroma and a texture of sirup, this red brown quadrupel is very drinkable despite its strong level of alcohol (9%). It has a sweet and butterscotch taste that makes the Chimay gorgeous and very complex!!!

Bouteille de 330 ml achetée dans une SAQ. Dégustée le 14 mai 2014 (trappist glass). Bière brune foncée. Mousse beaucoup, col beige-crème très épais et persistant. Très effervescente, bulles moyennes. Légère odeur de champagnette, dalcool et de levure. Douce, très sucrée, peu amère. Savoureuse, gout de caramel, de céréales. Alcool bien présent (chaleur en amorce) mais pas gênant. Bien équilibrée, se boit bien. Très bonne, meilleure que la rouge mais pas autant que les Rochefort.
Bottle pour. Brown color with large brown head. Lightly roasted malt with a faint herbal hops. Thin syrupy body. Lightly roasted chocolaty taste. Finishes faintly bitter.

Bottle pour. Cloudy dark brown with large head. Malty caramel, chocolate, and dark fruit aroma. Full body. Complex taste that is similar to the aromas. Aftertaste is long lasting and very flavorful.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle. A hazy reddish brown with a large creamy light brown head. Malty sweet aroma with yeast, plums and toffee. Malty sweet flavour with notes of plum, raisin, licorice and a warming alcohol finish.

It was like cracking the lid off a fruit bowl. So much banana bread aromas wafting in your face. Mouthfeel had almost caramel syrup like quality. Very fruity taste with hints of raisin and caramel, it was very sweet with not a lot of bitterness. The bottle I bought was just far too big for this type of beer, I would try it again, just in a smaller bottle.
Bottle to glass. Dark brown/Deep Red color. Aroma of Blackcurran and caramel. Taste of Bread, caramel, plums and a little bit coffee. Feels carbonated.

Bottle. Pours A very deep Ruby/black colour

Aroma. Mainly of blackcurrant

Taste. Very strong dark fruit flavours, with hints of caramel and dark chocolate.

Overall. A very rich and decadent beer full of complex flavours, a true work of art.

Bottle, 330ml. Pours an almost opaque deep red . Tan head dissipates quickly, no lacing. Bready aroma with notes of vinegar, caramel, biscuit, raisins and blackcurrents, with a fair bit of alcohol presence. Medium-high carbonation. Taste of bread, honey, caramel, and some hop presence and bitterness on the back end, with smother over over smaller fruity, citrus and perhaps floral notes. Quite a complex one, this, with a fair degree of satisfying alcohol warmth.

Pours a caramel copper color with a sweet malt aroma. Taste is of molasses mixed with a slight roasted malt flavor. The sweet flavor trumps any other flavor and quickly dissipates after the swallow. An enjoyable beer that allows the alcohol flavor to be tasted but not overwhelmed.

Bottle to ChiMay goblet.
Aroma of raisins, Belgian yeast, cherry, and bready.
Dark reddish brown with a thick 2 cm creamy off-white head that reduces to 1/2 cm leaving no lacing. Taste is friuty, a little sour with malt, bread, plum and a alcohol. This is quite good.
Bottle. Reddish brown with almost no head. Aromas of yeast, raisin and plum. Taste is sweet, roasted malts and plum. A good beer.

Dark head, its recommended even on the bottle to be served at 10* C all flavors well balanced chocolate, caramel, toast

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Small bottle pours cloudy red brown with a finger of head. Nose is rich earthy fruity berry, dark bread, plum, grape. Taste is highly carbonated, fluffy, nutty berry cola, bready, red grape, plum. Finish is mildly bitter dark bready fruit and berries. Complex and tasty!

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2016 Bottle. Dark brown, nice carbonation. Large and lasting fizzy head. Inviting, deep aromas of caramel, chocolate and raisins, slight metal aroma, cinnamon, barley wine. A lot of components, but these are nicely balanced: it still smells like a beer should. Taste is full of carbonation, a very crisp Belgian dark style. Starts creamy and sweet, with chocolate and cinnamon notes, barley wine. Develops a deep sweet bitterness with a distinct oily sensation, with a small alcoholic punch towards the end. Hints of dark fruit, cherries. Aftertaste is light caramel, caramelized pears. Drink it slightly below room temperature: when too cold, the tastes fade significantly. --Currently (Nov. 2016) enjoying a Grande Reserve 2012 (75cl). Beer has developed vinous and madeira notes, has a more pronounced chocolate character, is a bit more rounded and robust. Excellent beer for a cellar as well.

Brauner Zucker und Feige in der Nase, allerdings etwas schwächer als vermutet. Tolle Farbe, schöne Kohlensäure, beständiger Schaum, fast wie Cola. Leicht alkoholisch am Gaumen, süßliche Banane, dunkle Früchte und wundervolle Kohlensäure. Sehr gut trinkbar, tolles Quad, geschmacklich leicht hinter den Erwartungen.
Pours a deep, chestnut brown, with a very subtle malty aroma. Wonderfully balanced taste, especially given the ABV.
Brown pour gusher when top popped. Floral brown sugar yeast aroma. Some caramel floral sweet yeast taste. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle from Bruges. A bit of a murky amber colour with a cream head. Plenty of flavour in this. Sherry, fruit cake, caramel and chocolate notes. A little pine too. Very easy to drink for the strength.
Good, the perfect belgian beer! Very famous everywhere! You have to try!

Bottle. Pours a beautiful dark amber with thick off-white head. Fresh, spicy aroma. Taste is also very spicy, roasted malts. Really pleasant carbonation in combination with the spices, lots of character. This is top-notch in my opinion, doesnt get much better.
one of my favourite beers! i dont love very much its aroma but really good taste! too dark!

Cloudy dark brown beer, with a big head, bit after a seconds it disappear. Citric, and caramel notes come together, with some ginger ones to. Strong body with a strong flavor with a nice bitterness, and a right balance with the alcohol level.
Bottle at home. Poured dark brown with off white head. Got a surprose from the fountain. Aroma is dried fruits and christmas cake. Taste is yeasty, malty. Alchohol is well disguised
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with nice tan head. Nose is spices and sweet dark fruit. Taste is sweet. Some alcohol burn. Very nice.

Poured from 150 cl bottle to tumbler. Champagne pop when cork is released. Pours deep amber, light brown small head that just stays there from its heavy carbonated full body. Aroma of flowers, candy, plum and raisin. The taste is big time complex. Sweet Belgian sugar, dark fruit, yeasty, pleasant bitterness which complements the alcohol thats slightly noticeable. Finishes sweet with notes of roasted malts and candy that lingers on the palate. Truly awesome stuff. Glad I treated myself to this!
Pours a nice dark brown with tan head. Dark fruits, cherry, fig, and some roasted malt character on the nose; all follow onto the palate. Full-bodied. Finishes with a roasty character.

Vintage 2011. Surprised us with 5 min gush/fountain. Creamy head, dark brown body, smell of Belgium candy. First sip lasts long, warms the mouth while I listen to rain pouring outside. A lovely choice when you have time to enjoy. 3 years of waiting took away a bit of its body, but still a treat. Candy, very carbonated, dried fruits. Cheers!
Very dark color, herbal and flowery notes combined with roasted malt on the aroma. Good hop/malt balancr. Very good strong ale and the best of the Chimay trappist beers.

Bottle.

A: Mahogany with purple and red around the edges. Fluffy offwhite head. A little lacing.

N: Toffee, clove, prune, raisin, esters, brown sugar. Biscuit and big malt. Yeasty and nutty. Jammy, too.

T: Sweet with some nutty bitterness.

M: Some alcohol burn. Creamy and medium-heavy. Pleasing level of carbonation.

O: A damn fine beer. A good sipper to pair with Stoofvles. Or put in there. Not as strong as others in its style, and I prefer St. Bernardus and Kaizer Blauw.

Drunk from 33cl bottle at Da Gino's in Brussels. Dark beer, slightly sweet in flavour.

Poured into Chimay tulip a deep brown with fairly thick slightly off white head. Head was lasting and with a thick lace. Aroma was malty, raisin, yeast and spice. Taste was raisin, malt and alcohol. There is a small hop presence. Balanced to the malt. Full bodied with a long malt finish. Slightly warming. Wonderful.
0,33cl. color marron oscuro, espuma beige. olor tostado, a pasas, ciruelas, caramelo, que se acentuan boca, con un leve toque amargo al final. un cerveza compleja, equilibrada, muy recomendable

@ Havregatan 150806. Flaska (330 ml) från Systembolaget. [ Vintage 2006 ]. Really fruity, dried fruits, notes of chocolate, soft carbonation (almost flat).
Bottle 330 ml from Vrutak, Zagreb. Pours dark brown with beige head. Malty, toffee sweet aroma. Sweet flavor, spices, alcohol in finish. Complex.

I blame Belgium for getting me into craft brews. I also thank the country for the same reasons. Smells of spices and dark fruit. Some spices and dark sweet fruit. Nothing overpowers the others. A slight smell of alcohol but well. Only issue is the price
Shared 33 cl bottle. Pours brown amber/brown with a small head that fades quickly. Aroma is malty with some yeast and light honey. Taste is sweet and malty with light yeast and hints of figs.

330ml bottle as part of a blind tasting. I have no idea why I didnt guess this given how much Ive had in the past! Pours reddish brown with pale / munich malt, dark fruits, candy sugar sweetness - more than I remember previously actually. Strong, delicious and very well-blended. A classic!

Pours hazy chestnut brown with a 1-finger bone-colored head. Aroma of nutty malt and candied fruit with a touch of earthy yeast. Body is medium-to-full, with a slight thickness. The finish is dry and very lightly astringent. Flavor of nutty malt mixed with earthy yeast and a tart, lightly fruity note.

Birra belga per eccellenza. Perfetta. Decisi sentori di chiodi di garofano e caramello. Perfettamente bilanciata. Nonostante lelevato grado alcolico mantiene una ottima beverinità. Una delle mie birre preferite.
cereal, hay, floral, red, brown, cloudy, minimal head, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter,

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2016 Keg at Andrew Ushers. Hazy ruby/brown body with a thin beige head that fades. No lacing. Aroma of walnut, tar, red apple and vanilla. Flavour of marzipan, cherries, cloudy cider and caramelised sugar. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Light fizz. Id had this in bottle many times and rated it 3.2, thinking this was an overrated beer. On keg though, I found this much more enjoyable and complex.

Vigorous off white 2" foam quickly dissipating w low lace. Hazy amber liquid. Moderately fragrant of bread and grains. Good balance and clean warm finish. Very drinkable beer.

A- Deep ruddy brown color with a massive, creamy head.

S- Yeasty, plum, cherry

T- Plum, raisin, yeast, candy sugar, slight hop bitterness.

M- Creamy, medium/full bodied.

D- Fairly drinkable. Not my favorite quad but I can see how people would love this.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 It pours very dark brown with some reddish texture. Long lasting and compact beige foam. Nose of pure sweetness: raisins, dry fruit, prunes. Very complex and tremendously good! Very balanced mouth: fruity, sweet. I think this bottle is not part of the best batch...it happened to me before with Chimay. The yeast is well hidden by the other notes and this is a plus which makes it a bit different from the other Trappists. So complex and good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured in a original Chimay glass from 33cl bottle. Nice dark brown coffee like colour with a medium head. Smells very Belgium trappist. The taste is quite sweet and trappist too and hidesthe alcohol level. For the lovers of Belgium trappist it is one of the best. For me it is a great overall.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance had a dark brown colored body with a massive three finger white head. The head must last for about a good four minutes before it died. Minimal spider web lacing speckled the sides and slid fairly quickly down the sides of the glass.
The smell had raisins and cherries with light pears and caramels in the background, slightly in a bready sort of way. The yeast is very subdued, but its there.
The taste takes all of the previously mentioned flavors and combined altogether in a sweet bready yet somewhat earthy sort of way.
The palate sat about a medium with nothing remotely close to having any sort of harshness on the tongue. As many times as Ive had this, this is probably the smoothest most Belgian beer on the market. It leaves a sweet sticky aftertaste and a slightly dry finish. Though at 9%, Id still say fairly sessionable.
Overall, this is a Belgian I like, probably because the yeast is tamed well. Nice dessert and night cap!
Brown pour with light tan head. Aroma is sweet with a musty finish. Taste is sweet with light caramel, bitterness and a champagne feel.

Pours a reddish brown with a thick two finger foamy tan head. Highly active carbonation. Sweet malty aroma. Nice, lightly sweet flavour. Just a hint of bitterness. Alcohol mouth feel. Nice lacing. Slightly slick texture. Very nice.

pours hazy reddish brown with a fluffy light tan head, which leaves quickly with little to no lacing. Aromas include caramel apples, apricot, bananas and some peppery undertones. Flavors include toffee, plums, cherries, and other dark fruits. Nice spicy mouthfeel, fizzy and a little dry. Those monks know how its done.

330ml bottle. Pours hazy deep amber. Aromas of floral, spices, dried apricot, caramel. Tastes of died apricot, toffee, a little spice some plum and cherry. Has a slight warming and finishes with malty sweetness and spice.

7-8 years old (2006 Vintage from 0.33 l bottle)
Appearance: Almost reddish brown, slightly cloudy.
Nose: Fresh yeast (directly from the open vat), coffee and some sour fruit. Hints of flowers and toast.
Taste & palate: Medium to rich, almost creamy texture, pleasant freshness / acidity. Rich maltiness but not overdone. Average to soft carbonation. Medium long aftertaste. All in all quite balanced, quite rich and with some freshness to it. The alcohol (9%) is also partly noticeable. 
Nice Trappist beer but not outstanding at this age.
Dark amber with an off white head - Good malt aroma - Good malt body with some dark fruits and some spicy notes - Good malt finish that lasts for some time - this was good
Une très grande bière ! Un must des trappistes. Belle couleur, belle mousse, complexité et équilibre proches de la perfection.
Bottle, pours a cloudy brown with a beige head. Tastes of caramel, yeast, and fruit. Has a bit of an alcohol aftertaste. Good beer.
750ml bottle pours a hazy brown color with a lot of head. Lots of subtle flavor. Some caramel. Very easy going.

Clear red/brown, cappuccino brown head average
Malts, chocolate, toffee, caramel, winey
Pleasantly light complex aroma
Winey, sweet with bitter ending
Nice aftertaste

God lukt. Fint skum. Jevn, mørk farge.
Litt tam. Dårlig munnfølelse. Stram ettersmak.

Out of a small bottle. 
Aroma is stout (but not like a stout... Just robust you know?) malty sweet. 
Appearance is very bubbly golden brown red. 
Taste is really quite weak. A little malty. Very dry. Sweet. A wheatiness on the finish. Really lacking. Yeah Im giving this 100 beer a 5 for taste. What of it? 
Palate is good. Smooth. Light. Easy drinking. Alcohol is hidden well. 

Overall this beer is good in every way except the one that perhaps matters most: taste. Very light. Truly lacking in taste. Solidly average.

But en petite bouteille de 330 ml. En versant dans un calice, on remarque la belle couleur brun brique du liquide assez opaque. La mousse de grosse bulle disparait graduellement pour laisser place à un petit voile de surface. Une belle effervescente remonte des bulles en surfaces. Au nez, les arômes de Candy, caramel et de girofles sont toutes en subtilité. En bouche, une petite pointe de piquant nous taquine la langue pour ensuite laisser place à une belle rondeur. Il y a un bel équilibre en lalcool, le côté sucré et une finale sèche.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 Kolor rubinowy. Piana jasnobeżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, bardzo obfita, wolno opada, ładnie znaczy szkło. W aromacie słodkie nuty, głównie karmel i owoce. W smaku natomiast na początku głównie wyczuwalna gorzka czekolada, brązowy cukier, potem paloność, kawa, z czasem pojawia się banan i lekko kwiatowe nuty. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty, choć piwo bardzo przyjemnie rozgrzewa przełyk. Odpowiednio zbalansowane. Wysokie wysycenie. Bardzo dobre belgijskie Ale.
buona birra, anche se fra le tre chimay colorate (gialla, rossa, blu) è quella che mi piace meno.
33cl bottle from abbatia.pt, pours dark with good white head, aroma is sweet, taste is caramel, roasted malts, full bodied with great finish great quad overall!

Bottle @ unibaren. Dark brown, big off white head, nice lacing. Aroma, malty, Belgian yeast, caramel, toffee, roasted notes, . Taste, malty, caramel, brown sugar, belgian yeast, bitter dark chocolate. Really nice bitter aftertaste. Slightly oily mouth feel. Girlfriend says it should come with a side of waffles.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2014 Bottle, 33cl. Pours cloudy, hazy, thick and brown color with moderate beige head. Aroma of candy sugar, sweet malt, caramel, clear notes of yeast of fruits. Taste is similar. Moderate-intense sweetness, quickly followed by fruits, light, and darker in a beautiful mixture. Spices in the middle. Dry, warming alcoholic and hobs finish. Good balance. Full bodied, oily texture, lively carbonation. Alcohol is present, without being too dominating.

Hazy dark amber pour with medium sized cream colored head. Aroma of malts, yeast, fruits and slightly floral. Taste of malts, yeast, caramel, faint candy apple, slightly spicy with a dry finish. Picked up a slight cherry taste as it warmed closer to room temp. Full bodied, higher carbonation, very good beer, flavors more pronounced as it warmed.
Donkerbruin, dikke beige schuimlaag. Ruikt fris, citrus. Smaakt super, beetje zoet, beetje bitter, toast. Erg lekker.

Of the Belgian style beers Ive tried, this is one of my favorites. Dark, dark brown color and tan head. Aroma is roasty malt and yeast. Taste is dried fruit, roasted grain, some yeast, some booze, a nice hops touch and a nice sweetness. Good stuff.
La seule chimay que japprécie pour linstant le caractère dune vrai bière dabbaye .
Flaska @ Cindirella. Choklad färgad. Ingen skumkrona. Doftar russin. God fruktig smak med en beska som rundar av.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Chimay Blue is black, its light brown foam is abundant, fine, creamy, and very persistent. It smells low metal because of the very lightly roasted and hopped malt I think. The palate is round, even a little fat: one feels a thin film deposited on the buccal walls. 
The final, strong intensity, is long, sweet and extremely rich. He first reveals leaked and spicy aromas, and concludes with a slight bitterness and an alcoholic note.

A bottle from 2012 served in a Chimay gobelet, poor choice for tasting but great for looking. Pours a dark brown with a medium beige head that persists for the duration of the glass and leave nice lacing. Nose is of candi sugar, dark fruits and bread. Taste is sweet and malty, offering some brown sugar flavors along with with some other sugars and fruits. Quad-ish but not quite there. Body is full, carbonation medium-high. Alcohol shows a little but its nothing disturbing. A classic although Im moving more and more away from beers that are sweet and heavy.

Pours out thick and brown, with a fair amount of head. Really quite amazing to look at. The smell hinted at some fruit, and a nice mellow flavour. The taste followed up, as everyone says, with fruit, berries, etc. Smooth and tasty

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 Quaint bottle, large frothy head. Stunted aroma unfortunately, but smells exactly like a trappist should: yeast and malt. Surprisingly easy to drink given the robust taste. Initially a very smooth, but strong combination of malt and yeast with some bubblegum, followed by a delectable bitterness fused with hops and alcohol. Quite good.

This beers beer became a trigger for me fits in Belgium beer. Honest shock ran when I drank for the first time. Delicious! The words came out with. The fundamentally different from the beer was drinking up to now, and it was found beer tastes as goods that he a thing like this in the complex flavor of the beer body is also very heavy and above all. It would drink to buy just just because good circulation.
Mooi donker bier met ruime schuimkraag. Drinkt fris weg, zonder te bittere nasmaak. Je proeft caramel en suiker. Kan dit bier zeker aanraden.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 33cl bottle. Klare orange braune Farbe, geringe weiße schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen roten Früchten, leicht oxidiert, karamellig. Geschmack karamellig, reifes Obst, rote Früchte, leicht holzig, oxidiert.

Bottle from the Jumbo in Gorinchem. The beer is dark brown and has a nice cream colored head which rich carbonation. In the aroma tones of caramel, sugar, prums and a little alcohol is noticable. In the taste tones of dark fruits and a nice bitterness. In the end the warming alcohol is noticable. The finish is warm and intense for a long time.

Bottle 33 cl.
Dark brown, red tinted, with a nice tan head. Aroma with pronounced yeast, earthy basement, and some caramel malts. Medium sweet, and a bit fruity. You sense the alcohol, its very warming, without it overwhelming the taste.

Dark brown, caramel colored beer with a creamy off-white head. high carbonation. Aroma and taste of caramel, banana and a slightly roasted malts. with a fine alcohol aftertaste. Very subtle for such a dark beer (they often get to roasted or fruity in my taste). Best of the Chimay range and one of the best drak beers ive tasted thus far.
Aroma of yeast, cherry, and alcohol. Fantastic taste of caramel, cherry, peppermint candy cane, and cola. Fresh aftertaste, well-balanced.

Everybody knows what it looks like. Everybody knows what it tastes like. Good beer. But the alcohol taste can be overpowering depending on what youve tasted before. The roast is pleasant though. But, when tasted, the fruity components were not as present as some comments may suggest.

Brune opaque, avec une mousse de grosses bulles couleur érable à la surface ; en nez, fruits confits (prunes, raisins), caramel, un peu de boisé. Les saveurs sont du même groupe, avec une carbonatation un brin forte, mais qui sert à alléger délicatement la bière. Réchauffante, complexe et copieuse, totalement délicieuse même, mais pas le grand cru que sa réputation laisse croire.

Bottle 330 ml. Pours red-brownish liquid, lovely creamy head, excellent lacing. Aroma of rape fruits, hints of banana, yeast. Taste: yeast, spices, plums, alcohol. Full body, oily texture, lively carbonation. This is an amazing beer.

Gushing from bottle. Cloudy red brown. Aroma dark fruit, prunes and alcohol. Tastes the same. Interesting and complex but not totally my thing. My mate Ja loves it....!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl bottle. Dark brown colour with big soon fading head. Sweet taste with some alcohol. Aromas are caramel, flowers and yeast. Reminds me of an Norwegian Christmas ale. Thumbs up for Chimay blue!
Belgian double fronting a clean caramel taste with a hidden 9% . Enjoy with some spicy salsa and possibly complex wings ( not just buffalo!)

Dark muddy brown, moderate off white head; very yeasty aroma, with some toasted malt; taste is sweet, malty, stewed plums, raisins and yeast; no bitterness; good, but slightly overrated in my opinion; slightly prefer the Red over the Blue over the White.
Semi sweet pleasant brew, tasting of cereal, faint caramel and toasty oats. There is a slight banana overtone, with a vanilla dash of awesomeness.
Very warm, full and round beer. Friends with Bernardus Prior 8 and Val Dieu Brune.

Pours brown with medium, disappearing head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, dried fruits, chocolate with some spiciness. Sweet. High carbonation and high body. Warming alcohol note. Very good, rich beer.
Nicely aromatic with a nice but hazy brown color. Highly carbonated to style with not to much body. Overly apparent alcohol in this 330ml bottle.

Bottle. Hazy brown with a thick tan head. Aroma is bready, floral and caramel. Taste follows suit and is also nutty with some dark fruit. Light vanilla notes show up as it warms. Medium mouthfeel and carb. Very nice.

Pours a nice and hazy brown body with a thick offwhite head. Nice fresh aroma with a very nice taste. The alcohol is a bit too appearent though...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2014 75 cl. champagne-flaske. 9 %. Dejlig mørk farve med højt brunt skum. Verdensklasse efter min mening. Perfekt start på vinterferien. 
Sommerferien juli 2014. Smagt den lille fætter på 0,33 l. Stadig lige fremragende

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Brown color, huge staying tan head. Full body, lively carbonation. Aroma is caramel, yeast, spices, strawberry. Taste is sweet, but not too sweet with slightly bitter and dry finish. Very well balanced.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2014 New rating, Chimay Blue 2014: Cloudy dark brown body, red hue, small off-white head. Aroma is dark fruit, berries, caramel, some alcohol and bubblegum. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Very very nice.
(Vrutak 0,33l bottle)

Old rating, Chimay Blue 2013: Dark brown color, big tan head. cereal, hay, medium sweetness, cloudy, average carbonation, long finish. 
6/4/7/4/14 Total: 3.5 
(March 18, 2014)
Traditionnel compagne de mes soirée arrosée la Chimay bleu est une bière qui doit se boire entre amis et pas seul!
Very yeasty and quite strong alcohol taste, warming and leaves a nice mouthfeel. Good beer but it didnt make me suprised or excited.

One of my favorite Trappist beers of late. Smooth aroma and flavor that lasts after you have finished the beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Most ratings beer that I have yet to have. Bottle from Giant Eagle. Pours a murky reddish brown with a tan head that quickly falls. Aroma of raisins, dark fruits, and big alcohol. Maybe some green apple. Sweet taste. Slightly chewy but not as thick as I anticipated. Tingly carbonation.

Small bottle, but what it lacks in size it makes up in great taste. Good foam on the edges of the glas. High alcohol rate but the fruity taste hides it really well.
One of my favorite beers.
Sweet caramel aroma. Medium cloudy brown, nice balance but a little sweet finish with great mouth feel.
Cerveza oscura con cuerpo, mucho sabor, es una cerveza fuerte, de graduación media, espuma tambien oscura y consistente.
It seems like st bernardus abt 12. So, a great beer. Smells caramel, strong e sweet same time.

Pours a rich black with faint orange highlights. Aroma is punchy yeasts & slightly biting, almost like a shrill white wine. Sharp flavour & surprisingly not as full or round as I was expecting. Damn good but the others in the canon of this beer type are more complex & rewarding. Id suggest this is over rated on this site.

Very dark amber beer. Smells like a mix of St-Bernardus and Rodenbach, The taste is more complex, definitely not as sour as Rodenbach. Yeast, roasted malt, some red fruit. Quite lively for a strong dark one. Long finish but alcohol starts to dominate there.

Pours a dark brown, a cola color. Decent head. The aroma is dark fruits, some spice, roasted malts. Very good. Taste is smooth, and well balanced. Not strong in the ABV. This is a good, classic beer to drink during the cold months.



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a dark brown. Smells like raisins and yeast. This has a big, dark, fruit flavors and sweet breaded malt. Great tasting ale.
Scent of caramel, berries, and coffee. Clear, dark, amber colour. Flavours of dark chocolate, dates, and coffee. Mild bitterness at the finish. Mild carbonation. Great to sip on!

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2014 11.2 oz bottle poured into a goblet. Immediately after pouring, theres a strong, aggressive yeasty and mildew aroma, but it fades quickly into a combinations that strong green grape and alcohol (reminds me a bit of a chardonnay). Some apple and peach undertones peak through as well as a very faint hint of banana. As the head recedes, the aroma of warm buttered (maybe even honeyed?) biscuits becomes prevalent. Its a murky, raisin colored beer with a light, off-white, fizzy head that has splotchy retention (a bit wells up on the sides, with a light collection smack dab in the middle). Its balanced well, about medium all around with regards to sweet, sour, and bitter - maybe a bit less on the sour. On the palate, the alcohol is present and noticeable, but theres also a pleasant toasted and astringent balance to keep the alcohol from dominating. Its a full and fatty body beer that finds a texture somewhere between oily and creamy. Theres a lot of carbonation, but its fairly dull - it comes out if you swish it; almost to the point of filling your mouth further. It finishes with a complex, non-offensive combination of floral, spicy (honey & clove come to mind), and alcohol which leaves a heavy coating on the mouth for the aftertaste which, after some time, manifests as an umami taste.
Favourite Beer , strong but not too strong , most digestive beer . You can drink it in winter or summer . Im used to drink it in restaurants in place of wines.

Good. But in a tasting with Westy 12 and Roche 10, this was easily in last place. Just not as deep notes as the others. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
floral and honey aromas. pour golden with a small head. taste medium plus sweet, and medium bitter. long bitter aftertaste
UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 Mooi donkerrood bier. Smaak heeft rook en caramel in zich. Niet erg bitter, ietwat zoet van smaak.
Fles 0,33l, donker robijnrood met een crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Geur brood en gedroogd fruit. Smaak is redelijk zoet met een klein bittertje dat in de afdronk weg valt.

Pours brown with a slightly off white 5. The aroma is fruity and some bread. The overall taste is good with dried sweet fruits, malts, with a bubble gum sweetness. Moderate carbonation and overall not too bad for a mass produced brew.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours dark brown with off white head. Aroma has yeast, dried fruit, plums. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, dried fruit, plums. Aftertaste is sweet, no alcohol present. Medium carbonation, soft.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A brown mahogany beer with a large beige head. Medium persistence. Aroma is fruity, spicy, alcohol and caramel. Nice balance between sweetness and bitterness. Medium start. Development a bit stronger. Full body. Medium texture. Warming beer ! Heavy sweet finish. Overall an excellent belgian strong ale. One of my favorite trappist beer !
Dark brown body with a medium beige head. Yeasty aroma with hints of brown sugar, dark fruits. Taste is quite sweet. Soft carbonation. Good beer.
Rozijnen met gebrande mout van de caramel en veel fruit. Heel volmondig, romig in zachte bitterheid.

0.33L bottle. Beautiful fluffy foam with bubbles. Old wood, old wood house aroma. Alcohol flavor disturbing at first, some toffee caramel candy and plum candy mix after this disturbing vodka flavor Remainds some damp basement. Anyway, ethanol taste is unpleasant.
Vähän Happoinen. Tosi hyvä muutaman oluen jälkeen. Väri on kohtuullinen. Eliittikisakokous ja pub pickwick.

Nice, dark brown colored beer with bread and light smoke aroma. At first tastes sweet but it soon becomes lightly bitter. It is also a bit salty. The body and texture are extraordinary. Carbonation is pretty soft. All in all i expected more.

330ml bottle poured into Chimay chalice. Appearance is dark brown and slightly ruby. An off-white head which quite quickly goes, leaving some foam. Aroma has lots going on. Dark fruit, brown sugar, raisins, yeasty/doughy, bit of banana. Taste is excellent- plums, raisin, molasses, yeast, spicy dark fruits, hints of stewed apple, banana in the finish. Quite a bit of carbonation, coats the palate really well. A superb ale.

Bottle pours dark brown into the glass with a white head that lasts just long enough. Aroma is of figs, raisins, banana and a little caramel hidden behind there. Taste is sweet, not too though which other trappistes I´ve tried tends to be. The body is medium, not light like it firsts seems to be, but the alcohol pulls it up a few notch. Good carbonation, makes this beer lively in the mouth. The Finish is a little too abrupt, and could have a few more notes too it than the short bitterness that is found there. All in all a decent Trappist, not more, not less.

33cl in a Trappist glass. 2012 Vintage. Pours a murky brown colour with a somewhat disappointing lack of head. Aroma is typical Trappist bready, yeasty and malty. The taste of the last one was almost all toffee. Very little suggestion of anything else. Previous bottles I have sampled have revealed a much more complex roundness with suggestions of banana and walnut along with the usual dried fruits. Maybe it wasnt stored properly.
Wonderful lightly sparkling & carbonated dark mahogony ale. Bitter sweet aromas & taste with some light fruit. Wine like texture & likewise slightly warming, excellent!

Shared 75 cl. bottle, poured to snifters showing a cloudy, mahogany color, with a modest layer of off white/light tan head foam that gradually reduced to a ring & film, leaving some spots & streaks of lacing. The nose was light yeast & spice, malt sweetness, some vinous character, and esters as grape & raisin. The taste was similar, with lively spritz to the carbonation, and light astringency & dryness to the finish. Alcohol presence was solid, but not necessarily warming. A fine, benchmark Belgian Dark.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with sizeable tan head. Fresh aroma with caramel and burnt notes. Very balanced taste with underlying sour flavours. The alcohol is there but again it is not obvious. Quite high carbonation.

22/01/2014 Bir&Fud Bottega, 330ml bottle (Vintage 2009). Bruna con riflessi mogano, intensa, schiuma beige media. Al naso sentori di zucchero di canna, mou, miele, frutta secca, datteri. In bocca lattacco è dolciastro, miele, caramello, non bilanciatissima e un po stucchevole alla lunga. Corpo medio-pieno, carbonazione media. Non la migliore delle trappiste.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 Pours a dark brown with a regular thick head. Aroma is sweet molasses, basement, earthy, dark stone fruit, hay, plum, buttery toffee. Taste is toffee and caramel, rich butter, extremely nutty, light brown sugar, plum, fig, clove, hay, roasted, toasted, and slight chocolate flavor. Overall a good beer, much different from what I remember. Still a fantastic beer, but not on the holy grail level I had earlier in my day.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a long lasting beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, raisin, caramel, belgian yeast, cloves, floral and some soy sauce. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter. Full bodied and quite fizzy.
Mahognifarge, uklar. Medium/lite skum, aroma av tørket frukt, rosiner, nøtter - portvin. Mye kullsyre, litt malt og alkoholsmak. Tørr ettersmak.
Poured into a Chimay chalice nice dark pour with a long lasting beige head. Typically delicious Belgian trappist brew
Dark red-brownish with a airy beige head. Well carbonated. Aroma of some red berries. Smooth full body. Taste is sweet.

Have had many, many times. Rating now from the bottle (obviously). Very dark cooper pour with a creamy beige foam. Has the quintessential funky dark Belgium flavors. Lots of medium-rich dark fruit. Dried blueberries, raspberries and blackberries. Wild thistle. Celery hearts. Aged heather. Overripe pomegranate. Tootsie rolls. Notes of dark mushrooms and truffles. Also lots of wild flowers and herbs. Very unique. An extraordinary and distinct beer. Certainly the best from Chimay and nearly the best of any proper Trappist brews!

Mellow beer. Great taste. Not too bitter. On the better side of beers. Definitely worth a try. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2014 Great beer. Fair aroma, low bitterness and a beautifull golden look. I liked it a very much
Fin mørk farge og fint skum. Lukter rosiner og frukt. Mild og fin smak. Nytes på Cardinal som vanlig

Aromas of fruits, raisins, sweetness, alcohol and sour. Poured a thick head dark copper with a tint of red. Taste of your typical Begian Ale that I have a tough time describing. You can taste the alcohol, some fruits and a sourness, with a slight bitterness on the end of the palate.
Bottle. Amber-brown pour, large beige head. Big raisin and yeast aromas. Flavour is raisins, plums and other dark fruits, and some yeast and bread notes. A tasty Belgian Strong Ale!

11oz bottle poured into tulip. Appearance is brown with yeast suspended in the active carbonation that builds to a two inch head before collapsing to a cap. Little lacing is left on the glass. Aroma is clove, dried fruit, pepper, caramel malt, sugar, and alcohol. Taste is sweet bready malt, sugar-topped raisins, clove, and booze. Medium-full body, active carbonation, creamy texture, and a dry, slightly bitter finish.

Pours a deep amber with a huge dense off white long lasting head. Aroma of raisins, plums, fruity esthers, caramel, brown sugar and light spicy phenols are present in the background. Flavors of raisin, plum, caramel, brown sugar and some spiciness on the finish. High carbonation give a full body feel but I feel it should be fuller. This is a dark rich complex beer but I was expecting a bit more for this beer being rated so high.
One of the most remarkable beers in the world. Great taste, with complex flavours. Awesome!

Bottle  Dark Reddish-Brown in colour. Very Fruity; dark fruits, raisins, plums, apples. Spicy; including cinnamon, peppery spice. Yeasty; lots of floaties and sediment. Malty; toasty bready malts, caramel, toffee, candy sugar, and quite a lot of chocolate. Well hopped. Quite dry. Fruity, spicy, yeasty, sweet beer with some bitterness in the finish. Warming alcohol well disguised. Terrific Beer!
Clean, crisp, yet layered; sweet, yet balanced; one of the best beers in the world for a reason

It pours a muddy brown with an off-white head. The aroma was toffee, caramel, raisins and I detected a slight spicy note from the yeast. When tasted the first thing that hits your tongue is carbonation in effect cleaning and preparing it for the wonderfully balanced flavours of malt, dried fruit, caramel, a slight spicy note with an alcohol glow. The entire effect was like a carbonated traditional fruit cake that left a beautifully balanced aftertaste combining bitterness and a light sticky feeling on the tongue from the sweetness.
Strong Trippel. A very tasty malty dark brown beer. Retains its head for an elegant consistent appearance. Highly recommended beer.

Maltyniess and citrusy earthy aromas come from this beer with its great cream brown head of tiny bubbles and its slightly cloudy redish brown color. A sweet malty nutty flavor come from this brew has a alcohol feel that pairs with the tasre perfectly. Its a medium bodied brew. A great beer.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2014 Dark brown/red pour. Initial taste is malty and fruit with a solid base of banana and fig. Smell is raisin and yeast. Medium bodied and strong. Body had strong fig and alcohol flavors.
From a bottle to glass. Dark brown with moderate head. Taste is malt and floral. Smooth full mouth feel. Too good to just sip. A very nice one.
Bomber split four ways. Deep brown with a bit of red. Dark fruit and sugar aromas. Really good.

Great brown/mahogany with off-white head. Prunes, cloves, dried fruits, candy sugar, sweet malts, toast. Taste is sweet, with just a touch of sour and bitterness. Great mouthfeel, creamy with almost chewy carbonation. Medium bodied. Complex, beautiful and still drinkable.

Dark, reddish brown colour, nice medium head. Very pleasant aroma, sweet and mild. This is probably the best beer when it comes to the feel, it really melts in your mouth and leaves wonderful feeling on the tongue. Also the taste in very good, sweet and with just right amount of the alcohol. Even though I didnt like the white (yellow) one and I wasnt impressed by the red one, this is probably the best beer to date I have tried. Really pleasant and enjoyable beer. Bottle.
UPDATED: MAY 26, 2014 Dark pour with huge head, aroma of malt, toffee, banana and caramel. Wonderful malty taste, with notes of dark fruits, caramel and red wine. Excellent
Dark brown body with a medium beige head. Aroma of brown sugar, prunes, plums raisins. Taste the same, sweet and warming. Lovely beer.
A personal favourite ! This beer is really a good brown trappist. Would totally recommend it.

Ijusbrun vätska med en pigg bubblande krona som sedan lägger sig till ett krämigt skum. Doften är söt och maltig. Tänk julmust. Smaken är fyllig och kraftfull med mycket maltsmak och sötma. Även smaken påminner något om julmust. Jag är ingen trappistfantast, men denna var god.

Couleur brune avec un col peu mousseux et résistant. Nez typique de levure belge dépices et de fruits. En bouche cest un mélange assez doux et épicé avec une finale de fruits grillée. Une bonne bière trappiste mais elle nest pas dans mes cordes!

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 Magnum Grande Réserve Vintage 2012 at home, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: brown beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: caramel, burned malts, sweet.
TASTE: caramel, sweet, fruity, port.

33cl bottle. Pours a very dark brown color with medium-sized beige head. Aroma is dominated by the yeast with a slight floral notes accompanied by a touch of banana and rich malt. Full bodied and malt forward. Just a bit of sweetness. Tastes a bit like figs. Damned good.

150 CL bottle, 2012 vintage. Pours a cloudy dark ruby/brown with a thick tan head that settles to a thin film. Aroma of yeast, spice, brown sugar, molasses, raisin/prune, dried fig & some alcohol with a touch of sourness. Flavor is all of the above. Warming alcohol in the finish. Excellent!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2016 Good head, nice amount of foam. Not a very strong smell. Rich taste. Cant place it, but its nice. Tastes like a dark beer should.

Edit: rated lower after supermarket-beer-tasting with Rik 13/8/16. Taste of this beer is rather neutral for a quadrupel.

750ml bottle. Dark brown with a foamy, long lasting light beige head. Aroma of toffee, alcohol, dried fruit and a light must and spice. Flavor is malty and slightly sweet with some spice and alcohol. Medium body with lively carbonation. Good beer, the sweetness subsides with age, great with a year or two on it.

33 cl bottle. Aroma: fruity and mulling spices. Appearance: dark brown, cloudy, thick white head. Taste: sweet, but not too sweet. Palate: creamy, full bodied, smooth. Overall: very nice strong ale, one of my favourites

Chestnut coloured with a reddish tinge. Full, slightly tanned head (very stable). Smell of red berries and complex malt with hints of chocolate and coffee. Full body with hidden bitterness. Very balanced and warming. At the end a bit alcoholic.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Poured into Chimay glass. Wonderful yeasty and fruity scent. Maybe some faint alcohol aromas as well. Poured a creamy head that dissipated quickly with some lacing in the glass. Plum colored with some haziness. Nice taste of malt and dark fruit with some mild bitter alcohol in the mouth. This beer improved as it warmed up in the glass. Superb.
Bottle. Brown with a large tan head. Aroma of malt and chocolate. Medium body with notes of chocolate, caramel, and dark fruit. Alcohol is not very noticeable with just a slight warming at the end.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a large off-white head. Deep hazy brown appearance. Malty, yeasty aroma with hints of brown sugar, dark fruits and cheese. Cheese?! Thats a first timer, did something go wrong in the Chimay brewery? The cheese is also prominent in the taste, even more than in the aroma. I quite like it, actually. The taste is also very yeasty with hints of dark fruits, chocolate and brown sugar. Full body and a oily texture. Funny beer.
Brown clouty nice yellow head. Candy alcohol in the aroma. Candy flower toffee alcohol in the aftertaste. High in carbon.

Dunkel braun mit zunächst sehr intensivem aber kurzlebigem Schaum. Schokolade, Alkohol und etwas Frucht im Aroma. Sehr süß, starke Kohlensäure. Mild. Gutes Bier, das an einen ebenfalls guten Wein erinnert. Ild

Bottle. The beer with the most ratings that I have yet to rate. Pours a dark amber body with a slight haziness under a one finger fizzy beige head that faded to a thin film. The nose is rather sweet with lots of dark fruits like plum and fig lime notes. A little alcohol, lots of caramel and candi sugar and a fairly heavy yeastiness. The flavor is fairly sweet as well with plenty of candi sugar and dark fruits. Some fairly noticeable alcohol, but its not overbearing. The carbonation level on this is a bit heavy and fizzy an thats a bit distracting. Maybe a bit lighter bodied than the other big Belgian Quads like Rochfort and Westy. Still a pretty damn decent beer after all these years though and really widely available, so thats nice.
Dark brown pour. Sugary and sweet aroma. Syrupy and brown sugar taste. Cinnamon notes. Interesting. Don't love it and don't hate it

Aroma amadeirado com notas de cravo. Aparência de cobre escuro, encorpada e com belo laço. Sabor complexo que mistura especiarias, cravo e frutas vermelhas. Amargor no paladar e algo de álcool. Geral, uma cerveja saborosa, forte e típica trapista.

33cl bottle @ home. Clear top hazy bottom, reddish brown color, medium lasting beige head. Aroma caramel, dark fruits, dark chocolate notes, bit rosty malt. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, slightly salty and umami. Medium body, dry, fizzy carbon, medium lasting bitter finish. This is a good beer, but worse than expected.

Honey, dark syrup, dark fruits, dark chocolate and some alcohol in the aroma. 
Clear deep red colour with a beige head that dissipates to quickly 
Sweet, fruity and alcoholic taste. 
Full body, creamy high carbonation 
Too sweet and alcoholic for me.

Aroma: varied fruits, banana?, toffee malts. Appearance: dark brown, almost black, medium thin head. Taste: quite sweet. Palate: heavy body, malty, light alcohol. Overall: extremely pleasant Belgium Strong Ale. Bottle from Wittich Weine, Switzerland.

Reviewed from notes on 05/27/10
Poured from bottle to New Belgium tulip.

So, yum. 

A: Foaming upon decapping, this beer always foams over. Its a deep, muddy mahogany color with little/no transluscency. Light brown, 1-2 finger whipped creamy cap on this one.

S: Sweet, light molasses, hin of sour apple and pear from yeast. Dates, figs. 

T: Sweetened Ruby port flavor up front is accented by tones of maple, walnut, fresh pecan, brown sugar. Imagine these traits to develop with time in bottle.

M: Medium-full body with light carbonation allows you to really chew on this sticky monster. Every flavor is revealed as the carbonation is subtle enough to help move along flavor, not overbear it.

D: Drinkability: my ability to drink this is high. This is a goddam delicious brew and I plan to purchase a 750ml as they have the bottle date on cork and then lay it down for a couple years. Of the other Chimays, this stands out for me.

Serving type: bottle

12-22-2010
Pours amber to brown in color. It has a nutty flavor with some hoppy bitterness.

750ml bottle from the state store 
Clear brown with a small beige head and light lacing. Aroma of caramel, dark fruity, nutty and earthy. Flavors of toasted malts, caramel and nutty 
Nice and smooth
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2013 Candi and fruit (apple, pear and banana). A bit thin, with some hop bitterness.
Pours dark amber with a decent head which quickly goes. Rich smell with tastes of dark fruit. Might have served it a bit cold.

Aroma: Red forrest fruits, dark dried fruit, hint of cheese, hint of caramel Appearance: Big bubble foam, slowly disappearing deck, bit frothy, no yeast to be found, off white head, brown amber, red orange glow, quite sparkly, medium lacing Taste: Dried dark fruit, dates, caramel after taste, fizzy, little booze

Small bottle to wine glass. Pours deep amber with a nice light tan head. Aromas of dark fruit, spice, Belgian yeast esters, and a hint of booze. Flavor is so smooth and full of awesomeness. Loads of plum, candy, other dark fruits, and a warming finish. Wonderful
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Mooie bruine kleur maar zwak schuim. Disreet aroma. Volle moutige smaak met aangename zachte bitter. De top onder de bieren.
Poured from bottle, cellared for 18 months. Pours with nice cream head , retains well. Smooth flavor. One of my favorite styles of beers and one of my favorite beers.
Dark amber. in aroma everything you expect from Belgian beer - fruits, malt and some chocolate. Tastes the same - little bit sweet, but still hints of fruits and dark chocolate in it.

Trapista quadrupel, cor ocre com boa formação de espuma nao muito persistente. Aromas diversos, com destaque para o malte. Muito boa.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown/amber color , medium off white head. Aroma of fruits, chocolate ,malt. Complex fruity,yeasty taste with chocolate notes. Full bodied, warming. Great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Kolor solidnie zaparzonej herby, piana dość szybko opada, zapach drożdżowo- owocowy, wysycenie nie za wysokie. Bardzo pijalne. W smaku owocowość, lekko winne posmaki, troszkę paloności. Polecam :).
Dark brown colour. Aroma is yeasty and floral. Taste is complex: fruity, yeasty, sugary, chocolate, cookies. Finishes with a subtle bitterness. A Classic!

Smells like a nice beer. Non homogenous appearance throughout. Darker in the middle. Taste is complex. Multiple tastes required to put words to this delicate beauty. Palate similarly complex. I found this beer in a 750 mL bottle at my local Costco. Good beer to give as a gift for sharing and celebration. Would not drink a whole bottle in one sitting myself.

Sampled side by side by side with the other chimays. Brownish purpish pour with ample khaki head. the alcohol is the most evident of the group, and is honestly not that enjoyable fresh. Raisin and plum and fig with the same biscuity floral yeast. I think this is my favorite if it is aged, but fresh, I prefer the dubbel. It is better than the 150 anniversary though.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 75cl. Thick, creamy, yeasty, full-bodied beer. One of the best strong ales out there. This time I had a bottle of June 13 - red sugary grapes were prevalent in the taste. Still cant decide if which Chimay is I like the most.

More creamy than bottle (justified by extra gas form tap?). Worth it!

I was really looking forwar for this one. The appearance is hazy brown/amber. Very high carbonation, the taste is well balanced really malty with just the right amount of hopps. The body is full, you get a warm feeling in your throat from the alcohol but cannot see it before. Great beer.

330ml bottle. Pours beautifully. A hazy dark garnet, with a good sized head of creamy light nut coloured bubbles. The nose has an almost grape candy note up front, with alcohol, light cinnamon, yeast, a light woody note, and faint strawberry jam. Flavourful with, fruity, earthy, mineral notes up front that lead into brown sugar, dried fruits, and a bitter finish that mingles with some molasses, spices, and nutty notes. Great carbonation, light bodied, super flavourful, and terribly easing drinking at 9%. This is one classy beer.

Nice 3/4" head. Light chocolate colour. Good carbonation. Easy to sting with a nice hop balance. No lingering aftertaste which may be quite deceiving considering the beer is 9%abv. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown-to-ochre colour. NIce two-finger head. Assertive malty aroma. Strong, dark fruits (figs, some raisin). Taste is dark fruits, lively belgian smallhops, some yeasty cookie-goodness in the finish. Slight biterness in the late finish. Palate is silky smooth.

Fresh 2013 batch. Typical Belgian hops aroma, amazing white thick head. Amber red color and lively carbonation. Strong, but not boozy. The 9% voltage is very well hidden. A bit boring though. Some flowery hops and malt. The finish is indistinct.

Bottle poured a cloudy rich brown hue w/ a medium creamy tan head w/ a remaining cap and nice lacing. Moderate sweet fig aroma. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a light bitter finish. Tastes are fig, brown sugar, light roasted malt, dark bread, and candy caramel. Big body, creamy mouthfeel, and a warm finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Compared to abbey quadrupels it seems to have quite a "flat" taste. This doesnt mean this is a lesser beer. This is balanced to perfection.
Golden standard for every everyone to work off of. What else do you say? Great look balance flavor!

Bottle from 2012. Aroma: raisin, some prune, candi sugar, some bitter alcohol feel. When warmed, shows aroma of bread. Brown colour. Light sweetness, light bitterness. Carbonation is higher than average. A good example of the style, although I dont find it an exceptional beer.

I dont know why all the dislikes on this beer ....In my opinion this beer is EEEEEEpic!!!!
Nice typical trappist smell fruity and floral!

feels like a sweet beer but the magic happens when you feel the perfect balance between ingredients. not too sweet just charming on a cold day the malt taste is really present with a delicious hop/biter aftertaste
this really holds up nice in mouth!!! have it a try

God trappistøl med en mild ettersmak og god balansert smak. Ambefalles i lag med mat (biff elns)

This is quite a strong beer. It is almost like theres some pure extra alcohol added, and its not very nice thing. Also theres too much bitterness for me. Otherwise this is good, of course, with much sugary aromas, but without too much sugary feel.

Feinporiger Schaum mit guter Standfestigkeit. Dunkel braune Farbe. Würzig im antrunk. Oberligen säure im Abgang. Meiner Frau gefällt es.

Een lekker bier van een diep donkere kleur en een medium schuimkraag. Bier heeft een volle smaak
