Great Beer for import lovers. Great taste without the wierd after taste. A little on the expensive side.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 I tried yesterday the blue Chimay... I was a bit disappointed...
I found it good without a special taste....
Dark brown with a thin head. Malty sweetness with that begian yeast taste. Awesome beer that only gets better as it warms up.

This is a great ale. It has a deep, dark rich color with an nice head. It is medium to full bodied, with a very pleasant malt aroma, and the taste is superb, with a deep, rich calamelized malt. The malt is very nicely balanced with hops. Overall, a very good ale.

Det här är en gammal omtyckt klassiker som jag, av okänd anledning, inte tickat än. Smaken är härligt kraftfull med toner av belgisk jästkultur, farinsocker och krydda. Balansen på ölen var bra men om man låter den stå ett år så blir balansen fantastisk.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Smells like raisins, apple and other fruits, hints of yeast. Dark brown with big light tan head. Very sweet, noticable caramel, very smooth, alcohol is really well hidden, but still noticable. Sweet aftertaste with some metallic hints. Lively carbonation. Overall: great beer, but the sweetness dominates too much for me to like it. 7-5-8-5-11:3.6

0,33L bottle, 2006 vintage. Pours dark brown with off white head. The head stays for a second. Aroma is sweet dark fruits, plums, raisins, and alcohol. Flavor is sweet, dark fruits, plums, apples, yeast. Overall: aged version is a lot better.
Real smooth light head and carbonation. Bottle amsterdam dark red autumm brown. Fruity sweet really smooth for a strong beer. Creamy and suprisingly easy. Very enjoyable at any time

Slightly muddy dark pour with medium tan head. Dark malts and burnt sugar, sweet raisins and a little bit of booze. The smell is not in your face though. Taste is malty and slightly sweet. Dark fruits, raisins / plums and caramel. Very nice. Creamy mouthfeel with the right amount of CO2. Very good trappist.

750 ml bottle into signature chalice, bottled in 4/2013. Pours moderately hazy deep ruby red color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big pear, apple, raisin, plum, pepper, clove, banana, caramel, candi sugar, toast, brown bread, floral, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast ester and malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, pear, apple, light banana, caramel, candi sugar, toast, brown bread, clove, pepper, floral, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of light/dark fruits, light banana, clove, pepper, caramel, candi sugar, toast, brown bread, floral, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity of malt and fruity/spicy yeast flavors; with a great crisp malt/fruity/spicy flavor balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a lightly slick, crisp, and moderately prickly mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent Belgian dark ale. All around great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and malt flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

From 750 ml bottle. Pours very dark brown with a light tan head full of uniform, long lasting bubbles. Aroma of raisins, dark fruits, yeast, and slightly of nuts. Taste of the same, with the warmth of alcohol, but not as strong tasting as other beers with same ABV. Palate is not as smooth as I would like. It is a bit more fizzy than I would have expected. Pleasant finish and aftertaste that is slightly sweet. Overall excellent. One of the best beers I have had.

Brune avec une teinte rougeâtre et trouble, collet épais crème. Nez de levure, petits fruits et de malt. Goût sucré, de caramel, dalcool et quelque chose de terreux. Légère amertume à la toute fin, mais à peine perceptible.

330ml bottle into a goblet.

Pours a slightly hazy very dark ruby brown with a frothy two finger tan head. The head sticks around for a very long time leaving huge globs of lacing once it finally does fade.

Aroma is chock full of grapes and plums along with licorice. A whiff of alcohol along with some spicy yeast notes. Some woody notes in there as well. The aroma doesnt smack me in the face like i was hoping but it is very nice and complex.

The flavor is really heavy on sweet molassas, toffee, dark grapes and plums. Some wood and a fairly hefty dose of alcohol. Thankfully the sweetness tends to fade and does not dominate the taste and mouthfeel. More alcohol is detectable while cold but as the beer warms, more complexities begin to emerge with the wood and dark fruits. Silky smooth and slightly sticky mouthfeel but the sweetness is restrained.

Overall, a very good and accessable quad. While it may not have quite the complexity of some others, it stacks up well and is a favorite of mine that is nice to revisit every now and then.

Raisin, roasted malt, nuts aromas. Dark plum flavor, crispy malt, honey, herbs, peppery bitter finish. Can clearly feel the alcohol, has a kind of whiskey ending, not my favorite Belgian strong but a very solid one.
Together with Schneider Aventinus (which actually is more similar than one would think), simply the best!

Dark opaque brown pour with massive, bubbly light tan head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, alcohol, and earth tones. Taste couples the aroma, increasing in complexity as it warms. Nice yeast, spice, cherries and dark fruit notes. Boozy and warm. Lively carbonation, medium bodied, slick. Terrific beer.
Dark amber color. High long lasting sticky head. Aroma of fruits and malt. Lovely bitterness of malty beer.

Une des bonnes bières importées disponibles au Québec, la Chimay bleue est de couleur brune, quelque peu sucrée et plutôt pétillante. Son nez ne va pas battre des records dintensité, mais est très agréable : raisins secs et autres fruits brunis me viennent en tête. En bouche, cest un peu trop sucré pour conquérir mon coeur, mais ça se laisse boire très facilement. Elle cache son alcool plutôt bien pour une 9%.

Aroma is caramel, dark fruit and some alcohol. Pours dark raisin colour with fizzy lasting head. Taste is dark fruit again and roasted malt. VERY dry, left a lingering metallic taste that I wasnt too keen on. Decent.
Buen aroma pero sabor amargo que opaca el paladar. Se desimula el porcentaje de alcohol. Aparencia perfecta

The aroma is sweet with hints of cherries, with a pleasant dough aroma. It is a medium amber brown with a slightly tan head. It has a doughy, yeasty flavor at first with complex character. For a strong alcohol content, it is pleasant to the palate.
Bottle Dark amber,tan head, dissipates quickly. Aroma is malty, biscuit, spice, yeast. Taste is caramel, dried fruit, nicely complex. Full body. Warming alcohol. Excellent beer.

The only thing I can say about this beer is exactly what I said about La Trappe Quadrupel "Perfect. This beer is perfect. It has the exact right amount of carbonation, it is perfectly balanced, sweet, alcohol, bitter, dance in perfect harmony."

Hazy, dark brown colour with minimal head. Moderate aroma of yeast and dried fruits. Taste is complex with dried fruits (plum and cherry), woody note and yeastiness. Medium to high carbonation. Medium body. Average trappist beer, St. Bernardus is much, much better.
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 Grape,sweet, blue poppy seed- complex enjoyable body. Turbid caramel appearance.  Really enjoyed

Pours deep red with large head which reduces to nothing. Nose is caramel, red grapes, cherries, biscuit, maple syrup. light carbonation. Flavour is toffee, red wine, luscious full body. No watery lightness here. Alcohal is well balanced and integrated but it does give it a nice bitterness. This is lovely.
Pours with a great color and a smooth head. Smells great coming out of the bottle and taste even better. High alcohol content, but still has a full body.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 Ruikt heerlijk. Mooi troebel bruin, schuim wat dun. Smaakt pittig maar erg lekker. Beetje koud nog dus even wachten.

Augustus 2014: rating beetje aangepast, nog altijd erg lekker

Toast, coffee, herbs, chocolate, basement aromas, alcohol, rotten eggs, chocolate, bread

From a bomber with my brother during an October snowstorm in Reno... Nothing better to do than taste great beer. Pours dark brown with hefty head. Classic Belgian ale well balanced full of flavor, delicious !

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ampolla. 
Aparença: Cervesa ben transparent de color dambre fosc amb tocs marrons i vermells. Lescuma és persistent, de color beix clar, despessor variable.
Aroma: Olors complexes de fruites, plàtan. També trobem una nota dherbes i despècies. 
Sabor: El cos és important. Notes dolces de caramel, de plàtan i també de pera. 
Perfectament bevible, sense cap mena de resistència. No podem dir que sigui equilibrada perquè molt clarament, el perfil es decanta cap al malt i el ferment però tampoc es pot dir que el llúpol quedi ocultat.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl : Une de mes bières préférées, une magnifique robe brune avec la mousse qui va avec. Un nez complexe qui part dans le grillé, le caramélisé voire une petite touche de fruit rouge. On restrouve tout celà en bouche mais avec une fin de bouche à la banane et qui se termine doucement sur une pointe damertume houblonée.

Pours copper with a tan head. Aroma is caramel, rye bread, figs, raisins, orange zest. Taste is raisins, caramel, butterscotch, figs, honey. Very good.

Bière anciennement excellente, un peu moins caractéristique désormais, peut être victime de son succès. 
Cela reste une brune de très bonne facture, dun excellent rapport qualité/prix.

33cl bottle poured in a Chimay tulip at Aloe Cafe in Bora Bora. Very rich complex trappist ale. Only complaint is that it is perhaps a bit too sweet. I believe I had had this before but this is my first time rating. Will try again when Im in the US or preferably in Europe.
Pretty good, but not as full bodied and tasty and rich on aroma as the best trappist beers. Some nicely balanced dark fruits in the taste along with nice level of sweetness and great carbonization.

My favorite beer from the Chimay line. Very dark, but its light, fluffy body will surprise anyone expecting a stout. Flavors are cedar, chocolate, and nuts. Wonderful musty yeast strain gives it a great leathery taste/aroma. Best if aged a bit. My personal choice as the worlds most soothing, relaxing beer. Drink it at room temperature in a Chimay goblet in front of the fire. Magnificent.

bottle: color: brownish red, caramel, cloudy. aroma of caramel, dried fruits, bread, roasted chestnuts, liquorice, dark chocolate and hints of cheese. thin palate. tastes of coffee, liquorice, hints of smoke, well rounded, low carbonation. nice beer but i expected more.
Ølet er mørkebrunt, lukter friskt og typisk belgisk, og har en god, fyldig sødme. Smak av karamell og tørket frukt. Luftig, stort skum.
UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 2012 75cl. Nice aroma of dried fruits an hops. Strong taste, alcohol, hops and sweetness. Great beer, perfect for a chilly evening. --- Rated by Victor

Cor marrom, turva. Espuma cor creme, com boa formação. Aroma de malte tostado, passas, frutas negras, amadeirado. Sabor de malte, açúcar mascavo, cravo, amadeirado, médio dulçor, pouco amargor persistente ao final, um pouco adstringente no final.

Pours an opaque deep amber with a medium tan head. Aroma has earthy hops, slight roastiness, and subtle dark fruits without sweetness. Flavor follows suit...nice notes of fig, raisin, candi sugar without sweetness...good earthiness and slight leather. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with a slightly raisiny/figgy and earthy dry finish.
Very good beer. Intense aromas with predominant fresh yeast aroma. It tastes sweet and bitter well compensated. Really good!

Grande reserve 2010 (bought 2010?) from shop/Bar/gasstation north from Chimay center. Reddish dark brown with High thick head. Round malty sweet aroma. Full smooth taste.

Piękna prezencja, bardzo dobry zapach ciemnych słodów i drożdży, który mógłby być trochę mocniejszy. W smaku przeważają drożdże, karmel, niska goryczka, troszkę zbyt jednowymiarowe, spodziewałem się czegoś wybitnego, było tylko bardzo dobrze. Klasyka, ale wolę czerwonego od nich.
Good malty-yeasty flavour, brave aroma, a lasting dry aftertaste wich resembles oak mermelade.
This beer is alright tasting. I think that it gets better as you get further into it.

Andra gången jag springer på en gammal 03a. Även denna håller världsklass. Vällagrad och komplex. Plommon. Träffat flera som gnällt på just 03an. Gissar att det kan vara lite flaskvariation efter dessa år. Kul att man fick testa den här igen

Pours very fizzy into an off-white head of substance that quickly fizzes into nothingness. Color is dark brown - almost cola-like. Aroma is malt, yeast and darkfruits with an undergirding of booze. Very carbonated to taste with flavors of caramel malts, oak, prunes and dates. Some boozy bitterness to finish with a mildly fruity aftertaste. A very good beer but not all that it was cracked up to be. To be sure, I've enjoyed other Belgians more.

Dark amber color with nice beige head. Fruity aroma with spicy, malty and high alcoholic flavor. Dry malty finish with a bit of bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Bottle 0.33. Colour is dark brown, small head that disappeared almost instantly (badly washed glass?). Aroma smells of caramel and fruits of some kind. Sweet as well. Taste is rich, sweet with caramel and some detectable alcohol. A little bitterness to mix things up. (*rerated 12. oct - 2013. Added some points, because I liked it better this time, plain and simple.)

Pours dark brown with nice head. Nose is malty with dark fruits. Taste is dark fruits, tastes pretty strong with some alcohol warmth. A little bitterness to go along with the sweetness, earthy. Interesting and complex. Thick solid mouthfeel. Good overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2013 Pours a deep mahagony with creamy tan head. Head fades quickly. No lacing. Aromas of Carmel, malts and yeast. Big malt and caramel flavor up front lively carbonation and faintest bitterness on the back. Overall excellent beer.

Une belle couleur brune aux reflets ambrés. Des notes de pain frais et de caramel. En bouche une agréable touche caramelise et de noix et de noisettes. De légères touchés resineuses également tout au long de la présence en bouche. Précisons quelle est de 2007 donc 6 ans de bouteille.

I didnt get much of the aromas because there were a lot of others smells around but Id say there are fruity smells but theres another stronger smell that I cant identify/name.
it has a beautiful dark brown color, kind of orangy when the light hits it in certain ways. 
The taste is easy in the mouth, bitter at first, in a second time you taste all the aromas at once. Its very very good and surprising. Its like an explosion of aromas.
So it leaves you with very strong and diversified palate and very satisfied.
Dark brown&opaque in colour, a bit smokey&roastey taste with high carbonation. Best Chimay beer Ive had so far.

Pour ia dark brown with a beige fluffy head that dissapears quickly and little lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, spices, dark malts, yeast. Taste is very fruity, pears, cherries, tobaco, coriander, light caramel, warming alcohol, a bit sweet, fairly dry finish. medium-full body and average carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 Pours a hazy dark brown/red with a thin off-white head. Aroma of malts, yeast, caramel, raisins, brown sugar, sweet toffee, dark fruits. Prickly carbonation. Just a little step up from the excellent Dubbel. Quite nice.

750 ml bottle served in a tulip. Pours heavily murky reddish amber with thin off white head. Aroma is sweet figgy malt with notes of caramel, raisin, and grape. Taste is smooth dry lightly toasted malt with notes of fig, plum, and oak. Slightly bitter finish, quickly overwhelmed by sugary yeasty notes. Tastes like a dubbel, and strong for that style. One of the easier Trappist beers to find, good thing its worth it.

Visuel : brun fonce, petit col blanc
Aromes : Caramel et fruits rouges
Gout : Caramel, épices et prunes. Bien équilibré, corps imposant
General : Une très bonne bière de dégustation

Bottle at the cafe at the campsite in Spa. Chestnut brown, ruby red pour. Thin off-white cream head. Aroma is socks, caramel some raisin. Flavour is soft roast, caramel, dry finish. Some belgian yeast.

Not bad but not as exciting as I had hoped. It almost seemed like an amped up Dubbel. Bready malt notes with some sweetness for the aroma. Nice bread crust brown color with a small head. Good weighty palate with some creaminess. More bread and grain flavors with some caramelized malt flavors. Spices and alcohol were present on the finish. A nice Belgian you can find just about anywhere.

(Bottle): Pours a murky brown, foamy off white head. Aroma of yeast, dark fruit, spice, candy. Dark fruits, sweet cherries, brown sugar, yeast, malt, toffee notes all in the flavour. Well balanced and cant detect any taste of alcohol. Superb.
Söt och lättdrycken, lite kola lite fallfrukt. Noll beska. Alkoholen slår inte igenom. Hm, speciell dryck!

750ml bottle. Pours a reddish-brown with a tan head. High levels of carbonation. Aromas of prunes, apricots, brown sugar and honey. Tastes sweet with strong initial flavours of dried stone fruits, followed by an alcohol hit that makes this beer delicious to sip. Sweet with a nice bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2014 330ml brown short bottle, poured into a Chimay Trappist Glass. Pours cloudy dark brownish-red, with a small thick off-white head with good retention. Aroma of prunes, raisins, caramel and apricots. Flavours of prunes, raisings, apricots, dark muscovado sugar, herbs, spices and dark bread. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. A strong and complex beer that greatly benefits from aging, pleasant to sip.
Flot rødbrun farve. Sød let blomstret duft. En dejlig karamel smag, med hint af nødder og figner.

3 litre corkjed and caged bottle 2009 vintage poured a clear reddish amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of carmel, fruittiness, yeast and toffee. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, toffee, fruittiness, light spice and light yeast with a smooth lingering toffee finish.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2016 Bottle produced in 2012.
Appearance Pours a yellowish colour, but looks cherry red in the glass. A tan head of about 1/2 inches, which dissolves a tad too fast.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 Hazy nutty brown-red in colour with a fading roasted coloured head. No CO2 visible, lightly opaque. On the nose aromas of banana peel, leather, brown sugar, sweet honey, lightly roasted malt and barley dust as well as dried fruit such as plum develop. Light fizzy fading quickly away developing its light slick texture and full body. Rather sweet tasting of bread, malt, gingerbread and liquorice with some hinches of sourness and bitterness on the outer part of the palate. Very palatable with a finish developing a slick long lasting aftertaste.

33cl bottle poured into tulip. Cellar temp.

Overall: First time I have had this beer in a few years. I remember it being better, though this is still a fantastic beer. in the top half of the trappist beers. Good depth and complexity. Well balanced. 

Aroma: roasted malt, raisin, teasty

app: deep deep brown, pillowy tan head

taste: sweetness, but not too much.

palate: good body. relatively likely carbonation. Longer finish.

bouteille 750ml de brune. odeurs tres doux de sucre dorge et de petites notes dépices. en bouche gout de caramel petite acidité et peu damertume. tres bonne équilibre a reprendre. 9% alcool mais quand meme très doux

Bottle poured into a Chimay trappist glass. Appearance is a dark, brownish copper with a moderate tan head. Aroma is lots of rich malts, Belgian yeast, dark bread, plums, and raisins. Very complex and rich. Taste, which mirrors the nose, is as intense and complex as the aroma. Great all-around beer.

Bottle from Fakta, Hammel - Amber pour with healthy medium off white head. Rich dried fruit medley of berries, raisins, prunes, dates, with nutty notes, and with sweet caramel malts, brown sugar, toffee. Complex yet well balanced. Lovely.

2nd tasting - first evaluation: October 2011.
Aroma: Caramel and flower notes are hitting the nose first with the presence of licorice and anise. A strong and powerful malty nose. We can also find candy sugar and crystallized fruits. Un nez puissant aux déclinaisons de caramel et dépices sur une base éthérique. 
Visual: Hazy brown, no residue, beige rocky head with a good thickness and long lasting. Doesnt stick much on glass though.
Taste: Le caramel et les sucres remplissent la langue, accompagnés par une chaleur envahissante et bienfaisante. A warmful sensation is invading the tongue with caramel, malt sugars, crystallized fruits, anice and wild flowers. All that on a yeast basis with wild and etheric accents. Mouth feel is round, unctuous and sparkling; acting on all surface of the tongue. A very wide flavor palette. A perfect beer, well balanced and tasteful. Une bière parfaite, équilibrée, savoureuse, qui fait dire wow à chaque gorgée.

This beer tastes really good despite of the high alcohol content. High aroma Level, delicious caramel taste. 
I ordered this beer in a package on belgiantrappist.com (page is writtten in german, but ask him for shipping into US..)

Greats 
belgianlover
750ml bottle - pours ruby brown with small off white head. Yeast and sweet caramel aroma. Toffee sweetness is up front with a warm hit of alcohol. Medium palate with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle. Pours a dark murky brown with an off-white head. Aroma is yeasty, sticky sweet toffee, dark fruits. Medium body, medium fine carbonation, foamy. Candy, toffee sweetness, a touch medicinal, boozy, a little creamy, theres a touch of grassiness in there and dark fruits and nuts. A bit lighter and subtler than I was expecting and none the worse for that. Complex, well balance, booze well integrated. Nice.

Dark brown, modest head. Raisins, fruit, caramel. Alcohol and yeast both come through. Medium sweetness, As the most widely available Trappist beer worldwide, its one of the classics you can always fall back to after being adventurous. Always a pleasure.

Perfect quad. Perfect foamy head, perfect lacing, perfect raisins and meaty center. It's got legs. It's got harmony. It's inspiraiting.

Palate: Smooth light mouthfeel and texture, light/medium body, prickly carbonation, the finish is a lingering fruity sourness with alcohol warmth.

33cl bottle from the LCBO. Pours an opaque black/brown with a bunch of tan head that dissipates quickly. Smell is decently sweet, but not overbearing, with some caramel, biscuit, toastiness, and just a hint of dough. Palate is on the thicker side of medium bodied with aggressive carbonation. Taste is really nice, slightly sweet at first but then developing more complex flavours, starting with a bit of bitterness, some slight tart sweetness, and a more rounded spiciness. Aftertaste is slightly spicy, slightly sweet, and slightly bitter, with some alcohol heat. Really nice, one of my favourites to be sure.

The palate is medium-full bodied, has light carbonation, and a long finish. Overall, again its good (but definitely over hyped).
UPDATED: JAN 17, 2014 Dark chocolate brown. Aroma is sweet toffee, slightly malty. like a good bourbon. The taste is out of this bloody world: warming, sweet, fruity. Hard to better.

Simply the bar setter for Belgian Ales! It has a pretty murky brown pour with a thin tan head that doesnt leave much lacing but somehow scream complexity just in appearance. It was bery flat and did not encourage to have another sip.

Great beer. Ill be brewing a clone of this. Has esters of plums (reminds me of Dr pepper),a little roastiness, maltiness, and the alcohol melds in with all those flavors into a velvety mouth feel. As a real lover of dark Belgian beers (and generally more towards the quad end) I've always felt this fell a bit short, but upon finding a 3 year old bottle, I felt it was worth another shot. An impressive nose, that beautiful, signature dark fruit, but the alcohol is definitely there too. A lot more sweetness in the taste than in many of my favourites, caramel and spice on top of the expected cherry, plum, fig... Light and smooth mouth, but with a fair bit of fizz too (in my 3 year old bottle). Would recommend at this age and would be keen to try at 5 years and above too. Nice lacing. My money is still on the Abbaye de Rocs, Westvleteren 8 and Rochefort 8, which all carry a unique character that beats the anticipated 'all-roundedness' of Chimay. Still, it's far more readily available than the above and often the best beer available in many bottle shops.

I poured a 750ml bottle (dated 4/10) into the official Chimay chalice.

Appearance: Deep shade of burgundy/brown proper. Forms a small, dark beige, soapy head which eventually dissipates and doesnt lace the glass.

Smell: A veritable cornucopia of fruits, some spice, and confectionery sweetness.

Taste: When I first reviewed Chimay Blue in December of 2009 I liked it, but thought it was too intense and a bit overrated. Ive had a lot of experience with beer over the last three and a half years and was eager to try this vintage bottle from my cellar collection. Its amazing how my perspective on it has changed and also how well the beer itself has improved. 

What was intense and spastic is now smooth and refined, yet still plenty complex and robust. I think this palette is inherently drinker-friendly, it just needs some time to ensure a smoother delivery. I cant imagine not being amazed by these flavors. Sweet caramel and toffee flavors at the beginning with slight bitterness through the middle and a delicious rush of dark fruits to the finish line: plum, cherry, fig, raisin, red grape, etc. There is still a hint of alcohol which adds a subtle warmth and ties the flavors together like a Oriental rug to a living room. This is by far the best of the Belgian quads I have ever had and makes me appreciate the style much more now that Ive experienced a true vintage.

Drinkability: Ill admit that Chimay Blue and most of the bottle-conditioned Trappist beers are pretty intense when theyre fresh. After three years in the bottle, the carbonation has settled nicely. The mouthfeel is calm, on the thicker side, but not sticky or cloying. It goes down quite smoothly, though I was still getting some CO2 stuck in my throat even after all this time. The 9% ABV hasnt completely disappeared as theres a faint warmness, but it works well with the delivery this time. I was able to drink the entire 750ml bottle myself without any struggle.
Color caoba oscuro con espuma marfil. Aromas a caramelo y frutos rojos ácidos. En boca se muestra dulce, si bien el regusto es ligeramente ácido. Desde luego, mejor que la blue Standard.

There is no perfect beer or ale! But this one is close. A true gift of God made by his servants. Bought a 750ml for about $15. Worth every penny. The Blue is a real treat. Better to leave in the glass a few minutes and let it start to warm a bit to release all of its potential and some of the CO2. Smooth as silk and full mouth feel with a hint of the strong alcohol content. Add this one to your bucket list.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown, tan, frothy head. Fruity aroma, slight alcohol underlying. Very simple taste compared to other trappists. A bit nutty (perhaps almonds and hazelnut), and fruity.

Delicious Belgian. Perfect level of fruitiness without being overly sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
cloudy dark amber. Light head and lasts about a minute! Aromas of a floral /citrus nature. Light sweet taste with nicely blended sourness.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2013 Colour: Dark coffee.
Nose: Yeast, coffee, malt. Not really fragrant.
Flavours: Caramel, spiced coffee, sweet malt with a bitter finish.
Finish: Lingering.
Verdict: VERY well made Trappist - highly recommended.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2013 Reddish dark brown beer with a huge persistent beige head. The beer is clear at first but pouring in the yeast makes it hazy. Aroma has Belgian yeast and pear sourness with sweetness of ripe banana, dark sugar and little malts. Flavor is dark sugary, syrupy and licoricy sweet with little roastiness, little raisin fruitiness. Mouthfeel is thick and slick with medium carbonation. The finish is long with alcohol warming up but not tasting much. No much bitterness. Pouring the yeast in makes both the aroma and flavor a bit softer. The flavor actually benefits from it. A nice enjoyable beer but not the best dark trappist out there.

Pours up  deep brown with a huge creamy head.
Fruity scent telling me is going to be Belgian all the way. Bread yeast & malty caramel aroma is delicious
High carbonation distracts from the flavor for me but definitely a sweet floral strong ale. 
Overall the superior brew of the 3 Chimays.
Caramel, bread, toast, roasty, spruce, leather, clove, butterscotch, raisin, smoke, woody

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 A strange omission from my rates, I guess as I only rate beers after new samples and not from memories. This occasion was a young 33cl bottle from Waitrose. Im always a bit surprised how highly carbonated young Chimay is. Nice reddish brown colour, fizzy foam. Smells are fruity, fruit cake, raisin, yeasty spice. Soft palate. Slightly boozy. This is classic old school European booze, a refined claret standing in a world of stronger tasting New World products. Was it the best beer around 20 years ago? Yeah it was up there. Now? Less clear, but still a classic.

Re-rated a year old version picked up in Bignens Vins in Balexert. Still quite fizzy, but beautiful palate, fine bubbles. Fruity, estery, smooth. Lovely.
Complex aroma of dark fruit and spice. Flavors of berries, caramel, citrus, clove and white cake. Very well rounded beer.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2013 Pours hazy to muddy dark drown-reddish, superfast beige-tan top, long yeasty lacing. On nose - sweet malty, heavily yeasty, a bit toasted or roasted malty, creamy a bit, alcohol pungent when warmer. 
Taste is sweetish malty, yeasty with some bitter from darker malt and minimal from hops. Pungent, carbonated-spicy mouthfeel, seems medium bodied, a bit oily texture, minimal dry, floury a bit sweetish finish. Nice Belgian, could be more bodied, but otherwise enjoyable,

UPDATED: APR 2, 2015 Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a high, sticky, caramel head. Nose is brandy, fig, cheese, and the warm comfortable mustiness of a gentlemans study. Intensely warming with whisky-like notes of astonishing complexity -- lives up to the hype. Finish is smooth as the shaven head of a Trappist monk.

Fantastisk duft. Flot nøddebrun med cremet skum. Smagen er sød, stærk, frugtig, lettere vinøs og laaaang. Dejlig øl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Pours a dark brown brown with a small head. Caramel, dark fruit and nutty aroma. Taste - caramel, chocolate, bread, plums, raisins. Smooth and creamy with a long finish. Exceptional brew.

Pours an opaque, dark brown with a finger and a half of frothy, mocha head. A ton of carbonation with very little lacing. Aroma is caramel, spice, anise, alcohol, malt and grapes. A slight carbonation/sparkling wine note. Mouth is very complex. Hints of banana, yeast, roasted malt and alcohol. Dark fruits are very strong, mainly plum and red grapes. This beer was delicious.
muy buena cerveza. ya sea recien hecha o anejada. muy buena la experiencia del vertical tasting

Very complex flavors of banana, dark fruit, and cloves with a nice balance of sweetness and dryness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from LCBO.  Pours deep dark brown, with a thick beige head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is general "nice Belgian spice".  Taste is sweet caramel malts, with some nice spice.  Tasty.

Appearance was clear root beer with lasting tannish creamy 1 finger head, lacing abound. Aromas are sweet Carmel, pale, crystal malts with deep fruits. Esters of floral rosé-like with touch of alcohol and candi. Taste are deep fruits of raisin, date , fig, cherry candi sweetness with hints of spices. Palate was smooth soft creamy CO2 with full body, then deep fruity lasting glorious finish. Wonderful Belgian beauty.
A wonderful trappist. A full bodied, wonderfully malty beer. This is a must try for beer lovers everywhere.

Westmeisters Birthday Beer Tasting Extravaganza Beer #2.  Paired this up with some delicious barbecue.  Smelled of wine, grapes, and honey.  Poured the color of a reddish brown ale.  Not sure if that description is akin to using a root word to define another word.  Tasted sweet with a mildly bitter finish.  Excellent effervescence (alliteration is fun).  Bottle - Westmeisters House - Cumming, GA

33cl 2012 bottle (in past i drunk one very good 2008 reserve 4 years aged) dark brown/red color with fine head, strong aroma and taste, with roasted malt, caramel and liquor notes. But young beer is not good how much one aged bottle. 
At low temperature this beer is excessive and heavy, but at 12-14° temperature is good in body and taste.

330ml bottle. Dark murky mahogany pour with average head that leaves a blanket of lace. Lots of dark fruit and whisky on the nose with spice and black cherry. Sort of a rum fruit cake flavour dominates the palate with a solid spicy note. Theres something lacking in the taste and finish.
Close to perfection and one of the standards to measure all other beers. This is so well done, complex, and smooth that it feels like youre meeting an old friend when you drink it. Superb!
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text:
Spicy yeasty aroma, roastiness and malty.   Nice sweet and balanced flavor.   Heavy on the peppery side, slight notes of dried fruits, but overall peppery flavor wins out.  Getting more dark fruit flavor as it warms up and carbonation goes away

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had the red and white b4 and more then once yrs ago but see I didnt rate them. Well Blue: I got a good head off it,the beer on the left side looked red and right side like a bark brown. Smell it from open bottle at a distance as spice,yeast,fruity boosyness up front to nose beer smells of plum & gape. Taste is the heavier fruity(plummy,grape)higher % Belgum beer taste. If the 9% is ever felt its just a little small warmth. You do feel a bit buzzed from this. Well,I think I liked white & red better but not sure what one is better been to long. This is still good butnot great to me. Cheers,

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Large tan, bubbly head. Reddish brown body. I poured carefully, still the yeast is visible when held up to the light. Aroma of yeast, leather and wood. The alcohol is pretty camouflaged. Sweet taste. Rich and complex, but not at the same level as Rochefort 10. Aftertaste of metal.
33 cl bottle @2013. poured into chimay glass. little head,  no lacing maybe dirty glass?  sweet fruity aroma,  taste is sweet, fruity (plums) and bitter.
Appearance: brown/copper, hazy. Minimal head, tan foam. Taste: very bitter, lightly sour. Palate: full body, fizzy carbonation, creamy texture, bitter/long finish.

Aroma starts off very yeasty but as the head subsides becomes more floral and herbal.  Pours thick red-brown with a active thick head that dissipates quickly.  Tastes sweet with a long finish of berries.  Good active carbonation, thick meaty beer.

Pours a dark mahogany color with a thick head that fades to lacing. Aroma of fruit, losts of fruit, spices with some sweetness and hint of alcohol. Taste of fruit, some caramel sweetness and spice. Mild bitterness and a dry finish. Moderate body, smooth, well balanced and with a well hidden but warming alcohol feeling. This beer is quite complex as it seems to evolve as it warms. A good world class beer to relax with at the end of the day.

Aspetto ramato,opalescente,schiuma fine non particolarmente persistente,aromi fruttati (melone) e di frutta secca,gradevoli ma poco persistenti,poco fine e persistente al gusto,restano le note di malto e un po di alcool.
Grandemente sopravvalutata.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a thick off-white head. Aroma of fruit, plums. Flavour is sweet fruit, spices.
Smakar gulligt, lite fruktigt med liten beska. Lite sött också. Tydlig kolsyra. Lite sträv eftersmak. Mycket fin öl att dricka enstaka av.

330 mL bottle. Pours a dark mahogany with a thick soapy beige head.  Aromas of fruity malt, fig, prune, apple and bread, earthy, herbal hop. Highly carbonated with a full body, mildlly sweet and well balanced with both bitter hop and a sour bite. superb balance and flavor.

Floral, caramel, citrus, malt, and a lingering banana aftertaste. Yummy, nice alcohol content, does the trick time and time again, NEVER disappoints. I imagine people will be drinking Chimay for generations to come.
Deep brown pour, offwhite head. Citrus, melon and alot of candysugar in the nose. Taste is intensely sweet, with some bitterness. Actually loving it, was (for some reason) expected alot less.
Et godt fylding trapist øk.  Også kalt Chimay Blue.  Et godt øl som gjerne drikkes igjen.

4/27/13 @55° into goblet, bottle code L11-067 055257

Pours deep amber into nearly cola brown, nose is suprisingly animated, and just as simple, blueberry juice over blueberry syrup, taste folows with added dopplebock prune layers, simple and mildly sweet, some bitterness and carbonation to cut with watery herbal yeast notes, definitely easy to drink
Pours a nice brown amber beer with a good white head. Smells sweet. Fruity. I find this is a bit to sweet.

Pours a rich deep red, a thin head that reduces to a film. Aroma is of plum, rich dark fruits, liquorice, and spice. Tasting notes include huge black liquorice onslaught, dried fruits, yeast, spices, earthy malts, very dry finish. Not bad at all!

Belgian yeast, plum, other dark fruits in the nose. Looks beautiful, hazy brown with thick brownish, long-lasting head. Taste starts off with a a subtle sweetness, middle is slightly sour and finish gives you a long-lasting belgian yeast and caramel aftertaste. Medium bodied, heavy carbonation. Not clolyingly sweet and alcohol is well masked. Not the most complex belgium strong ale Ive had, but its lack of cloying sweetness and its subtle balance make this a good one.

Would I drink this again? Yes, if there was no real beer handy. Would I buy it again? Er, if there was no real beer on sale and I felt like a bit of clumsily-made, over sweet plum wine, with rough alcohol finish, then, yes, Id buy this crap.

Beautiful  dark amber color poured from a 1 pint, 9.4 oz. bottle dated 02/2012.  Pours a small amount of head that retains itself excellently. Smells of a lovely flowery aroma, slightly fruity.  First taste that hits is a quick hit of alcohol. Definitely a hint of clove. A pleasant sweetness follows that lingers on the tongue and the back of the mouth. Slightly bitter taste at the end followed by a double dosage of the alcohol.  Overall, possibly the greatest beer Ive ever had.

Chimay "blue" grande reserve....what can I say. Let me break this down for you; myself and my great herk had a blind tasting one night, pitting the Chimay grande reserve against other heavyweights Rochefort 10 and "The Saint" St. Bernardus Abt. 12. That?s right. You heard me. Not one, not two, but three of the world?s best beers, United, for quite possibly the first time in the history of the world, head to head to head, to determine the world champion. After much deliberation on both our parts, to our surprise the Chimay grande reserve emerged as the undisputed champion. Was it his pleasant aroma? Maybe. Was it the unmatched head retention? Sure, that might have had a little bit to do with it. In the end however, the richness and smooth body of this Belgian strong ale made it the undisputed champion of the world.

Pours a chestnut brown with a big foam head that slowly goes away.  Nose is complex.  Dark fruit, yeast, funk.  Taste has a fair amount of complexity, too.  Dark fruit/raisins, sugar, chewy bread and a little too much alcohol on the finish.  Enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Holy shiz this is a beast. Foamy dollop head with aroma of cinnamon chocolate and funk. Flavor is big bold and delicious. Smooth as ever with the faint alcohol burn. Deliciouso

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 23/4/2013
Dark red honey hazy color, lots of top at the beginning that dissipates after few minutes. Smells nice, little alcohol, ripe bananas, raisins but the taste is less then what the nose promises. Less sweet (bit watery) and surprisingly little alcohol for its strenght. Going to give this a notch higher score then Trappistes Rochefort 8, similar but this is more drinkable because of less strong alcoholic effect  and better appearance.
Re-rate14/12/2015.
Smells yeast, sweet yeast and its not ripe but raw bananas, wet raisins.
Tamed down taste, initial impressions still watery, murky, slight bitterness and some prunes,  even a hint of wood and ash. On the positive side, the alc. is very well hidden, a jasmine flavoured yeast beer.
Lowering the score only by 0,1 since letting this mature for several years, this can be more grandiouse.

Bottle, 33 cl. Dark copper color; nice, off-white, creamy and long lasting head. Low CO2, good lacing. Aroma is strongly malty and roasty: bread, caramel, cookies and black fruits. Body is moderate, carbonation is average to high; alcohol is nicely present. Finish is very well balanced, sweet, warm and alcoholic. Taste is sweet, warm: black fruits, smooth caramel and vanilla.

Pours deep dark rich brown. Complex nice aroma that is just like it taste. The is one of the best beers that i have ever consumed. It does not have the sickening sweet taste that alot of trappist beers have. Thank God for drunk monks. Very complex but smooth taste with just a slight bitterness at the end.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2013 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a dark brow, nearly black. Short 2cm head that lasted half the beer. Aroma is dark fruit almost savoury sweetness and a doughy bread yeast. Taste is very dark fruit, plum forward with a chewy bread aftertaste. Lingering booze warmth, inconspicuous 9%. Nice bit of bitterness has me reaching for more. Grew on me as I got closer to the bottom.

Brown, fluffy beige head.  Aroma of brown sugar, raisins, plumbs, light spice.  Flavor of dark bread crusts, raisins, toffee, plumbs, earthy spice, a little tobacco.  Carbonation gives a soft bready impression.

Pours a dark amber with a thin white head. Yeast, light citrus, and hints of cherry in the aroma. Really great and full on the palate. It has a very complex flavor, with plums, candy, and alcohol. One of few Trappist beers that is easy to find in the US, so definitely worth a try! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours dark brown medium tan head. Doughy yeasty aroma, citrus aroma. Medium sweet taste. Bit of a funky palate but good. Full body and smooth, low carbonation. Overall good.

Pours dark brown; almost black, but a little light comes through. Beautiful creamy pale-white head that hangs in there for a while.
Aroma is slightly yeasty with citrus notes. Flavor is predominantly sweet like reconstituted dried fruit: hints of plum, raisin, and booze.
Full bodied creamy brew that goes down smooth and lets you know you had a brew!
Very nice. I'll make love to another sometime!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home , from supermarket.  Profumo: prugna , pesche sciroppate, malti tostati e lievito tipo pasta di pane.  La casa dice di avere ottenuto un aroma fluoreale ma io non lho avvertito. La schiuma è color cappuccino, con una birra scura, color wengé.  Il gusto è più alcolico del previsto, che scalda piacevolmente il palato e si avvertono con maggiore insistenza i sapori del malto tostao, che ricorda un po il caffè dorzo in questa birra. Il sentore dolce è presente ma solo in sottofondo. Il corpo è pieno, la sedimentazione rende la birra pasotsa e stimola tutta la bocca durante la beva.  Finale lungo e dolciastro.
From a bomber. Pours opaque medium brown with a thin white head. Tastes like grapes, apples, pears, cider. Smells like apples, pears, spices. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours murky dark brown with average, creamy beige head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is cookie and caramel malts, figs, plums, Belgian yeast, candy sugar, floral hops, and some fresh dough. Flavor is sweet, bready malts forward with supporting dark fruit and berry esters, light floral hops, light yeast, and some candy sugar; dry finish. Medium/full body and low carbonation.

Bottle at home from drinkstore
Pours hazy cola brown with fluffy beige head and herbal, savoury malt nose. Rich, bready malt, fairly booze forward and spicy yeast esters. Long dry malt finish. Definitely a sipper
July 2010. From bottle. This is one of the most complex and balanced beers available. Pours redbrown with a tan head. Aromas of dried fruit, spices, chocolate. Worldclass beer.

Look: Dark brown body ruby hues, big soapy 3 finger head. Smell: Roasted malts, metalic, floral, some spices, candi sugar. Smells like a BSDA. Taste: Follows the aroma, spicy yeast, candi sugar, roasted nuts, flowery, slight tart apple, faint alcohol. Feel: Medium body on par carbonation. Overall: I have no problem drinking a 750ml bottle of this. This is balanced, not too yeasty and not too sweet. Even though I like my BSDA to be on the sweeter side, this one doesnt disappoint. Though it doesnt have a "wow factor" it still stands its own ground. This brew is Recommended.
Adult beer with a balanced taste. Not too sweet and nice to drink. No a trappist beer that takes you in a dream flight but one to enjoy.
Nice caramel and yeast nose. Dark fruit caramel and bread taste. Really,nice Belgium strong. 2012 special label.

[ASPETTO]

profumi zuccherosi, caramello, un tocco vinoso che si accompagna con un leggero fruttato,  sentori alcolici evidenti

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 Perfect example of Belgian strong ale. Divine aroma, smooth from beginning till the end. Alcohol is barely noticeable.
Donker trappisten biertje. Drinkt gemakkelijk weg maar is toch wel interessant genoeg. Ondanks het niet hele speciale karakter is het geheel wel erg lekker.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2013 Pours dark brown, ruby red with one finger head that rappidly decipates. Aroma of dark fruits, yeast, caramel. Taste has hints of bread, yeast, dark fruits, caramel, a little bit sweet. Very well balanced.

Ruby red beer with a creamy coloured foam. The foam is reducing on the beer as a blanket. The aroma is light fruity with herby aroma, the aroma and smell is not overwhelming. The taste is dry and smooth with good co2 saturation and a dry finish not a long bitter aftertaste but a mild small bitterness on the pallet .


---Rated By the Belleketels

Rich and murky brown with ruby highlights. Smells of bread, figs, sugars, and a bit of crisp fruit - maybe apple? Flavor is very full, opens up dramatically as it warms (I poured this one when it was way too cold so as to observe the changes). Bitterness fades as it warms and you get a very rich, complex and estery dark beer with a bit of heat to it at the end. I love this one a lot - definitely one of the top dark belgians out there.

Visserligen smakar legenden om Chimay en hel del redan innan flaskan öppnas. Som ett stenhårt paket på julafton är glädjen redan gjord innan omslagspapperet fallit. Här är tack och lov innehållet synkroniserat med förväntningarna och inga försök ska göras att sticka kniven i ryggen på sagan om Chimay.

Not my favorite of the Trappist beers. But still a very solid beer. A good one to kick back a watch the tourney with. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had this over 10 years ago in Belgium but never rated it so I thought it was time to try it again.  33cl bottle at BXL East.  Pours cloudy reddish brown with foamy, soapy tan head. Aroma is of raisins, prunes, dark cherries and other fruits. Taste is fresh and malty; sweet (caramel) at first but a bit of bitterness follows, which is really interesting. Incredible complexity and smoothness in the finish with an excellent mouthfeel. 9% ABV is well hidden in this beer.  Lives up to the hype.

Bottle pours a cloudy brown with a retentive tan head, good lacing. Some dark brown residue poured out of the bottom of the bottle and stuck on the head. Aromas of apple, sweet malt, caramel, alcohol, and pear. Very smooth taste, toffee, plum, and sweet yeast. A deliciously drinkable Belgian strong ale.

Nose is bread and dark fruits. Sweet sticky taste of figs, a touch of burns night toffee, and a warm alcohol burr. Slight apple acid tones, candy sugar and orange peel. Peppery finish. 

Palate is a little sticky and too carbonated for me. 

A very good beer but far from the best of its style.

Not the first time had, but first rated apparently. Bottle pops with removal of the cork. Pours deep mahogany amber capped by a thin tan head. Nose of burnt sugar and pitted fruit. This theme continues in the mouth with a sweet trending beer. Mouth is light to medium and a slight booze burn on the finish.
Beautiful trappist beer. Strong, dark, yeasty, complex, warming. Perfect. No complains.

This beer got me addicted to the trappist variety. It's worth the price and I like to get a pt a week at minimum. It rivals st bernardus and rochefort 10.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Espectacular aroma, y una presencia plena. Sabor suave pero  permanente, una gran trapista, qué repetiré sin dudar.
Just an amazing beer that I would always say yes to. Im actually a bit angry myself for not discovering this wonderful elixer earlier in life.

11.2 oz bottle: pours dark brown/ ruby red huge head continuous CO2. Aroma esters sour yeast plums caramel malt. Taste is balanced sweet slight bitter. Flavora of prune brown sugar malt balance. Smooth easy sipper hides alcohol well.

Overall a nice beer but the taste of the beer doesn't last very long. Yes sir!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle - aged for almost three years before consumption. Pours hazy dark red-brown, creamy sticky tiny head. Suntle notes of port/madeira, nuts, plums and liquorice. Mild and medium mouthfeel, taste of spices (cloves and nuttmeg, cinnamon), light bitter aftertaste. Special and holds well!

Single bottle into Chimay chalice.  Dark pour with a hint of a red hue.  Small off-white/tan head. Sweet nose.  Nice mouthfeel with notes of toffee and chocolate. Wonderful, slightly medicinal, boozy finish.  Favorite of the Chimay offerings.
UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörk vätska med kompakt högt skum. Dadlar, russin och bränt socker i doften. Sötma bestående av kola. Stor kropp utan inslag av alkoholdoft.

330ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with hints of red and a nice light tan head. Aroma is toffee, malt, spices, hints of chocolate, and dark fruit. Taste is caramel malt, figs, raisins, plums, cinnamon, chocolate, with yeasty overtones.

Pours deep brown with  a fair amount of head, but it doesnt hang around.  The aroma is a very sweet malt with notes of pears, cherry and spice.  The flavor is rich at first, those malty tones are big up front, but then the finish has a medicinal quality that becomes more prevalent as it warms.  The hoppy tingle in the finish is nice.   I didnt dislike this, but I probably wont buy it again.

Bottle.  Brownish ruby pour.  Tan head.  Aroma is grape, dried dark fruit and leather.  Taste is cherry, prune and candied sugar.  Finish is dry and tannic.  Body is light.  Havent had this in five years.  Did not enjoy it too much the first time.  Enjoyed it a lot today.
Pours deep dark with red tinge, sml-med head. Smells.. floral, some dried fruits, caramel, toffee and malts. Tastes..dark fruits, yeast, malts, toffee caramel and some booze. super.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2013 Dark brown color, very dark! Tempting scent, not revealing all its secrets right away. On the taste, first there was almost like banana type fruits, and at the aftertaste there is this big roasted flavor. Almost harsh, but in a good manner. Roasted but sweet, I noticed some licorice from aftertaste. Some yeast coming from under the roasted malts. Exciting, crisp and malty. Good!
Caramel, koffie, chocolade, alcohol, boerenerf, aarde, alcohol, caramel, hooi, geroosterd
UPDATED: JAN 11, 2014 Bottle. Pours deep brown with thick off-white head. Fruity and sweet aroma. Taste is strong, malty and fruity.
This beer is everything a beer should be. Beautiful pour, wonderful flavors. Worth every penny. Highly recommended!

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Nov 2012 - Small bottle.  Mild, sweet, subtle banana, malty.  Easy drinking.  Not sharp like some belgian beers.  Nice.  (3.8)
July 2015 - 750ml Grande Reserve, 2011 vintage, shared at Pauls for his 30th.  Dark reddy brown, small foamy tan head.  Aroma is sweet, molasses, fruity, cherry.  Body is medium, foamy, tingly carbonation.  Taste is fruity, dried strawberry, dry and bready.  Very different with a little age, but still a (3.8) for me.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours hazy brown (I was in delirium tremens, and shook the bottle). Low beige head, very good retention. Some lacing. Aroma is of malt, fruits, yeast, sligth bread. Taste is of malt, fruits, yeast, alcohol, sligth bitterness. Palate: Well carbonated. Medium body. Overall: Surprisingly refreshing (carb) for the style. Complex while not too heavy. Nice alcohol feeling. A very good beer.

Pours with a thick light brown foam. Color is dark brown and cloudy. Yeasty citrusy aroma. Alcohol comes through quite a bit on the taste. It has some malts to it, with the majority of it coming from a flowery citrus taste. Taste is light overall, with little carbonation. All in all an ok trappist beer.

Bottle stamped L12-288.
Appearance: The body is a deep garnet/mahogany with good clarity when seen through the light. The tan head is tall and dense with decent retention.
Aroma: The aroma is restrained but what I smell smells nice. I pick up some sweet malts with some brown sugar along with grapes and a slight medicinal note.
Taste: The fruit flavors are the most prominent leaving a slightly medicinal grape flavor, reminiscent of the artificial grape flavor in lollipops. Sweet malts underlie the grape providing a good backing to display the flavor.
Palate: Thick thick and creamy with lively carbonation.
Overall: This is the first Chimay beer Ive actually really enjoyed. This is a great beer with a full body and a lot of flavor, while being balanced nicely as well.

Bottle: Hazy brown with a creamy, off-white head. Aroma is fruit (plums),  raisin, spice (Cinnamon, cloves), alcohol, caramel and molasse. Flavor is full of dark fruits, figs,  caramel, dark sugar, candy. Alcoholic fiinish.

Aroma is a combination of tart from cranberry, sweetness from cherries, and underlying raisin. Appearance is dark brown. Head was bubbly and off white. Carbonation rises up all sides of the tulip glass. Taste is cherry and orange zest. Lingering on the palate I taste cherry and cranberry which gives a wonderful balance of bittersweet tartness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from 2011 (I think) and cellared for 1 year. Pours a hazy brown with 1 finger of light tan head. Aroma is yeast, caramel, raisins, and dark fruit. Taste is highly volatile with trmperature: raisins, toffee, and herbs when chilled, and yeast, alcohol, raisins, and dark malts when warmed up. Thick mouthfeel, but refreshing enough. This is a very good beer, although frankly you could get a comparable beer for half the money if you dont buy Trappist. Also, share this with a friend or two, because the alcohol sneaks up on you.

Pours a semi cloudy deep amber brew with a big beige head with regular too good retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and and moderate to low bitter with notes of caramel, banana and spices, médium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with the same notes as the aroma, good balance, bittersweet finish.

Bottle. Murky brown with a thick head. Complex flavour and aroma. Deep sweet fruit dominates with low bitterness and well hidden alcohol. An excellent beer.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber with a decent light tan head. Good lacing. Aroma is stone fruit, raisin, clove, alcohol, and caramel. Taste is dark fruit, vinous, alcohol, toffee, and yeast. Full body with light carbonation.

Bottle. Cant believe its taken this long to bang a rate in on RB. Pours Reddy Brown with a nice, thick, cream-coloured head. Sweet Belgian Candy on the nose. The flavour is extremely well rounded with very little bitterness at all. Toffee, caramel and candied fruit all circulate in a perfect harmony. Theres a lot going on at the same time but I suspect its just as accessible to a new comer as it is to an afficionado. A very fine beer available almost everywhere. In line with Rochefort in that regard.

Pours a dark brown with a burst of carbonation released while pouring. Remarkably smooth fig taste that offers complexity not always seen in a 9abv. Mouthfeel is extremely smooth and light with high carbonation. Finishes a light malt and caramel. Will not go wrong getting this Belgian ale.

La Chimay bleue, de couleur brun foncé, nous donne des arôme de sucre (pratiquement du bonbon, voire de la gomme balloune) et de fruits bien mûrs. En bouche, elle est soyeuse, relativement douce. Aucunement amère, elle laisse place au sucre et est en fait assez fidèle au bouquet. Belle surprise. Cette bière me semble différente des autres du même style. La finale est équilibrée, complexe, difficile à décrire. Très belle surprise au final. Une bière que je recommande pour son goût original, complexe. À déguster! Cheers!

We are doing Rochefort 8 vs Chimay Blue. Both looks the same - cloudy, dark orange-brown with half finger off white head. Aroma of the Chimay is dark fruits, yeast, orange, booze, brown sugar, rasins, bananas. Rochefort aroma is vanilla, wood, dark fruits, a little booze, brown sugar. Taste of Chimay is light sweet, warm alcohol feeling and great balance. Rochefort is not that sweet, also great balance but it has nice fruitiness all the way. The palate of both are quite similar - medium body, creamy texture and soft carbonation. May be Rochefort is a bit more watery, but not in a bad way and Chimay has a bit more carbonation. Both are great , me and my girlfriend prefer Rochefort 8.

Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle into a Trappist Glass.  Slightly cloudy, but a beautiful deep brown.  A one inch tan head quickly rises and slowly settles to a thin film that coats the sides of the glass.  Aroma of fruits, vanilla and caramel.  Medium sweet, medium body, and lively, though not fizzy like some other Belgians.  While I have enjoyed this beer and would certainly look forward to it again, I found myself hoping for something more complex.  As it warms its characteristics seem to be more pronounced, but still a bit one dimensional.

Im a little disappointed actually.  The aroma is good: fruity, dulled, some furniture polish in there, also very sweet buttercream.  But after that the taste is a little one-dimensional: strong certainly but a little complex - but not amazing.  A copper head quickly gave way to nothing and the drink looked sad in the glass with a slick of sediment across the top.  Maybe I got an old bottle of Tescos shelf, maybe I wasnt careful with the pour.  But Im not raving about it.

Dark, cloudy brown with a thick beige head of foam; burgundy highlights once you get half-way the glass.
Appealing aroma of mostly yeast and light caramel.
Soft carbonation which is exactly right for this kind of beer.
Its moderately sweet in a caramel kind of way, especially in the aftertaste; some alcohol but well hidden for a 9% beer; decent bit of roast (in a smooth, slightly bitter way) and a touch of acidity that also helps to keep it from being too heavy or too much on the sweet side.
Excellent brew and a classic for good reason

Aromas of cherries, plums, pomegranate, roses, and hints of brandy.  Hazy, dark ruby-brown with moderately retaining beige head foam.  Pretty sweet, with rich flavors of black cherry and almond, and subtle booze.  Full and strong, with thick, peppery carbonation, and a semi-sweet, lasting finish containing notes of cherry cola.  Delicious; the perfect night cap, especially in the winter.

Pours a small, frothy, light brown head that dully diminished. Aroma contains light bread, straw, roasted malts, caramel, lemon, dough, leather, raisin, plum, cherry, red wine, tawny port, spices, alcohol and forest fruits. Flavor starys off light acidic, to go to sweet and to finish sweet with very subtle  light astringent bitterness. Body is medium to full, texture creamy and carbonation soft. This is a beer with very subtle aroma's and flavors nad high complexity. Great, great beer!

Mouthfeel is medium with lots of scrubbing from the carbonation. Overall, very good and refreshing.  Epitome of a good solid Trappist beer.

Kaatuu omaan lasiinsa colanvärisenä ja kestävällä rusehtavanvalkoisella pilvisellä vaahdolla. Haju on vahvasti mausteinen, hieman luumuinen ja raikkaan hedelmäinen. Maku on kuivatun hedelmäinen, hieman alkoholin polttama, mausteinen ja hieman marjainen. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen humalan pistellessä kitalaella. Kokonaisuutena klassikko, joka ei petä. Jotain jää tuoreena kuitenkin puuttumaan.. Edit. 2 vuotta vanha Chimay blöö (juotu 17.10.-12) kaatuu lasiin tummana ja sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Vaahto jää pinnalle ohueksi kalvoksi. 3/5 pistettä. Haju on hyvin marjainen ja rusinainen, luumuakin löytyy. Raikas hedelmä ja mausteisuus ovat jääneet taka-alalle. Pientä leipäisyyttä tuntuu löytyvän. 8/10 pistettä. Maku on alkuun jopa paahteisen leipäinen, joka tuntuu muutenkin hyvin vahvana. Lopussa alkaa tulla rusinaa ja kuivattua hedelmää joukkoon. Maustettakin löytyy paljon. 7/10 pistettä. Suutuntuma on odotetun kuiva ja hiilihappoinen, muutenkin melko täyteläinen. 4/5. Kokonaisuutena tämä on hyvin säilynyt vahva belgi, mutta en osaa sanoa, onko parempaa kuin tuoreena. Makuun tullut paahteisuus yllätti. 16/20 pistettä. 2 vuotias yht. 8+3+7+4+16=38 pistettä.

(75 cl bottle 2011 vintage) Pours dark brown with medium, tan head. Good lace and retention. Aroma is yeast-character, chalk, caramel and something faintly floral. Softly carbonated, velvety-oily mouthfeel, full body with a lingering, caramelly finish. Taste is mildly sweet and mildly bitter. Very subtle and easily drinkable despite the high abv.

Pours a deep raw umber color with a nice three finger foam. On the nose its beautiful with burnt sugar, raisin, date and a touch of herbal cola coming through. The palate retains the noses complexity and the addition of a velvety beautiful mouthfeel really knock this beer out of the park !  Amazing balance of flavors with touches of brown sugar, dark fruit and yeasty earth coming through.... complex yet easy drinking !

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2016 (Re-rated on 3/8/2016):

Rationale: I was new to the style back then. With experience I want to revisit one of my favorite, and see if I like it as much as I was then. So here goes!

330 ml bottle bought at CitySuper in Harbour City, Tsim Sha Tsui.
Looks: Cloudy hazy amber brown colour with a layer of yeast sediments; One and a quarter finger head with creamy, lasting light beige foam; Excellent sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant rich dark malt, with strong plum, raisins, figs, light Brandy, nice alcohol, vanilla, strong caramel, strong toffee, whipped cream, candi sugar, sweet bread, strong Bel yeast and light grass. Lovely!

Taste: Mid to strong sweet full dark malt, with strong plums figs, metallic, smart alcohol, light liquorices, caramel, toffee, molasses, strong spices, earth, biscuits, strong Bel yeast, lime, herbs, fairly strong bitter hops and grass.

Body: Full body. Dry, slick and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Rich dark malt in a very smooth and solid background. Creamy and very Bock-ish. Then very strong plums and figs hit hard and fast followed by well-attenuated dry alcohol and liquorices and you know right away this is classy! Layered caramel and toffee with perfect medium sweetness. Most of it went to the booze, the rest is nice dryness. Spicy, slightly earthy and quite biscuit Bel yeast, round with pretty strong lime and herbs. Close to perfect!

Booze: I couldnt handle the 9% abv back then and got KO-ed fast with a rush. Now the booze tasted dry, tasty and quite restrained and I appreciated it even more!

Hoppiness: Light grass in nose. Lime, herbs and grass in taste; Bitterness is fairly strong for a lasting, mid to high astringent bitter-sweet fruity malt finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Creamy, fruity and nice herbal bitter to mouth.

Comments: Looking back, I think my original rating is just about right, but with a new appreciation with a bit more tasting experience today: Bold but subtle aroma and taste manifested with lots of plums, darks fruits, Bock-ish maltyness. Backed by perfectly-exceuted dry booze with subtle liquorices, and limey herbal hoppiness. All these niceties at the most affordable price you can have as Chimay being the most widely distributed Trappist beers in the city. Everything seems to works in its flavor and it earns it. Brilliant!

-------- />(riginally rrated  on 6 February 2013):

Cloudy dark ale brown colour; Very good head and frothy, though not as big as like Chimay White; Fine smell of caramel, vanilla, yeast, malt and some flowery fragrance; hops taste is minimal. It is very smooth to mouth with full body, creamy texture, with lingering taste of sweet toffee; lacing is not as apparent as Chimay White; Palate is subtle, lively, organically smooth throughtout with sweet after taste. At abv 9%, its really strong, with the rush come after 5-7 minutes but its gradual and you wont get a bad trip, lovely feeling really. :)

Comment: The best from Chimay, like everyone who have high regard with it, I love it for being the most subtle Chimay beers among the tri-colors; Lucky enough I bought a brunch of Chimay Blues at bargain price (looks like the people at the supermarket doesnt know how good this is!) so Ill have a great holiday treasuring them. Definitely one of the best Trappist beer in the World. Period.

(Original score: Aroma: 8/10; Looks: 4/5; Taste: 10/10; Palate: 5/5; Overall: 20/20)

Yeah it's ok. I don't think I get it. So it's ok for Belgian Beers to get away with a lot of stuff that an English beer couldn't. This beer is quite nice. Quite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2013 75 cl bottle. This is majestic. What a treasure. A smooth and delicious brew. The taste is so balanced and perfect. The aroma is sumptuous, with hints of chocolate, licorice and bread. Malty and yeasty. You think that  you are smelling flowers from heaven. Dark brown color, cloudy liquid with sediments, brown minimal head. The palate is superb. Full body with a creamy and thick texture. The carbonation is soft, letting you feeling the delicious taste. The finish is long, so long, with the notes of the taste and aroma accompanying you to happiness. One of the best beers I have ever tasted.
P.D: I have come to notice that this beer is slightly better in every aspect when served from the 75 cl bottle in comparison to the 33 cl bottle (at least one additional point in aroma, taste, palate and overall). I havent tasted the magnum bottle yet.

330ml bottle. pours a dark brown, coca cola colour with a caramel head.  Aroma is initially alcoholic with a strong smell of yeast. The taste is of hops and coffee with the alcohol hitting after. Not quite sure i get the floral notes others do.

Bottled, 0.33l. Pours clear amber brown with thick small tan-like head, lively bubbles and light yeast residue. Aroma of yeast, lightly roasted barley malt, dark fruits, caramel, vanilla and floral hops. Taste starts with sweet and rich maltiness, followed by spicy yeast and sour fruitiness. This beer is excellently balanced, rounded with gentle alcohol warmth and finished pleasantly hoppy. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Thats my best Chimay...

Bottle of 330 ml at home, poured into a Chimay glass.
Dark brown colour on the top, amber from the middle down. An inner fountain of bubbles rising from the center of the glass to the top.Head is light beige in colour, creamy, with very good retention, one finger tall.
Aroma of fruits, caramel, plum.
Taste is sweet and follows the aroma. Some grapes too. Alcohol very well concealed.
On the body is thick and carbonation is average.
Overall, a great beer, although I liked the red better.
Aroma was very short. This is a good beer. Very sweet and yeasty but little hops. Typical belgian. Will have again but no favourite.

Bottle from Belgianbeershop.com. Head: thick, beige, stable, nice lacing. Color: dark red brown, very beautiful. Aroma: filled with malts, notes of caramel and dark fruits. Alcohol is detectable. Taste: liquorice, dark fruits, well balanced sweetness-bitterness, complex. Mouthfeel: full. This is a heart warming beer, filled with lots of different flavours. Wonderful brew but not the best of the Chimay trappists.

Pours a hazy reddish-brown from the bottle with thin tan head and light lacing. Aroma of belgian  yeast, dark fruits, bittering hops, and slight alcohol. Taste follows, well balanced and alcohol well hidden. Pretty good, but not as awesome as I was expecting.

Aroma is yeasty with refreshing hints of a floral fragrance. Pours a dark, cloudy amber, almost brown color. Yeasty flavor with with floral undertones for an extremely flavorful, balanced beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Zeer goed iets wat fruitig bier met een mooie en zeer volle afdronk. vooral zeer lekker wanneer je het met de hergisting drinkt. deze Trappist is zonder twijfel 1 van de beste donkere bieren ter wereld!

Head: almost beige, shrinking fast. Color: clear ruby brown. Aroma: hops, ripe fruit. Taste: bitter, roasted malt. Palate: impessive, bittersweet, medium bitter finish. Overall: very good

Bottle. Deep sweet aroma, with prunes, raisins, candied fruit, and some yeast. Dark hazy brown, good lacing. Lip-smaking fruitiness in initial; mid has fumes, yeast, and moderate fruit; final leaves traces of sweetness and a hit  of alcohol warmth. Very good stuff. Not so complex. I really prefer the triple (White), but this is solid.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Clear dark amber with medium white to beige head, lasting well.
Aroma.. quite complex thou nicely balanced. Malty, hoppy, yeasty. Some hints of chocolate, dark fruits, even bread. Bit licorice and alcohol. Oaky.
Sweet. Finish is quite long, medium bitter with notes of alcohol. Nicely balanced.
Maybe not the best, but above average decent brew, that I like to enjoy from time to time.

Really delicious dark Belgian strong ale. Super malty and balanced, has a thick foamy head on top and yeast on the nose. A gorgeous deep brown amber pour. Floral notes from the balanced fizz make this beer superbly complex and a real treat.
Hazy dark with reddish reflection. Medium beige head.aroma grapes,wine,redberries.chestnut in the final. Wine taste, roasted malt, alcohol. Lively carb, full body

Incredible; glad I finally tried it.  Alot of what you'd expect in the nose; but it tastes even better.  Sweet up front with a nice balanced finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown/red, with half-finger frothy white head and barley any lacing.

Scents of dark fruits, mango, caramel, roasted barley. Very pleasing. Could smell all day long.

Taste raisins, dark tropical fruits, little caramel etc. Thick, smooth body, with heavy carbonation. Wonderfully delicious all the way through.

Nice. Price just needs a little negotiating, and then its a regular.

(330mL bottle from the LCBO cellared 2 years) Pours a barely hazy medium brown with an orange tint, since the yeast had settled, and a relatively short bubbly head that left no lace. Aroma light toffee malt, prune, a little vanilla, yeast. Flavour starts sweet with brown sugar, dried fruit, watermelon(?!), then a bit of roast, lots of yeasty spices, and some hop bitterness to finish dry. Booze is in here but the cellar time seems to have dampened its presence. Carbonation is high, lively and sharp for the style. Palate is fairly full and oily but cut by the carb. Flavour is rich, balance superb. Wish the mouthfeel was less aggressive to match the other characteristics.

Bottle. Dark brown colour, no head. Aroma is yeasty. Taste is dark fruits alcohol and sweet malts. The alcohol is there but not overpowering. The taste seems to gain in depth and complexity the more you drink.Fizz on the palate a little sticky. An excellent ale.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: pours a fuzzy brown with a small beige head. Tastes of sweet malts with a bit of a spicey kick, I also get the tastes of dark fruits and fairly strong alcohol, the taste is a bit wine like.
This beer is scrumptuos.  Buy a few and cellar them for a good long time.  Nothing will go better with tenderloin and new york strips.  Get another bottle to go with cigars after dinner.

Aroma: caramel, light roast flavor

Appearance: bubbly thick head, tan head, brownish, dark caramel color

Taste: sweet malt-ish flavor at first, smooth flavor, can taste something roasted, just enough hop after taste

Palate: average consistency, with very slight froth at the end

Overall: very good beer, the sweet flavor is a bit surprising when you look at it. Recommended 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark amber with a good 1/2" head and splashes of lace.  This is a terrific, complex brew.  Taste opens with a semi-sweet toffee caramel malt that grows and sweetens as it moves through the palate.  There is faint bittering at the end, just enough to balance beautifully.  An exceptional brew, perhaps the best of the Chimay trio.  Great for sipping, or, as I so often do, great with chocolate iced biscotti.  Highly recommended

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2013 The grandaddy of the Chimay Trappistes, and one of the most highly appreciated. This is a medium carbonation (unlike Rochefort and St Bernandus) malt fix. The smell is mild toffee and candy sugar; the alcohol is certainly perceptible. However, this is covered well in the taste - the sweetness of the brew lasts only a millisecond, followed bu a slight, lingering bitterness. Finally, an almost mandarin malt body concludes everything.

Bottle at rock pool. Hazy brown in color with no head. Aromas of dark fruits, roasted malt, vanilla & booze. Taste is quite upfront with the booze with raisins , roasted espresso, malts and brown sugar. Palate left pretty dry. Like drinking alcoholic syrup. Not my thing but its pretty good for what it's supposed to be

Aroma of dark fruits, vanilla, alcohol, caramel,  yeasty esters, toast and lots of malt. Appearance is ruby-brown and hazy (the yeast wasnt fully settled out) with thin off-white head, very high carbonation, not a pretty beer as it was.  Flavour  heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, raisin, prune, caramel, dark fruits dominate, touch of roast malt adds more of a dark nutty dimension.  Mouthfeel, high carbonation and medium-thin body, slight bitterness balancing the malt.  I was looking forward to this as a classic beer, not as great as I remember but the yeast may not have helped.

caramel, vanilla, roasty, chocolate, earthy, brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium - full body, creamy, sticky, oily feel, lively (too much carbo in my opinion), long finish,

0.33 l bottle @ Beer OClock, Bucharest.

Dark burgundy colour, short beige head.

It has an armonious aroma, with notes of forest fruits, caramel, brown sugar, honey, dried plums, dried cranberries, raisins, baked quince, baked apple, fresh bread, cinnamon, roses, champagne, citrus, noble yeast, noble alcohol.

Full body, bittersweet taste, soft carbonation, astringent finish, dry texture.

Amber color. Little head. Spicy smooth on palate. Nice clean finish. Great Belgium. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 16, 2013 Une couleur foncé de caramel avec une mousse moyenne qui reste jusqa la fin. Un nez a du malt, sucre à canne et alchool. Le goût initale est de malt et alchool avec un goût un peu terreux, peut-être aussi de sucre à canne. Il me semble un peu comme du rhum. Très distinctive.
Very fine bubbles in light tan head. Clear, dark brown. Aroma of yeast and alcohol. Flavor is much alcohol, maybe a little nutty or roasted. Palette is medium, neither sticky nor watery.

Bottiglia da 33 cl. Ottimo aspetto, birra di color tonaca di frate con schiuma nocciola non molto abbondante ma di buona persistenza. Al naso ottimi i profumi di frutta tropica a polpa gialla matura. Al palato inizia con un maltato torrefatto per passare al caffè, cacao e infine frutta matura, il finale è mediamente secco con retrogusto di caffè e cacao, per me davvero una bella scoperta che malgrado il suo alto tasso alcoolico non lo fa sentire durante la bevuta ma solo alla fine quando ci si alza dalla sedia.

Bottle shared with McTapps. This one was good. But not that good to give it some crazy ratings. Nice dark brown look with some nutty malt in the aroma. Drinkable and very well made beer but not one I would give crazy numbers as this one is not THAT special at all.

Poured amber and slightly cloudy with a nice lacing.  Dates, toffee, raisins and yeast in the nose.  Heavy carbonation with tingle on the tongue.  Malt sweetness but still dry, dark ripe fruit and bread.  A treat!

Bottle. Pours clear amber red, large tan had that mostly dissipates leaving a creamy, well lacing residual. Aroma is grain, dried fruit, toffee, yeast. Flavor is the same, lightly spiced, medium sweet, light astringence, light bitter, warming alcohol finish.

Bottle bought online and was shared with MichaelBruch. Pale dark brown in colour, with airy, strong and stable head. Taste of young yeast, fresh flowers, green grass and light malt. Very delicious and easy to drink. Top quality beer.

Pours a solid dark brown with ruby highlights when held to light, and a decent sized off white head that dissipates too quickly leaving a cap on top. The aroma is filled with prunes, plums, raisins, and lots of dark and burnt sugars. Slight aroma of ethanol and a hint of yeast, with just a touch of earthy spicy hops. The flavor is rich and sweet with a full complement of dark dried fruits as well as some complex dark sugary flavors. Slight vinous quality as well as some bready yeasty flavors round this one out quite nicely. Medium to thick body with a spirited level of carbonation and a sweet syrupy burnt sugary mouthfeel. Nice brew, its been so long I had forgotten just how much I enjoyed this ale.

Nose of fresh pear and caramel. Pour is brown with thick white head that dissipates quickly with little to no lacing.  Taste is crisp, fruity with sweet malt and hints of molasses. Smooth mouthfeel with nice tingle on the tongue.
