One of those beers that gets overlooked because it is so readily available. Every time I drink it I am reminded that I need to keep this excellent no frills ale in my cellar.
Il 100 che le viene dato mi sembra eccessivo...sempre e comunque birra con un gran carattere...

Oh yes; the famous Chimay Bleu.  Into a tulip you go.  I like having the sediment mixed in my beer, so it pours a murky brown, nice fluffy cream head.  Aroma is absolutely Belgian ale; yeast, sweetness, mild coriander, faint toasty notes.  Flavour echoes the yeast, delicious swee dark malts, mild hops balance, rich mouthfeel.  Ooooh yes.
Color caoba oscuro, de espuma frágil y efímera. Con sabor chocolateado o a toffe. Mucho mejor si se toma a temperatura ambiente un día de frio.

Ok beer when there's nothing else on offer. Full bodied but the taste wears off quite quickly

750ml.  Medium brown/red with lightt head.  High carbonation.  Aroma and taste are strong fruit.  Sweet with descending aftertaste.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2014 4 years aged bottle: Clear mahogany brown, tanned head. Nice sweet aroma, wood, malts, spices, raisin. Taste is very balanced, sweet, raisin, wood. Not strong flavors but balanced and smooth.


Fresh bottle at home. Almost black color with big bubbled white head. Aroma of licorice, alcohol, sweetness. banana. Taste of rye bread, light alcohol, licorice, pretty much co2. Balanced belgian, maybe that little alcohol lowers some points (3,8)

Ok this is one of my favorite beers of all time. A true Trappist beer. Pours very dark scarlet with a brownish tinge; slightly hazy. Topped off with a small, off-white head, surprising retention lasting till the very end. Great aroma, mostly sweet composed of fruity aromas, dark forest fruits. Taste is also fruity, and sweet caramel very consummate and basically resembles Chimay Red (which is another great beer!) , however it brings some small malty notes, nutty to an extent. Body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation average. Finish is medium as well, pretty much follows the taste but accentuates these nice sweet notes. This is a marvelous beer, something to be drunk at every occasion, I keep bottles of this beer always around. I have had 100s of bottles of this beer since 1996 when my taste buds had there first sip. I will drink this beer many more times.

Aroma: Roasted malt flavors with cheese yeast aromas with hints of dried fruit, raisin, and hints of hoppiness at the edges. Very rich and complex.
Appearance: Dark brown amber with rich tan head.
Taste: Medium sweetness with hints of sourness at the edges to balance it out.
Palate: Full body, slick oily texture, lively carbonation, long finish.
Overall: This is a beautifully designed beer. Well crafted, lots of great flavors and aromas, and not too extreme in any one way. Im really impressed.
Pours dark cola brown.  Aromas of brown bananas and some hops.  Something metallic and not so nice.  Dried fruits, cheese, winery flavours.  Tasty.  Creamy bubbles.  Yum.
UPDATED: NOV 1, 2012 Pours a deep red brown with a consistent strong head. Powerful aroma of apples and pears. Delicious fruit sweer forest fruit flavours. A gorgeous tasting beer.

(33 cl bottle) Pours a slightly cloudy dark brownish orange. Aroma of dark sugars, caramel and figs with hints of yeast and alcohol. Rich malt flavour with a slight bitterness and some warming alcohol, very smooth. Medium to full mouthfeel. A very classy classic.

volle body iets dropperigs, mooie fijne afstemming tussen alcohol, zoet licht bitter, kruidig fluweel.

Bottle from Alko. Dark bown color, beige head. Malty taste with barnyard aroma, nuts, plum and earthy notes. Very nice belgian brew.

Bottle. Pours cloudy dark brown color with nice tan head. Aroma is plums, spices, malt, ripe banana. Flavor is a lot of fruits, especially plums, spices, malt, bit of alcohol. Carbonation is medium to high.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours deep ruby, hazy looking and with a nice foamy head.  Aroma is very yeasty and fruity, with the announced flowery touch. Pleasant!. Mouthfeel is medium. Taste is sweet dark fruits, and the relatively strong abv is not apparent at all. Very pleasant drink this indeed.

Overall great drinking beer! Not too dark, not too light, great character. Rich, slightly fruity, with deep strong overtones.

Bottle. Hazy dark brown color with a frothy beige head. Yeasty aroma with some caramel. Strong earthy taste of yeast, roasted malt and warming alcohol. Quite dry, sour finish.

Aroma: caramel, woody and a little alcoholic. Appearance: bright brown fading to amber. Hazy liquid and solid head. Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter. Palete: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter and a little sweet long finish.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2012 Aroma: caramel, a little bit of dry plums(?); Appearance: dark brown (or very dark amber), hazy, nice head, slightly tanned and quite firm; Taste: overall malty, light sweetness, lightly bitter, alcohol (but in good "warm" version); Palate: medium body, creamy, average (to soft) carbonation, "dry" finish; Overall: very good strong ale, without flaws but not exactly my favorite, nevertheless, strongly recommended.
Chimay is one of the authentic trappist beer from Belgium. A strong beer with fine aromas.
Ruby red colour. Soft and creamy foam. Smell makes me think of wine. Quite sharp on the tongue, strong taste of alcohol.

Poured with a massive thick light tan coloured head that slowly produced a translucent red-brown liquid. When the thick head diminished it left a thin bubble head that gave a slight filmy lace. Low carbonation. Aroma sweet with a trace of yeast. Taste very sweet malts. Medium body. Different from the norm but not my style of beer - overall too sweet.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 0.75 bottle. Pours very dark scarlet with a brownish tinge slightly hazy. Topped with a small, off-white head of, as for its size, surprising retention lasting till the very end. Complex aroma, mostly sweet composed of fruity scents, dark forest fruits to be specific, which I would ascribe to yeasts. Taste is also fruity, very consummate and basically resembles Chimay Red, however it brings out some small malty notes, nutty to an extent. Body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation average but as with the red version it swiftly subsides. Finish is medium as well, pretty much follows the taste but accentuates these nice sweet notes, introduces a plethora of different notes, very elaborate. Overall this is a marvelous beer, something to be drunk at every occasion and even bought in advance for time to come. Despite its substantial alcohol content it is completely undetectable, perfect.
330ml bottle. Hazy chestnut color. Small off-white head, stays. Caramel, alcohol, yeast, plums, dark fruits in aroma. Raisins, yeast, dried fruits in flavor. Dry yeasty aftertaste.
Slightly sweet yeast and malt aroma. Dark brown with light tan head. Smooth. Slightly sweet. Slightly bitter. Alcohol warmth. Very well balanced.

Based on what I was told before tasting this beer, I must admit that my expectations were quite high. Unfortunately, the taste wasn't too much.

Murky brown color with a fantastic bubbly tan head, this beer looks delicious. Smells very yeasty and slightly sugary. Similar flavors of candy sugar, banana, and hint of leathery spice. Pretty aggressive carbonation keeps this 9% abv beer deceptively drinkable.
Probe la del 2011.Dicen que hay que beberlas  mucho despues del embotellado.Yo la encontre potente.Mucho alcohol,notas de oporto.Una buena cuadruple.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 A must try for anyone. I think the best bet is to go with the cork bottle. The smaller one lacks something that the corked version seems to always bring. Certainly not a palate wrecker, but after this you just kinda want more of the same.
Pure superlatives here...nothing I can add to what hasnt already been said about this beer. Near perfection!
Ruby red colour. Soft and creamy foam. Smell makes me think of wine. Quite sharp on the tongue, strong taste of alcohol.

#870
 Dunkelbraunes, ziemlich trübes Trappistenbier mit sehr schnell verflogenem Schaum. Im Geruch ziemlich hefig, einem Weizenbock ähnlich. Der Geschmack ist hefig-säuerlich und ganz leicht fruchtig. Der Alkoholgehalt schlägt ziemlich durch und betäubt den Gaumen. Die ganze Aromenvielfalt, die ein Trappist üblicherweise zu bieten hat, wird durch den Alkohol quasi erschlagen. Hinzu kommt, dass es nicht ausreichend gelagert worden ist (MHD 2014!). B-Probe erfolgt daher später...

330ml à Paris. Aroma is sweet malty and caramel. Taste is light sour and very sweet. A light bitter and malty after taste. Overall a fine Trappist beer.

Poured into a Chimay glass out of a gift pack. This is my third Chimay in three days. I wanted to have a good idea of every beer that Chimay produces. Nice dark and clean. Surprisingly clean. One of my favorite Belgians. Pours dark with some sedimet. Creamy head. Smells of chocolate and prunes. Flavor is steog fig and chocolate combo, with nice alcohol warmth. Heavy/chewey mothfeel. Just perfect.

Bottle at Huppel de Pub, Den Haag.  Poured a murky dark brown colour with a huge frothy white head. UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 Dark pour with huge head. Strong malt aroma whilst bottled, not so strong once poured. Wonderful malty taste.
Pours a nice hazelnut brown with lasting off white head. Smells like warm spices and raisin bread...yeast too. Sweet dark fruit flavours, a touch of maple..nice boozy finish. Warm. Excellent!

Bottle to oversized snifter.  Looks good; a cloudy brown with beige head that dissipates into lacing.  Smells good too; candied, yeasty, and doughy.  Tastes like it smells with some dark fruit in there too.  Good on the palate.  Very good beer.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 P: Dark hazy brown. A: Dark fruits, spices, yeast, cinnamon, and nuts. T: Roasted carmelt, yeast, mapler, raisins, dark frutis, brown sugar and vanilla with a bitter finish. M: High carbonation. O: a tasty brew.

Dark amber color with beige foamy head. Lots of yeast floating around in the bottle. Aroma is light malt, some caramel and dried fruit. Also some subtle spices.  It has a fizzy feel on the tongue, followed by flavors of caramel and roasted malt. The finish is balanced. Alcohol content gives it a warm feel but no burn.  A great beer!

Vertical tasting of 3 different vintages - 2010, 2007 and a magnum of 2001.
All were tasted  in 2011, bottle samples. 

2010 - deep mahogany, slight haze, nice head. 
Classic Trappist nose, yeast, slight brettiness, dark fruits and dust. 
Light chocolate flavors, caramel, ashtray, sugar powder and damp.
Creamy, surprisingly not heavy bodied, pretty balanced. 6/4/7/4/14=3.5

2007 - slightly darker that the 2010 version, with a sweeter nose and candied popcorn and sour fruits (dried apricot).
More complex flavors with more layers, alcohol is more dominant.
No ash flavors, no earth. Some lactic notes and ginger tones. 
Heavier body. 7/4/7/3/13=3.4

2001 - Much darker brown, small head.
Spicy aroma, very nutty and almondy, Moist and damp all around. Fruity. Chocolate powder. 
Cork acidity, Intense candied sour fruits. Not fresh, age is detectable. 
Alcohol is not in the way, medium finish. 8/3/6/4/14=3.5
75cl. Pours dark hazy brown with a good white head. Many flavors in it a somewhat sweet aroma. A world class beer.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 Bottle as a gift (bottled 2011) Pours dark brown with a big and dense white head. The aroma showcases dark estery fruitiness, yeasty spiciness, caramel maltiness. Very refined, rich dark fruitiness, gives also sherry-like vibes due to aging. Taste is medium to heavy sweet; it is malty, yeasty and spicy but has also a prominent element of oak and vanilla. Hops are quite non-existant in this version but with this much malt and yeast presence, they are not really required. The palate is thick and full bodied. You can see why this is a classic and aging makes it even better.

Aromatic vanilla bean, caramel, oak and cinnamon on the nose. Appearance is a cloudy dark brown with a tan foam. Incredibly complex flavors of coriander, maple, brown sugar, roasted caramel, wood and a touch of vanilla. Big alcohol warmth on the finish. Flavors are complex and fantastically balanced. Overall, an absolutely incredible brew that boasts a ton of complex flavors. Id give this an A+ rating.

Bottle. Pours an extremely dark amber color with a moderate off-white head. Slight hints of sweetness to the nose with some great balance of malts to it. Some fairly strong sweetness to the flavor, but awfully malty in the aftertones.

Appena versata si sente lodore di luppolo, ed è lunica cosa che traspare. Il gusto amaro tipico di questo genere di birra non ha nulla di particolare, un leggero sapore tostato  e poco speziato. Al palato non lascia molto amaro rispetto ad altre Ale più economiche, ma in sostanza una sufficienza senza troppe pretese.
From a bottle ar huppel the pub in den Haag. Pours dark and cloudy with a creamy tan head. Aroma of dark fruits. Flavor of biscuits. High carbonation. Lingering slightly bitter finish.
Brown with beige foam. Aroma of caramel, ripe fruit and dry fruit. Taste is intese and full bodied, sweet and with little roast flavour.

33cl bottle, 2.95. Mahogany brown to red color, soapy offwhite head  sadly quickly reducing. Flowery and fuity on the nose. Brown sugar, caramel. Candy fruits, raisins, spices, red wine. Earthy yeast. Pretty lightbodied for the style, light to medium. Taste has an initial sweetness followed by a good bitterness. Carbonation is sustained, texture is a bit watery. Finish is sharp, dry, spicy, alcoholic.

Strange smells and much but I can not really hang of what it is. Tastes much. Do I feel some raisins to taste. The aftertaste, I also hard but it lingers for quite some time. The one I currently try is vintage 2003. May not buy this again. Sorry.

I just love this beer. It is in my top 2 list.

Dark full-bodied and a great taste.

Bottle. Pours a hazy brown body, with an average light brown head, that stays until I finish my glass. Very nice malty aroma, with notes of caramel and roast. Medium to heavy bitter taste, along with some light sweetness, but the taste of alcohol is very strong for me. Medium to heavy carbonated, watery and dry texture. An interesting beer, with an intersting aroma, but for me the alcoholic taste was very strong, and not pleasant.

red brown. full body. intense taste of caramel. fruity. important beer, so strong like a red wine. interesting to pair with meat and special souce. Not a recept with caracter, good execution of a traditional "bruin" style.
bottle. light brown with one finger head. sweet and fruit, plum and raisin. lots of flavor and spice. some alcohol burn.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2012 Strong aroma starts with mostly green apples then follow slightly ripe banana, then caramel. Has also yeast, esters, alcohol. Really lively aroma. Hazy mahogany brown, beige head one finger and long. Taste has fruity base, just slightly spicy, alcohol, fizzy carbonation. Medium body, light feel, long finish. Nuanced aroma and flavors, fruity and fresh and easy to drink and enjoy. Overall a good beer...nah.. this one is excellent. To say it other way: this one is like an analog beer in all its great impurities compared to digital bulk beers that play it all so safe.

750 ml corked and caged bottle. Pours a hazy garnet red color. Small creamy beige head. Sweet, yeasty toasted malt aroma. First sip is sweet candy-like with hints of dark fruits and nutmeg. The mid-taste develops more complex notes of black pepper and thyme. The finish is drier and conjures tastes of dried figs and spicy hops. Very nice indeed.

Boh??? Lo stesso punteggio della Westvleteren 12??? 
Intendiamoci, non è male, anzi, avercene di birre così......ma punteggi superiori a 4 per me sono regalati.....
Bel naso con note fruttate e vinose....e bocca tipicamente Belga, ma distante dalle quadrupel migliori.....
Fruity,plummy, hint of licorice, sweet, malty, I can taste the alcohol but would never have guessed 9,0% A bit watery.
33 cl flaska, Ölrepubliken Göteborg. Härlig mörk färg, lagom mkt frukt och sötma. Imponerande lite alkoholsmak med tanke på styrkan.

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a lightly cloudy dark amber/brown with modest-sized light tan head.  Aroma is fruity (mostly dark but some lighter notes too), toffee and floral notes.  Flavour is cherry, raisins, toffee, brown sugar and floralness.  A little alcohol warmth in finish.  Dangerously drinkable.

Will something bad happen if I diss the classic Belgium well luckily Im not going to because Im scared of the beer police. No its because this is a gorgeous big complex malty beer that Im definitely going to have again.
750ml bottle. Pours a cloudy brown with a tan head. Aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, and some hop bitter. Flavors of caramel and yeast, with sweet malts and slight hops.

Nice head that sticks around, beautiful lacing. Fruity yeasty caramel smell. Light bitter alcohol taste with after notes of fruity caramel a little smoke a little sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle courtesy of Kristin and Gary as a bday gift.  Dark brown pour finger or so light tan head and good retention.  Pleasant sugary malt and dark fruit in aroma.  Taste is nuts, pepper, dark fruit, caramel and brown sugar.  Perfectly balanced.  Fairly carbonated in medium creamy palate.  Worthy of the reputation.
Im constipated. Shared with brother in law impromptu beer tasting/pissup. Just stronger than other 2

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy brown/red with tiny head. 
Aroma is caramel, yeast, hops, dried fruit. 
Taste well balanced bitter and sweet. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Good trappist.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 A truly fantastic beer. Pours a dark ruby/brown with a frothy off white head. Nice lacing on the glass. Notes of malt and dried fruit on the nose. Sips beautifully. No alcoholic bite whatsoever. Warming and just all around delicious. This would be a great brew for people just getting into Belgian Strong Ales or Quads. Its so well made. I can see myself sipping this by a fire in the winter on a regular basis.
0,33 flaske fra Polet. Imponerende hvordan det skjuler sine 9% bak en fyldig med samtidig elegant smak. Noe å strebe mot for hjemmebryggere. Blir aldri lei av dette.
Just a great beer.  Also came with a chimay glass which I use for most beers now, very nice.  Theres a lot of different aromas and a lot of different flavor, best strong beer Ive had

Just having a night cap and thought Id share. . . just my thoughts, not the beer.

A - Dark mahogany, poured a finger and a half head that turned to a thin film halfway through (I admit though that I was using a Belgo Chalice and not the proper Chimay one which is wider). Not too much lacing.

S - Apples, candied fruits, and alcohol. All more subtle than I would have expected. EDIT - Aroma perked up as I drank this and by the end everyting was more prominent with the addition of some slightly tart cherries.

T - Dark roasted malt, candied figs, raisins and dates, a bit of alcohol. Very well balanced and very nice. Aftertaste is pleasant and a bit sour and fruity. Wonderful!

M - Perfect! SO smooth and rich and wonderful. I usually combine Mouthfeel and Drinkability but not with this one. Carbonation and body are perfectly balanced and full.

D - I could drink this all night and would if I had more.

750ml bottle. Pours midnight brown with thick off-white head that doesnt dissapear. Very strong sultana alcohol aroma with spices and sugar. Follows through with classic belgian sultanas and alcohol, some fruity floral hops. Good solid trappist ale

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 75cl bottle, 2012, brown mokka coloured medium head, black brownish colour, strong sugary smell, fruity strawbery/peaches, rich carbonation and a warm taste, brown sugary rich flavour

Bottle. Pours a reddish brown, rich regal color. Thin head with the lightest laces. Smell of peppery malt with a touch of yeast. high carbonation that leads to powerful burps. Taste of spice, clove, and malty richness. A touch of bitter aftertaste. Rich, dark and mysterious. Delicious but maybe a touch thin for something this strong?

Pours a deep root beer brown with a very short lived tan head. No lacing noted. The aroma is a combination of flora and yeast while the taste is complex. Initial sweetness noted followed by an light alcohol aftertaste. The mouthfeel is lighter than I had expected.  It has a crisp dry finish.
0,33l bottle. A dark brown beer with red highlights. Good head. The aroma has notes of fruits, caramel, chocolate, spices, raisins and brown sugar. The taste is slightly sweet. An awesome beer!

One of the best beer. Its aroma is sweet like candy sigar. One of the best beer of the world. If you want doscover belgium trappist beer : try it. And if you can : go to the poteaupre restaurant. It is near the abbey and you can discover beers and chesses. Good place to be.

330ml bottle. A murky brown body with reddish tones, big latte head with good retention. Aroma of yeast, figs, caramel, old cheese, raisins, alcohol. Taste is caramel sweetness upfront, yeast, raisins, dried berries, alcohol well hidden. Lively carbonated. Late warming effect.

Bottle from Beer Planet, Brussels. Brown hazy beer with a small beige head. Malty, raisins, caramell, chocolate aroma with some nice vanilla notes. Malty, brown sugar, nutty, vanilla, chcoclate flavour. A really nice beer :-)

Bottle at Boru, Brugge (Irish pub to keep the old man happy for a bit!) - 08/07/12.
Mahogony - reddish brown in colouration with a thick khaki head.
Dark malts and yeast on the nose allied to dark berry fruit, raisens and figs.
Sweetish upfront taste, but well balanced so never becomes overbearing, taste continues as nose with a little spice and chocolate thrown in.
Well balanced and complex beer, medium to heavy in body but never becomes chewy.
Dryish finish with a little alcohol warmth.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Beautiful in the trappist glass  . . . dark chesnut roasty taste and look with a big head that really lingers - sugary lacing lingers too. To roasted for me but if you like the bready beers this is a great one to check out. 9.0ABV is well hidden. Will buy again in the late fall/early winter.

Great. The nose is burnt sugar with dark fruits especially in the plum region. The beer is deep brown with a nice syrupy tan head. The beer tastes like sweet dried rasins and cherries with a touch of spice. Smooth medium plus bodied with a long sweet finish.
UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 One of the best beers i have ever tasted, its as close to perfection as you can come.

A Trappist classic--finally time for the review. Ive been drinking this beer periodically for years, from the time I saw it in stores and thought it was French. At hotel in Leuven, so I dont have a proper glass, but this still pours well into a small, clear, plastic cup. Rich, smooth, uniform, big-bubble head. Beer is reddish brown. Combined flavor/palate effect is pretty spicy--probably stemming from the alcohol and the high carbonation level. Has some of the standard Belgian dark aromas and flavors--lots of fruit and funk. The thing with Chimay Blue is that its so balanced--after visiting a lot of other Belgian beers (including every Trappist), its almost simple--but perfectly simple. Really delicate and effervescent. Kind of expands and fills your mouth--the palate is a great feature of this beer. Like other Belgian beers, this is a standard-setter. I think this is my favorite in the Chimay range.

The perfect beer.  Earthy aroma with hints of raisin.  Yeast definitely stands out in this beer and not malt or hops (although extremley well balanced).  Pours with a lovely thick head.  Serve warmer for full experience.

from bottle. brown hazy colour and a one finger head that quickly fades away. malty, fruity (banana) and yeasty aroma. lots of caramel, chocolate and some spicy notes as well. average carbonation, medium body but not the complexity as initially expected. sweet flavours of roasted malt, brown sugar and some nuts. dry finish.  the beer smells better than it tastes and is maybe a bit overrated. however, still a good beer though
Cerveja escura, de aparência imponente, com aroma encorpado e sabor frutado bem marcante

caramel, bread, chocolate, roasty, citrus, dough, earthy, alcohol, banana, bubblegum, clove, vanilla, brown, cloudy, minimal head, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation

My first genuine Trappist Dark - an excellent experience!  Thick brown pour with creamy head, aromas of various dark fruit/choclate/spices (think raisins covered in dark chocolate with a bit of clove/chili spice).  Taste is lightly bitter with caramelly sweetness, and a very substantial mouthfeel.  Finish is malty sweet with a light alcohol touch.  What a great beer!
Dark brown (bottle). Fresh bread nose. Yeast, banana sweet caramel malts. Very good, no hops I could detect.

(bottle)  OK, bottle was chilled a little too low so was allowed to warm slightly.  Poured with a fruity, rich, caramel aroma and Coke colour. Carbonation was fine, but head retention was a little on the low side.  Flavourwise Im getting sweet malt and some spiciness,  vanilla. Ever so slight alcohol warming.  Hops are hardly noticeable in this beer.  
I love it but it could be improved with some head and more yeast character.

Bottle shared by Jeff. Thanks man!

A: Slightly hazy brown color with hints of orange. Moderately sized head with a little lacing.

S: Belgian yeast, scents easily identifiable as a quad, subtle dark fruits, toffee.

T: Chimay is a great brewery and this is a great beer. Heavy Belgian yeast character with notes of dark fruits soaked in alcohol. Raisin and toffee notes are very tasty as well.

M: Moderately high carbonation. Nice feel with a slight note of alcohol in the finish.

D: One of the best quads in the world. I am very glad that this is readily available throughout the country.

cola flavored with a muddy appearance, like a very cold close to icy coke. small creamy fizzy head. lots of foam that wanted to escape the bottle upon opening so not sure about the quality of this specific tap. a lot of smell from the hops with some citrus and grass. tastes from caramel and bread. the huge amount of co2 makes it very fresh and lively. one of the best beers ive had so far.

Dark muddy brown with orange highlights, with two fingers effervescent tan head. Head fades quickly to nothing. Aroma of raisins, old socks, yeast, bread. Flavour is intense. Some raisin and plum on the attack, developing in to a more yeasty, bready, funky flavour on the mid palate. Finish is slightly sweet and medicinal. Nice carbonation, and lovely viscous moth feel. Lots of dark brown flaky sediment left at the bottom of the glass. A great beer, but not really my cup of tea style wise.
A 2012 Blue Chimay. Dark brown, a bit shady. Thick white head.  Complex Belgian style yeast aroma. Strong. 9% ABV. Would probably gain if stored a couple of years (Best before end 2017).
Taken from old notes. Nose of dark fruits with a little sour notes. Taste is toffee with a yeasty finish. Thin mouthfeel and well carbonated.
750 ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a nice white head.  Aromas of caramel, dark roasted sweet malt.  Full bodied with a great comples finish, a classic
Rating to rate it.  I know, boring right, well it had to be done.  This is by far my fav of the three.

Pours chestnut brown with a small off white head, low level champagne like carbonation. Notes of raisins, rich spicy malts and hints of yeast. The flavour profile is quite complex after some initial carbonic bite the mid palate is very smooth with flavours of dark, peppery spicy and an aftertaste of late fig, alcohol is well hidden but the warmth is soon felt.
This aromatic, lively, rich ale has a medium-sweet middle, with gently drier suggestions of thyme, pepper, sandalwood, and nutmeg in the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2012 Bottle poured into included goblet.  Creamy pour, dark-yellowish opaque brown color with off-white head.  Aroma of fruit, malt, caramel and spices.  Taste is yeasty, dried fruits, brown sugar, nuts, some alcohol and bitterness.  Full flavored and complex. Enjoyed!

750 bottle at home. Dark tea color. Creamy off-white head. Nice woodsy aroma. Somewhat fizzy mouthfeel. Somewhat medicine taste. High alcohol flavor. Very good beer, but not my favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle, poured into large tulip style wine glass. Dark amber colour with hints of ruby around the edge, almost opaque, 3 finger tanned head. Belgian yeasty aroma with notes of malt and raspberry. Tasted raspberry, malt, caramel, biscuit, plum and brown sugar. Booze was hidden very well, balanced with a slightly bitter finish. Body was on the thick side of medium, smooth texture with decent carbonation. I was very impressed by the depth of the beer and how well the booze was hidden, but I would not say I was blown away, think it needs a year or 2 to reach full potential..
Strong aroma and sweet, sharp, and crisp taste. Truely one of the best Belgian beers.
Pours creamy and good carbonation, I taste banana, plums, raisins, belgium malt, and just wonderful. One of my all time favorites!!!

Nice dark pour with a little bit of brown. I felt the taste was bland. Nothing to flavorful, slightly smooth for a 9% beer, but not any real flavor either. For my first corked beer, it wasnt anything great.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2016 Bottle (33 cL). Pours opaque dark yellowish brown with medium off-white head. Aroma is caramel, malt, honey, wet earth, copper and allspice. Hints of alcohol. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet. Body is oily with lively carbonation. Finish is sweet, bitter and metallic with notes of caramel, licorice, plum, apple, raisin and hints of coffee.

pours a deep ruby colour with a lingering off white head.plenty of fruity malt in the aroma which is magnified in the flavour along with some pleasant yeasty flavours. cant believe i waited this long to try one.

Bottle. Pours a dark red color with a fizzy off white head. Aroma is of dried dark fruits, nutty notes, caramel, toffee, some grape notes, brown sugar, Belgian yeasty esters too. Flavor follows the nose with lots of yeast esters, the brown sugar, dried dark fruits, nutty notes, caramel, toffee and grapes. The body is medium with a fizzy and dry mouth feel. Overall a tasty Trappist classic.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy caramel with medium head.  Aroma of yeast and raisins.  The flavor is more complex, with rich caramel malts, dark fruits, and Belgian yeast.  Mouthfeel is a bit carbonated at first, but gets very nice after a few minutes in the glass.  A very nice Trappist ale.

On small bottle from Vinmonopolet, Økerm.
Dark color, some foam.
malte aromas and dreid fruit- Nice yeast.
Good carbonation
Full body and high complexity.
Sweetness, but balanced with some bitterness , complexity & carbonation.
Very enjoyable

First really good beer I ever had, when I was 16. Very malty, lots of dried fruit, maybe some nuts, and a mild but certainly there alcohol flavor as well. This is the beer that got me into beer, and I still enjoy it thoroughly.

Hazy chestnut/mahogany pour with creamy tan head and a little lacing. Very active carbonation,  nose offers a hint of toasted malts, yeast and fruit. Deep fruity, yeasty, nutty with boozy back. Lingering bitter finish with a hint of booze.

A classic Belgian strong but definitely not my favorite.

Red-brown with plenty of carbonation and head. Smells and tastes of lots of malt and fruit. Some yeast. Finish has a fair amount of bitterness. A very full flavored beer, but not too heavy on the tongue. Very good.
330 ml bottle pour. Muddy brown, small beige head. Banana, figs, alcohol in the aroma. Taste the same with delicious Belgian yeast, plums, raisins. Fantastic.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2012 Bouteille 750ml (Grande réserve). 2011. Couleur brun ambré, mousse crème laissant une belle dentelle. Bonne effervescence. Arôme fruité (pêche?), de levure, un petit quelque chose de métallique. Goût fruité, de malt, de grains (orge?). Excellente!

0.75L bottle, 2010 vintage.  Definitely a chimay, a little more bitter than I remember.  Melon aroma, "muddy" taste, alcoholic at the end.  Lots of sediment, a little bitter and not as sweet as the normal Blue, which I love.

This is my favorite of the 3 (Red, White, Blue). Pours hearty dark copper-brown. Mild eggshell head that fades, but leaves a lasting lace. Aroma is a bit mild, but hints of toast, brandy, and alcohol. Palate is bold, dark fruit, figs, caramel, plums, balanced alcohol bite. Easy drinker for a big beer. Very tasty brew.

330ml bottle. Dark brown with huge white head that gets bigger and bigger. Aroma has lot of fresh yeast. The frothy head keep getting bigger in the glass and keeps forthing in your mouth. Flavor is well balanced with yeast, caramel and citrus. Overwhelming.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2015 33 cl. botle @ ome, bought @ MItra. Pours brown with a dense off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits and caramel. Despite its heavy ABV its surprisingly fresh and fruity. One of the many classic Belgian beers and also one of the best.

Pours brown with a one finger head. Smells of Caramel malt with, floral and dark fruits (Very pleasant). When let to warm up a touch this beer is brilliant, with plenty of malts and fruityness for the taste buds. Was not disappointed with this beer in the slightest, very good beer!

Bottle, pours dark ruby with big head. Aroma is dark fruits, figs, caramel, coke, spicies. Medium carbon, medium mouthfeel, long sugary aftertaste, medium-high sweetness, low bitterness.
Nice!
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2012 Perfect beer for me, just done right. Rich aroma, creamy and full taste. If your pour it to glass then u already know that u have bought the right beer:)
Little more punch than the red, full body, nice kick. A dangerously tasty venture.
Bottle at royal mile in desire moines...has a good twang to it..very strong...some fruit

Poured from 330 ml bottle at Yangshuo Village Retreat in Yangshuo, China. 

Nearly opaque, very dark brown with 3-finger tan head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of dark fruits, cherry, brown sugar roasted malt and alcohol. 

Taste of sweet dark fruits, cherry brown sugar, roasted malt and alcohol. 

Full body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep root beer brown with a very short lived tan head. No lacing noted. The aroma is a combination of flora and yeast while the taste is complex.  Initial sweetness noted followed by an alcohol aftertaste. The mouthfeel is medium-light, with a crisp dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

An excellent aroma with perfect (not too strong) floral tones. The taste is distinctly Belgian, if a little mild. Very good beer, but with other Strong Belgian Ales that I have recently tasted, I believe this is going to fall out of my top 5.

Dark ruby red pour with a small beige head and lace. Aromas of malt, dark fruit, toffee, vinous. Meaty and bursting with flavour. Initially bitter and spicy. Sweet from the fruit and toffee. Chimay Blue has real red wine qualities and is just another belter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
My favorite winter beer - classic trapist with caramael and some chocolate back taste.
Great beer! I tasted this beer firstly in Belgium. Nice taste and great aroma. My favourite from Belgium!

This beer is one of the best, not specifically due to its overall quality, but its consistent quality as a well balanced beer.  The deep spicy, caramel and aged fruit flavors are perfectly symmetric to one another which creates a distinct flavor which is hard to pass up.

This is not a hoppy beer by any stretch which is most likely due to the amount of malt and adjuncts used when making this beer.  Any hops would most likely er towards the resin, herbal and spruce spectrum.
Nice concept of the apperance "blue chimay, red chimay etc" great taste. Good percentage of alcohol sweet aromas. Conclusion: its a beer that deserves the name of a trapistbeer.

Bought in Carrefour supermarket Valencia Spain with a good price. Drunk at room temperature so lots of bubbles. Aroma has that classic Dubbel Belgian invoking monks working. But it is a yeasty, unique Belgian aroma, best drunk in wintertime around a fire. Appearance is opaque dark brown. A strong strong beer with a unique slightly bitter yeasty taste, smooth, rolls around your mouth, to be sipped and savoured especially in warm weather. Has a faun coloured head, always good. Not up there with the Rochefort 10s, but a very good drink for cold days

Pours a hazy amber with a miniscule head. Very light lacing. Nightmarish bready scent, laced with a touch of cola and pine. Overweening lemony taste, maybe a little molasses and chocolate. Non-descript mouthfeel and long finish.
Caramel and molasses aroma.  Also rich and chocolatey taste.  Awesome beer.  Highly recommended.
De las mejores del mundo y siempre lo será. Chimay Azul nunca decepciona. Imprescindible.
Pour out of 22oz bomber.  Palate slightly fizzy.  Otherwise, excellent taste, appearance, and aroma.  I shared this bottle at a dinner.  It nicely complemented my steak.

Poured in a stemmed pilsner. Dark brown in color and a bit hazy. Ample head formation which settles down to thin layer. Little lacing. Aromas of fruity esters with light caramel raisin and a hint of spice. Seems a bit light on the nose. Flavors of caramel, raisin, plum abound with a spiciness mixed in. Mouthfeel is medium and smooth with light carbonation. Overall this is an excellent Trappist ale, but not as deep as some other offerings. 

--- Cheers
From the bottle. Dark reddish brown, malty and chocolatey, spicy and delicious. Head hung around for ages. Develops as it heats up. A total classic.

If every beer tasted like this  than 
you are probebly in heaven. 
Great smell and lots of alcohol. Simply loving it.
One of the best trappist. A great dark colored bear with a foamy white head. Very nice bitter touch at the ending.

Vintage 2003 bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours muddy dark dark brown almost black with a very low off white head which quite quickly disappears
Aromas of oak, plums, port, burned brown sugar
Taste is ... Wow! Portwine like without the thickness. Round edges, low xarbonation. Cherries are there aswell. Ending is nice but the years might have taken some of the edge away
Beautiful tasting beer from the moment it is popped you can immediately smell the aroma, even with a sniff you can angel it is going to taste amazing

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 2nd May 2010Hazy dark red-brown beer. Frothy off white head. Light airy palate, soft and frothy. Rich malt with a little chocolate in the undertone and a splash of coca cola. Finishes soft and dry with a whisper of brandy and spice. A classic brew for good reasons. 21st February 2008A 1982 bottle. Slightly flat palate. Nice Porty tones over a malty background that bring subtle chocolate. Nicely aged.
Ottima birra dal sapore deciso e dalla grande corposità. Molto più godibile se accompagna un pasto
Vraiment bonne, mais suis pas le plus fan... pas mon premier choix, mais si il ny a que ça, alors :-)
Very dark brown with a big kinda white head. Smells of dark fruits, bown sugar and alcohol. pretty bitter at the end.

A very angry bottle from Purvis that started frothing and spouting out foam as soon as I opened it. It had been sitting around all day so not sure why.

Huge thick head with good retention and lacing, very large amount of head with only a mild pour. Deep dark brown colour.

Sugar along with alchohol and soap on the nose, but not in an unpleasant way. Rich roast malt palate with very strong caramel flavours barging in randomly. That caught me off guard and was very exciting.

My favorite Belgium ale.   Great taste but even more than that,  there is something different about this beer that always leaves me feeling very relaxed.   I drink Chimay when I want a nice chilled out night..

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 Bottle from
Nyc and again several times thereafter. Good balance and taste with bit of malt at the end. Some molasses and yeast mixed in too. Good monk work. 

---Rated via my mouth

33cl bottle. Pours deep hazy chestnut brown with thick tan head - lots of thick lacing. Aroma is floral, dark fruits, spicy yeast complexity, sweet banana, clove, apricot. Taste is full of dark fruit - figs, plums, dates - clove, lightly roasted malt, floral notes, lively yeast complexity that dances on the tongue - perfect carbonation. Very full mouthfeel - carries the complexity of the flavours perfectly. This is one magestic beer.
Amber colored beer with white normal head. Surprising level of fruitiness and floweriness for a Trappist both in aroma and taste. Also taste of malt while ending is very smooth.

Pours a murky light brown with a large off-white head and good lacing.  Scents of yeast and a touch of flowers, with caramel coming out in the taste.  Good balanced sweet flavor with a creamy body and moderate carbonation.

En cuanto a aroma, ésta cerveza me quedó a deber. No se si haya sido solamente la que me tome y corresponda a un mal cuidado, pero realmete esperaba mucho más. Notas a cafe y chocolate, vainilla, madera, canela y tonos importantes a malta y levadura.

En cuanto a apariencia, simplemente perfecta. Color obscuro, carbonatación ligera, cuerpo redondo, espuma abundante, burbujas finas y densidad cremosa.

En Boca, Perfecta!!! Cremosa, elegante, estructurada. Ligeras notas a cafe y vainilla y ligeras notas a canela.

Al paladar, los aromas y los primeros sabores en boca, se multiplican. Chocolate, vainilla y canela principalmente.  Una cremosidad impresionante, que no empalaga y que te deja con ganas de beber una más.

En general, una excelente cerveza. Una autentica abadía que se disfruta intensamente y que definitivamente no deja sentir su fuerte potencia alcohólica.

Brown copper with thick head. Wonderful light fruit and yeast. Absolutely. Fantastic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is perfect as well as its appereance. The taste is strong and a little acid in the end! The palate does not stand too much. Lacks intensity. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Colore rosso bruno con schiuma beige chiaro medio-bassa. Aroma leggermente pungente con sentori di frutta candita, lievito, Porto e zucchero di canna. Gusto mediamente dolce e parzialmente fruttato con una lieve punta di acidulo, nel finale diventa leggermente più asciutta con un retrogusto delicato di pane e frutta secca. Birra morbida e non eccessivamente corposa, ben bilanciata e con uneffervescenza gentile.

330ml bottle. Cloudy dark amber colour with average to huge firm frothy lacing off-white head. Fruity aroma has red and dark berries, floral, yeasty and hay notes. Fruity taste has well balanced sweet and tart fruit notes, berries again, a decent roasty malt touch; lasting finish sustains dry and floral notes, even a slightly sweet fruity touch.
This is on of my favourite beers for over 20 years now. I had it once from a 300cl Doppelmagnum bottle, which was the best experience concerning texture - perfectly smooth and soft, though lively carbonated.

Bottle(s). 2003 vs 2012 vintage. 
Appearance: 2003: Almost clear, deep brown liquid with very small brown head. 3
 2012: Same liquid but much bigger head. 4
Aroma: 2003: Port, dark fruits (plums, raisins), light vinegar (?), brown sugar, chocolate. 8
2012: Much sweeter with lots of brown sugar, banana (belgo yeast esters), dark fruits, some alcohol, bread, biscuity malt, caramel, nuts. 7
Taste: 2003: Light sweet and light bitter with some very light tartness with notes of brown sugar and port. 8
2012: Sweeter and more fruity with same bitterness with notes of dark fruits, banana. Much more "belgo". 7 
Palate: About the same in both but higher carbonation in the newer one. Medium bodied with soft carbonation (though 2012 is almost a bit spritzy).
Overall: Enjoyed the older one more than the younger. Still, nice balanced and velvety belgo ale.
Hazy burnt orange colour. Dried currents, malt and vanilla on the nose. Rich, deep flavour - slightly sweet. Wood, fruit and caramel coming through too.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2012 Bottle 33cl, 2003. Pours dark amber with a small light brown head. Aroma of raisins, dates and frowst. Lots of dried fruits in the taste, root cellar. Low carbonation, med-full body. Great beer when matured!

Bottle.  Dark brown pour, a long lasting disc of carbonation and an aroma of clove, banana and rich malt.  Flavor is also clove, a little too effervescent, rich malt with a hint of brown sugar and rich and bready.  Solid, but there are other beers which are better and cheaper.

330 ml bottle. Pours a frothy dark brown with full head. Classic aromas of roasted malt, fruit, and brown sugar. Creamy and rich. Flavors of malts, toffee, and dark spices. Warm, dry finish. A great beer.
Hazy burnt orange colour. Dried currents, malt and vanilla on the nose. Rich, deep flavour - slightly sweet. Wood, fruit and caramel coming through too.
Many flavors here that are fighting for attention. Dried fruits, toffee, caramel and a pleasant bitterness. Recommended!

Hazy Brown, cloudy,  lovely full and persistent head, firm bubbles. Yeast, caramel and fruits (figs) on the palate its broad, creamy full on with good length and well integrated bubbles which refresh nicely, add weight  and volume.
Lovely!!

An old favourite, from long before my beer interest reached its current level, its nice to notice this one still is as good as I remember it from the late 90s when esp0r and I discovered the excitement outside of Lagerland.
Dark brown, good tanned head. Warm aroma of dark fruits, malts, vanilla. Really complex taste of dried fruits, alcohol, spice, yeast and flowers. Good aroma, with just the right level of carbonation - lasting sweet finish

Bottle shared with (and courtasy of) Inbreak and ClubGonzo. Vintage 2007. Pours a hazy brown colour with a small beige head. Nice sweet aromas of dried fruit, wood, leather, fudge, port and a hint of alcohol. In the flavour I find leather, dried fruit, coffee and some anis and something salty (licorice). Light bitterness, and slick but a bit watery mouthfeel. The beer has a good aroma but feels a bit thinner in the taste.

Pours dark brown-amber with a thick creamy-smooth tan head. Sweet malt, yeast, some spices and some dark fruits on the aroma. Roasted malt, caramel, dark fruits (probably plums), yeast and spice. A little alcohol at the finish. Smooth and balanced beer with complex taste. Great beer.

Excellent beer that you must try. It has smell of dark fruits, cherries, malt and yeast. Its medium, creamy and has great carbonation. Smooth and rich beer that tastes like mild cherry, belgian yeast and caramel. 9% alc didnt feel so much.
Great beer!

Aroma is plums, prunes, raisins, smoky malts, caramel, metallic hops and booze. Taste is plenty of caramel, cocoa, roasted malts, sugar, raisins and plums, spicy and a bit nutty. A bit of metallic hops with a liitle sour funk. Palate is medium with tons of carbonation. Very rich, smooth and complex. Very, very well done.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2012 Oh my goodness, ladies and gentlemen.  This gem pours to an amazing head and lacing with a beautiful dark copper color.  Intoxicating scent - plum, mandarin, banana, yeast, floral, pure bliss.  Suppose it could be a tad stronger, but still.  Flavors - candy apple, banana, malt, booze, grapefruit, heaven.  Lingering lip-licking complexity.  One of the greatest beers to ever grace mankind.  DECEMBER RE-RATE: As I have branched out more, I see more flaws with beers I once thought were Teh Ultimate, and this includes the beloved Chimay, so I must downrate a little.  Sometimes, it is a weaker apple drink than what I described earlier.  At its ideal state, though, its certainly one of the best.
Very well balanced, but nothing about it stands out as spectacular. Some raisin and dried fruit flavors mixed with a little herbiness. A tasty and very solid beer thats been overhyped.

Roasty and malty. Slightly yeasty plum raisin flavor. Overly carbonated for my taste. Nice dark caramel color

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 oz. bottle, labeled as Chimay Peres Trappistes Ale with a blue label. Doughy aroma features banana bread, brownie, oatmeal raisin cookie, caramel, and peach scents with a bit of lemon. Pours a ruby-tinted opaque, cloudy, medium brown with a moderate amount of short-lasting beige head. Produces some short-lasting, sporadic lacing. The liquid is appealing, but the head and lacing dont impress. Sweet, malty taste matches the aroma. Toffee, brown sugar, and milk chocolate flavors. Complex and classy taste. Dry finish and light dry aftertaste. Medium body. Fizzy in the palate. Easy to drink initially but becomes filling. Chimay Blue is a well balanced, sophisticated, subtle, and very good beer.
Årgång 1999, brödigt, otroligt vad som kan hända med ett öl som får stå till sig några år.
Bottle 75cl. into tulip. Pours a nice amber with medium head. Complex fruity aroma and complex yeast and fruit taste. Very clean finish with moderate duration.

Bubbly brown body and huge beige head. Tasty looks. Doughy, nutmeg, dried fruit and candy sugar. Smooth body, very Belgian and a bit rough. Drank this fresh bit will try some aged bottles later. Brewed with care. Enough balancing hops. Funny how I never rated this... Very well made. (33cl bottle, cheap)

Bottle 0.33 L.
Cluudy dark brown body with a huge, creamy, off-white head, mostly lasting with an good lacing; moderate density of tiny particles.
Intense malty aroma (toasted) with a strong character of wine; notes of red fruits (plums) and alcoholic spices are also quite evident.
Malty and fruity sweetness in the flavour; the alchoolic feeling, though evident, does not disturb too much.
Medium body with an oily texture; soft carbonation; light alcoholic feeing in the finish.
Very good beer!

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2012 Aroma is bread, cookie dough, and candy sugar.  The sugar part is more like the toasty glaze on a creme brulee.  The appearance is dark brown with a quickly fading head and a great deal of particulate suspended in the brew.  The taste is very sweet with no significant hop bitterness.  Slightly thick mouthfeel and minimal carbonation.  Overall, I have to say that I just discovered "dessert beer".  Would be very interesting to try with tiramisu, creme brulee, or a custard-based dessert.  This is however, one of the most over-rated beers of all time. Be sure not to serve it to cold as the flavor comes out slightly above fridge temperature.
A very strong and blanaced Belgian flavour. One of the quality flagship beers from the country

330ml bottle.Malty, herbal, caramel and yeast aromas. Pours dark brown, with nice tan head, persistant, good lacewrok. Medium to full body and average carbonation.Taste is sweet, some caramel, herbal,  and malty. Alcohol well hidden. Have been drinking this one for many years, being my fav for a long time.

From BA: 2nd October 2007: The night of the Chimay in my front room. All three beers to be drank in one session. Red, White and Blue, the colours of the Union Jack .

This blue labelled 33cl bottle with its best before date of 2012 was taken with a whole round of Chimay cheese, also with the blue label. Both bought in Belgium on a resent visit.

Poured into my Forbidden Fruit chalice glass, it looked fine, I ensured the whole bottle including the sediment got into the glass.

Dark and a little cloudy, because of my pouring, the off white head didnt hang around, pity.

Although some BAs can smell the scent of a randy fox from half a mile, I struggle to smell my own farts sometimes, so it is not suprising that all I can smell is burnt malts and plums in this fine beer.

The taste however is easier to detect, a good blend of malt and plum fruits are there for all to find, this is a flavoursome beer and the 9% alcohol doesnt kill the intermix of quality products this beer is obviuosly made from, allowing them to infuse without ruining them.

A very good beer indeed, the cheese from the Monks also helped to intensify the flavours, try them together if you ever get the chance.
Very dark brown/red color. Aroma has a scent of caramel/chocolate, reflects on the taste as well, leaves a long taste on the tongue. Good beer!
i dont get to drink this much living in mississippi, but i Fn love it. its good..............................................

Cloudy brown with small light brown head.  Aroma sweet and malty, dark bread, yeast.  Full body but drinkable, small amount of carbonation and alcohol.  Complex flavors of malt, brown sugar, some sweetness but not too sweet, dark fruits, roastiness.  Finish slightly on the more bitter side which keeps it drinkable.  Maybe a few of the other belgian quads are a little better but a great beer in its own right.
Long time ago I drank this, have to open the bottle I keep in the cellar again. Nice beer, but doesnt distingues from other Belgian beers. Bit ground taste. (Velp 201201)
This beer is very nice, but I dont know that it lives up to its hype as THE Belgium beer.

Corked and caged bottle. Dark brown color with medium beige head.   Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit and some spice.  Flavor of slight roasted malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruit (mostly plums), and spice.  There is some alcohol at the finish. Nicely balanced and moderately complex.  Overall, quite nice.

Bottle 330 ml. Pours hazy brown with a light beige head, fully diminishing. Not much lacing. Aroma is very complex and includes roasted malt, fruits (bananas?) , flower and spices. Taste is sweet and well balanced. Very spicy. Intense carbonation. 
Bouteille 30 ml. Robe brune, léger collet beige non persisitant. Pas vraiment de lacing. Arome complexe incluant du malt rôti, des fruits, des feleurs et des épices. Le goût est sucré et bien balancé. Très épicée en bouche. Carbonatation intense.

Chimay bleue, un mythe, appelé Grande Réserve en bouteille de 75 cl.
On titre ici à 9 % abv, mais on est bien plus chaud dans le coeur..
Il faut dire que cette bière a toujours attiré le respect et ladmiration des
personnes qui la connaissent, et lextraordinaire joie et allégresse de
ceux qui la découvrent.
Les céréales sont lorge bien sûr mais aussi le froment.
Couleur marron foncé avec une belle mousse beige, juste ce quil faut
pour napper ce breuvage divin.
Volume extrêmement soyeux. 
Arômes superbes de marron, châtaigne et une pointe de chêne.
1er goût de terre brûlée et marrons grillés, à la fois très fin et ample.
2ème goût damandes grillées, avec une pointe de poivre et de girofle.
3ème nez dun brassin sacré, avec des fruits mûrs, des pruneaux.
3ème goût sur léquilibre de saveurs, dune grande délicatesse avec 
bien sûr une chaleur due à la teneur alcoolique, mais qui agit plutôt 
comme un soutien et une structuration des diverses saveurs.
Superbe, voire grandiose. Un véritable symbole de ce que doit être
une vraie bière dabbaye, avec toute les nuances que peut apporter
le savoir-faire trappistin.
La longueur sannonce déjà savoureuse et régulière.
La levure est teintée de douceur et de classe.
La finale ne peut se définir que comme sublime, et pour ceux qui
acceptent les superlatifs : sublimissime.
Question finale : qui peut coter cette bière en dessous de 5 ?
Pour moi, ma note est de 330 sur 100 (identique à ma note sur la 
trappiste Rochefort 8 qui est en fait de 9,2 abv, donc très proche 
de cette Chimay bleue). 
Que vivent longtemps ces deux bières... Amen.
Hard to separate the beer from the reputation.  The mouthfeel is soft but the tiny carbonation highlights the spice.  The carbonation defines this beer for me, and the style.  Fruity, spicy and euro.

Bottle. The pour is deep slightly hazy brown color with a big, light brown head. The nose is yeasty, nutty fruits, port wine. Decadent fruitcake. This reminds me of christmas morning. The taste follows the noses lead. I get dark grapes, cherries, dark fruits and spirits. Spicy bread malts. Full body. The finish is slightly hot. Full bodied. Active carbonation. Overall, really nice, dependable. Very good.

Just what beer is all about. From start to finish you close your eyes and get a lesson in what palate really means. If you havent tried it, just do. Its brews like this that prove the top beer can be just as good as the 10 000 dollar bottles of wine... buy as many as you can now, before the beer world starts getting posers buying these up to show off.

This grand cru of one of Belgiums largest trappist breweries is quite deserving of its representative, blue label! This brew pours heavily effervescent and volatile. Letting off the typical aromas of a Belgian strong ale, this brew fits well into its genre. From the viewpoint of an American craft drinker, this genre has been defined by slightly less expensive brews like Delirium or St. Bernardus ales; both of which are incredible breweries however, fail to truly embrace the hoary muskiness that embodies trappist brews like Rochefort, Westy, and Chimay. 

Enjoy this one...Its complex and delicious yet still leaves an hop-head like myself wanting. Next time you have some great friends over, share this brew in a trappist glass!
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2012 Dark pour, nice head. Floral hoparomas, roses, malt and dried fruits. Bitter-sweet finish with a spicy aftertaste.
Had this beer at the 4th Annual Casanova Beer Cave Festival. Nice sweet fruit/wine scent, boozy finish.

750ml bottle. Pours kind of a prune juice colour with a large off white head. Aroma is dark red fruits and musty yeast. Fruits, molasses, spices and yeast are well balanced in the taste, not too much booze comes through. Texture is quite thick. Overall, it is a bit of a rough ride for the lager drinker. A sipping beer for sure, but of excellent quality.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2013 Dark amber colour with a light brown head. Aroma of roast, banana, cinnamon. Quite sweet and fruity taste, light sourness and bitterness. quite good carbonation, medium body. A very nice beer.

Pours a deep amber color with a foamy tan head and some lacing.  The aroma has lots of yeast and spices with a bit of citrus. The flavor is light but complex, with spice, hops, lots of lightly roasted malt and a bit of yeast, along with a caramel-sweet aftertaste.
Color is a dark amber or reddish brown. Nice medium foamy head. Aroma is sweet.  Yeasty, malty, dark fruity... Some burned sugar. Flavor is sweet and yeasty, fruity and a bit bitter too.

Deep dark brown poor with very slight off white head.  Nice warm feeling after a few sip/gulps that warm the cheeks straingt away.
The taste is mellow with slight kicks 2nd to the high Alc and light carbonation at the end of every sip.  
A sneaky enjoyable beer.
Who wouldnt want to be a monk in Belgium!
Pours a hazy brown color with an off-white head. Aroma is malty with dark fruits and spices. Taste is very similar. Finishes clean. Medium bodied.

Aroma: Nuts and malt, hit is of a sweet desert bread. 

Appearance: deep hazy orange, quite dark almost black. light almond head

taste: fruit and nuts, fantastic lingering sweet notes

palate: very easy to drink, nice thickness and carbonation

Overall: fantastic. you could pair it with just about any high quality produce for a fantastic treat
330ml bottle. Brown amber body. Sweet and fruity (apple, banana(?)) aroma and taste. Full body. Great aftertast!

pours a dark amber to brown color.  the head sticks around for a while.   The aroma is sweet, grassy, yeasty.  The flavor is sweet, with a bit more bitterness that i would expect, along with yeast flavor, fruit, and grass.  The palate is a heavier body with a alcohol warming feel doing down.  overall this is pretty good.

This was first belgian beer I rated - really big surprise. Excellent beer, strong and I had to be carefull of alcohol because I wanted to drink and drink and... Taste is really good, medium-bitter and balanced. Excellent foam, stays on top after couple of minutes. Dark colour. Im sure Ill buy it once again, every time Ill see it.

Bottle 330 ml. Appearance: Dark amber, almost brown. Medium beige head and good lacing. Aroma: Spices, dark fruits, raisins, plum, bready aroma, sugar. Taste: Medium sweetness, spices and dark fruits. Warming alcohol. Medium duration of the aftertaste. Overall: Exactly what I look for in a belgian strong ale: great complexity, good balance, strong presence and good aging potential.

Pours with an average sized head for the style, a little rocky. Medium brown with lots of red hue and medium bodied appearance. Aroma is sweet with yeast, a little fruity or flowery. Medium palate feel with a mild finish with heavy carbonation. Taste is malty with yeast and just a touch bitter.

Thats not the first time I drink it. But the first time I sit down and rate it.
It pours deep red with a medium foam head.
Indeed this is a great nose: malty, yeasty, like all big Belgians.
In mouth, thats OK, but a bit short, then Argh! Acetate, stripper-like flavours come, awful! Then that sweet aftertaste and sour agressive volatile acidity hurts my nose.
I probably had it from a wrong batch , too bad!
Ill try it another time.
Everything you ever wanted from Belgian beer and even something more. The best Chimay and one of the best beers I think.
Bottle at home.  Brown pour with a big tan head.  Aroma of plum, raisins, caramel.  Dark fruit flavor also with caramel and raisins.  Alcohol warmth in the finish.  Lovely beer.

A good beer for sure. However, if you have had any other Belgian beer, this is not the best around. St. Bernardus ABT 12 is better. Anyway, aroma is great, taste is great, appearance is like a Belgian should appear. Cant go wrong with it though.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2012 Small bottle from bierzwerg. Poured to chimay chalice, dark amber colour with 2 finger head. Aroma is  cherry. Flavour is sweet, nutty, raisin, malty. Pairs nicely with chimay grand cru cheese.

Niente da aggiungere se non che questa é una grande birra. Meno fruttata e piú decisa di altre trappiste. mi piace molto la semplicit,á i sentori di malto tostato e di caramello e la tonalitá alcolica decisa ma non invadente. ottima.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2012 25.4 oz. Bottle. Cork dated 10/11, drank 06/04/12. Strong spicy scent, cinnamon, grapefruit, and coriander. Beautiful dense brown with frothy head. Medium silky palate with a fizzy finish. Sweet caramel fronted taste that fades to a hot cinnamon spice and a slightly bitter bready dough finish with a hot touch. A winner over and over.
I love this beer at ambient temperature. It has a heavy yeast taste that yields to a rosy note on the tongue. Trappist beers are among my all time favorites.

Awesome beer, a classic. The aroma is caracteristic from Abbey beers, smells alcool and caramel, also has a big caramel taste also a little bit fruity I like the warm taste that this beer has. It  has a dark brown robe.
 A must, not my favorite Trappist beer but a real classic.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 Aroma is zoete cake, kaneel en rozijnen. Smaak is wat peperig, koffie en weer cake. Carbonisatie is behoorlijk.
#2 koffie smaak is wat minder, of het moet dat licht zurige zijn van oude koffie, maar de drie elementen van de eerste rating staat met wat rozijnen. Aroma is fijntjes, niet uitgesproken om het wat negatiever neer te zetten. Zelfde rating van dit bier van klassieke brouwerij.

A deep brown with ruby port notes and a good finger of creamy white head that sat like a carpet across the top of the beer. Aromas of fruit leather, leather and fruitcake liberally dosed with dark rum. More complex caramels, cinnamon and allspice become evident upon nosing. In addition to that, theres an almost armpit wild yeast character along with some basement mustiness (although not in a bad way). 
Upon tasting that fruitcake character is foremost along with orange juice and then a return to the mature spiciness. A merry dance along the tastebuds indeed.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2012 Appearance: murky dark amberish brown. lively tan head, disappearing quite quickly and leaving no lacing. Aroma: bread caramel and raisins. Taste: medium sweetness with warm and toasty malt finish. Palate: full, creamy, lively body. Nice beer, but would recommend others in this category before recommending chimay blue.

Appearance:  Dark reddish-brown, with a beige head that fully diminishes and leaves little lacing.
Aroma: Plum, raisin, caramel, black pepper, chocolate. Very well balanced.
Taste : Sweetness is a little more muted then in other abbey ales i have tried, but definitely present. Very little alcohol taste. 
Palate : Medium/full body, lively carbonation, smooth texture, with a soft, warming finish.
Delicious Belgian brew. Had it in a big bottle, and the taste didnt disappoint. Not strong flavored or boozy by any means but just what Id expect from a solid Belgian ale.

Big bottle.  Poured a hazy brown color with full head.  Aroma has strong presence of belgium yeast, candy, slight raisin, coriander.  Med light sweetness, light bitter.  Dry finish.  Champaign like carbonation. Had this many times before and its always a winner.
Not a session beer. It should be served cold in a challace. Perfect bubbly carbonation and excellent flavor. Ultra expensive though. Saving up for the massive bottle ive seen of this sold.

Pours a dark brown with aromas of dark fruits, spices, nuts faint cinnamon and caramel-malts. Taste of brown sugar, nutmeg, nuts, caramelmalts, spices, rasins, prunes, plums and a slight warming alcohol. Nice beer, but a little hyped by my tastes.
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 I think this beer is a little overrated. Dont get me wrong it tastes good and is complrx but for the price there are better beers out there
One of the best beers for me. Perfect in everything.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2012 (First Taste, Home, 330mL Bottle, Vintage Sept. 2011, Tulip, 9% ABV, Cellar Temp, 04/04/12. #34.)


Appearance (4/5): Pours a dark, muddy reddish-brown (Dr. Pepper?), with a creamy, light brown, two finger head that fully diminishes and leaves little lacing. A little sediment.

Aroma (8/10): Plum, raisin, florals, toffee, black pepper, cloves, wood, earth, chocolate, and licorice. Very complex yet nothing really dominates. Well balanced and sophisticated.

Taste (8/10): Begins with sweet plums, raisin, toffee, and chocolate, which dies off to reveal a very soft, earthy bitterness that fills the mouth and lasts for quite a while. Sweetness is a little more muted then in other abbey ales i have tried, but definitely present. Very little alcohol taste.

Palate (4/5): Medium/full body, lively carbonation, smooth and slightly dry texture, with a soft, warming finish.

Overall (17/20): Extremely good beer, but something keeps me from rating it higher... Very soft and very well blended; I guess this beer "relaxes" me with its excellence, but other Trappists "excite" me with theirs.

 Drinkability: 2/5. Character: 5/5. Buy Again: Yes.
Some people don´t like this type of beer, but I do. Has a nice subtle sweetness in it together with the well balanced bitterness.
Loved it. At first i thought it was too sweet but the flavor is exceptional
Bottle - very big thick head, dark amber color, nice Belgian yeasty aroma and taste, with sweet malt and fruity flavors - definitely more fruit flavor than I expected - excellent beer though!

Sweet, spicy hops is first noticed on the nose. Then plums. Brittle. I also get Weizen-like aromas (clove and banana), but in a more sweet-alcoholic way than in a typical Hefe-Weizen. (more like in a dark strong weizenbock).

There is definitively some alcohol warmth here, but its quite well hidden. Belgian yeast makes its way through and creates caractheristic fruitiness towards raisins and plums. Not as much Weizen-fruitiness in the taste as in the aroma. Sweetness, fruit and some alcohol dominate the finish.

The beer is highly carbonated, and it feels distinctively creamy in texture. Dark, rich and powerful, but still a fairly drinkable ale for the ABV strength. This is my first try on a classic Dark Strong Belgian Ale, and I can honestly say that this wont be the last!

bouteille 75cl, verre trappist.
Arome de caramel, chocolat, raisin et dalcool. 
Brun maron avec un bon collet beige. 
Gout moyennement amer et un peu sucré, bon mélange des deux.
Liquoreux.

Dark and sweet-smelling. Tastes like it looks/smells... sweet, malty, and pf raisins. Nice mouthfeel, similar aftertaste to Kasteel Donker perhaps? Not sure why I dismissed this beer previously, its delicious (and available in Waitrose!)

.----.            .----.
 {O}              {O}
          \    /
          \   /
         (.    )
                 
       

---Rated via Beerology
Yeasty aroma with dried fruits and caramel. Nice mouth feel with taste similar to the nose. Finish is slightly bitter and boozy. Very nice.

How have I not rated this one yet?! Not much to say that hasnt already been said. Loads of dark fruit and yeast on the nose. Flavor is similar with a light molasses tone. Awesome. A world class brew that is readily available. Nice.

1 pint 9.4 oz bottle poured into a wine goblet.  Pours a cooper brown color with a beautiful thick off-white almost tan head. It has the aroma of fruitcake, bread, leather, yeast & a little banana & floral aroma. It tastes of resin, bread, raisins, smoke, vanilla and fruit. This is a very easy beer to drink but is still complex. This is a wonderful beer. I love that you can buy this at Costco!
Chocolate pour with a thin tan head.  Yeast, raisin, bread aroma.  Apple, molasses, and spice taste.  A great beer you can always find.
Bonne bière à boire au coin du feu un régal depuis toujours avec quelques morceaux de fromage de chimay
Chocolate brown. Poured from a 33cl. Brandy and toasted brioche nose. Perfect weight and balance in the mouth. Yeasty palate with a slightly roasted nutty character. A hint of banana on the finish.

Drank a glass in le Roy d'espagne in Brussels. Great flavor and smooth aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tutti sulla blu! Enormemente pubblicizzata e "sopravvalutata". Io preferisco la bianca, molto più complessa. Resta il fatto che conservata a lungo questo nettare raggiunge doti artistiche elevate. Speziata con un tocco di mandorle e leggermente amarognola nel finale. E buona anche appena comprata ovviamente.

dark chocolate brown color, good head. Lots of raisins, chocolate, fruitcake in the nose and taste. Creamy body, quite chewy. delicious. 
Not sure why I do not have any in my cellar as just improves and deepens over time

33 cl bottle.  One of more attractive beers youll ever set eyes on - pours a deep, dark chocolate brown.  Cloudy with sediment and a thick, foamy head.  Aroma of yeast, chocolate malts, fruitcake.  The flavour is very complex - as you would expect from 9% ABV.  Syrup, Christmas cake, some smoked/roasted notes, some bitterness to prevent it from becoming too sweet.  The mouth feel is quite something - just the right level of carbonation plus it paradoxically burns and soothes at the same time.  Its hard to know where to knock this down - perhaps the aroma isnt quite as spectacular as some others of this style but this is still a wonderful beer.

Pours a dark hazy brown with an copper hue, fluffy tan head. Smell: Sweet dark fruits and flowery perfume. Taste: fig, molasses, spice, apple, and a just a little toasty. Very smooth and creamy texture. Slight warming effect from the alcohol. After taste is warm, clean, and just a little toasty. Great balance of sweet, spicy, and roasted flavors with many complex flavors and much to be enjoyed. This is very drinkable, elegant, and just great!
Can you believe they sell this at Costco?  Great beer that is pretty easy to find anywhere

Dark brown color, very nice carbonation with a huge creamy head that lasts a long time. Nice lacing afterwards. Aroma is malt, grapes. Very nice sweet/bitter taste with a slight alcohol warming feel. Medium body. This is a very drinkable brew.

Belle robe brune avec mousse généreuse. Arôme riche, épicé, caramélisé.  Un peu sucré, un peu acide, mince amertume, riche et complexe, un peu fruité.

Note; elle est meilleure un peu plus chaude que la pluprat des bières.
A simple review will not suffice the complexity of both the flavors and the brewing process on this beer.  Get a book and read about it and then drink it often as possible.
brown amber color, aroma is sweet and fruity, clove, apple, banana, flavor is the same, full bodied and warm, great beer

Poured into a Chimay drinking bowl @ cellar temp. Darkest murky brown, no hue shines thru, big lasting creamy tan head. Dark fruit and malts, Belgian yeasty aroma. Taste is strong, powerful and complex... more flavors emerge as it warms. Toffee, brown sugar, roasted malts, dried dark fruits, spices and yeast. Warm alcohol finish. Every beer enthusist should sample this elite brew at some point on their journey. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

Wow, is this a great strong ale.  This beer is a great example of what a Belgian Strong should be.  Slightly warming, but not overpowering.  Soft mouthfeel with light carbonation.  Try it if you can find it!
complex aroma with prune, roasty notes. Very thick, cloudy beer. Tastes like prune.

330ml bottle. I loved this beer. generous warmth. Full body mouthfeel. Malty characteristics, choco, caramel, toffee, faint peppery. Astringent -apricots. Rich characters. Wish I had another bottle, right now.
Hazy dark brown, beige head. Taste is raisins, overripe fruit, bread and caramel. Full body and soft carbonation give it a very nice mouth-feel.

33 ml bottle. Lovely caramel, bread and sugar flavours. Pours a nice off white head, not the most masculine head, small bubbles. Kind fruity aroma, a hint of bread. A lot of flavours, a lot of sweetness and heath in the after. A classic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.

750 ml Grande Réserve bottle. Pours a hazy reddish brown with a thick, persistent beige head. Smells of fruits, caramel. Tastes of caramel, brown sugar, fieldberries. Very sweet and intensely malty, could not detect any bitterness. However, had quite a watery body and an aggressive level of carbonation. All in all, a very accessible, tasty belgian ale.

From notes.  First reviewed 6/11/2009.  Poured from a 75 cl bottle into my Chimay branded goblet.

Chimay Grande Réserve pours a brown sugar color with a nice level of head. The head slowly relents, making the lively carbonation more visible for a while. 

Cherry and dark fruit malt is the primary scent, with a little bit of vanilla and alcohol present as well. A careful, if not hidden collection of smells.

A smooth, balanced flavor from start to finish. The cherry and dark fruits are quite noticeable, but less dominant than in the smell. Some light spices make an appearance, as do vanilla and brown sugar. For 9% though, the alcohol is very nuanced. The malt is wide and deep; there is almost no hop flavor. A slightly medicinal aftertaste reminds me it is time for the next sip. 

A very balanced feel on the tongue. Not especially carbonated, but not too thick either. Really it is just the right balance for a beer of this ABV. 

Such a classic beer, at the end of the glass all I can do is think about the next bottle. A great beer to relax with.

33 cl bottle. 2011 Vintage. BBE 2016.
Originally rated on 20090215.
Pours hazy dark red color with large foamy, long lasting head. Aroma of belgian yeast, caramel malts, slight spicy notes, dark ripe fruits like plum, mild toffee notes and earth. Flavor of dark ripe fruits, mildly sour dark berries, yeast, caramel malts, some spicy notes, a bit of sugary toffee and distant liquorice notes as the beer warms a bit. Strong CO2, slightly sour palate with a sweet and spicy finish. Very complex, yet well balanced brew, optimal for cellaring long times.
5337
Bottle from somewhere or other. I may have left it in the cellar a bit long, very whiffy indeed. More whiffy than I remember it. Very tart and very Belgian.

Deep amber colored pour. Big, pillowy, foamy off-white head. Little bit of lacing left behind the slow fall. Sugary, malty, bready, raisiny aromas. Little bit of booze in there as well. Taste is sweet malt and sugar with some raisin notes. Sweet, a little thin from the big booze showing up. Pretty decent. Dont know why I havent reviewed this one yet. I always have some laying around.
Bottle. Brown and slightly cloudy.Malty ad full bodied. Lacks the sweetness that sometimes seems to go hand in hand with this strength. Impressive.

Bottle, 33 cl. 2011 vintage. Hazy reddish brown with a foamy tan head. Spicy aroma with notes of yeast, spices (cinnamon, star anise among others - my guess), toasted malts, toffee, plummy dark fruits. The taste is sweet, spicy and slightly bitter. Notes of dried dark fruits, licorice, spices. Full body. Warming alcohol in the finish.

Pours red copper hazy yeasty cloudy with off-white head. Aromas roast, caramel, malts, berries, fruity, nutty. Palate full-bodied, carbonation lively crispy, mouth-feel tart, with sweet malty taste and alcohol. Aftertaste thin with hints of dryness, alcohol comes through somewhat. Standard Trappist, with no much surprises or nuances but well balanced.

I feel like I owe this one a review...

A - Looks great. Deep red to brown, nice clarity. Thick off-white head.

S - Smells even better. Malty and thick dark fruit. Very pungent.

T - Im not sure what keeps this one from being considered a Belgian quad. Fits right in with abt 12 in my opinion.

M - The carbonation on these Ive found can be hit or miss, which is understandable I suppose. Usually though Id say its spot on - nice consistency, thick enough but drinkable.

O - Overall this is one of my go-tos given its availability. Im sure youve had it but if you havent, give it a try, I bet itll end up in your rotation.

Currently drinking while typing. Once poured you will notice a nice aroma with this beer, a good mix of malts, Belgian yeast, bread, raisin, brown sugar and a nice floral note in there too! The beer appears as a chocolate/chestnut coloured haze with a lazy tan head that was originally bubbly but soon dissipated into nothing more than an ultra thin layer in the center of the glass. The taste is really good, very delicate and complex! Flavours of Belgian yeast, toastiness, roasted malt, bread, nuttiness, wood, well hidden alcohol content and a lasting flavour of malt, subtle plum and cereals. Great feel in the mouth, its full bodied with a clean finish and a gentle carbonation which feels right for this beer. Very good beer, very interesting, surprisingly light and delicate but with a solid flavour. Recommended!

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2013 Pours dark hazel with about a finger of quickly dissolving head. Smells earthy, fruity, fig, nut, belgium yeast. Taste is earthy and figgy, rasins and cherry, very smooth. Solid quad. 

Re-rate for 1990

Pours deep brown, finger o-white head.

Smell WOW, big fig and amazing red fruit. Molasses.

Tastes like candy. Sweet smooth toffee and caramel.

No heat, med body.

Amazing what this turns in to.
